___________________________________________________________________________________

Come and join our wonderful team at NUH. We are big believers in diversity and welcome new ideas to help develop our team in order to deliver world class healthcare to the vast patient populations we serve. With endless personal development opportunities available, at the NUH we will endeavour to turn your job into a career!

We particularly welcome applications from people who identify as Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic, or Disabled, as we are striving to be better represented at NUH.

Closing Dates: Please submit your application form as soon as possible to avoid disappointment; we reserve the right to close vacancies prior to the published closing date if we receive a sufficient number of completed application forms.

Communication: All communication related to your application will be via the email address you have provided. Please ensure you check your email account including your junk email regularly.

Easy read application: if you have a disability and find it difficult to complete our online application form, you can apply via our easy read application which you can find on the intranet https://www.nuh.nhs.uk/easy-read-job-application

NUH are now able to offer application completion support and interview preparation support. Please follow the link to book onto our sessions: Support for NUH Job Applications

Salary: The quoted salary will be on a pro rata basis for part time workers.

Disability Confidence: All applicants who have declared a disability and who meet the essential criteria for the post will be shortlisted.

At Risk of redundancy: NHS employees within the East Midlands who are ‘at risk’ of redundancy will be given a preferential interview where they meet the essential criteria of the person specification.

International Recruitment: If you are applying for a role with us from outside of the UK then please read the guidance on applying for a health or social care job in the UK from abroad.

ID and Right to work checks: NUH authenticate ID and right to work documentation including passports and driving licenses through a system called Trust ID. NUH will scan your ID and right to work documentation in to the Trust ID system at your face to face ID appointment. The system will run a check against the key security features within your documentation. The system will provide us with an outcome of your check which will be stored securely on your personal file along with all other pre-employment check documentation.

Consent:

  • Transfer of information: If I have previous NHS service - I consent to the transfer of my Electronic Staff Record (ESR) data between this and other NHS Trusts. I also consent to the Occupational Health Department confidentially accessing my occupational health records from my current or previous employer in order to check the status of my vaccinations, immunisations s and screening tests as relevant to the post. I understand this is an automated process and the information will only be used for these purposes prior to me taking up the position at NUH.
  • Disclosure and Barring Service: Your post maybe subject to a DBS check which incur a cost dependent on the level of check required (£42.90 for enhanced and £22.90 for standard). I agree to reimburse Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust the cost of a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check if it is required (by deduction from first month’s pay). Should I decide to withdraw from my job offer, I agree to reimburse Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust the cost of the DBS check undertaken by cheque or other agreed method.

title: Paediatrician
company: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
description:
Applications are invited for an enthusiastic and committed Consultant Paediatrician with general, diabetes and endocrine +/- neonatal experience who will work to further enhance the hospital based paediatric and neonatal services, assist in managing the increasing clinical and administrative workload and help achieve the 'facing the future' standards set out by the RCPCH. The post will retain the total number of consultants on the on-call rota to 9.8. It is currently advertised as a 10 PA post. We are seeking applicants with endocrine interest but additional special interests such as safeguarding, rheumatology, or allergy, immunology and gastroenterology or other suitable special interest will be considered and developed based on the future needs of the department.

JD pending Royal College approval.

To provide a Consultant Paediatric and Neonatal service to children within the Trust in conjunction with Consultant Paediatric colleagues. To establish and build on a special interest- ie diabetes and endocrinology

The post holder will reside within 10 miles or 30 minutes’ drive of the hospital.

To maintain annual Appraisal and Job Planning with Clinical Director and Revalidation with the Responsible Officer.

To participate in Junior Doctors appraisals, assessments, and training. To participate in medical students training.

To participate in clinical governance activities of the department including participation in audits, developing, and updating guidelines, responding to complaints, and investigating adverse incidents.

To participate in safeguarding children and when required by department, to accept rotational named doctor for safeguarding role.

To receive direct referrals from General Practitioners, Consultant colleagues, members of the Community Child Health Department, other health professionals and members of other agencies dealing with children.

To provide outpatient clinics

To share the on-call Consultant Paediatric rota with the consultant colleagues. Internal cover is provided for absent colleagues. The on-call commitment includes cover for the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit. The appointee will need the appropriate skills to provide this cover.

Candidates with endocrine interest are particularly suitable.

Applications are invited for an enthusiastic and committed Consultant Paediatrician with general, diabetes and endocrine and neonatal experience who will work to further enhance the hospital based paediatric and neonatal services, assist in managing the increasing clinical and administrative workload and help achieve the 'facing the future' standards set out by the RCPCH. This is a new consultant post, part funded by two senior consultants who wish to reduce their clinical sessions to take over additional academic and managerial responsibilities. This retains the total number of consultants on the on-call rota to 9.8. We are seeking applicants with endocrine interest but additional special interests such as safeguarding, rheumatology, or allergy, immunology and gastroenterology or other suitable special interest will be considered and developed based on the future needs of the department.

The Consultants operate a Paediatrician of the week rota for the Children’s wards. Following the weekend on-call commencing Friday 1 pm, all general paediatric and neonatal admissions are admitted under the duty paediatrician. The Paediatrician of the week is responsible for all paediatric in-patient Paediatric admissions during the week and for all Paediatric emergencies during regular working hours, with out of hour’s on-call shared amongst the consultant colleagues. Attendance at morning and evening handover is expected. Clinics are cancelled during the Duty Paediatrician week to provide full ward / emergency cover. There is now a separate consultant covering the neonatal unit from 9 AM to 5 PM during the working week as well as a PAU consultant who covers 9am- 5 pm during the working week.

The newly appointed consultant will join the team of existing consultants to deliver a high quality emergency and elective paediatric service. They will also have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the new hospital build and urgent care hub. These are exciting times with a proposed funding for our Estates project that may cause substantial restructuring and smart wards areas. Urgent care hub is fast developing with a co-located PAU with 12 beds that is expected to evolve with excellent opportunities for a truly integrated working with primary, secondary and community care services.

In the ‘non –acute’ weeks (ie approximately 6 weeks in 8) the post-holder will hold face to face diabetes clinic/ general clinic and one Virtual e- clinic a week and occasional ‘hot’ (rapid access) clinics. There is scope to develop a suitable sub specialty clinic. The newly appointed consultant will share equally in paediatrician of the week with other consultants (1:9.8), provide daytime PAU cover by rotation, conduct clinics and participate in teaching, training, audit and guidelines. The weekday on call cover includes on site presence in the evening, (usually until 19.00 hours, longer in winter).

There is scope to have a dedicated time in the job plan to enhance and further develop the sub-speciality service delivery alongside the transformation programme. The Group model helps to enhance collaborative working as a county wide approach to speciality services with increased opportunity with a larger case mix, opportunities for research and enhancing excellence in paediatric care in Northants.

Participation with consultant colleagues in clinical governance arrangements for the NICU, general paediatrics, safeguarding and areas of special interest to develop practice and buttress existing frameworks is essential.

title: Obstetrics and Gynecology Physician
description:
Our tertiary fetal medicine service is a regional referral centre. The main referral hospitals for fetal and maternal medicine problems are Mansfield (King’s Mill), Lincoln, Boston and Grantham. Between them, these deliver more than 9000 women. Referrals come from Derby for paediatric surgical, neurosurgical and paediatric nephrology cases. Referrals for cases of suspected facial cleft come from most of the Trent region. QMC is the only provider of a fetal blood transfusion service in the East Midlands. The busy fetal-maternal medicine unit consists of a well-developed team of subspecialists (four sub-specialists are predominantly based at QMC and one at City) in a dedicated clinical area with one or two clinics running every day of the week and regular MDT meetings with clinical genetics and neonatal team on a weekly basis.

Our maternal medicine service includes general maternal medicine clinics supported by an obstetric physician, and also joint specialist clinics including renal, epilepsy, diabetes and haematology. Our maternal cardiac service is supported by a team of cardiologists with a variety of special interests, and co-ordinated via our obstetric cardiology MDT. We have links with the East Midlands Maternal Medicine Network.

Our maternity service has a variety of other specialist clinics (both scan and non-scan) including: mental health, vulnerable service users, twins, preterm birth, small baby and Rainbow.

There is a draft job plan within the job description that reflects our best assessment of what the final plan will be, based on 10 PA's.

Any consultant who is unable, for personal reasons, to work full-time will be eligible to be considered for the post on a part-time basis; if such a person is appointed, modification of the job content will be discussed on a personal basis with the Trust in consultation with consultant colleagues.

This service provided by maternity is provided across both campuses, but your primary base is the City campus. The proposed Job Plan is detailed in this job description.

The on-call commitment is currently 1:8, supported by Junior staff. This post is deemed to be in Category A, and an allowance is paid for being on-call, which is currently 3 %. The out of hours commitment is non-resident as specified above.

Come and join us at this exciting time of change as we embrace the development of our mission, objectives, expectations and values - the cornerstones of tangible transformation! Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust is one of UK’s largest acute teaching Trusts in England. Our Maternity Services offer a wide range of choice and support for all women and families, from midwifery-led birthing units to specialised neonatal care.
Our Maternity Service has faced scrutiny since 2020. That’s when we began our journey of vast improvement and sizeable investment towards making our service the best it can be. Be part of a team which is 100% committed to implementing the necessary and sustainable improvements to provide the highest possible care for women and families who use our service, you can find out more about here: Maternity | NUH [nuh.nhs.uk] .
We’re looking for compassionate, ambitious, and progressive people to join our team. With so many opportunities for self-development and progression, we need people who want to learn and inspire others. People who have a voice and want to use it to drive positive change. People who love a challenge and want to be part of transformation.
When you join our team, you’ll be welcomed into our family of supportive and passionate professionals – all united by the same vision, ambitions, and goals .

There is a draft job plan within the job description that reflects our best assessment of what the final plan will be, based on 10 PA's.

Please refer to the job description and person specification.

title: SAP Business One Support Consultant, End User, GBP40K
Professor
description:
Diverse community. Inclusive Research. Rewarding Careers.

Doing things differently.


Professor & Academic Lead

Automated Distribution & Manufacturing Centre (ADMC)

£71,460 - £100,883 per annum (pro rota)

About the Role

Nottingham Trent University seek a Professor and Academic lead of the new Automated Distribution and Manufacturing Centre (ADMC). Due to open in summer 2024, the Centre is a £30m investment and will be a purpose-built multifunctional centre, with space allocated for research and development, new product development and testing, education and skills development, technology showcasing, networking, collaboration and event hosting. It will encompass researchers, engineers and technical specialists and be an international centre of excellence in how industry adopts automation. The investment represents a partnership between the University, established commercial organisations, National and Regional Government, and other education providers. It will follow the established UK model of Catapult Centres, providing an environment for technology innovation and impactful application.

Two teams will be established at the Centre, a core operations team and a research and innovation team. The operations team will be focused on identifying opportunities with tier one logistic and manufacturing companies as well as regional small to medium size enterprises. The research and innovation team will be led by the Professor & Academic Lead and will focus on innovation and emerging technologies. Employed by our School of Science and Technology, the Professor and Academic Lead will establish the research and innovation team in robotics and automation, supporting the adoption, integration and expansion of new automated technologies amongst regional businesses and so improve productivity and competitiveness. The team will also offer skills development to companies and support wider training which the University delivers with West Notts College.

The job of Professor is aligned to one of three career pathways: Teaching and Research; Teaching and Scholarship; or Teaching and Practice. We welcome applicants with a strong profile within the broad discipline and the ability to integrate a range of technologies and systems which could include industrial robotics, corobotic systems, autonomous mobile robots and sensor, actuator integration. Along with building the team, interfacing with senior representatives from businesses, retailers and the scientific community are key elements of the role, and the post holder will be experienced in cross-collaboration and working with senior representatives from industry.

How to Apply

Nottingham Trent University has engaged the services of Anderson Quigley to whom applications should be sent by the closing date of midday, Monday 18 March.

An executive search process is being carried out by Anderson Quigley in addition to the public advertisement.

Should you wish to discuss the role in strict confidence, please contact our advising consultants at Anderson Quigley.

Imogen Wilde on +44(0)7864 652 633 or imogen.wilde@andersonquigley.com;

Ed Pritchard on +44(0)7873 218 380 or ed.pritchard@andersonquigley.com.

Applications should consist of:

  • A full CV.
  • A covering letter setting out your interest in the role and details of how you match the essential knowledge, skills and experience criteria of the person specification.
  • Please include current salary details and the names and addresses of two referees. Referees will not be approached until the final stages and not without prior permission from candidates.

Completed applications should be uploaded at https://andersonquigley.com/job/aq2459

Safe and Inclusive

At NTU, we continue to build an inclusive culture that encourages, supports and celebrates the diverse voices and experiences of our students and colleagues. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring and we encourage people from underrepresented communities and backgrounds to apply to join our team.

Applications from job seekers who require sponsorship to work in the UK are welcome and will be considered alongside all other applications.

Whilst this role is eligible for sponsorship under the Skilled Worker Route, we recommend that you assess your eligibility before applying for this position. Visit https://www.gov.uk/skilled-worker-visa for more information.

This role is covered by the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (1974) and successful applicants will be asked to declare any unspent criminal convictions.

title: Rugby Coach
description:
Calling all Rugby Coaches!

Embark on Your Classroom Adventure: Shaping Futures in your local community!!

Are you a passionate rugby coach eager to make a profound impact on the lives of young minds? Classroom Recruiters is excited to recruit for a schools in the Derby area, seeking dynamic Rugby Coaches to work as mentors and support children in re-engaging with education.

Position: Rugby Coaches turned Mentors
Location: Derby, UK
Type: Full-Time
Working Hours: Standard School Hours
Pay: £16 per hour
Age Range: KS3, KS4
Contract: Temporary with an Opportunity for Permanent Placement

Your Role:
As a Mentor with a rugby background, you'll play a pivotal role in supporting children, both on a 1:1 basis and occasionally with groups. Your primary focus will be delivering a variety of structured activities, contributing to the holistic development of students. Get to know the pupils in your care well, whether it's through individual sessions or during group work. Utilize the skills honed on the rugby field to connect with children who may struggle in a mainstream environment.

Requirements:

  • Essential prior experience in rugby coaching or playing.
  • Passion for sports and a genuine desire to help children succeed.
  • Full-time commitment to making a positive impact within education.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with students, fostering engagement and enthusiasm.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with students on a 1:1 basis, promoting positive engagement in education.
  • Deliver captivating lessons in rugby and structured activities, ensuring a well-rounded experience.
  • Provide mentorship and support to students, facilitating their reintegration into education.
  • Collaborate seamlessly with the school's staff to create a positive and empowering learning environment.

Why Choose Classroom Recruiters?
This is more than a job; it's an opportunity to leverage your passion for sports to inspire and re-engage children in education. The competitive pay of £16 per hour reflects the value we place on your dedication and expertise.

Your Opportunity:
Beyond just a role, this opportunity offers a chance to make a meaningful impact in the lives of young learners. It also provides a pathway to permanency within the school, recognizing your potential to contribute to the success of these students.

Training and Development:
Working through Classroom Recruiters opens a world of possibilities for those who want to progress their skills in the classroom. Become a star player in education, acquiring new skills with our support. We offer training in behavior management and education to help further your knowledge. You'll work with a dedicated consultant who will guide your journey, ensuring you're equipped with the tools to excel in your role and make a lasting impact on the lives of the students you mentor. Join us in this exciting venture, where your love for rugby becomes a catalyst for positive change in education.

Active Participation:
While sports are a key element of the timetable, you'll be expected to enthusiastically participate in all aspects of the schedule. This includes embracing diverse activities and contributing your unique coaching skills across subjects.

The Interview and Vetting Experience:
Get ready for a unique journey of discovery. Your application and vetting form will set the stage for a conversation with the head teacher. But hold on – this isn't your typical interview; it's an opportunity for us to unravel your uniqueness in just 45 minutes.

Before embarking on this extraordinary adventure, we'll guide you through a comprehensive vetting process. We believe in ensuring our team is as unique and exceptional as the role they play. It's not just about skills; it's about your passion, your perspective, and the spark that sets you apart.

Ready to be the spark that ignites change? Apply now and become a valuable part of our diverse and dynamic team of inclusion mentors. Your uniqueness is the key to unlocking a world of possibilities for our students!

Salary: £16.00 per hour

  • Are you available Monday to Friday 08:30 - 15:30?

  • Sports: 1 year (preferred)

  • Rugby coaching: 1 year (preferred)
  • Rugby: 1 year (preferred)

Expected start date: 04/03/2024

title: Mentor
description:
Are you seeking a flexible working pattern that allows you to make a real impact? Look no further!

This is an outstanding opportunity for individuals who want to work part-time at local schools, offering much-needed support on an ad hoc basis. Our role is perfect for those who crave flexibility and relish the chance to work with children.

Classroom recruiters are recruiting on behalf of secondary schools across Derbyshire for learning mentors to help cover classes when teachers are off. You will not be expected to teach but simply support students while they continue the work that has been set by their class teachers.

Headlines:

  • Pay: Between 13.00 and £15 an hour
  • Hours: 08:30 to 15:10 (some half days)
  • Contract: Zero hours
  • Days a week: Very flexible, must be available on a day-to-day basis.
  • Are pre-booked block bookings available: Yes when the schools needs longer-term staff there will be opportunities for whole weeks or longer-term work.
  • Availability: Must be available for day-to-day and morning cover
  • Area: Local schools across the Derbyshire area.
  • Start Date: Beginning of March (but hey, we're flexible for the right person)

Responsibilities:

  • You'll step in when local schools need extra support, providing assistance on an ad hoc basis.
  • Some assignments will be block bookings and pre-bookings for those with the availability.
  • Be prepared to cover emergency morning shifts in your local area, ensuring you're ready to help when needed.

Background Diversity:

  • No matter your professional background, if you have a genuine passion for working with children and a desire for a flexible working pattern, we invite you to apply. Your positivity and willingness to connect effectively with students are what truly matter.
  • You don’t need to come from a dedicated background in working with children. You just need passion to help children in your local area.

Government-Accredited Qualifications:

  • In this role, you'll have the unique opportunity to gain government-accredited qualifications, all at no cost. These courses are available online through third-party training providers, allowing you to enhance your skills and knowledge while you earn.

Compensation:

  • Get ready for competitive compensation, with pay ranging from £12.50 to £15 an hour, depending on experience and assignment.

Training and Specializations:

  • We provide comprehensive training to ensure you excel in your role. If you have a particular specialization or experience as a tutor or mentor, there are opportunities for additional compensation.

Career Growth and Development:

  • This position offers the ultimate flexibility, allowing you to choose when and where you work. It's a fantastic opportunity to gain experience and explore a career in education.
  • We are deeply committed to your professional growth and offer ongoing training and development opportunities, all of which are free and accessible online.

Working with KS3 Pupils:

  • You'll primarily work with Key Stage 3 (KS3) pupils, offering an excellent opportunity for those looking to make a difference in the secondary school environment.

Application:

If you are interested in this role please click “apply” and a consultant will be in touch with you in the new year to give you more information about the role, talk through your CV and experience.

Join us at Classroom Recruiters, where every day brings a new chance to inspire and support young learners on their educational journey.

For inquiries, you can also email enquiries@classroomrecruiters.co.uk or call: 01332 322 591. Your journey toward a fulfilling and flexible role begins here!

title: Safety Consultant
description:
Health & Safety Consultant

£40,000 - £43,000 DOE + Car Allowance £4800pa

Full Time – Permanent – Mon-Fri- Hybrid/Field Based

Thurmaston, Leicestershire

Duties and responsibilities include:

· To undertake Health & Safety audits and produce a report of the findings highlighting risks and how to implement a suitable health and safety management system. Assist client in the implementation of the agreed action plan.

· Draft Health & Safety manuals and policies and procedures to meet client needs and compliance.

· Effectively account manage clients; to ensure compliance and determine their Health & Safety operational and strategic needs, delivering services in line with agreed SLA’s.

· To provide Health and Safety advice to clients; ensuring the advice offers best practice and commercially practical solutions, whilst explaining the risks and liabilities with associated solutions.

· To advice on and undertake ad hoc consultancy tasks including risk assessments at client sites; for example, Fire Risk Assessments, DSE.

· To develop and implement Health and Safety training programs to meet client needs.

· Operational awareness of the various ISO standards and other accreditation systems (such as SSIP and CHAS) to support clients maintain and achieve their certification where applicable.

· Work effectively with the wider team to support consistent delivery to clients, ensuring continuity of advice and practical support for client support issues where required.

· To support the business development team by identifying opportunities for additional services.

Qualifications and Experience Required:

· NEBOSH General Certificate, or equivalent is essential.

· Minimum 2 years experience working in a H&S Consultancy or H&S Management role.

· Working knowledge of Health & Safety at Work Act 1974 plus all supporting regulations.

· Fire Risk Assessment certificate is desirable but not essential.

· Ability to engage and develop relationships remotely and to adapt support at all levels of organisational hierarchy.

· Ability to analyse and interrogate available information from a health & safety perspective to get to the root of the cause, identify risks and provide solutions and the varied options available.

· Ability to influence key decision makers in organisations.

· Excellent communication skills and not be afraid to have that difficult conversation.

· Experience of working to deadlines in a pressurised environment.

· Ability to organise and prioritise own workload and think outside of the box.

· The ability to work effectively as part of a team, and on own initiative and autonomously.

· Good IT skills. A working knowledge of Windows (Word, Outlook and Excel).

· Must have a full driving license and use of own vehicle as travel throughout the UK will be required.

The Benefits

In addition to your basic salary, we have a competitive benefits package including commission, pension, death in service, 23 days hols (increases with length of service to 26 days), Employee Assistance Programme and free car parking. We operate a hybrid working model.

If this role sounds like you then please get in contact with Sophie Sansby at Coulter Elite.

Benefits:

  • Company car
  • Company pension
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: On the road

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
Regional Impact Sales Manager – East Midlands base location

to 35K basic 40K OTE +4K car allowance

I am currently recruiting for a regional impact sales manager to work for a leading health and fitness operator, you will be covering a wide territory in the East of England including the Northeast, Yorkshire and Lincs, Leicestershire, Northants and Suffolk. You will typically be working from home for 1 day each week with the rest of the time being spend in centres within the region. It is expected that you will be staying away from your base location for around 50 nights per year, so it is essential candidates are able to commit to this and be very open to working across different centres with different challenges and focuses. These could include supporting with the set up for a new contract win and relaunching the membership offer, to preselling a brand-new opening, launching a centre after a significant investment in the gym and pool or supporting a centre that is below their target. One day you could be auditing sales performance and processes, the next you could be coaching then sales manager and then you could be planning for the implementation of upcoming sales and marketing campaigns and promotions.

  • Coaching and developing your sales managers and sales consultants in all aspects of their roles.
  • Review, analyse and interpret key management information and metrics.
  • Monitor and manage social media channels working closely with the Central Team.
  • To provide sales management cover and support as and when required.
  • To work closely with and support the GMs with managing their sales teams.
  • To provide the regional team with sales and activity reports requiring strong Excel knowledge.
  • Work within the Regional Weekend Sales cover framework providing regional support, typically 1 weekend in 3.

Given the size of the region an ideal base location would be in the middle of the territory in the East Midlands around Nottingham/Derby/Leicester or Northampton although other locations can work. As regional sales manager you will need to be target driven with a proven track record of leading sales teams in the fitness industry to meet and exceed targets. We would expect you will already be a successful sales manager or club manager from the health and fitness industry looking for an opportunity to develop your career.

The position offers a basic salary of up to 35K, an annual car allowance of £4186 and a monthly bonus potential of up to £400 based on overall regional performance against targets and an individual contribution to sales, with company phone, laptop, 28 days holiday per annum and free gym membership.

Interviews are immediately available.

description:
Established in 1994, The Fragrance Shop (TFS) is known for its passionate and innovative nature within the fragrance industry and we are the largest, Independent fragrance retailer. title: Flooring Consultant
description:
Job Introduction

Who are we

The Floor Room is a new and exciting offering created to make the process of buying flooring as enjoyable and inspirational as possible.

It is a space to encourage creativity and fun, whilst placing our customers aspirations at the centre of the experience, allowing their creative ideas to become a reality. We provide a customer experience like no other, creating a truly immersive and exciting way to shop for all your flooring needs.

In joining the floor room family, you will join a well connected and collaborative team who will be inspired to work hard whilst having fun! This will be a progressive and entrepreneurial environment where you feel empowered to be your authentic self.

We create an experience to ENJOY, a vision to INSPIRE and a relationship to TRUST


The Position

We currently have a number of exciting opportunities for Flooring Consultants to join the floor room family across a number of locations in the UK.

As a Flooring Consultant, you will drive sales and profitability through the delivery of an inspired end to end customer experience.


Key responsibilities:

  • Be devoted to exceeding customer expectations from a customer service and hospitality perspective, whether in store, online or via other communication channels.
  • Provide advice and information on our products and services and work closely with your colleagues to convert customer enquiries into sales using the prescribed sales journey.
  • Play your part in ensuring the store is impeccably presented both front and back of house and that product samples are impeccably presented.
  • Adapt your approach to offer a bespoke service ensuring all customers feel welcome, comfortable and inspired.
  • Develop a detailed understanding of the customer’s project, taste and preferences
  • Use your expertise and influence, including your design capabilities, to demonstrate and explain options in-line with the customer’s needs
  • Own your customer’s end-to-end journey and apply attention to detail throughout, ensuring the customer has a smooth and seamless experience from all those involved (including In-Home Consultants and Fitters)

The Person

The successful candidate will meet the following criteria:

  • You will have proven experience in a similar role.
  • Demonstrable experience/interest in interior design/textiles, home trends and styles
  • Must have previous customer service experience in a similar role, with a strong emphasis/focus on providing an excellent customer experience ideally in design led retail environment
  • Must be computer literate with a good working knowledge of MS packages
  • Will have experience of working to sales targets
  • Good administrative skills

Benefits

Why work for us? This is an exciting opportunity to play a crucial part in contributing to the ongoing success and continued growth of the floor room brand.

You will join a brand that feels like a strong family unit and work in a fast-paced retail environment where you feel inspired to be your best and where you enjoy what you do!

  • 22 days holiday plus bank holidays
  • Competitive salary & bonus scheme
  • Retail discount
  • Cycle 2 work scheme
  • Digital GP service
  • Holiday trading
  • Pension scheme
  • Heath cash plan
  • Life assurance
  • Give as you earn

title: Senior Optometrist
description:
Job Title: Senior Optometrist

Grade: Band 6/7/8a depending on experience

Trust: George Eliot Hospital NHS Trust

Location: Ophthalmology, Main outpatients, George Eliot Hospital, CV10 7DJ

Hours: 40 hours per week, Mon-Fri 8am-5pm (1 hr break)

Pay rate: Weekdays starting from £19 per hour

George Eliot Hospital NHS Trust provides a range of elective, non-elective, surgical, medical, women’s, children’s, diagnostic and therapeutic services to a population of more than 300,000 people. The hospital opened in 1948.

The hub of the Trust is located on the outskirts of Nuneaton and its services cover a large footprint, including north Warwickshire, southwest Leicestershire, and north Coventry.

The Trust also provides a range of community services, delivered across Coventry, Warwickshire and Leicestershire. These include sexual health and community dentistry services for the whole of Warwickshire as well as hosting the Blue Sky Sexual Assault Referral Cent

Responsibilities include:

· To be an autonomous practitioner providing highly skilled and specialised HES optometric services to George Eliot Hospital Nuneaton (GEH).

· To work closely with the ophthalmology Lead Optometrist and Operational Manager in order to deliver a comprehensive range of specialist optometric services to the highest standards of quality and patient care.

· The post holder will have clinical responsibility for the specialist paediatric and some adult refraction clinics.

· Patients may have specific learning difficulties, special needs, various degrees of visual disability and varying communication skills.

· The post holder will participate in multi-disciplinary Glaucoma diagnosis and

· management clinics, working under the direction of the lead Glaucoma Consultant

· assessing both new and follow up patients.

· The post holder is required to contribute to the teaching, audit and clinical governance requirements of the Ophthalmology service.

· Ophthalmology staff work as part of a multidisciplinary team and all members contribute to providing a high-quality service for its users.

· If the post holder is a registered independent non- medical prescriber, to prescribe medicines for patients, working within the GEH Policy and Procedure for Non- medical Prescribing and Directorate’s local guidelines/procedures. To ensure prescribing activities comply with legal requirements and HCPC guidance for non-medical prescribers. To maintain competence under the National Competency Framework for all Prescribers. To monitor own prescribing activities and participate in the evaluation of this service development. *

*being an independent prescriber is not essential to this post, but is advantageous.

Who we are looking for:

· GOC Registered Optometrist.

· Professional knowledge acquired through Degree, clinical placement plus advanced clinical training and experience to Master’s level or equivalent.

· Significant post Pre-Registration experience.

· Experience of testing children and additional learning needs patients.

· Evidence of ongoing continuous professional development.

In addition to experience, all Qualified roles will be required to provide evidence of

  • Relevant Qualifications
  • Registration with the relevant Registration Body if applicable.

Who are NHS Professionals?

If a hospital cannot supply staff on a ward or area, due to increased demand, sickness, or common staff shortages, they need to call upon Bank staff. NHS Professionals works with Trusts to develop a ‘Bank’ of highly skilled workers who want to work flexibly with the NHS.
Why NHS Professionals?

We value your skills, dedication, and commitment in supporting your local Trust and the NHS. We believe together we continue to deliver world-class healthcare service to our patients.

In return for your hard work commitment NHS Professionals (NHSP) can offer you some fantastic benefits: -

· Competitive Pay Rates - work this week, get paid next week!

· First choice of placements at over 50 NHS Trusts in England

· Dedicated consultants

· Flexible working options

· Free DBS and free training

· Build holiday allowance

· Support when you need it – 24/7 365 days – Call us anytime on 03332 407552

· Stakeholder pension scheme

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary contract
Contract length: 3 months

Salary: From £19.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

Reference ID: 71109

title: Special Assistant
description:
Band 4

Main area
Cardiology
Grade
Band 4
Contract
Permanent
Hours
  • Full time
  • Flexible working
  • Home or remote working
37.5 hours per week
Job ref
164-5837735
Site
City Hospital Campus
Town
Nottingham
Salary
£25,147 - £27,596 per annum
Salary period
Yearly
Closing
22/02/2024 23:59

Job overview

A vacancy has arisen in the Cardiology Department, Medicine Division, for an experience Speciality Medical PA to join our well established secretarial team in providing a comprehensive secretarial and administrative service to our Consultant Cardiologists and clinical team.

The successful candidate will have experience in the use of computer systems such as Microsoft Office, Word and Excel. Experience of hospital systems including Winscribe, Medway PAS, Nots and DHR would be desirable.


Main duties of the job

In addition to the below summary, you willl need to familiarise yourself with the full Job Description and Person Specification documents attached to this advert.

You will use your judgemental skills to prioritise tasks and deal with incoming mail, investigation results/report management. Duties to include word processing clinical and non-clinical letters, communicating with the management team, inbound and outbound telephone calls, liaising with the waiting-list team, supporting and mentoring new staff.

Working for our organisation

Nottingham University Hospitals (NUH) was established in 2006 and we are one of the biggest and busiest NHS Trusts in the country and provide services to over 2.5 million residents of Nottingham.

NUH are, by any measure, a large, complex, person-centred organisation. With over 17,000 employees from a wide range of professional backgrounds, they are one of the region’s largest employers.

NUH has an excellent national and international reputation for the quality of their patient care and for their research, education and innovation. They have strong links to the University of Nottingham, Nottingham Trent University and Loughborough University. This allows for the provision of excellent training and education for their students, as well as being a major research organisation.

We are driven by our strategic objectives and organisational values and we look for people who are strongly aligned with them. We are a supportive and friendly team who value all our staff by engaging, developing and empowering. We strive to provide safe care with outstanding outcomes and experiences for our patients.

Detailed job description and main responsibilities

Working as part of a team, the post-holder will provide a comprehensive secretarial and administrative service to a Consultant Cardiologist and team, managing diaries and commitments.

To manage Advice & Guidance requests.

Accurately transcribe clinical letters using Winscribe, producing high quality work within defined deadlines.

Use judgement and initiative to prioritise the importance/urgency of tasks within defined guidelines.

Establish and maintain admin systems/databases.

Dealing with incoming mail, results/reports management.

Attending/organising meetings, take minutes.

Ensure RTT patient data quality is accurate.

Key point of contact for consultant.

Communication link to directorate management team, regarding consultant leave/service issues.

Dealing with consultant queries/visitors, managing consultant diary.

Telephone calls inbound/outbound relating to patients specific care, in a confidential manner.

Typing of non-clinical letters as required.

Liaise with Waiting List Co-ordinators to ensure patients are treated within breach dates.

To support and mentor new staff.

Share responsibility with line manager for own personal development.

Undertake HR related tasks, appraisals and recruitment.

Undertake any other duties which may be reasonably required.


Person specification

Training and Qualifications

Essential criteria

  • 5 GCSEs C or above to include English Language
  • Typing qualification or equivalent

Desirable criteria

  • NVQ level 3 in administration or equivalent

Experience

Essential criteria

  • Proven secretarial experience
  • Knowledge of medical terminology.
  • Previous NHS experience in similar role
  • Experience of Medway PAS, Notis, Winscribe, Medical Office
  • Electronic diary management

Communication and Relationship Skills

Essential criteria

  • Proven ability to convey information verbally from documents, reports, telephone
  • Evidence of sensitivity and empathy in communication
  • Understanding and maintaining sensitivity

___________________________________________________________________________________

Come and join our wonderful team at NUH. We are big believers in diversity and welcome new ideas to help develop our team in order to deliver world class healthcare to the vast patient populations we serve. With endless personal development opportunities available, at the NUH we will endeavour to turn your job into a career!

We particularly welcome applications from people who identify as Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic, or Disabled, as we are striving to be better represented at NUH.

Closing Dates: Please submit your application form as soon as possible to avoid disappointment; we reserve the right to close vacancies prior to the published closing date if we receive a sufficient number of completed application forms.

Communication: All communication related to your application will be via the email address you have provided. Please ensure you check your email account including your junk email regularly.

Easy read application: if you have a disability and find it difficult to complete our online application form, you can apply via our easy read application which you can find on the intranet https://www.nuh.nhs.uk/easy-read-job-application

NUH are now able to offer application completion support and interview preparation support. Please follow the link to book onto our sessions: Support for NUH Job Applications

Salary: The quoted salary will be on a pro rata basis for part time workers.

Disability Confidence: All applicants who have declared a disability and who meet the essential criteria for the post will be shortlisted.

At Risk of redundancy: NHS employees within the East Midlands who are ‘at risk’ of redundancy will be given a preferential interview where they meet the essential criteria of the person specification.

International Recruitment: If you are applying for a role with us from outside of the UK then please read the guidance on applying for a health or social care job in the UK from abroad.

ID and Right to work checks: NUH authenticate ID and right to work documentation including passports and driving licenses through a system called Trust ID. NUH will scan your ID and right to work documentation in to the Trust ID system at your face to face ID appointment. The system will run a check against the key security features within your documentation. The system will provide us with an outcome of your check which will be stored securely on your personal file along with all other pre-employment check documentation.

Consent:

  • Transfer of information: If I have previous NHS service - I consent to the transfer of my Electronic Staff Record (ESR) data between this and other NHS Trusts. I also consent to the Occupational Health Department confidentially accessing my occupational health records from my current or previous employer in order to check the status of my vaccinations, immunisations s and screening tests as relevant to the post. I understand this is an automated process and the information will only be used for these purposes prior to me taking up the position at NUH.
  • Disclosure and Barring Service: Your post maybe subject to a DBS check which incur a cost dependent on the level of check required (£42.90 for enhanced and £22.90 for standard). I agree to reimburse Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust the cost of a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check if it is required (by deduction from first month’s pay). Should I decide to withdraw from my job offer, I agree to reimburse Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust the cost of the DBS check undertaken by cheque or other agreed method.

title: Environmental Consultant
description:
We are currently looking for a Graduate Environmental Permitting Consultant to join our waste permitting team. Tasks will be varied but will include the following:

  • Helping clients to identify whether and what sort of Environmental Permit they may need
  • Identifying the mitigation, monitoring and best practice measures that should be employed
  • Liaising with environmental regulators and preparing Environmental Permit applications
  • Carrying out the relevant risk assessments
  • Varying permits in response to changes in the activities at a facility or changes to the controlling legislation or guidance
  • Preparing, reviewing and submitting monitoring and reporting data
  • Checking whether clients are complying with their permits by carrying out audits
  • Collating and submitting the necessary information for the surrender of permits when there is no longer a need to operate a particular facility.

We will train you to become familiar with the relevant legislation and guidance and how it should be interpreted in practice. You will work with others in the company who carry out specialist risk assessments such as impacts on the water environment or slope stability and you will learn to carry out assessments such as nuisance risk assessments, dust and odour impact assessments and atmospheric dispersion modelling.

Applicants will have a degree level or higher in a relevant subject area (e.g. Geology, Hydrogeology, Environmental Science, Environmental Consultancy, Chemistry and Waste Management, Geochemistry) who are interested to understand not only how activities are controlled but are inquisitive as to why they need to be controlled for a specific activity in a particular location. You will need to have strong IT and excellent communication and organisational skills and a full UK driving licence.

If you are interested in working on a wide range of challenging projects and can thrive in the exciting and fast paced environment of consultancy we would be interested to hear from you


please contact our recruitment department on telephone number 01827 717891 or alternatively applicants should email their curriculum vitae to juliewarner@mjca.co.uk. MJCA is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Commercial Manager
description:
Commercial Account Manager

Field Based Role, Full UK Driving License Required - East Midlands & South Yorkshire

£40,000K - £50,000K plus commission and car

2/3 days in the field/2 days home based


We are looking for people ideally with experience of both new business development and account management, to focus primarily on targeting and acquiring commercial agents in a designated geographical area, to advertise their commercial properties on Rightmove. In addition, we need you to account manage and grow both newly acquired customers and existing customers so that the overall business goals of additional advert numbers and product saturation on site are achieved. This required revenue growth is expected to be achieved through persuasive face to face activity. You will possess the drive to overachieve KPI’s and relish the challenge of both professional and personal development within a new business sector at Rightmove.


A typical week as an Account Manager might involve


  • Achieving individual sales revenue targets & activity
  • Owning the sales cycle from lead generation to
  • Generating and converting new business opportunities through dedicated prospecting and cold
  • Managing the customer base to deliver first class account management with quality regular & timely review meetings. Upselling with Rightmove’s product suite.
  • Ensuring that all accounts have a clear understanding of Rightmove products & pricing structure, and to deliver value- added solutions against their business
  • Interpreting data and information in review meetings with customers enabling them to better understand their business and the market/s within which they operate.
  • To liaise with internal support functions such as Customer Services and Finance to ensure smooth management of the billing & administration process for your customer base, plus the provision of any supporting sales
  • Work closely with your Telephone Account Management (TAM) and New Business Telephone Consultant (NBC) to maximize opportunities in your patch
  • To attend monthly national/regional meetings
  • To manage the day-to-day relationships with external parties in support of company objectives and
  • To drive the satisfactory resolution of customer queries and disputes, g. in relation to invoice queries.
  • To be a positive role model & ambassador of Rightmove company values and
  • To take responsibility for self-development to support the achievement of personal objectives. Help to drive and support your team around you.

We’re looking for someone who


  • Has proven outstanding sales and negotiation skills, and consistent over achievement of targets
  • Demonstrates excellent relationship-building
  • High conversions and thrives from closing New business
  • Excellent objection handling skills
  • Maximises time effectively, to insure optimum appointment levels
  • Account Management experience (appx 30 % role requirement)
  • Capability to get through the toughest of gatekeepers
  • Shows resilience and tenacity when the going gets tough
  • Experience working in a multi-product environment
  • Ability to make tailored recommendations based on customer’s
  • Excellent Geographical planning, to optimise appointment levels
  • Solid business acumen and a good level of industry knowledge
  • A strong belief that ‘good enough is never good enough’
  • Structured, disciplined, energetic, committed to individual and group improvement
  • Able to challenge ideas and ask probing questions
  • Is a problem solver with the ability to take ownership and resolve issues
  • Must be confident using a PC, particularly competent with Microsoft Word, Excel & Powerpoint

Ultimately, we care much more about the person you are, how you think and approach things, than a list of qualifications and buzzwords on a CV. Even if you can’t say ‘yes’ to all of the above, but are smart, self-motivated and passionate about delivering great account management then get in touch.


What do our team say about working here?


“Working in commercial is like running your own business. It’s not a 9-5 job, and it’s not your average sales job – it’s much

more.

‘Everyone in the team is passionate about Rightmove and the growth of commercial. I feel really proud to work in the commercial

team and being part of its success”

‘Working in the commercial team means being part of the area of the business with most potential for growth.

Joining the commercial department was the best decision I made and this was reinforced by the team welcoming me and sharing

their knowledge and experience at every opportunity’.


About us


We are on a mission to make the move easier and simpler, by giving everyone the best place to turn to and return to for access to the tools, expertise and trust to make it happen.


A great success story, we’re now the biggest home-grown web brand in the UK our traffic levels surpassed only by Facebook, Google, YouTube, eBay and Amazon.

Despite this success, we remain a down-to-earth bunch. To join us in our mission, we look to recruit people who share the same values and beliefs as we’ve always had, because Rightmove is people. We call it the secret to our success and why staying 10 years or longer, reaching ‘gnome status’, is simply the Rightmove way.


We encourage and support all Rightmovers to continuously develop themselves. Together we work towards the best outcome, both in terms of our technical solutions and continued business growth. We are always on the lookout for the great new people to join our team. If you are a smart and passionate initiative-taker then get in touch. You could be part of the next chapter of the Rightmove story! Will you be ‘Gnomed?’


Did you know?


  • Rightmove was meant to be called 'Doorknob.' But it didn't quite have the same ring to it
  • There have been eight weddings between Rightmove colleagues over the past 16 years
  • We still have employee #1 working at Rightmove
  • We currently have 52 gnomes on our gnome tree

title: Account Manager
description:
We’re on the search for a high performing, ambitious Business Development professional to join a leading International financial services business with an expanding presence in Nottingham.

An excellent position has become available for an experienced Sales professional to join the team as an Account Manager, working with current clients, old contacts & new prospects to increase spend across their region.

To be successful in this role, you will be a proven high achiever who is well versed in exceeding targets on a regular basis. Due to the technical nature of our client’s service, plenty of training will be on offer as well as sponsored qualifications to get the successful candidate up to speed! The track-record of progression in this role from others internally has been unrivalled and this position should be viewed as “just the start” in an organisation who have quadrupled in size over the past 3 years.

The basic salary for the role is up to £32,000 with an uncapped OTE of c£15k, up to 30 days annual leave plus stats, sponsored finance qualifications and hybrid working 1 day per week. Both the basic salary and bonus will increase year on year up to an attainable £60k-£70k per annum package.

It would be highly beneficial to have experience in the Financial Services or linked sectors, such as mortgages, pensions, financial advice, credit services or banking.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Utilise existing accounts and business relationships to increase revenue streams
  • Generate new business through contacting prospective clients
  • Attend regular client meetings to build on relationships
  • Keep up to date with industry information to provide insight to clients

Skills & Experience

  • Previous experience in a similar Account Management/Business Development role
  • Proven track record of hitting sales targets
  • Able to deliver a highly consultative sales approach
  • Willingness to take professional qualifications to improve industry knowledge
  • Preferable financial degree or background (or willingness to take on company sponsored qualifications)

title: Software Architect
description:
Express Recruitment are excited to be recruiting on behalf of an innovative and exciting global market leader in the Cyber and Security sectors with an enviable client list in the private and government sectors.

They are looking for a Technical Solutions Architect to join their growing team. This is a client facing role and will involve analysing and advising clients on existing cyber infrastructure and solutions, as well as advising on systems this role will be hands-on configuring and assisting with setup.

This role also offers substantial flexibility with home working and flexible working hours.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Follow project specification ensuring full comprehension at all times
  • Visit customer site and implement new software applications and hardware such as diodes according to company standards and timescale
  • Work closely with other members of the internal team including technical analysts and project managers
  • Advise clients on how to solve technical and IT problems

  • Experience working with Servers or Diodes in some capacity beneficial

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen within the leading Hinckley based manufacturing company for a Customer Service Engineer/Technical Support Engineer, to support its new and existing machinery.

THE ROLE

The aim of the Technical Support Engineer is to support both the internal and external Customers in relation to all technical issues that arise both pre and post installation.

Responsibilities include the Support of the engineering Group, Distribution Partners, and End Users.

  • Setting up demonstrations, troubleshooting.
  • Be able to communicate with corporate IT departments on requirements and security.
  • Liaise with Engineering and subcontract software engineers on customer requirements.
  • Manage corporate installations.
  • Commission projects and training customers.
  • Be able to remote in or visit and observe installations so can troubleshoot.
  • Software testing – Assist engineering team in testing hardware and software.
  • Supervise small team.

THE PERSON

The role of technical support engineer will suit and electronic, mechanical or systems engineer with an ability to solve engineering problems and support customers. Ideally you will have a HNC or above in engineering along with good communication skills. This is not an IT role however good IT skills are vital.

THE PACKAGE

  • £28,000-£35,000 Basic
  • Pension
  • Life Assurance
  • Flexitime Working
  • Half Day Friday

title: Sales Assistant
description:
DESCRIPTION

The Drapes department within PDS, which operates under the brand name of ‘Drapemakers’, is looking to recruit an additional Sales Assistant to handle customer enquiries.

The successful candidate will be able to communicate confidently with a range of customers from the theatre and live event industries including production managers, theatre consultants and architects, tour managers, designers and production suppliers.

The nature of the industries we operate in mean that the job can be fast paced. This role will suit someone who enjoys responding to changing requirements and meeting urgent deadlines, whilst always paying careful attention to detail.

The products that we make are available from other manufacturers, so it is the personal relationships that our sales team make with our customers that help us stand out from our competitors. This role will suit someone who gets a buzz out of being pro-active and figuring out what our customers need before they even know it themselves!

EXPERIENCE

Knowledge and experience of the theatre and live events industries from a backstage / production perspective (essential)

Knowledge and experience of manufacturing large scale theatrical drapes (desirable)

RESPONSIBILITIES

Obtain all the information required from customers to enable accurate quotes to be put together

Ensure all relevant information is relayed to the manufacturing team

See projects through from initial enquiry to final delivery

Deal with customer concerns and complaints calmly and efficiently

SKILLS

Attention to detail

Numeracy skills

Written and verbal communication in English

Time management and organisational skills

Flexible approach to work

Enthusiastic and driven attitude

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From £28,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Sick pay

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • GCSE or equivalent (preferred)

Work Location: In person

Application deadline: 04/03/2024

Expected start date: 01/04/2024

title: Porter
description:
Porter

Nottingham University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

Nottingham City Hospital, Hucknall Road, NG5 1PB

Band 2 - £11.45 - 20.95 per hour shift dependant

12 hour shifts working the following pattern:

Week 1 Monday, Tuesday, Friday, Sat and Sun 18:00 -06:00

Week 2 Wednesday, Thursday 18:00-06:00

Week 3 Monday, Tuesday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday 06:00-18:00

Week 4 Wednesday and Thursday 06:00- 18:00

Formed in 2006, Nottingham University NHS Foundation Trust is one of the biggest and busiest acute Trusts in England, employing 14,500 staff. We provide services to over 2.5 million residents of Nottingham and its surrounding communities. We also provide specialist services to a further 3-4 million people from neighbouring counties each year.

Could you be a part of this team?

Overview

We are currently looking for four Porters to join our friendly team. You will will be required to work as part of a team providing high standards of portering in all areas throughout the hospital, following appropriate procedures.

You will be required to handle equipment responsibly, and within health and safety guidelines and be responsible for maintaining patient, staff and public safety whilst undertaking their duties.

You will also be required to work on their own or as part of a team to deliver services as directed by policies, procedures which are monitored by the Assistant Manager Patient Movement.

We are looking for people who have a friendly and helpful manner and have a sensitive approach when dealing with patients and their families.

Your duties will include:

· Transfer of patients either in wheelchairs, on a bed/trolley to and from wards and departments within the required time.

· Assist with of the moving and handling of patients when requested.

· Moving deceased patients from wards/ departments to the mortuary in a discreet and sensitive manner, observing any religious or cultural requirements.

· Collection and delivery of pharmacy stores to wards and departments

· Collection of urgent specimens from wards and departments to the path lab.

· Receive deliveries and deliver and exchange medical gas cylinders in wards and departments.

· Assist the nursing team whilst transporting patients who are on ventilators/medical gas etc.

· Provide a transportation service throughout the Trust of bloods, samples, fluids, medication, notes, x-rays, snack boxes and other such items directly related to patient care.

· Provide an emergency collection service of blood samples in the event of pneumatic tube failure.

Skills required:

· Experience working in a hospital setting in a porter role or similar role.

· Caring and polite manner, professional, flexible, positive, adaptable, persuasive, motivated, diplomatic, pro-active and innovative team player and adaptable to change.

· Good verbal and written communication skills (must be able to complete application data and paperwork accurately and legibly).

· Physically Fit to lift and move patients and inert objects in accordance with manual handling training.

· Ability to manoeuvre patients via a trolley, wheelchair, PAT slide or bed (To include Bariatric).

· Stable calm temperament, able to work in stressful situations and meet response times.

Who are NHS Professionals?

NHS Professionals (NHSP), owned by the Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC), works in partnership with hospital trusts to provide a bank of highly skilled temporary workers who want to work flexibly within the NHS.

Working through the NHSP bank means Trusts don’t have to rely on expensive agencies. Right now, we have over 130,000 members registered on our bank from various roles, grades, and specialities, saving the NHS over £70 million each year. This money is then reinvested back into the NHS.

In return for your hard work commitment NHS Professionals (NHSP) can offer you some fantastic benefits: –

· Competitive Pay Rates - work this week, get paid next week!

· First choice of placements at over 50 NHS Trusts in England

· Dedicated consultants

· Flexible working options

· Free DBS and free training

· Build holiday allowance

· Support when you need it – 24/7 365 days

· Stakeholder pension scheme

Disclaimer

Please note, you will be contacted by email throughout the recruitment process, so please check your emails, including your junk/spam regularly. We regret we cannot contact everyone who is not selected for an interview, therefore if you do not hear from us within 21 days after submitting your application, please assume you have not been successful on this occasion.

Job Type: Temporary contract
Contract length: 3 months

Salary: £11.45-£20.95 per hour

Expected hours: 24 – 56 per week

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • portering or similar: 1 year (required)

Ability to Commute:

  • Hucknall, NG5 1PB (required)

Ability to Relocate:

  • Hucknall, NG5 1PB: Relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: In person

title: Apprentice Nursery Practitioner
description:
ENVIRONMENTAL PRACTITIONER APPRENTICE


LET’S CUT STRAIGHT TO IT


Taking care of ‘one of life’s essentials’ – it’s our purpose and we want you to be part of it. Supplying wholesome drinking water, treating wastewater and recycling this back to the environment responsibly is no mean feat. We serve around 8 million people across the Midlands and Wales and unlike other businesses, our delivery is non-negotiable. It’s a matter of life.


Many of our employees are also our customers, so we truly take pride in what we do! Employing people from across our communities and beyond, Severn Trent is an exciting and inclusive place to work – a place where you can be curious, can be ‘Wonderfully You’ and where you can truly make an impact to our environment, now and for future generations.


LET’S TELL YOU MORE


Apprenticeship Programmes are a great way to earn and learn! Our Apprentice Environmental Practitioner Programme offers the perfect blend of personal and professional development, exposing you to the core of our business. Entering an Apprenticeship scheme with us involves working towards the role of a fully-fledged professional, earning a salary, whilst also being able to maintain a sense of academic achievement. At Severn Trent we provide the perfect mix between hands-on experience and a formal qualification, enabling our apprentices to make a real lasting difference to our customers and communities, not just for now, but far into the future.

You’ll be supported every step of the way, by your line manager and mentor.


You will be working within either our Biodiversity and Ecology team or Environmental Regulation team in Customer Operations, or our Asset Planning team in Chief Engineer.


Biodiversity and Ecology – Raynesway, Derby, Derbyshire DE21 7BE

Within our Biodiversity and Ecology team you will help us to promote and protect the natural environment we work in and the challenges and opportunities that brings. In your daily work, you interact with junior and senior members of your team, as well as external partners and stakeholders. With a balance of office and field visits, you’ll work with technical specialists both within and beyond your profession, for example, environmental scientists and consultants, environmental impact assessors, and ecologists.


Environmental Regulation - Severn Trent Centre, Coventry, West Midlands CV1 2LZ

In our Environmental Regulation team you will be at the forefront of protecting the environment each and everyday. This will mean understanding how the design and build of new assets translates into operations and ensuring we are identifying emerging environmental issues. You will receive a background into regulation within a practical setting with opportunities across the whole water cycle.


Asset Planning - Raynesway, Derby, Derbyshire DE21 7BE

Within Asset Planning in Chief Engineer you would be working on the capital programme to improve river health. This is an exciting and rare opportunity to learn new skills on your journey to becoming an expert hydraulic modeller, working with water quality specialists to determine what solution is required to meet an obligation and our fair share in removing harm due to intermittent discharges of overflows. You will be helping to coordinate surveys and getting out and about attending site visits to help in your understanding of our asset performance and our impacts on the environment.


HOW WILL THE PROGRAMME WORK


Standard


Environmental Practitioner (Degree)


Website

https://www.instituteforapprenticeships.org/apprenticeship-standards/environmental-practitioner-degree-v1-1


Apprenticeship Duration


53 months (Excluding EPA)


Apprenticeship Level


Level 6


Location


  • Raynesway, Derby, Derbyshire DE21 7BE
  • Severn Trent Centre, Coventry, West Midlands CV1 2LZ


Salary

£17,194


Provider/ F2F or Online

Keele University / F2F


ENTRY CRITERIA


For this Apprenticeship Programme (Level 6) we require all candidates to have 3 A-Levels at BBC or above, alternatively an equivalent qualification or above, will be considered. You must also have Maths and English Level 2 (GCSE grade 4/C or equivalent).


DRIVING LICENCE/TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS


You must have a full driving licence with access to your own vehicle at the time of starting the apprenticeship.


ROLE EXPECTATIONS POST APPRENTICESHIP


By the end of this programme, you will either take up a role as an Environmental Scientist, Assistant Asset Engineer, Assistant Modeller or an Environmental Permits Technician working within our Asset Planning, Biodiversity, Ecology or Environmental Practitioner teams, where you will be able to put your skills to action.


WHAT WILL YOU LEARN


  • This apprenticeship operates to teach you how to promote sustainable growth whilst maintaining responsibilities to our environment.
  • In order to limit pollution, you will take action to use less resources and produce less waste.
  • You will combine a high level of knowledge and understanding of environmental principles and techniques to complex environmental systems.
  • You will work towards making our company eco-friendly through minimising pollutive outputs.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR


We want our employees to care and to have a genuine passion for what we do as a business. We need people who want to make a difference in providing a vital service to our customers, now and for the long-term.


We’d love you to be someone with…


  • A ‘can do’ attitude – willing to get stuck in, take accountability for decisions and actions and who takes pride in their work
  • A love of variety in a role and ability to adapt to a dynamic, fast-paced working environment
  • Ability to quickly prioritise tasks and the initiative to dive head-first into problem solving.
  • No two days are the same on the front line and not every day goes to plan, so you’ll need to be quick on your feet to respond!
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills and enjoy working with multiple teams
  • Ability to analyse and interpret information and effectively communicate this to different team members and audiences
  • Ability to travel freely across our patch to visit different sites and travel to meetings and training days
  • Curiosity to learn quickly in a reactive and dynamic working environment


HOW WE’LL REWARD AND CARE FOR YOU IN RETURN


It’s not just a job you’ll get here, you’ll get a career too. We have a range of benefits that reward and recognise great work and award-winning training to ensure you reach your potential. And we’ll also help you play your part in looking after the environment and the community in which we live.

With that in mind, here are just some of our favourite perks that you’ll get being part of the Seven Trent family:


  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays (and the ability to buy/ sell up to 5 days per year)
  • Annual bonus scheme (of up to £1,500, which is subject to eligibility)
  • Leading pension scheme – we will double your contribution (up to 15% when you contribute 7.5%)
  • Sharesave – the chance to buy Severn Trent Plc shares at a discounted rate
  • Dedicated training and development with our Academy
  • Electric vehicle scheme and retail offers
  • Family friendly policies
  • Two paid volunteering days per year


As if that isn’t enough, you’ll receive an annual salary increase whilst you’re on programme and you’ll also get an increase when you move into your first job.


LET’S GO


Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you.


Please note, we don’t require a CV or cover letter to complete your application, the system will ask you for this, but you can just upload a blank document.


  • Roles close on Friday 29th March 2024
  • Check your diary – face to face assessments will run from 7th May – 27th June


To find out more about working with us, search #LifeatSevernTrent on social media.


DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION


At Severn Trent we are passionate about our people. We want to make sure that we continue to foster a more diverse, inclusive, and cohesive culture that represents the communities and customers we serve. We’re making sure we keep up the progress with our wonderful working groups – LGBTQ+, Women in Operations & STEM, Disability and Ethnicity, who help us with our commitments. Find out more about our commitments to Diversity and Inclusion at Severn Trent. Click here to find out more

At Severn Trent we provide the perfect mix between hands-on experience and a formal qualification, enabling our apprentices to make a real lasting difference to our customers and communities, not just for now, but far into the future.


As an apprentice HR Consultant, you’ll be exposed to a wide range of opportunities through tailored placements across the following functions to help you develop your HR generalist experience, including; HR Operations & Reward, Resourcing & New Talent, The Academy and HR Business Partnering & Change.


You'll be supporting colleagues to help create a fair and equitable working environment where everyone can succeed by:


  • Providing advice, guidance, and support to our colleagues when they need it most
  • Developing data and analytics that drive valuable insight and decision making
  • Supporting our annual employee cycle of activities (such as pay review, bonus, performance, and talent reviews etc)
  • Enabling and supporting our colleagues through business change and transformation
  • Attracting, selecting, and on-boarding talented individuals to Severn Trent so we can deliver on our customer promises
  • Partnering with leadership teams to continue to improve employee engagement
  • Help our colleagues to continue to grow, learn and develop new skills through our Academy
  • Delivering on our diversity and inclusion ambition, to have a workforce that reflects the communities we serve


You’ll rotate across a number of different areas of the HR team throughout your

apprenticeship programme to help you build a breadth of knowledge, skills and experience

People Professional

Crosby Management Training Limited (Online)

WHAT WILL YOU LEARN

  • How to develop and deliver HR solutions that drive business performance whilst motivating, supporting and developing our employees.
