title: HR Consultant
description:
Position Title: HR Digital Consultant

Duration: 6 Month Rolling Contract

Location: Whitley

£36.00 per hour Inside IR35 - Umbrella Rate

The Opportunity

  • This role is the HR Digital Consultant within the HR Digital Operations team.
  • The role will focus on managing HR data and enabling the effective delivery of HR processes and services through innovation of existing and new technology.
  • This involves working closely with HR process teams and IT teams.

Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities

  • Act as the functional expert in HR systems (primarily SAP HR, Concur, and SuccessFactors).
  • Collaborate with HR process and IT experts to maintain and improve HR systems in line with evolving business needs
  • Business data solution lead for required changes to SAP HR to support new or changes to business processes.
  • Ensuring robust data design and use along with clear definition of business system requirements.
  • Working closely with HR Direct process teams to provide key end user support and identify opportunities for HR System enhancements.
  • This includes the design and delivery of specialist transactional system training.
  • Managing troubleshooting and resolution of complex system defects and technical incidents with IT partners (ticket handling)
  • Attend product and user forums for knowledge sharing and best practice, to learn practice from other external organisation
  • Actively participate in the Clients’ data management forums and business assurance reviews to ensure robust HR data management processes.
  • Lead and participate in business system testing (UAT) for new HR System releases
  • Identify and lead on delivering innovation and improvements to HR systems to ensure great end user experience in HR systems to make it easy for our customers to do business with us
  • Ensure up to date version controlled documentation on system configuration and user guides.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve complex end user support issues, working with IT partners (i.e. TCS, SAP)
  • Lead or support the delivery of projects impacting on HR systems and data to ensure robust data design.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience

Essential:

  • Specialist knowledge or working with Concur or SuccessFactors as a Key User
  • Methodical detailed approach to work context
  • Experience in building and managing relationships with wide range of stakeholders.
  • Strong analytical and communication skills

Desirable:

  • Understanding of HR transactional processes
  • Experience of designing SAP roles
  • Knowledge of SAP & SuccessFactors
  • Experience of working on business transformation/technology implementation programmes
  • Experience of working in a cross-functional team
  • Relevant degree or equivalent experience preferred

Excellent Opportunity with immediate starts available.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £36.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

  • Employee discount
  • Life insurance
  • Referral programme

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Ecologist
description:
(Permanent)

Nottingham, East Midlands

Senior Ecologist

Nottingham

£30,000 - £40,000


I am looking for an experienced and highly driven Senior/Principal Ecologist to join a successful Ecology team. My client operates mostly in the private sector on a variety of projects, including renewable energy, residential, logistics, and education. They are flexible in terms of location in the UK, Nottingham is just one of their offices within this discipline.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in the required subject.
  • At least four years of experience as a professional environmental consultant.
  • Good ecological field skills for a variety of protected species and ecosystems.
  • A thorough awareness of the legislative and planning policy frameworks governing ecological and environmental conservation.
  • The capacity to prepare clear, high-quality technical reports in accordance with CIEEM standards.
  • Experience with the newest Defra Biodiversity Metric is helpful (training can be provided).
  • Experience creating fee proposals, project management, and client engagement is desirable
  • Membership of CIEEM
  • Protected species licence(s) or working towards licences (help and training could be offered for interested candidates desiring to pursuing licenses.

Responsibilities

  • Extended phase 1 habitat surveys/UK Habs surveys are being conducted to accurately define and map habitats, as well as assess their capacity to support notable/protected species.
  • Conducting phase two surveys for legally protected species.
  • Creating a variety of environmental reports and assessing junior team work
  • Designing and managing ecological surveys, as well as related mitigating measures.
  • Project Management
  • Communicating with clients, professional advisors, contractors, and the general public.
  • Developing and sustaining strong working connections at all levels of the organisation, including with clients, subcontractors, and third parties (regulators, statutory consultees, etc.).
  • There will also be opportunities for candidates to manage and mentor junior team members if they like.

Additional Benefits

  • Working away allowance for overnight fieldwork
  • Company matched pension scheme.
  • 24 days annual leave in addition to bank holidays, with holiday increasing with service with options to buy additional holiday
  • Extensive training opportunities and supported CPD.
  • Hybrid working

If this opportunity is one of interest and you’d like to discuss it further, please get in touch with our Geotechnical and Environmental consultant, Dan McIntosh, with your most up-to-date CV.

title: Teacher
description:
SEMH Teacher Needed at Special Education School

We are looking for a SEMH teacher for a SEND school! Our supportive and close-knit special education school serving students with social, emotional, and mental health challenges is seeking a dedicated SEMH Teacher to join our team. You will be a class teacher to a class size of 6 to 14 students all with EHCP plans, along side you will be a team of dedicated support staff to work with the students.

As an SEMH Teacher you will be expected to teach the class, create appropriate resources, Complete planning and ensure it is differentiated for all children in your class. You will be creating engaging lessons, planning trips when available and ensuring the students can access the environment and curriculum!

The responsibilities include:

Teaching classes across a range of subjects catered to students' individual learning needs

Developing engaging lesson plans that incorporate emotional regulation, relationship-building, and self-management skills

Employing specialized instruction techniques such as visual schedules, movement breaks, sensory tools, and positive behaviour supports

Collaborating with other teachers, counsellors, and parents to implement customized behaviour plans

Encouraging students to express themselves in healthy ways and providing emotional support

Collecting data on behaviour and academic progress to adjust teaching strategies

Maintaining an structured, compassionate classroom environment

The ideal candidate will have:

Special education degree and certification in SEMH

Experience teaching students with learning disabilities, ADHD, mood disorders, trauma, etc.

Access to a vehicle and the ability to drive

Knowledge of de-escalation techniques and conflict resolution strategies

Strong classroom management abilities

Empathy, patience, and passion for working with special needs children

The benefits of working with Simply Education:

  • 24 hour access to Jess the SEN consultant with 6 years experience in the education
  • No or minimal timesheets
  • A range of specialist provisions in Northamptonshire and Warwickshire
  • FREE CPD Training including (SEND specific)

The successful candidate will be required to:

  • Subject to two years of satisfactory references
  • An Enhanced DBS check

Don't miss out on joining one of Northamptonshire's outstanding SEN team! Get in touch with Simply Education today to explore current vacancies in more details and take the next step. I look forward to helping you progress in your SEN career!

If you are interested in the role please contact Jess our experienced SEND consultant who can help you with more details on 01604 372 495 or email your CV to jessica@simplyeducation.co.uk

Together we can make a difference!

title: Service Engineer
description:
• Location:

    Coventry

  • Sector:

    Industrial

  • Salary:

    £36000 - £55000 per annum

  • Contact:

    Ben Gough

  • Job ref:

    BG/151111

  • Published:

    8 days ago

Laser Service Engineer

Coventry

Up to 45k (depending on experience), plus overtime (Up to 55-60k)

Get bored of being stuck in the same place? Fancy opportunities to travel the UK and more?

You'll already know what a service engineer does. You travel from site to site, fault finding, servicing and maintaining. You'll be doing a similar role here, but on LASERs.

Imagine telling your friends down the pub you work with lasers?!

After a £4 billion global turnover for 2022, the company is looking to invest in new members of their UK service team.

You might not know anything about lasers, and that's ok. This role provides an intensive product specific course on Industrial Laser Machinery in Germany! What's more, PLC training is also included!

So, whether it's your first steps into engineering or simply a career or industry change, this could be for you.

The business wants to look after you. So, as well as training and a good salary, they'll also give you a van and milage cover, 33 days holiday that increases with service and bonuses on length of time served.

What do I need?

You might not have worked with lasers before, but you'll already have maintenance experience. This could be in manufacturing, aerospace or automotive - whatever you've done, this could be the next step for you.

There is job specific training on offer, but you'll already have a good knowledge base through a recognised Electrical or Mechanical Engineering Qualification.

This role will see you travelling across the UK, so nights away will be required. At least hotel beds are comfortable (and paid for) though!

A UK driving licence is essential, but that's a given as you'll be spending your time on the road, and you get a van with the job.

What business will I be a part of?

They are one of the largest industrial laser manufacturers on the planet with teams in the UK, Europe, North and South America, Asia and Pacific, and Australia! Providing ample opportunity to explore the world.

What better place to advance your career than a global business?

They are involved in multiple industries such as the Automotive, Aerospace, Plastics and FMCG sectors giving you plenty of variation and exposure to new areas of manufacturing.

Not name dropping, but they work with the likes of Rolls Royce and JCB.

What's Next?

Give me a call! Whether you're already hooked or fancy knowing just that little bit more. You can reach me, Ben at 01780480530 or email me at ben.gough@morepeople.co.uk. You can also drop me a message on LinkedIn if that's easier. Don't worry about having an up-to-date CV, we can sort that out later.


Ben Gough

Recruitment Consultant

07376 971 308
ben.gough@morepeople.co.uk

title: Senior Account Administrator
description:
Overview

Location: Leicester, LE3 5BJ (Fully office based for 6 months, then hybrid working from home 1-2 days a week)

Hours: 37.5 hours Monday – Friday (Open start/finish between 8am-5pm)

Salary: £23,000 per annum.


Not just excellent Customer Service

You'll be joining a people-centric organisation, recently recognised as a 'Very Good Company To Work For' by Best Companies (2023). Also voted as ‘Consultancy of the Year’ with the ‘Best Business Solution’ at TELCA (2021), Consultus is a leading provider of net zero and energy services. Lauded for a ‘world-class’ service with an exceptional reputation, we have one of the highest client retention rates in the industry and have been voted ‘Most Trusted Consultancy’ 2 years running.

The Consultus International Group is a cause-driven business, on a mission to leave the planet in a better place than it is now. At the forefront of innovation, we’re looking for great minds to help us support people on their Net Zero journey.

Why are we different? It’s more than a customer-first mindset, it’s a different way of thinking. We think outside the box and work together to deliver solutions for our customers.

Our Senior Customer Account Administrators are:

  • Able to lead by example – you will eventually help to train new starters
  • Experienced in customer service and account management, with a customer focus
  • Relationship builders with personality – we want to see the real you!
  • Computer literate (MS Office/365) with a focus on attention to detail
  • Good communicators, particularly over the phone

We’re looking for people whose values are aligned with ours – Our Values | The Consultus International Group Limited


Become an expert with us

This is an exciting opportunity within a fast paced, well-established team, supporting the Account Management of an Industrial & Commercial portfolio. We are looking for a commercially minded person, with a keen eye for detail to assist the designated Consultant and Team Leader with the administration of customer accounts. The ability to delegate to the wider team and a keen eye for detail is essential.

We will provide you with a great understanding of the energy industry. After initial training, as part of your role you will:

  • Maintain relationships with relevant clients, internal stakeholders, and suppliers
  • Submit tender requests and providing recommendations to the client (flex/fixed contracts)
  • Review client estates quarterly for accuracy – check for additions and deletions
  • Update monthly strategic internal reports
  • Assist in the review of client metering contracts and update systems accordingly
  • Assist in the management of complex queries associated to your specific portfolio as well as providing cover for fellow team members when absent – we have a supportive culture
  • Drive company revenues and identify new business opportunities
  • Where required work independently to resolve queries and liaise with clients
  • Assist in resolution of objections and rejections
  • Phone clients and participate in client meetings
  • Delegate where required
  • Deliver the training to new starters

We are invested in you!

We want to build a team for the future, not just today. That’s why we’re committed to your development and wellbeing and value your opinion. As part of your role, you will have your say on how we can improve.

We understand that everyone has their own needs, which is why we provide our people with Perkbox rewards. Perkbox allows you to create a benefits package which is unique to you! In addition, you’ll receive:

  • Personalised learning and development programme
  • A clear Progression Pathway, to ensure your career is moving in the direction you want it to
  • External ‘Employee Assistance Programme’ and continuous initiatives, to support mental and physical wellbeing
  • Enhanced maternity/paternity/adoption leave pay
  • Enhanced annual leave
  • Access to company’s annual Bonus Scheme
  • Incentivized Referral Schemes
  • Flexible Working Scheme, to ensure a comfortable work-life balance
  • Hybrid home and office working from our modern offices in Leicester, because you can!

Committed to inclusion and diversity

The Consultus International Group is an organisation represented by individuals from all backgrounds. We are proud to continue building a team which embraces inclusion, so encourage suitable applications from a diverse array of talent.

As a Disability Confident Committed employer, under our Guaranteed Interview Scheme (GIS), we commit to interview candidates with disabilities if their application meets the minimum criteria for the role – please let us know during the application process.

Unfortunately, because we are unable to offer VISA sponsorship for this position, all applicants must be eligible to work in the UK.

Please be advised The Consultus International Group holds the right to close application deadlines early if high volumes of applications are made before the advertised close date.

title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Ready to launch your career with a lively recruitment agency? We're searching for enthusiastic go-getters to join our client's team as Graduate Recruiters. No degree required—just bring your best, a healthy dose of enthusiasm, and a touch of tenacity!

Position: Graduate Recruiter (5 Openings)
Location: Leicester, LE4 Area
Working Hours: 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM, Monday to Friday

What's on the Table:

  • Competitive base salary: £20,000 - £25,000 (based on experience)
  • Uncapped OTE in the first year: £40,000
  • 35 days of holidays, including bank holidays and Christmas Shutdown
  • Relaxed and chill work culture
  • Quarterly incentives and early finishes on Fridays (12:30 PM)
  • Exciting holiday trips for top performers (next stop: Barcelona!)

Key Duties:

  • Foster positive connections with candidates and clients
  • Identify and evaluate relevant candidates
  • Assess candidates based on client job specifications
  • Capitalise on client opportunities for broader business benefits
  • Generate leads for candidates and clients within the industry
  • Source for client needs nationwide

Essential Qualities:

  • Proficient in IT systems

title: Paediatrician
description:
Job Title -Consultant Paediatrician

Hours per week-10 PA- Substantive post

Perm/Fixed Term-Permanent: Locum also considered

Salary-Dependant on experience

Closing Date: 20th February 2024

Interview Date: 25th March 2024

Come and join our lively Paediatric team at George Eliot Hospital. This is key at this exciting time as there has been significant investment in the department and a new Medical Staffing Model has been implemented. For those with existing or aspiring leadership skills this is an excellent opportunity to develop further and have a meaningful contribution to the development of the service.

This post may close early due to high numbers of applications so you are advised to apply promptly.

All correspondence for this vacancy will be sent by email; please check your account regularly including your Junk and SPAM areas.

A great and friendly place to work, so bring your passion, commitment and expertise and enjoy the opportunities to make a difference every day.

#JoinTeamEliot

The successful candidate will join our team at a very exciting time. We have transformed the Paediatric model at Nuneaton which puts Clinicians leading and working together for career development at the heart of our service. Our vision is to provide first class consultant-delivered care to the children and families of Nuneaton and North Warwickshire.

The department has 8 Consultants, 6 middle grade doctors, 8 tier 1 junior doctors and 3 advanced practitioner nurses in an integrated multi-professional model of care. A good general Paediatric and Neonatal background is the priority and practical skills are essential. Special interests to complement the team are welcomed and in addition the opportunity exists for further on the job development.

In this new model consultants are resident on call at night, at the weekend. During the week the middle grade tier are resident on site with the consultant available from home after 21.30. There is also a tier one of junior doctors and physicians associates as well as rostered support from advanced clinical practitioners both in Paediatrics and neonatal care. The resident nature of the evening and night work provides for substantial time off during the week because daytime activity is adjusted accordingly - detailed in the example work schedule Acute Paediatric Service.
There is no Paediatric inpatient ward at Nuneaton and ambulances convey directly to UHCW hospital.

Here at George Eliot our vision to ‘ excel at patient care’ takes centre stage. An ever evolving clinically-led acute service provider we are on a journey to continually provide high quality, safe and responsive services delivered by inspiring, friendly and compassionate staff who share our corporate values which underpin everything we do. Our values are not just words on a piece of paper, they bond us together, reflect our ambition and shape who we are:

E ffective Open Communication

e x cellence and safety in everything we do

C hallenge but support

E xpect respect and dignity

L ocal health that inspires confidence

Benefits: On-site nursery, 27 days minimum annual leave plus bank holidays, cycle to work scheme, flexible working, extensive in-house course learning directory, buying and selling of annual leave, subsidised restaurant, tranquillity garden and generous subsidised on-site parking.

To provide, with Consultant colleagues, general Paediatric and Neonatal services within George Eliot NHS Trust for the prevention, diagnosis and management of illness and the proper functioning of the department

To undertake General Paediatric Outpatient Clinics and other special interest clinics as appropriate to the skills/interests of the post holder and as agreed at annual Job Planning

The post holder undertakes to perform additional duties in occasional emergencies and unforeseen circumstances

Undertake administrative duties associated with the care of patients (including activity data as required) in line with Trust Policy.

There is scope for a motivated consultant to take the lead in shaping the future of the service and for special interests to complement the team including cardiology and safeguarding.

About the Team and the Trust

The Children’s Department is undergoing significant changes in the next few months. There are dedicated clinical areas:

Level 1 Special Care Baby Unit within the Consultant Led Maternity Unit.

CAU, currently located within ED but with aspirations for development.

Outpatient Clinics

Nuneaton itself offers all the advantages of urban living with easy access to the beautiful countryside nearby and good wider transport links. The George Eliot serves a population of about 300,000 from Nuneaton & Bedworth, North Warwickshire, South West Leicestershire and Northern Coventry. It serves a catchment population between the major hospitals in Coventry, Leicester and East Birmingham and has good working links with the specialist services at tertiary units in Birmingham and Leicester.

The region has very reasonable house prices, and a large choice of very good state and private sector schools in the area, make this an ideal setting for a family home. There are numerous villages within easy driving distance of the hospital for those who prefer a rural setting. It’s a great place to bring up a family, have a great quality of life and a great place to work.

We are committed to balance well-being and professional interest throughout a career in Paediatrics at the George Eliot. We are delighted to offer an interesting yet life-style compatible 1:8 Consultant of the Week rota. This consultant is responsible for all the patients seen by the Paediatric team in the hospital for a consecutive period of either 4 week days (Monday - Thursday) or 3 weekend days (Friday – Sunday). The week is split to provide better work-life balance. The Consultant of the Week will have no other routine commitments such as clinics. An example 10PA work schedule is included in the Job Description.

The post is offered on a full-time basis; however, the Trust would welcome discussion with individuals looking for a more flexible working pattern to support a different work life balance. The post-holder (full-time or part-time) will be expected to take part in the full on-call rota.

title: Registered Nurse
description:
NURSING

Registered Nurse Ward (RN)

Registered Nurse - Ward (RGN)

Derby Hospital | Nursing | Permanent | Full Time

37.5 Hours per week

Nuffield Health is the charity that’s building a healthier nation, one day at a time. From award-winning hospitals and leisure facilities to flagship community programmes – we’ll do whatever it takes to look after the UK’s wellbeing. It starts with passion and commitment to quality. It starts with you.

As a Staff Nurse on the Elective Surgical Ward at our Derby Hospital, you’ll drive the standard in patient care. You’re registered with the appropriate governing body, plus you bring the qualifications and experience that are relevant to your registration, including NMC. You also have post-registration experience.

As a Ward Staff Nurse, you will:

  • Be flexible, motivated, an excellent communicator and team worker

  • Join a close-knit team headed by our matron on our consultant-led ward

  • Fully understand and pay close attention to each patient’s needs

  • Work directly with some of the best clinical talent around

  • Gain valuable experience of new practices, equipment and facilities

  • Collaborate with practitioners across other departments to ensure continuity in patient care

Helping you feel good

We want you to love coming to work, feeling healthy, happy and valued. That’s why we’ve developed a benefits package with you in mind. From free private healthcare to gym membership, a cycle to work scheme and more. At Nuffield Health, we take care of what’s important to you.

Nuffield Health Derby Hospital

The Nuffield Health Derby Hospital is a modern, purpose-built hospital with 38 en-suite beds, three operating theatres, and together with a comprehensive range of outpatient services.

The Radiology department is a small but busy department covering general radiographic procedures, theatre, ultrasound, MRI and CT. Set in beautiful grounds, we’re about 3 miles from the city centre, within easy reach of all major roads and bus routes.

Join Nuffield Health and create the future you want, today

If you like what you see, why not start your application now? We consider applications as we receive them and reserve the right to close adverts early (for example, where we have received an unprecedented high volume of applications). So, it’s a good idea toright away to ensure you’re considered for this role.

It starts with you

Location

Derby - Derbyshire

Contract type

Permanent

Reference

JR0073964

REWARDS & BENEFITS

Helping you be and feel your best.

Annual Leave

25 days + Bank Holidays, increasing to 27 days after 5 years and to 30 days after 10 years of service.

Nuffield Health Healthcare Plan

Membership is free for employees and you can add partner and dependants at your own cost.

Financial Wellbeing

A range of employee benefits through a Financial Wellbeing provider – including affordable loans repaid through salary, access to your pay when you need it, simple savings, a government Help to Save scheme and money insights.

Cycle to Work Scheme

Save money, get fit and reduce your carbon footprint by taking advantage of this tax-efficient scheme to get a new bike.

Gym Membership

Free membership to any Nuffield Health gym, plus discounted memberships for family members.

Online GP

Discounted access to secure video and telephone GP consultations and a suite of healthcare management tools, provided by digital healthcare company Doctor Care Anywhere.

Emotional Wellbeing Support

Access to our Emotional Wellbeing services and discounted virtual, telephone, and face-to-face treatment.

Healthcare Scheme

Provides you with access to treatment in our own hospitals (or other Nuffield Health approved facilities).

Overtime

For clinical roles grade 9 and below, the overtime is at a standard rate of pay. For unsocial hours, you’ll be paid an additional enhancement to your salary at the following rates: Nights Hours worked between 7pm and 7am on any day of the week, 30% of basic hourly rate. Weekends Hours worked between 7am and 7pm on a Saturday or Sunday, 20% of basic hourly rate. Bank Holidays Hours worked between midnight and midnight of a bank holiday, 100% of basic hourly rate.

title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Have you always wanted to work in recruitment but found it hard to break into the industry? At QS Recruitment we firmly believe in discovering and nurturing new talent. Our well developed in-house training programme supports and encourages growth, assisting consultants to unlock their full potential and forge a successful career within the recruitment industry.

Based in our Nottingham office your duties as a Trainee Recruitment Consultant will include:

ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT:
  • Developing strong relationships with all clients, maximising our market share potential
  • Providing unrivalled levels of customer service.
  • Communicating with customers regularly - creating staffing solutions, advising on market trends, troubleshooting, and discussing future requirements.

RECRUITMENT:
  • Proactively sourcing new candidates using a variety of different methods.
  • Managing applications, ensuring that they comply with legislative guidelines.
  • Building and maintaining strong relationships with candidates, ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process
  • Identifying and maximising work opportunities for applicants.
  • Utilise social media platforms to promote job openings and engage with potential candidates.

BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT:
  • Creating, developing, and maintaining relationships with a variety of clients,
  • Securing new business using various Business Development techniques, including cold calling
  • Utilise social media platforms to engage with potential clients

How are we different to our competitors?
  • We offer a starting basic salary of £25,625 with a guaranteed increase to £27,000 following the completion of your training programme.
  • Monthly bonus opportunities
  • 20% bonuses paid out on perm placements
  • Weekly or monthly pay
  • Enjoy up to 34 holidays per year.
  • Then take another paid day off every year to celebrate your work anniversary!
  • We have a team of Mentors on hand to help you succeed
  • We boast an inhouse Training Team delivering industry leading training throughout your career
  • Continuous Personal Development
  • We offer clear paths, support, and encouragement for genuine career progression all the way to management level.
  • Company events
  • All our sites offer free on-site parking.
  • Dress down Fridays.

Could you be a Recruitment Consultant?
Entering the industry as a Trainee Recruitment Consultant is an excellent way to learn in a supportive working environment, but what skills and attributes do you need?
  • A resilience to work under pressure and to deadlines.
  • A drive to overcome challenges and problem solve.
  • A genuine desire to succeed and develop your career.
  • A team player attitude.
  • Previous experience in a business to business customer service or sales environment (not retail).
  • Educated ideally to A Level.
  • A driving licence and access to transport.

You will be office based Monday to Friday. You will also be required to take part in our on call service on a rota'd basis
Recruitment is a rewarding and challenging career but one that offers diversity and no two days are the same!
**Visit our Work For Us page within our website to learn more about QS https://www.qsrecruitment.com/work-for-us/



About Quality Service Recruitment:

We are proud to be one of the leading staffing agencies in the Midlands and South Yorkshire.With eight offices stretching from Hinckley to Rotherham, and a head office in Nottingham, we offer high-quality permanent and temp recruitment services with a unique insight into the local market.We started as a specialist recruiter of HGV drivers back in 1993 and quickly gained a reputation for supplying reliable relief drivers. Since then, we have expanded our offering across three specialist sectors:Driving recruitmentWarehouse & Manufacturing recruitmentOffice and Admin recruitment

title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Recruitment Consultant

We are looking for an experienced Recruitment consultant, recruiting for both permanent and temporary staff to join our branch in Leicester.

365 People are a highly recognised and a respected brand for supplying driving, Industrial and commercial staff throughout the UK, with over 30 years combined experience.

Key duties of the role:

· Follow the step-by-step process to source candidates for opportunities in the Industrial and Transport industry.

· Understand all in-house systems, databases, job boards and social networks.

· Screening and interviewing potential candidates over the phone and face to face, ensuring that they are fully compliant.

· Writing appropriate Job descriptions and advertising

· Generating leads from interactions from both candidates and clients.

· Hitting daily, weekly, and monthly activity and financial targets

· Checking in with clients daily to check we are meeting their requirements.

· Checking in with candidates daily to make sure their requirements are met.

· Checking candidates’ documentation (Right to work documents, qualifications and references)

· Monitor responses and applications received.

· Work closely with clients and prospects to understand needs for relevant roles.

· Hold sales and account meetings with new or prospective clients.

· General admin

· Ensure that we operate to compliantly and in line with employment legislations.

What we would like from you:

· Must be exceptional at sales calls on the phone and in person.

· Ideally 6 months recruitment experience

· Proven record of successful business development

· Target driven.

· Excellent level of customer service

· Good level of Administration

· Full UK driving licence

Benefits

· £23,000 to £30,000.00 depending on experience

· Superb, uncapped commission structure

· Various weekly incentives and initiatives

· 22 days annual leave, plus bank holidays

Majority of your time will be spent in the 365 People office; however, you will be required to meet clients and candidates off-site at our client’s premises. It is therefore required that you have a full UK driving licence.

If you enjoy a fast paced and dynamic environment and you feel that you meet the above criteria, then please apply for this role.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
Our passion and purpose at Matrix is to ‘Connect people to work’. The more people we connect to work, the better it is for society and our business.

Our technology, and over 400 awesome people, make that possible by bringing together organisations that need solutions to meet their recruitment needs.

We provide products and services that allow our customers to recruit temporary, contingent or permanent staff, procure consultants and statement of works, and manage the screening and compliance of all workers.

We already do this for over 4000 customers across the UK and as that number grows we are perpetually looking for great people to join our team.

THE ROLE:

We are looking for a dynamic and personable Customer Success Executive with a background/experience in the recruitment in the recruitment sector.

Reporting to the Customer Success Manager, the Customer Success Executive’s primary role is to provide world-class service to their customers, using Matrix’s technology to fulfil their customer’s recruitment needs.

This role will be on-site, based at our clients hub in Lutterworth.

How will you do it? Well, you’ll:

  • Understand the customer’s requirements in depth and share this knowledge with the supply chain, to ensure the right quality of candidate is put forward
  • Hosting meetings with managers around fulfilment with their roles
  • Understanding of framework and compliance
  • Solution based theory’s on hard to fill roles
  • Creating relationships with suppliers that enable our boroughs to have confidence in quick turn arounds
  • Being able to understand requirements of manager needs and deliver timeframes within our SLA periods
  • Helping to ensure off contract spend is limited and brought on contract via Matrix, saving the client monies
  • Ensure that the details of your customer’s vacancies are up to date with the correct levels of detail to attract the right candidates
  • Follow up to make sure timesheets are submitted and approved without queries each week
  • Attend weekly and monthly customer meetings, providing operational overviews of service delivery performance
  • Provide training support to customers, to ensure they are using Matrix technology effectively and efficiently
  • Answer customer queries via phone, email and live chat in a timely manner
  • Ensure that all candidates put forward for roles are 100% compliant, with the correct documentation.
  • Be committed to achieving the right outcomes for your customers – ensuring all key performance targets are met and working with Business Managers to achieve the customer’s commercial targets Highlight any commercial anomalies so they can be addressed immediately
  • Be committed to providing world-class service to your customers – achieving the highest scores in customer satisfaction measures and following up on feedback where necessary
  • Other tasks as required.

PERKS AND BENEFITS

  • Standard Pension – 3% Employers, 5% Employee
  • 25 days annual leave (plus Bank Holidays)
  • Your Birthday day off
  • Online discounts platform for major retailers (Westfield Rewards)
  • Employee Health Benefits (Westfield Health)
  • Electric Vehicle Salary Sacrifice Scheme and Cycle 2 Work Scheme
  • Discount Gym Membership
  • 2 Volunteer days a year (to volunteer in their local community)
  • Air conditioned, well positioned office space in Milton Keynes
  • Break out room with pool table and Smart TV
  • Free onsite parking
  • A strong sense of belonging and a great culture in a work focused environment
  • Opportunities to progress
  • Social Committee with minimum 2 events per year
  • Free fresh fruit, teas, coffees and hot chocolate available

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Up to £24,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • Recruitment: 1 year (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Lutterworth

title: Warehouse Lead
description:
Fairfield School of Business (FSB), a private higher education provider founded in 2006 with campuses in London, Birmingham and Luton. We provide industry-relevant qualifications in business and healthcare management, in partnership with leading UK universities.

Our focus is to offer an open and inclusive learning and teaching environment for both students and staff. We are also committed to providing access to higher education to those who may not have formal qualifications, financial means or can commit to the schedule of a mainstream university.

We are currently seeking to appoint an IAG (Information, Advice and Guidance) Team Leader on a Full-time, permanent basis.

Job purpose:

We are seeking a qualified leader to help keep our company running effectively whilst managing a group of consultants in the company’s new phase, through the use of their own skill and leadership.

You will be supporting the sales, marketing, and the IAG team by ensuring that the team is compliant with the policies and procedures of the organisation and offering consistency in service delivery.

You will also be responsible for leading, training and guiding each team member under your supervision.

Our ideal leader has in-depth knowledge of and experience with the sales process, excelling at lead generation, relationship building, and closing. We’re seeking a quick learner with strong negotiating skills, and someone with a track record of success who can inspire the same in others.

More importantly, we are looking for someone who has a strong background in either sales, customer service or information, advice and guidance with a real passion for helping people through understanding.

Although it will not be a sales role, the company progress reports are based on deliverables and target quotas so it may well seem like a sales role.

The role demands a leader with a sharp mind and the ability to coach, advise, motivate and guide to create and maintain a high-performing team.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Set sales goals for your team, compare performance to goals, and adjust goals as needed. Calling new prospects after sourcing their CVs.
  • Assessing prospective applicants and matching them with opportunities.
  • Screening and short-listing candidates before clients meet them.
  • Making sure your team are focusing on quality service.
  • Making sure your team provide accurate information, advice and guidance.
  • Meet overcall targets set by stakeholders and management.
  • Motivate and guide advisors with your track record and regular morning huddles.
  • Provide detailed and accurate forecasts for people within your team.
  • Ensure that your team hit their target/quota
  • Help each team member to become better through regular training.
  • Foster a competitive yet collaborative team environment.
  • Assess individual performance through observation and measurement, and suggest corrective actions as needed.

Desired Criteria

title: Psychologist
description:
This new Assistant Psychologist post offers an exciting opportunity for an experienced assistant psychologist with an interest in social issues. The postholder will work across Nottingham Recovery Network (NRN), a partnership of organisations providing support to individuals in relation to substance abuse and related difficulties.

The Assistant Psychologist will be employed by partner organisation Al-Hurraya, an organisation focused on providing culturally specific interventions for people in Black, Asian, Minority Ethic and Refugee communities.

The post will involve working closely with a consultant clinical psychologist and will evolve over time. There is potential for some direct clinical work with service users, but mostly indirect work supporting staff, e.g. through training, consultations and team formulations, responses to incidents, and service developments and evaluations. There is excellent networking across the teams, organisations and wider Nottingham City Severe and Multiple Disadvantage partnership. The post will be closely supervised and supported.

We particularly welcome applications from Black, Asian or Minority Ethnic Individuals who have experience of working with people who use substances and / or experience of the criminal justice system. Lived experience is welcome. A psychology degree at 2:1 or higher is essential.

Role Purpose:

The post-holder will support the clinical psychology provision across Nottingham Recovery Network teams, including specialist drug, alcohol, criminal justice, psychosocial and Rough Sleeper Drug and Alcohol Treatment teams. The specialist clinical psychology provision aims to develop and support psychologically- and trauma-informed approaches for both service users and staff. Specific roles will include:

· Reviewing electronic notes and liaising with other professionals to prepare for psychological team formulations or consultations and contribute to risk assessments.

· Writing reports and electronic notes to a high standard.

· Supporting development, delivery, and evaluation of training to staff teams.

· Coordinating Critical Incident Stress Management Debriefs, maintaining a database of debriefs and collating and analysing feedback.

· To utilise skills for audit, service evaluation and research to contribute to policy and service development.

· To support specific service development initiatives, such as increasing accessibility of the service to those who face additional barriers (e.g. on the basis of ethnicity or culture, neurodiversity, or other reasons). This would include consultations with relevant specialists, service users, or other stakeholders.

· To undertake relevant reading, literature reviews, training or other learning activities as required.

· To actively attend and contribute to Framework’s Anti-Racism Working Group and other initiatives that support the development of inclusive and equitable services.

· To make excellent use of reflective supervision and feedback to support personal and professional development.

· To work autonomously within the limits of competence and seek help when required.

· Depending on skills and experience, there is scope to be involved in direct work with service users, but the qualified clinical psychologists predominantly work indirectly, supporting team members who provide direct support to service users.

Role Context:

This post will provide support to a consultant clinical psychologist working across NRN teams and Framework, and a clinical psychologist working specifically within the NRN Rough Sleeper Drug and Alcohol Treatment Team. Both psychologists have close links to the Trent Doctorate in Clinical Psychology programme and research active.

The role will involve frequent exposure to highly distressing circumstances, e.g. histories of or current severe abuse, trauma, physical harm to self or others, as well as working conditions which may include verbal aggression and threats of physical violence from others.

Safeguarding

All employees are responsible for taking all reasonable measures to ensure that the risks of harm to children and vulnerable adults are minimised. They should take all appropriate actions to address concerns, working to agreed local policies and procedures including the guidance on Safeguarding, in partnership with other relevant agencies. This includes accessing appropriate training, advice and support, and Disclosure and Barring Services.

Where this post relates to the types of work, activity, employment or profession as set out in The Exceptions Order made under the Rehabilitation of Offender Act 1974; the post will be subject to a DBS Disclosure check at the point of recruitment and thereafter, as the Framework determines appropriate. The level of the check will be determined by the type of activities undertaken and the level of contact the post holder will have with children and/or adults in receipt of health services.

Infection Control

All employees have an individual responsibility to have knowledge of and employ the basic principles of infection prevention and control practice. All employees must comply with Infection Prevention and control mandatory training requirements specific to their role.

Equality & Diversity

All staff should be able to demonstrate an understanding of and commitment to Equality, Diversity and Inclusion in line with policies, procedures, and associated Equality, Diversity and Human Rights legislation.

Sustainability

It is the responsibility of all staff to minimise environmental impact wherever possible. This will include recycling, switching off lights, computers, monitors and equipment when not in use. Helping to reduce paper waste by minimising printing/copying and reducing water usage, reporting faults and heating/cooling concerns promptly and minimising travel. Where the role includes the ordering and use of supplies or equipment the post holder will consider the environmental impact of purchases.

Please ensure a cover letter is sent with your CV.

Salary: £28,407.00 per year

  • Nottingham, NG1 6BB: Relocate before starting work (required)

title: Junior Technical Consultant
description:
Reference: TQ2223_2139_327

Vacancy: 3

Job title: Junior Oracle Technical Consultant

Location: Leicester

Job Purpose:

TESTQ Technologies is an IT services and solutions company whose offerings spans over variety of industry sectors with strong technical, domain and process expertise helping clients grow their businesses and decrease operational costs on continuous basis in an ever-changing business environment.

This opportunity is in the solution design and development arena for Junior Oracle Technical Consultant who will play a major role with the technical design and development of the company’s technical offerings. The position is based at our Leicester office with occasional assignments at client locations.

Job Description (Main Duties and Responsibilities):

  • Developing, maintaining, supporting, and optimizing key functional areas, particularly, network infrastructure, server infrastructure, data communications, and telecommunications systems.
  • To provide and deliver development services around Oracle Middleware Solutions and Technologies - Oracle Identity Management.
  • Systems Administration in Oracle and Amazon Cloud (AWS).
  • Enable provisioning and ongoing support of our Oracle hosted client solutions and Oracle internal infrastructure.
  • Develop and optimize database objects such as tables, views, stored procedures, and triggers.
  • Perform data modeling and database performance tuning.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation for Oracle solutions, including design documents, code documentation, and deployment guides.
  • Provide technical support to clients during implementation and post-implementation phases.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Oracle applications and databases.
  • Configure and develop middleware solutions to facilitate data exchange between Oracle and other systems.

Key Skills, Qualifications and Experience Needed [The candidate must demonstrate these in all stages of assessment]

  • Relevant Oracle certifications (e.g., Oracle Certified Professional) are a plus.
  • Strong expertise in Oracle technologies, including Oracle Database, Oracle Forms, Oracle Reports, Oracle APEX, and PL/SQL.
  • Knowledge of Oracle Fusion Middleware components (WebLogic, SOA Suite, etc.).
  • Proficient in Oracle application development tools and frameworks.
  • Experience with Java, JavaScript, or other relevant programming languages.
  • In-depth knowledge of Oracle database concepts, SQL, and database optimization techniques.
  • Familiarity with OTLR earning policies, shift differentials, rotations plan.
  • Expertise in payroll functional step-ups including local, state, federal taxes, pay runs.
  • Good understanding of the IT market & trends and IT architecture.
  • Previous experience in Oracle implementation projects or consulting roles.
  • Capable of integrating Third party tools with Oracle Apps Databases.

Other Key skills:

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Working together in teams.
  • Leadership and effective decision making.
  • Flexible Attitude.

Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree or above in the UK or Equivalent.

Salary:  GBP 29000 to 40000 per annum

Published Date: 02-Feb-2024

Closing Date: 03-Mar-2024

Evaluation: CV Review, Technical Test, Personal and Technical Interview and References

Job Type: Full-time, Permanent [Part time and Fixed Term option is available] *

title: Production Coordinator
description:
Job Title: Waiting List Coordinator

Shift Pattern: Monday- Friday 9am-5pm or 8am-4pm

Trust Location: Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust

Would you like to be a part of a team that works well together, always there to help each other? If you answered yes, Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust is the place for you.

About the Trust

We deliver district general services to 2.5m residents of Nottingham, Nottinghamshire, and its surrounding communities. Our specialist services allow us to deliver care to 4.5m people from across the East Midlands and nationally for a handful of services. QMC is where our Emergency Department (ED), Major Trauma Centre and the Nottingham Children’s Hospital are based. It is also home to the University of Nottingham’s School of Nursing and Medical School. Nottingham City Hospital is our planned care site, where our cancer centre, heart centre and stroke services are based, and where some of our emergency admissions units are located. Ropewalk House is where we provide a range of outpatient services, including hearing services.

What you’ll be responsible for:

· Responsible for adding/removing patients to the NUH waiting list and co-ordinating/booking

· admission to hospital, using hospital IT systems, e.g., Medway and Bluespier.

· Act as the first point of contact within the Trust for patients who have enquiries regarding

· Admission details and waiting list queries, in person, telephone, email.

· Be responsible for the management and accurate validation of consultant waiting lists in line with 18-week RTT targets, maintaining accurate records to ensure all admissions for elective procedures are outcome and completed on Medway PAS, in line with Trust Access Policy.

· Ensure all relevant actions are taken to initiate, amend and cancel theatre lists in accordance with theatre policy

· Ensure surgeon’s annual leave or availability is escalated, to ensure theatres can be

reallocated.

· Arrange transport/interpreter for patients who require it

You’ll learn the following whilst working at the trust:

1. An in depth understanding of the roles and responsibilities involved in working within the NHS

2. Knowledge of the systems used, to effectively complete your role to the highest standard at all times

3. A sense of teamwork, gained through working alongside and supporting colleagues from all levels, within the organisation

You’ll have the following skills/experience:

· Excellent communication skills- both verbal and written

· Microsoft office skills- Outlook, Word, and Excel

· Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure

· Previous admin experience

· Previous NHS experience

· Diary management experience

This role may require you to show evidence of vocational level 3 qualification or at least 2 years relevant experience.

As a member of NHS Professionals, you have fantastic benefits:

· Competitive pay rates- work this week, get paid next week

· Essential support when you need it- 24/7 365 days- call us anytime

· Multi locational- work across neighbouring Trusts

· Manage your shifts and timesheets on the go- access your “My Bank” shift portal anywhere, anytime online or through your smartphone

· Varied working options to suit your lifestyle- access to the Bank gives you options of ad hoc shifts or longer-term placements

· Training and development opportunities- Keep up with the essentials and more

· Build holiday allowance for every shift you work- your work life balance is important to us

· Stakeholder pension scheme available- a flexible future for you and yours

Who are NHS Professionals?

We specialise in putting people in place to care. Every year we help thousands of dedicated candidates and highly skilled NHS workers enjoy better career opportunities, access to more shifts and a healthier work-life balance, giving more choice and control to our members.

As an equal opportunities’ organisation, NHSP is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective Bank members and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender reassignment, or marriage and civil partnership. We believe there is a strong case for the Equality, Diversity and inclusion agenda and we strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants form a range of backgrounds to apply.

Apply Today

By joining us you can look forward to a choice of flexible Bank shifts across any of our client Trusts in England, as well as the ability to develop professionally and gain experience in several wards or areas.

Disclaimer

Please note, you will be contacted by email throughout the recruitment process, so please check your emails, including your junk/spam regularly. We regret we cannot contact everyone who is not selected for an interview, therefore if you do not hear from us within 21 days after submitting your application, please assume you have not been successful on this occasion.

NHS Professionals manage your data, please see our Privacy Notice on our website.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary contract

Salary: £12.86 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Do you have previous NHS experience?

Work Location: In person

title: Private Client Solicitor
description:
A leading regional firm has an opportunity for a Private Client Solicitor to join the team in Ashby-De-La-Zouch. It is a pivotal time to join the team as it looks to further expand its offering in the area.

Having been established in the area for many years, the firm is well-known across Leicestershire for its high-quality client service and has built up a loyal client base.

Joining the friendly team, the main responsibilities of the successful Private Client Solicitor will include:

  • Handling a caseload of wills and probates, lasting powers of attorney, administration of trusts and estates, COP matters and more
  • Building and maintaining strong relationships with both new and existing clients
  • Networking with other professionals and contacts to continue building the department's profile in the region

This role would suit a Private Client Solicitor with upwards of 2 years' PQE, or perhaps a more junior solicitor with pre-qualification experience in this area.

Having been established for over 20 years, our consultants at Sacco Mann are experts in legal recruitment and have developed long-standing bonds with clients and candidates. title: People Assistant Apprentice
description:
Job Title:

People Assistant Apprentice

Employer:

Nova Education Trust

Location:

Room C09–C11

The Sir Colin Campbell Building

University of Nottingham Innovation Park

Triumph Road

Nottingham

NG7 2TU

Pay:

£5.28 per hour

Daily Hours:

Monday to Thursday 8am to 4pm.

Friday 8am to 3.30pm.

(Can be flexible if needed)

Total Weekly Hours:

37

Qualification: HR Support Level 3

Duration: 16 months

Units Covered:

· Personal development

· Role fundamentals

· Business fundamentals

· Stakeholders

· Legislation and policies

· HR services and fundamentals

How an apprenticeship works:

As an Apprentice, you will be employed, just like anyone else at the company, the only difference is that you spend some of your week studying towards a qualification.

Typically, you will have a teams meeting once a month (2-3 hours) with your assigned Trainer Assessor unlike the usual assumption that you will attend college for one day a week. Throughout the month, you will be expected to complete different assignments and independent study as discussed in this meeting in preparation for the next month. Each week, you will spend a minimum of 6 hours in a number of different Training, Learning & Development Activities that all develop your Knowledge, Skills & Behaviours which will be completed in your place of work during your working hours- so no homework!! These 6 hours will be agreed with your manager and can be set as a whole day or split throughout the week, whatever works best for you!

After approximately 6 months, you will be set mock activities by your Trainer Assessor to help you prepare for your End Point Assessment (EPA). This will include Multiple Choice Questions, Presentations of your work and Q&A’s. You will receive lots of one-to-one support to prepare you for this!

CT Skills is always sure to provide full support from your Initial Application to your final EPA! As we are a training provider, all of our vacancies are for immediate start and available all year round, so please consider this when you are applying!

IN ORDER TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR AN APPRENTICESHIP, YOU MUST HAVE GRADE 4/C OR ABOVE IN GCSE ENGLISH AND MATHS (OR EQUIVALENT) AND HAVE LIVED IN THE UK FOR AT LEAST 3 YEARS.

About the employer & website link:

Our family is currently made up of 15 academies (five primaries, nine secondaries and one sixth form college). In 2019, we entered into a long-term support partnership with Madani Schools Federation in Leicester to work with their two schools.

Our organisation has undergone a significant transformation in recent times and is now unrecognisable culturally, educationally, financially and in governance terms.

Educationally, we go from strength to strength. 87% of our academies are now judged by Ofsted as Good or Outstanding.

Our trust support and governance is strong, and has been externally recognised as amongst the best in the sector, and our organisation is financially stable. Back-office functions have been completely reformed and centralised, there are robust systems and controls, and financially we post a year-on-year operating surplus.

We run a successful School Centred Initial Teacher Training (SCITT) programme making us a key player in the region by developing new teachers and providing training and development programmes for existing teachers and support/operational staff throughout their careers.

All our schools and operating units share the same mission, values, principles, and ambitions and as one family we fundamentally believe that through collective action (collective efficacy) we are stronger together.

For more information, please visit https://www.novaeducationtrust.net/

About the Team:

The People & Organisational Development Team is made up of a Head of People, 2x People Business Partners, 2X People Assistants. There is also a Head of Organsiational Development.

About the role:

We have a unique opportunity for a proactive and multi-talented individual to support People initiatives across the Trust. This is a new position and a great opportunity for someone who has a keen interest of working within HR. You will support the People leads in all aspects of administration across our school portfolio. You will also assist with the wider administrative needs for the Central team including room bookings, travel, monitoring of the email inbox and dealing with enquires in an efficient and professional manner.

Daily Duties:

· Support all aspects of HR administration for the portfolio of Primary schools and to have ownership of this group of schools, in their entirety, for administrative purposes.

· Work with schools in drafting adverts and job descriptions for posts in relation to the recruitment and on-boarding process. o Use the HR system to notify existing staff of internal opportunities.

· Manage the administrative system to monitor and track the recruitment process, to ensure all checks and references are undertaken and received and keep schools informed of new starter checks.

· Support schools to set up personnel files for their staff including the administration of their Single Central Record as required.

· Administer all Payroll Variation administration including contract amendment and leaver letters.

· Lead on administrative support around family friendly procedures i.e. maternity paternity and shared parental leave informing payroll of any applications.

· Maintain integrated HR/payroll systems by inputting all new starters and updating with leavers and any changes on the live system.

· Work alongside and support the wider People team in relation to all administrative support required for schools. Run regular reports for the Head of People and People Business Partners to inform Business Partner meetings within schools and for any internal board reports.

· Support the Head of HR and Business Partners in relation to specific project work.

· Support the wider People team in relation to servicing disciplinary, grievance, capability meetings and hearings and provide general administrative support for employee relation cases as required.

· Maintain employee confidence in the trust by keeping HR information confidential.

· Adhere to and promote the strategic aim of the People team and the trust.

Skills:

Apprenticeships are very demanding as you are working towards a qualification whilst working full time! You will need to be committed and motivated as there is lots of self-guided work involved.

  • Communication
  • IT
  • Logical
  • Attention to detail

  • Customer care
  • Initiative

  • Patience

Desired Experience and Qualifications:

· GCSE or equivalent English and Maths grade 4/C or above

· Some office/admin experience

Future Opportunities:

There will be the potential opportunity for a permanent role within the company following successful completion of the apprenticeship.

You could progress into People Officer/ People Advisor with an increase in salary and responsibilities.

Future Careers:

· Human Resources Officer

· Recruitment Consultant

· Employee Relations Adviser

· Management Consultant

· Occupational Psychologist

·

Please go to https://www.ctskills.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/HR-Support-Overview-L3.pdf for more information.

INTERESTED? Before you apply….

· Make sure you’ve fully read and understood the advert, the company, and the qualification.

· Are you committed to completing the apprenticeship qualification?

· Do you meet the eligibility criteria?

· Have you explained in your CV/Cover letter why you are applying and what interests you about this qualification?

· Is your CV up to date and relevant to this role? If you need help with this, please use our CV template: https://www.ctskills.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/Candidate-CV-Advice-Template-1.docx

What happens next?

If you’re application is successful, you will receive a phone call from our Recruitment Consultant. So, please ensure that this is apprenticeship programme is of interest to you as it will be a minimum 12-month commitment. If you are interested in an apprenticeship but unsure what you would like to do, please contact us for advice: https://www.ctskills.co.uk/contact-us/

After this phone call, you will be requested to complete a supporting statement that will be added to your CV before being sent to the employer. You will then be sent English and Maths assessments and a Basic Information Form to complete. The assessments must take at least 30 minutes and you need to achieve a Level 1 or above to be put forward for the position. You will also be asked to complete a Knowledge, Skills & Behaviours assessment (KSB) to recognise any prior learning related to the qualification.

title: Sales Consultant
description:
About Us

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses. With a founder's mentality and a 'team-first' attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

Role Description

As a self-employed Field Sales Consultant, you will have the opportunity to earn competitive uncapped commission by building relationships with small businesses and helping them understand the value SumUp products can drive. With our expansive product toolkit, you can act as a solutions consultant and offer all solutions in-house.

We are building an ambitious Field Sales team and we're looking for individuals who are passionate about sales, driven to succeed, and have a proven track record of exceeding targets. Our goal is to help and empower more business owners, and we need your help to achieve it.

What you'll do

  • Identifying and engaging high-potential clients within your designated territory, focusing on small and medium-sized businesses
  • Conducting compelling face-to-face meetings and delivering persuasive product demonstrations to showcase the benefits of SumUp's cutting-edge Card reader and POS solutions
  • Effectively communicating our products' value proposition and unique selling points, addressing client needs and objections with finesse
  • Proactively generating leads and building a robust sales pipeline through networking, referrals, and other targeted activities

You'll be great for this role if

  • You have demonstrated success in a prior Field Sales role, ideally from the hospitality and retail industries or another point-of-sale solution
  • You have the ability to consistently exceed sales targets and deliver outstanding results
  • You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build trust and foster long-term client relationships
  • You have in-depth knowledge of your market and a genuine passion for supporting local SMBs
  • You have experience with outbound lead generation, cold calling and building lead pipelines

Why you should join SumUp

  • Competitive uncapped commission structure, providing unlimited earning potential based on your performance
  • Comprehensive training and ongoing professional development opportunities to enhance your sales skills and product knowledge
  • The chance to run your own business and be a CEO of your company

The Recruitment Process

  • Introductory Pre-Selection meeting with our Talent Acquisition Partner
  • Meet the team with one of our Field Area Managers
  • Technical interview with the Head of Field Sales

About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating tools that help them run their businesses. With a founder's mentality and a 'team-first' attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. We do not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. We also strive for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibit harassment of any kind.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don't tick every box, it's ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.
