title: IT Technician
description:
Nottingham

206035-en_GB

Life on the team
We are seeking an experienced IT Technician for an immediate start, working at one of our customer sites in Derby. This is a site based role and you will be required to work onsite Mon-Fri, working a 8.5hr shift with 1hr lunch.

What you'll do

The responsibilities of this role will be to assist local and remote users to remedy software and hardware based IT issues both face to face and via the phone.

What you'll need

Essential:
SC Clearance.
Own transport, or suitable means of travel (Required to be on site Mon-Fri).
Face-Face customer experience.
Experience with software and hardware fixes.
Ability to go through additional clearances.
Willing to do out of hours work via on-call rota.
Pro-active nature.
Team player but ability to work alone unsupervised if needed.

Desirable:
Tech-Bar experience.
Experience in Laptop and Desktop build functioning
Ticket system experience (Service Now, ITSM).
Dell/HP or Lenovo accreditations.

Due to the nature of this role there may be additional entry requirements, for further information please speak to the Talent Acquisition Team.

Why you should choose us

Freedom & trust

You’ll have the support on hand when you need it and the autonomy when you don’t. Feel right at home in an environment where you’re able to work with freedom and flexibility, and trusted to manage your own work.

Showing appreciation & having fun

Great performance is recognised, so too is the willingness to help others. Our Bravo! awards and Long Service Awards Scheme are just a taste of how we say thank you for a job well done. And when it comes to recognising success, we love to celebrate. Our company and team events are legendary!

Working with the best

Over 1,300 technology consultants, 900 project managers and 3,200 systems engineers come together to form our highly regarded professional services community. You’ll find they’re a close-knit team, where mutual trust and collaboration is the norm.

Sharing knowledge

We organise several events and initiatives, such our UK Professional Services Conference and ‘Lunch and Learn’ sessions, that bring together the brightest minds in the business. Here you can learn new things, network, and celebrate success together.

Exciting digital technology

Challenging and rewarding projects: The range of technologies and industries that we are so diverse, that no two projects are alike. The result? A role for you that’s varied and provides the opportunity to expand your expertise and develop your career further.

Health & wellbeing

Our people are our greatest asset and we’re passionate about supporting you in feeling good and staying healthy. We offer a comprehensive Employee Assistance Programme, Wellbeing Champions, Mental Health First Aiders, Access to Work scheme, and more.

Personal development

We like to invest in our people. We offer training and technology certifications, mentoring and coaching, specialist or management careers, access to our on-the-go immersive learning platform, Percipio, and much more.

Inclusive workplace

People work best when they bring their whole selves to work, that’s why we see and value you as the amazing individual you truly are. We take a genuine interest you that extends beyond skills, knowledge, and experience. Our Employee Impact Groups champion best practice, celebrate diversity and promote inclusion within our industry.

Pension and financial security

Thinking ahead, planning for life’s uncertainties, or simply saving for a rainy day? We offer auto-enrolment onto our pension scheme, a Sharesave/SAYE scheme and more besides.

Flexible benefits

Do you fancy a new bicycle? Want to work-out at the gym? Or do you prefer to get-away from it all? With our voluntary flexible benefits platform, ‘My Benefits’, you can. Achieve savings with our Cycle2Work, GymFlex, Travel Insurance benefits and loads more.

You belong

At Computacenter, we celebrate difference and it’s important to us that we have a working culture where you can be free to be yourself; in an environment where you feel valued, respected, and supported to reach your full potential and experience a sense of belonging. Because we know when you thrive, we thrive.

As a proud equal opportunities employer, we’re committed to ensuring that there is fair and equal access to opportunities for everyone. Your application is considered on its merits regardless of your age, disability, ethnicity, gender identity, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law. All that matters to us is that you share our vision and values, and you bring the experience and skills we need.

We are proud to be a Disability Confident Employer, a government scheme that helps employers attract, recruit, and retain disabled staff. We welcome applications from disabled people and accept applications in alternative formats – and guarantee to interview applicants who have a disability.

Winning Together

At Computacenter, we have been writing success stories for more than 40 years! Today, we’re driving digital transformation with over 20,000 employees worldwide. We develop IT strategies, implement new technologies and manage complex infrastructures.

As a proud, independent partner to some of the world’s leading technology providers, our portfolio covers workplace, applications & data, cloud & data center, security, and networking. What’s the secret of our success? Quite simply, it’s our people.

The people who bring their unique skills and perspectives to a diverse and inclusive environment that enables them to reach their full potential.

We are an award-winning employer!

Your working environment
Meet your recruiter

Lauren Oakeby

title: Surgeon
description:
The Job Plan is annualised. This means that the individual appointed will be expected to deliver 8.5 sessions of DCC per week.The post-holder will have regular elective operating sessions, clinics and the opportunity for endoscopy lists should it fit with the post-holders skillset. They will be across all of our sites (Queens Medical Centre, City Hospital and Treatment Centre). These will sit within the Colorectal Surgery specialty, overseen by the Head of Colorectal.

Some of these commitments will be out of work-day hours e.g. evenings and weekends. The Unit will actively support the development of subspecialist interests in line with the vision for colorectal surgery at NUH and provision for this will be made via individualised training opportunities. Please refer to the job description and person specification attached to the advert for the full details of the vacancy.

title: Project Manager
description:
Our Opportunity

Are you a knowledgeable Project Manager, looking to work on a diverse range of projects with a leading, national consultancy?
Do you want to work with high- profile, prestigious clients, and deliver excellence as part of a collaborative team?
Are you ready to take the next step in your career?
We want to hear from you!

We are seeking an experienced, proactive Project Manager to join our team at Nottingham and help us deliver projects on behalf of Central Government departments.

You will be joining a multi-disciplinary sector team and be focused on your client and the development of the project. Embedding protocols and driving all aspects of design management are central to the work, along with direct client interaction.

This is a Midlands based role with projects across the Midlands and Wales, therefore a willingness to travel as required by the project/client is necessary for success in this position.

Pick Everard have a rich 160 + year history of delivering excellence within the built environment, and are proud to offer the successful candidate agile working, enhanced benefits and proper succession planning to allow for stable growth and progression opportunities.
We are proud to have a culture that is positive and prioritises its people, offering support and collaboration to all that join us.
This role will be initially focused on delivering work for a new, exciting Central Government client, however we are able to offer a diverse range of schemes as part of our growing pipeline.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Agree and develop the client’s brief from inception in conjunction with any other consultants appointed
  • Co-ordinate, manage and communicate with the client, project stakeholders and other consultants appointed to meet requirements of the project, preparation of programmes and undertaking programme management
  • Undertake change management, co-ordinate the design process, oversee and manage the control of the project both pre- and post-contract including financial expenditure throughout all RIBA stages.
  • Co-ordinate and manage the development of the procurement strategy and procurement activities
  • Undertake and participate in risk-, value- and opportunities management, including facilitating workshops in order to ensure that these activities are controlled within the project team including contractors, sub-contractors, and the supply chain
  • Communicate and chair meetings with the client, their stakeholders, and contractors as necessary
  • Prepare and issue reports, including but not limited to preparation of Project Execution Plans (PEP), Strategy Reports, Risk Registers, Progress Reports etc.
  • Develop new business opportunities including leading and participating in the preparation and presentation of bids

About You

Key Requirements:
  • Experience in a similar role in the construction environment
  • HNC, HND, a project management, architectural, engineering / construction related degree or related transferrable experience.
  • Eligibility to obtain, or existing possession of SC level Security Clearance is required to fulfil the duties of this role
  • Member of a construction related professional body, such as RICS, CIOB, CIBSE, etc. - desirable
  • A comprehensive knowledge of building technology and construction principles
  • Have a good understanding of forms of building contract and experience of contract administration (NEC/JCT/PPC2000). NEC3/NEC4 PM Accreditation desirable but not mandatory
  • Ability to control day to day programming and planning
  • Ability to monitor progress and expenditure of projects
  • Have a clear understanding of risk management including identification, management, mitigation and risk transfer
  • A good understanding of IT including Microsoft Word, Excel and Project
  • Bid writing and presentation skills

About Us

    At Pick Everard, we work together to make the extraordinary a reality. We are looking for exceptional new talent to be a part of our journey as we move forward through our ambitious five-year Business Plan.

    We are an independent award-winning property and construction consultancy firm, operating within the industry, providing complete integrated service delivery to help our clients deliver better solutions across real estate, infrastructure and the natural environment.

    We are at the forefront of the industry and enjoy a culture that is centered around being creative, professional, compassionate, client-oriented and fun.

    Our recent successes include:

    • Listed as an NCE100 Consultancy and AJ100 Practice
    • Named a Top 150 Consultancy by Building Magazine
    • Recognised as a leading Financial Times Consultancy
    • Winners of the Association of Consulting Engineers (ACE) Awards, Best Business Performance of the Year – Large Consultancy
    • Winners at the RICS Awards – Infrastructure category
    • An Investors in People and Investors in Excellence accredited business
    • Winners at the Enterprising Women Awards

    Through our remarkable history we have already established the sound principles of success and we have the vision and ambition to be even better, as we move forward into a very bright future. We’re growing and we need more experts onboard. Join us and we will provide you with an inspiring environment in which you’ll be able to drive real progress and impact in your career.

    To learn more about why it is good to work here please visit our website and follow us on social media. Be part of it.

    Remuneration and Benefits

    We value and promote a positive work-life balance and encourage every member of our team to get involved with charity, sports, community, and company events. Providing a balanced, enjoyable career is important to us, and we work hard to make sure everyone feels a valued part of our organisation. We are also a responsible employer and Investors in People accredited business.

    You will receive an attractive salary that will match your skills and experience, as well as the following benefits:

    • Hybrid working
    • Stakeholder pension
    • Life assurance
    • Private healthcare
    • 26 days’ annual leave + Bank Holidays + option to buy up to 5 days’ additional leave
    • Healthcare cashplan
    • Enhanced Maternity, Paternity and Childcare benefits
    • Enhanced Adoption & Shared Parental Leave benefits
    • Long service awards – including enhanced annual leave and vouchers
    • Annual Being PickEverard awards
    • Staff Discount Scheme
    • Spot Rewards
    • Professional subscriptions
    • Season ticket loan or car loan at senior level
    • Cycle to work scheme
    • Wellbeing support and Employee Assistance Programme

    Please note we do not accept speculative CVs or approaches from recruitment agencies.

    As an equal opportunities’ employer, Pick Everard is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership.

    We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join us on our journey.

    #LI-hybrid, #LI-BS1

Apply

Share

    Share Vacancy on Facebook
    Share Vacancy on X
    Share Vacancy on LinkedIn
    Send Vacancy to a friend

title: Communications Consultant
description:
Career Area:

Marketing

Job Description:

Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

If you would like to kick-start your career at Caterpillar in a cutting-edge role – look no further. Caterpillar is looking for a Marketing Communications Consultant in Desford!

What You Will Do:

  • Support the business objective and opportunities to develop and align the marketing tactics
  • Conduct market/competitive research to identify new opportunities and industry trends
  • Monitor metrics to review the effectiveness of existing marketing tactics
  • Maintaining effective communications in the marketing department to discuss and align the marketing strategy to the changing business target
  • Work together with local industry representatives to understand the business and their needs

What You Will Have:

  • Customer-focused mindset - Knowledge of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and the ability to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions
  • Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with (senior) stakeholders
  • Knowledge of the approaches, tools, and techniques for promoting creative, original thinking and the ability to apply it to a variety of business situations
  • Ability to effectively manage relationships with both suppliers and other divisions
  • Aspiration to excel in your career
  • Willingness to work autonomously and make decisions

We Offer:

  • Our goal at Caterpillar is for you to have a rewarding career. Our teams are critical to the success of our customers who build a better world.
  • Here you earn more than just a monthly wage because we value your performance. We offer a total rewards package based on your yearly performance rating and corporate results.
  • Hybrid work (3 days office/2 days HO per week) (#LI-Hybrid)

Contract type: Permanant

Salary: £ 45 000 – 56 000 depending on experience

The Power of Everyone

At Caterpillar, we believe each person is unique and valued, and are committed to ensuring that our workplace is diverse and representative of the many customers we serve around the globe. Different perspectives help us achieve our best work and come together to form a high-performing Caterpillar team that makes positive changes in the communities where we live and work.

Posting Dates:

January 29, 2024 - February 28, 2024

Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).

Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community .

title: Senior Recruitment Consultant
description:
At Blue Arrow, we're redefining the world of recruitment. We don't simply hire recruitment consultants, we invest in Recruitment Superheroes with a passion for people and purpose and ambitions of progression, rewards and so much more.

We have been named as a Financial Times Diversity Leader, awarded Best Companies three-star rating, the highest possible level representing organisations that excel at world class levels of workplace engagement and we continue to be an Investors in People Platinum employer - the highest accolade that can be achieved. Making Blue Arrow a truly great place to work.

At Blue Arrow, we genuinely care about creating a diverse and inclusive team, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because we know it makes us a stronger, better business. We are searching for people that share our excitement and passion for what we do, and we will continue to grow our #OneBlueFamily with brilliant people from all different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences, celebrating our differences and knowing that collectively we make the difference.

We're a team of high-achievers we're also parents, mentors, gym-goers, animal-lovers, bakers, music-lovers and so much more. We're Blue Arrow, and we're dedicated to Enhancing Your Everyday with our people-first priorities, Progression, Purpose, Teamwork, Rewards and Performance.

Sound like something you want to be a part of ? Here's what you need to know…About being a Recruitment Consultant

Join our #OneBlueFamily at our well-established Derby/Nottingham branch as a Senior or Executive Recruitment Consultant to develop and grow a desk that supplies temporary staff to clients in the Nottingham area.

As a Recruitment Consultant you are supported by our advanced technology systems. At Blue Arrow we embrace hybrid working and offer our people the flexibility to work from home for a proportion of their week after training. We are also committed to maximising wellbeing which is why we have a dedicated Out of Hours service that can support our Operational teams when it's time to relax .

Some of your day-to-day responsibilities as a Recruitment Consultant, Senior or Executive Consultant in Derby will include:

  • Proactively developing new and existing business by identifying and establishing client relationships in the Nottingham area
  • Joining the team and working in the Derby office on some days
  • Business to business sales call and marketing activities working to targets
  • Travelling to visit clients for meetings so you will need to drive and have access to a car
  • Sourcing and recruiting temporary staff
  • Building relationships with your clients and candidates
  • Service management - compliance, payroll, administration, updating systems

Blue Arrow is a leading global Talent Acquisition and Managed Workforce Solutions provider. Blue Arrow specialises in staffing for Admin & Secretarial including Call Centre, Transport & Logistics, Hospitality & Catering, Manufacturing & Production and Public Sector.

Some of the Benefits, Training and Development we offer:

  • Salary basic up to 28k basic + uncapped bonus
  • Performance based quarterly salary reviews as a Recruitment Consultant and clear career path
  • If you are not an experienced Recruiter but do have strong sales experience from another industry then you can join as a Trainee, with promotion from Recruitment Associate to Consultant following successful completion of probation salary 22-23k
  • Dedicated structured support for new starters, including performance and development support, goal setting and advice on navigating your way through your new job
  • 25 days holiday (plus public holidays) increasing by length of service until it reaches 30 days
  • Focused wellbeing programme, including access to a network of mental health first aiders and a full subscription to the Calm mindfulness app
  • Your Birthday off and you can buy extra holidays
  • Fully paid day off for charity work of your choice
  • Blended working from home and the office (after training period)
  • Wide range of flexible and lifestyle benefits
  • Long service and recognition awards
  • Ongoing training and development
  • Very experienced Branch Manager, Team and region

Proud to be an inclusive and equitable employer

We are committed to being a Disability Confident Employer. Therefore, we strongly encourage applications from candidates with a disability and commit to interview these candidates if their application meets the minimum criteria for the role - just tell us when applying.

We are also a forces-friendly employer and extend the same interview guarantee to any current reservists, ex-armed forces personnel or forces spouses/partners applying.

To ensure you have the best experience with us, please let us know if we can make any adjustments to our application or interview process and feel free to note in your application which pronouns you use.

RSS Global is a portfolio of brands specialising in staffing and workforce solutions in the UK, Ireland and Asia Pacific. Our brands include Blue Arrow, Career Teachers, Chadwick Nott, Global Medics, Litmus, Medacs Healthcare and Tate.

Please see our privacy notice and note all data processing will be in line with our privacy notice that you can view by clicking here https://www.rssglobal.com/privacy-policy/

title: Learning and Development Consultant
description:
Location
1

University of Warwick Campus, Coventry

Department
1

Warwick Business School

Position Type
1

Full Time, Permanent

Salary
1

£45,585 - £54,395 per annum

About the Role
1

Working closely with members of faculty at all levels, including senior management, our current team of 7 Teaching and Learning Consultants provide expertise in the areas of technology enhanced learning; online materials development (leading on the design of modules for our world-leading Global Online MBA and other online courses); pedagogic innovation; assessment and feedback. In addition, Teaching and Learning Consultants play a strategic role in the implementation of various School-wide initiatives to improve the quality of teaching and learning.


We now wish to expand the team. The new Teaching and Learning Consultant will, in the first instance, take on similar duties to the rest of the team. Importantly, however, the post-holder will increasingly take particular responsibility for strengthening our capabilities in the area of support for Executive Education programmes at WBS. This is an expanding area, with blended and online programmes forming a key part of the Executive Education offering. For this reason, candidates with experience working in the area of online and blended learning in commercial contexts would be particularly welcome to apply (although this is not essential).


We will consider applications for employment on a part-time or other flexible working basis, even where a position is advertised as full-time, unless there are operational or other objective reasons why it is not possible to do so.

About You
1

You will need to have significant experience of online learning design, with up-to-date knowledge of current developments in distance and blended learning. You should also have a good understanding of other key aspects of Higher Education, such as assessment practices and curriculum design.

You will need excellent communication skills, good organisational ability and experience in the implementation of new learning and teaching technologies and approaches, ideally in Higher Education. You will preferably have prior experience of management education.


About the Department
1

The WBS Teaching & Learning Enhancement Team plays a pivotal role in supporting and developing pedagogic practices and innovations at Warwick Business School.

Warwick Business School (WBS), part of the University of Warwick, is a world-class business school at the heart of a world-class University, challenging assumptions and championing business as a force for good. We operate out of a world-class campus situated in the heart of England, as well as our London base at The Shard, the city’s most iconic building located in the vibrant neighbourhood that is the London Bridge Quarter.

WBS is an elite, research-led, triple-accredited business school with a broad portfolio of highly ranked, world-class programmes. From the pioneering research we undertake, to the students we help to shape, we are for the Change Makers who will impact the world for the better.

Our vision is to be Europe’s leading University-based business school, developing transformational ideas and people that shape how we do business. We are seeking the following role to join us and play a part in our future success.


About the University
1

Born in the 60s with a mindset of boldness, imagination and collaboration, the University of Warwick is a world-leading research-intensive university with the highest academic and research standards. We’re one of the world’s top universities, ranked 67th in the world and 10th in the UK*, with 92% of our research assessed to be ‘world leading or internationally excellent’**.

You'll be joining a diverse, innovative and globally connected community committed to igniting real world progress. Here at Warwick, we offer you opportunities to follow your ambitions as long as you bring the energy and determination to succeed.

  • QS World University Rankings 2024

** Research Excellence Framework 2021


How to Apply
1

For informal enquiries, please contact Dot Powell via email: Dot.Powell@wbs.ac.uk.

To apply please complete your essential personal details and attach a CV and cover letter by the closing date of 4th March 2024 - 23:55. Please ensure your CV includes your most recent employment experience along with any additional relevant experience and education history. Your cover letter should detail how you meet the essential and desirable criteria for this post.

The interviews will be held on 18 March 2024.

What we Offer
1

We will provide you with a great range of benefits, which include an attractive pension scheme, 30 days holiday plus Christmas closure, excellent learning and development opportunities, and savings on a wide range of products and services. We offer a generous maternity/paternity/adoption/parental leave policy, and onsite childcare facilities.


We are proud to say that we are a Living Wage employer.

If you are considering relocating to the UK, read our Relocation Guide to find out more about what Warwick has to offer and what might be involved in the process.

Our Commitment to Inclusion
1

Warwick is committed to building an organisation of mutual respect and dignity, promoting a welcoming, diverse, and inclusive working and learning environment. We recognise that everyone is different in a variety of visible and non-visible ways, and that those differences are to be recognised, respected, and valued. Where possible, we go beyond legislation to provide a place where everyone can thrive, supporting all staff to achieve their full potential. We aspire to remove economic, social, and cultural barriers that may otherwise prevent people from succeeding.

We therefore welcome and encourage applications from all communities regardless of culture, background, age, disability, sex/gender, gender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion/belief, or sexual or romantic orientation.

The University currently holds a Race Equality Charter Bronze Award, Athena Swan Sliver Award and a Disability Smart Bronze Award. The University of Warwick is also one of the six founder institutions of the EUTOPIA European University Alliance.

Disclosure & Barring Service (DBS)


The University of Warwick complies with the DBS Code of Practice and undertakes not to discriminate unfairly against anyone who makes a Disclosure relating to a conviction or other information revealed. More information is available on the University’s Vacancy pages and applicants may request a copy of the DBS Code of Practice.

description:

ABC Teachers are recruiting candidates who are passionate about a new career working in Secondary schools.

No experience is required, all training providing internally by ABC Teachers. The role can be made flexible for both full and part time to suit your needs.

About the role

ABC Teachers are looking for trainee cover supervisors to work in Secondary Schools across Leicestershire

. This is a diverse and rewarding role. Which includes -

  • Supervising work that has been set in accordance with the school policy.
  • managing the behaviour of pupils while they are undertaking this work to ensure a constructive environment.
  • Responding to any questions from pupils about process and procedures
  • Dealing with any immediate problems or emergencies according to the school’s policies and procedures.
  • Collecting any completed work after the lesson and returning it to the appropriate teacher.
  • Reporting back as appropriate using the school’s agreed referral procedures on the Behaviour of pupils during the class, and any issues arising

About the school

  • ABC Teachers work with a diverse range of Secondary schools across the Leicestershire area
  • Supportive and encouraging schools keen to help you develop and succeed
  • A range of day-to-day, short-term and long-term roles
  • Chance for position to become permanent with the school

Requirements

To be considered for the role of Trainee Cover Supervisor- Full training providing you will:

  • Completion of a mix of online training, and a training day in our Lichfield offices
  • A positive and can do attitude in your approach to work.
  • Own transportation or happy to use public transport.
  • Excellent punctuality and professional conduct.
  • Willing to get a DBS on the update service (DBS £45, update service £13)

Salary is dependent on experience, training or qualifications. The minimum experience, training or qualifications required for this position are:

  • A positive and can do attitude in your approach to work
  • Completion of training

ABC Teachers is committed to safeguarding children, young people and vulnerable adults. We take our responsibilities extremely seriously. All staff we register will undertake thorough interviewing and referencing checks and hold, or be prepared to undergo, an Enhanced DBS check that must be registered on the Update Service.

About ABC Teachers

ABC Teachers is a market-leading education recruitment and supply agency committed to the learning and development of young people. With branches across the country, we are an employer of choice for high-quality primary, secondary and SEND teaching and support staff.

What ABC Teachers offer

As a valued employee of ABC Teachers, you will receive:
  • Excellent daily rates paid weekly by our in-house Payroll team using the Pay As You Earn (PAYE) system.
  • Guaranteed pay scheme (subject to availability and qualifying criteria).
  • Pension contributions (subject to a qualifying period).
  • Full compliance with AWR (Agency Workers’ Regulations), to make sure you get the pay and working conditions you are entitled to.
  • FREE training to help with your professional development such as Team Teach training, online webinars and safeguarding and child protection updates.
  • Generous refer a friend or colleague bonus scheme.
  • Access to a dedicated consultant, who will provide ongoing support.

ABC Teachers do not discriminate on the grounds of age, gender, race, colour, religion, disability or sexual orientation, and we welcome applications from all sections of the community.

How to apply

Apply via this website with an up-to-date CV and contact details. For more information, or an informal chat about the role, please call Jamie Heath on 01543 410 500 or email jheath@abc-teachers.co.uk.

title: Lead Consultant
description:
Simply Conveyancing is expanding its Sales Team due to business growth and is offering fantastic Sales Consultant opportunities at our Daventry office!

Do you want to have fun at work and have an excellent OTE opportunities of c £33k?

Here at the Simply Conveyancing family we believe that “Work that’s fun- gets done!”

You will join a team that welcomes you whole heartedly and you will be supported by management who ensure your induction and ongoing sales training meets your needs to ensure you achieve your highest potential!

Are You?

  • Customer service focused?

So who are Simply Conveyancing?

At Simply Conveyancing, we are passionate about property. We are a team of experts and have over 20 years’ experience providing best-in-class service for conveyancing. We have combined the latest technology to underpin our commitment to provide a fast and secure conveyancing service for our clients. And it all starts with our Sales Team.Do you want to be a part of an ambitious company that rewards its employees in a generous manner based on great achievements? If so, do not hesitate to apply.

If you have a disability and require reasonable adjustments to be made during the recruitment process, please let us know in advance so that any support, aids or adaptations can be put in place to assist you in the application process, assessments (if required) and interview. Any disability related information you disclose to us for this purpose will not be used to determine your capability for the role, but purely for the purpose of making reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process.

If you require this job advertisement in a different format, additional support with your application, or need to discuss any reasonable adjustments please contact HR@simplypropertylawyers.co.uk.

title: Clinical Director
description:
NHS Medical & Dental: Consultant

Main area
Research and Innovation
Grade
NHS Medical & Dental: Consultant
Contract
Permanent
Hours
Part time - 5 sessions per week
Job ref
164-5977680
Site
QMC
Town
Nottingham
Salary
£93,666 - £126,281 pro rata
Salary period
Yearly
Closing
27/02/2024 23:59

Job overview

An exiting opportunity has become available at Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust (NUH) for the role of R&I Clinical Director.

This role is accountable for the clinical leadership in relation to Research and Innovation across NUH, and will lead the Research Management Team to provide Trust-wide clinical leadership for research.

Please see Job Description enclosed for full details.


Main duties of the job

Lead and motivate the R&I Team; communicate the benefits arising from NUH research; oversee and maintain the highest standards of Research Governance, ensuring compliance with Trust and national policies and frameworks relevant to research practice and safety; act as the principal point of liaison with the Trust on matters related to research; direct the Trust's response to regional and national priorities and opportunities in R&I to increase activity and funding; facilitate engagement of the Trust's multi-professional workforce in research; act as the point of final decision making in connection with urgent research clinical decision making; provide professional leadership to CRF medical staff; attend and represent R&I at the extended Trust Leadership Board.

Please see Job Description enclosed for further details.

Working for our organisation

Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust is the 4th largest acute Trust in the UK with an annual income of £1.2 billion, 87 wards and circa 1,700 beds across 3 main sites. We are one of the leading busiest acute Trusts in England, employing almost 18,000 staff. We provide services to over 4.5M residents of Nottinghamshire and specialist services to a further 3-4M people from neighbouring counties each year.

We have achieved a national/international reputation for many of our specialist services, including stroke, renal, neurosciences, cancer services and trauma. We are at the forefront of many research programmes and new surgical procedures. Nottingham is the only NHS Trust and University partnership in the country to have 3 successful bids for NIHR Biomedical Research Themes in hearing, digestive diseases and respiratory medicine. In addition we host the NIHR Nottingham Clinical Research Facility and from April 2024 will host one of the 14 commissioned NIHR HealthTec Research Centres. We will also be undertaking research at the new National Rehabilitation Centre.

As a teaching Trust we have a strong relationship with our colleagues at the University of Nottingham and other universities across the East Midlands, including Nottingham Trent University and Loughborough University; We play a vital role in the education and training of doctors, nurses and other healthcare professionals.

Detailed job description and main responsibilities

Please see Job Description enclosed for full details regarding the main responsibilities for this role.

Person specification

Training & Qualifications

Essential criteria

  • Senior Substantive clinical leader with at least 3 years’ clinical experience post CCT or equivalent
  • Full Registration with GMC without any conditions or restrictions on licence to practise

Experience

Essential criteria

  • Experienced researcher with track record of quality publications
  • Experience of undertaking research in the NHS

Planning and Organisation Skills

Essential criteria

  • Demonstrate strong leadership and ability to translate strategic goals into real improvements
  • Forward thinking, innovative, with well developed organisational skills with a proven ability to work under pressure and to deadlines

___________________________________________________________________________________

Come and join our wonderful team at NUH. We are big believers in diversity and welcome new ideas to help develop our team in order to deliver world class healthcare to the vast patient populations we serve. With endless personal development opportunities available, at the NUH we will endeavour to turn your job into a career!

We particularly welcome applications from people who identify as Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic, or Disabled, as we are striving to be better represented at NUH.

Easy read application: if you have a disability and find it difficult to complete our online application form, you can apply via our easy read application which you can find on the intranet https://www.nuh.nhs.uk/easy-read-job-application

NUH are now able to offer application completion support and interview preparation support. Please follow the link to book onto our sessions: Support for NUH Job Applications

International Recruitment: If you are applying for a role with us from outside of the UK then please read the guidance on applying for a health or social care job in the UK from abroad.

ID and Right to work checks: NUH authenticate ID and right to work documentation including passports and driving licenses through a system called Trust ID. NUH will scan your ID and right to work documentation in to the Trust ID system at your face to face ID appointment. The system will provide us with an outcome of your check which will be stored securely on your personal file along with all other pre-employment check documentation.

title: Surgeon
description:
Consultant

Main area
Colorectal Surgery
Grade
Consultant
Contract
Permanent
Hours
Full time - 10 sessions per week (10 PA's per week)
Job ref
164-5919749
Site
QMC Campus
Town
Nottingham
Salary
£93,666 - £126,281 per annum
Salary period
Yearly
Closing
21/02/2024 23:59

Job overview

The post would suit a trainee who has recently (or is about to) attained CCT and wishes to develop their subspecialist colorectal skills particularly with an interest in IBD/IF/abdominal wall reconstructive surgery.

Applicants must be fully registered with the GMC, and on the GMC specialist register, or be within 6 months of attaining specialist registration at the time of interview.

Main duties of the job

The post-holder shall be expected to deliver emergency general surgery and elective coloproctology. The successful candidate/candidates will also be encouraged to develop their skills in one or more of the specialist techniques/services described above and this will be actively supported.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a service which is at the forefront of providing a modern colorectal and emergency surgery service. Nottingham Colorectal Service has one of the busiest emergency and colorectal cancer workloads in the UK. It is also a major tertiary referral center for the wider East Midlands. We have established services in advanced laparoscopic surgery, robotic surgery, intestinal failure, anal cancer, retroperitoneal sarcoma, faecal incontinence, TEO/TEMS, SILS, locally advanced and recurrent colorectal cancer and an active Academic Department (University of Nottingham).

Working for our organisation

With over 17,000 staff, we are one of the biggest employers in the city with a central role in supporting the health and wellbeing of our local population. We play a leading role in research, education and innovation.

Come and join our wonderful team at NUH. We are big believers in diversity and welcome new ideas to help develop our team in order to deliver world class healthcare to the vast patient populations we serve. With endless personal development opportunities available, at NUH we will endeavour to turn your job into a career!

We particularly welcome applications from people who identify as Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic, or Disabled, as we are striving to be better represented at NUH.

Detailed job description and main responsibilities

The Job Plan is annualised. This means that the individual appointed will be expected to deliver 8.5 sessions of DCC per week. The post-holder will have regular elective operating sessions, clinics and the opportunity for endoscopy lists should it fit with the post-holders’ skillset. They will be across all of our sites (Queens Medical Centre, City Hospital and Treatment Centre). These will sit within the Colorectal Surgery specialty, overseen by the Head of Colorectal. Some of these commitments will be out of work-day hours e.g. evenings and weekends.

The Unit will actively support the development of subspecialist interests in line with the vision for colorectal surgery at NUH and provision for this will be made via individualised training opportunities.

Please refer to the job description and person specification attached to the advert for the full details of the vacancy.

Person specification

Professional Registration

Essential criteria

  • Full registration with the GMC
  • Eligible to be included on the Specialist Register OR Within 6 months of achieving CCT at the time of interview

Qualifications/Development

Essential criteria

  • MBBS; FRCS(Gen.Surg) or equivalent

Desirable criteria

  • Higher degree (PhD, MD, MSc)

Clinical Skills/Experience

Essential criteria

  • Relevant General Surgical and colorectal emergency and elective operative experience including laparoscopic training
  • Post CCT Fellowship in colorectal surgery

Desirable criteria

  • Provisional JAG accreditation

Teaching, Audit & Research

Essential criteria

  • Evidence of participation in Clinical audit
  • Able to teach and support junior staff effectively

Desirable criteria

  • Original research Publications
  • Experience and enthusiasm for undergraduate and postgraduate teaching

title: Teacher
description:
SEMH Teacher Needed at Special Education School

We are looking for a SEMH teacher for a SEND school! Our supportive and close-knit special education school serving students with social, emotional, and mental health challenges is seeking a dedicated SEMH Teacher to join our team. You will be a class teacher to a class size of 6 to 14 students all with EHCP plans, along side you will be a team of dedicated support staff to work with the students.

As an SEMH Teacher you will be expected to teach the class, create appropriate resources, Complete planning and ensure it is differentiated for all children in your class. You will be creating engaging lessons, planning trips when available and ensuring the students can access the environment and curriculum!

The responsibilities include:

Teaching classes across a range of subjects catered to students' individual learning needs

Developing engaging lesson plans that incorporate emotional regulation, relationship-building, and self-management skills

Employing specialized instruction techniques such as visual schedules, movement breaks, sensory tools, and positive behaviour supports

Collaborating with other teachers, counsellors, and parents to implement customized behaviour plans

Encouraging students to express themselves in healthy ways and providing emotional support

Collecting data on behaviour and academic progress to adjust teaching strategies

Maintaining an structured, compassionate classroom environment

The ideal candidate will have:

Special education degree and certification in SEMH

Experience teaching students with learning disabilities, ADHD, mood disorders, trauma, etc.

Knowledge of de-escalation techniques and conflict resolution strategies

Strong classroom management abilities

Empathy, patience, and passion for working with special needs children

The benefits of working with Simply Education:

  • 24 hour access to Jess the SEN consultant with 6 years experience in the education
  • No or minimal timesheets
  • A range of specialist provisions in Northamptonshire and Warwickshire
  • FREE CPD Training including (SEND specific)

The successful candidate will be required to:

  • Subject to two years of satisfactory references
  • An Enhanced DBS check

Don't miss out on joining one of Northamptonshire's outstanding SEN team! Get in touch with Simply Education today to explore current vacancies in more details and take the next step. I look forward to helping you progress in your SEN career!

If you are interested in the role please contact Jess our experienced SEND consultant who can help you with more details on 01604 372 495 or email your CV to jessica@simplyeducation.co.uk

Together we can make a difference!

title: Data Analyst
description:
Time Products is going through an exciting transformation program to drive a 5 year strategy. Our vision will be transforming all areas of the business to meet consumer and customer needs in the on-line space, as well opening up new innovation opportunities and putting our brands back into the fabric of British Culture. It’s a great time to join us on this journey and truly shape the future of some of the country’s best known and loved brands.

Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst! If you're passionate about uncovering insights, love transforming raw data into meaningful solutions, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we want to hear from you!

As the Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the landscape of our retail analytics. You will be responsible for managing all reporting and insights, utilising your strong experience and knowledge in Google Analytics, Advanced Excel, Big Query, and Looker Studio. This role demands keen analytical mindset, exceptional data management skills, and a passion for translating data into actionable insights. Unlock your potential with us.

This role will be responsible for consumer and customer-centric data, generating actionable insight across all 3 brands (Sekonda, Accurist and Limit) for Time Products.

We are looking for agile, highly analytical individual who will bring fresh thinking underpinned by customer insight and commercial acumen.

You will have confidence working with a wide variety of technologies, data sets, and techniques to explore, interpret, interrogate and deliver. The individual should not be afraid to adopt new technologies and methodologies.

Key Responsibilities of the role:

Data Reporting and Visualisation:

  • Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports in Google Analytics, Looker Studio, and other analytics platforms.
  • Translate complex data sets into understandable and actionable visualisations and reports for various departments.
  • Ensure accurate and timely delivery of regular reports to stakeholders.

Data Analysis and Insights:

  • Helping the Merchandising/Buying/Marketing functions to analyse trends and insights by creating detailed analytical dashboards.
  • Collaborate with marketing, sales, and other departments to support data-driven decision-making.

Advanced Data Processing:

  • Utilise Advanced Excel skills for data manipulation, analysis, and visualisation.
  • Employ SQL queries in Big Query to manage, extract, and analyse large datasets.
  • To have a good understanding of Data Blending, taking multiple datasets from different sources and uncovering deeper insights. Sound understanding of Join methodologies.
  • Ensure data quality and accuracy in all aspects of analysis and reporting.

Web Analytics Management:

  • Manage and configure Google Analytics for optimal tracking of website and campaign performance.
  • Analyse web traffic data to understand customer behaviour and site performance.
  • Implement tracking tags and pixels using Google Tag Manager.
  • Enhance digital CRM insights and analytics to drive customer retention and reactivation across online channels through data-led testing strategies
  • Analyse web traffic and key metrics / drivers to deliver recommendations and actionable insights on ways to further improve the site
  • Leverage data intelligence to identify opportunities to optimise onsite customers customer experience resulting in improved conversion and ROI
  • Identify ways to improve analytical procedures to improve agility and efficiency through the automation of marketing reports
  • To be the primary product owner of all digital analysis platforms demonstrating a full understanding of metrics and delivery through a variety of tools
  • Understand and interpret the impact of marketing activity both in the online and offline environment, the impact of the marketing channel mix and association; champion attribution
  • Build, maintain and manage the periodical review of the attribution model, taking into account new initiatives weighting; online, offline and retail channels

Cross-Functional Collaboration:

  • Work closely with IT, marketing, and sales teams to integrate data from various sources.
  • Present findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
  • Participate in cross-functional projects to enhance data utilisation across the company.

Project Management:

  • Lead analytics projects from conception to execution, ensuring deadlines and objectives are met.
  • Coordinate with external vendors or consultants as needed for specialised analytics projects.
  • Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in data analytics and retail.

Capability and Experience Required:

  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Experience: 3+ years of experience in a data analyst role, preferably in a retail environment.
  • Technical Skills:
  • Proficient in Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Google Data Studio.
  • Advanced skills in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, Macros).
  • Experience with SQL and familiarity with Big Query.
  • Proficiency in Looker Studio or similar BI tools.
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
  • Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Teamwork: Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
  • Time Management: Strong organisational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritise tasks.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with machine learning and predictive analytics.
  • Experience in e-commerce analytics.
  • Retail industry knowledge.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £35,000.00-£37,500.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Employee discount
  • Free parking
  • On-site parking
  • Sick pay
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

Experience:

  • Data analysis skills: 1 year (required)

Ability to Commute:

  • Leicestershire, LE18 2EZ (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Leicestershire, LE18 2EZ

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
Our Opportunity

Are you an experienced Project Manager/Senior Project Manager with a strong consultancy background, looking to take a step up in your career?
Do you have experience on a range of projects, including Central Government projects?
Do you want to work within a multi-disciplinary team, being proactive, client-focused and process driven?
Pick Everard are seeking a knowledgeable individual as a Senior Project Manager, to join us at our Nottingham office as part of a multi-disciplinary team.
You will lead work on behalf of Government organisations. The role is client focused and process driven, with often a concentration on the front end of projects. Embedding protocols and driving all aspects of design management are central to the work, coupled with direct client interaction as the first point of contact.
In this role, you will be working in Nottingham and throughout the Midlands and Wales on occasion, so a willingness to travel is essential.
We are proud to offer agile working, and enhanced benefits, as well as a collaborative, positive working culture that prioritises its people.
With Pick Everard, you can make your mark. We have a rich, 160 + year history of delivering excellence to our clients across the built environment.
If you want to join us on our journey, we want to hear from you today!

Key Responsibilities:

  • Agree and develop the client’s brief in conjunction with any other consultants appointed.
  • Gather an understanding of client specific project processes and protocols and put these in motion in tandem with standard project management practices.
  • Co-ordinate, manage and communicate with the client, project stakeholders and other consultants appointed to meet requirements of the project, preparation of programmes and undertaking programme management.
  • Co-ordinate the design process by bringing together a large multi-disciplinary team including both internal and external consultants and ensuring team outputs align with both the client brief and statutory agency requirements.
  • Oversee and manage the control of the project both pre- and post-contract including financial expenditure throughout all RIBA stages.
  • Initiate and run the change management process.
  • Co-ordinate and manage the development of the procurement strategy and procurement activities
  • Undertake and participate in risk, value and opportunities management, including facilitating workshops in order to ensure that these activities are controlled within the project team including contractors, sub-contractors, and the supply chain.
  • Communicate and chair meetings with the client, their stakeholders, and contractors as necessary.
  • Prepare and issue reports, including but not limited to preparation of Project Execution Plans (PEP), Strategy Reports, Risk Registers, Progress Reports etc.
  • Develop new business opportunities including leading and participating in the preparation and presentation of bids


About You

Key Requirements:

  • 5+ years industry experience, having worked in a similar role in the design or construction management environment.
  • HNC, HND, a project management, architectural, engineering / construction related degree or related transferrable experience.
  • Eligibility to obtain, or existing possession of SC level Security Clearance is required to fulfil the duties of this role
  • Member of a construction related professional body, such as RICS, CIOB, CIBSE, etc. is desirable but not mandatory.
  • A comprehensive knowledge of building technology and construction principles.
  • Have a good understanding of forms of building contract and experience of contract administration (NEC/JCT/PPC2000). NEC3/NEC4 PM Accreditation desirable but not mandatory
  • Ability to control day to day programming and planning.
  • Ability to monitor progress and expenditure of projects.
  • Have a clear understanding of risk management including identification, management, mitigation and risk transfer.
  • A good understanding of IT including Microsoft Word, Excel, Teams and Project
  • Excellent written and spoken English.
  • Bid writing and presentation skills - comfortable speaking to groups both online and in person.

About Us

    At Pick Everard, we work together to make the extraordinary a reality. We are looking for exceptional new talent to be a part of our journey as we move forward through our ambitious five-year Business Plan.

    We are an independent award-winning property and construction consultancy firm, operating within the industry, providing complete integrated service delivery to help our clients deliver better solutions across real estate, infrastructure and the natural environment.

    We are at the forefront of the industry and enjoy a culture that is centered around being creative, professional, compassionate, client-oriented and fun.

    Our recent successes include:

    • Listed as an NCE100 Consultancy and AJ100 Practice
    • Named a Top 150 Consultancy by Building Magazine
    • Recognised as a leading Financial Times Consultancy
    • Winners of the Association of Consulting Engineers (ACE) Awards, Best Business Performance of the Year – Large Consultancy
    • Winners at the RICS Awards – Infrastructure category
    • An Investors in People and Investors in Excellence accredited business
    • Winners at the Enterprising Women Awards

    Through our remarkable history we have already established the sound principles of success and we have the vision and ambition to be even better, as we move forward into a very bright future. We’re growing and we need more experts onboard. Join us and we will provide you with an inspiring environment in which you’ll be able to drive real progress and impact in your career.

    To learn more about why it is good to work here please visit our website and follow us on social media. Be part of it.

    Remuneration and Benefits

    We value and promote a positive work-life balance and encourage every member of our team to get involved with charity, sports, community, and company events. Providing a balanced, enjoyable career is important to us, and we work hard to make sure everyone feels a valued part of our organisation. We are also a responsible employer and Investors in People accredited business.

    You will receive an attractive salary that will match your skills and experience, as well as the following benefits:

    • Hybrid working
    • Stakeholder pension
    • Life assurance
    • Private healthcare
    • 26 days’ annual leave + Bank Holidays + option to buy up to 5 days’ additional leave
    • Healthcare cashplan
    • Enhanced Maternity, Paternity and Childcare benefits
    • Enhanced Adoption & Shared Parental Leave benefits
    • Long service awards – including enhanced annual leave and vouchers
    • Annual Being PickEverard awards
    • Staff Discount Scheme
    • Spot Rewards
    • Professional subscriptions
    • Season ticket loan or car loan at senior level
    • Cycle to work scheme
    • Wellbeing support and Employee Assistance Programme

    Please note we do not accept speculative CVs or approaches from recruitment agencies.

    As an equal opportunities’ employer, Pick Everard is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership.

    We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join us on our journey.

    #LI-hybrid, #LI-BS1

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
Our Opportunity

Are you an experienced Project Manager/Senior Project Manager with a strong consultancy background, looking to take a step up in your career?
Do you have experience on a range of projects, including Central Government projects?
Do you want to work within a multi-disciplinary team, being proactive, client-focused and process driven?
Pick Everard are seeking a knowledgeable individual as a Senior Project Manager, to join us at our Nottingham office as part of a multi-disciplinary team.
You will lead work on behalf of Government organisations. The role is client focused and process driven, with often a concentration on the front end of projects. Embedding protocols and driving all aspects of design management are central to the work, coupled with direct client interaction as the first point of contact.

title: Energy Manager
description:
Energy Bureau Manager, SOCOTEC, £45,000 - £65,000, Home based

To support our ambitious growth plans, we have a great opportunity to join our Building and Real Estate division. SOCOTEC’s Sustainability services provide individual consultants on short-term projects to support specific issues, all the way through to multi-disciplinary teams on long-term assignments working within a major project or corporate organisation. The specialist technical experience and knowledge of our teams mean you can make an immediate and positive impact on client projects and performance.


We’re looking for a Energy Bureau Manager


  • Manage Bureau team of nine
  • Deliver client reporting is delivered to reporting timetable
  • Support team with complex queries relating to energy suppliers/data collectors and clients to resolve queries
  • Provide energy management, consumption and monitoring reports for customers.
  • Provide tenant recharges
  • Support sales team with proposals for new clients, produce proposals for renewals
  • Manage fee invoices and credit control


Here at SOCOTEC, we deliver excellence to our customers by recruiting and retaining the very best industry talent. To be successful in this role, you will be able to demonstrate:


  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to lead a team to deliver high level of customer service
  • Demonstrates a high degree of analytical skills
  • Advanced user of MS Excel
  • Line management experience– recruitment, training, appraisals and mentoring


SOCOTEC is the UK's leading provider of testing, inspection and certification services. We offer an unrivalled range of technical expertise and services throughout the UK and worldwide. By joining us, you’ll be part of an 1,800+ strong team, where we will provide you with both the flexibility and a host of opportunities. We are committed to personal and professional development, and you will be supported and mentored at every step of your journey with us. You will join a large team of industry-leading, expert professionals and receive exposure to some of the best opportunities and challenges available.

As well as a competitive salary, we can offer you a wide range of benefits including, up to 25 days holiday with the opportunity to buy more. Where applicable we also offer an electric car scheme, employee recognition schemes, family friendly support, employee benefits and discounts app, employee assistance programmes and enhanced company pension.

Think you’ve got what it takes to add value to our success? We would love to hear from you and look forward to receiving your application.

Building a safer and more sustainable world is the core mission we set out to achieve at SOCOTEC, it is at the heart of everything that we do. We are committed to acting as a key player in society, investing in innovative solutions to ensure social and environmental concerns are at the forefront of all of our business operations.

title: Lettings Consultant
description:
Are you ambitious, driven to succeed and focused on success?

Have your got what it takes to be part of the best Sales & Lettings team in the Melton Mowbray Area, earn big and have a prosperous career in property? If so, read on!

We’re looking for a go getting, self motivated and experienced Lettings Consultant to join our team in the Market Leading Melton Mowbray Office.

An extremely rare opportunity has arisen to join the areas leading property professionals as a full-time Lettings Consultant within an award-winning, independent Estate & Letting Agent. We've built a reputation by providing Sellers, Buyers, Landlords and Tenants with a service that is second to none and is focused on the moving goals of each individual. You'll be working with a close-knit, professional team with excellent support from motivated individuals within the office.

What we're looking for?

  • A self-motivated driven individual that puts the clients needs first
  • Experience within the Lettings Sector in Property Management, Lettings Process & Negotiation.
  • A professional attitude that takes pride in their work and the service they provide. A real company champion!
  • A great listener & positive mindset.
  • Commercially minded individual that is process driven with the ability to spot opportunities and tactically resolve issues.
  • A confident communicator, with experience of communicating both in person and over the telephone.

What you'll be achieving daily?

  • Managing a portfolio of properties through the rental process
  • Conducting professional and informative property viewings
  • Managing the rental process from application through to move in, ensuring a positive experience at all times.
  • Compiling all appropriate documentation required by legislation for property lettings.
  • Communicating and prospecting with prospective clients in an informative and professional manner

What you'll get from us?

  • A competitive basic salary with personal commission. Completely UNCAPPED!
  • Quarterly and annual reviews for personal development.
  • Constant Training, Support and Professional Development, from industry leading professionals.
  • Regular incentive reviews for top performers including; car allowances, company car, mobile phone allowance, commissions for completing tasks & review bonuses.
  • An extra day off for your Birthday each year!

What we need from you?

  • Experience within the Lettings Industry
  • Full driving licence
  • An open attitude to learning & development

If you want to join the award winning, market leading estate agents in Melton Mowbray then apply in confidence today.

Please apply by email or in person at Newton Fallowell, Digby House, 14 Burton Street, Melton Mowbray, LE13 1AE and most importantly, with a covering letter telling us why you’re the ideal fit for the job!

For more information, call Peter Ledger on 01664 566210.

title: Supply Chain Manager
description:
Supply Chain Planning Manager Ref code: EYM99096872 Procurement, Supply Chain & Logistics £36k - 40k per year Coalville, Leicestershire, England Temporary / Interim Hybrid Working Job Title: Supply Chain Planning Manager Location: Coalville, Leicestershire Contract: Temporary, Opportunity to go permanent Salary: £36,000 - £40,000 The Procurement and Supply Chain Division at SF Recruitment are currently recruiting for an experienced Supply Chain / Planning Manager to join their client on a full-time basis. This opportunity is starting as a Temporary position with the opportunity to progress into a permanent role for the right person. As a Supply Chain Planning Manager, you will play a key part in the managerial team and be responsible for supporting with the smooth daily operations of the procurement and distribution functions. Your daily responsibilities could include: - Ensure product and material stock levels are at efficient levels for production to run smoothly, meet customer demand and avoid delays. - Liaising closely with suppliers, vendors and hauliers to manage lead times and have control over inbound and outbound deliveries. - Carrying out regular stock taking activities. - Forecasting for product demand and inventory levels. - Reviewing and investigating material shortages / risk issues and problem solving ahead of time. - Providing assistance, coaching and upskilling support to the onsite supply chain team. - Liaising and working closely alongside Sales, Procurement and Operations. The successful Supply Chain Planning Manager will ideally have experience working in a similar role as listed above and have experience at working at either a senior or managerial level. Other key skills and experiences required: - Material planning and forecasting. - Highly organised and can work to tight deadlines. - Adaptable when working under pressure. - Excellent communication both verbal and written. - Ability to identify issues and problem solving. - An approachable manager and leader. - IT Literate - experience using MRP or ERP systems. If you are keen to find out more about the Supply Chain Planning Manager opportunity, please click '' with a copy of your CV. Alternatively, contact the managing consultant on Emaloney@sfrecruitment.com. Due to the location of the role, you will need to be able to drive. Ideally you will be immediately available to start in a new role, or have no more than 2 weeks' notice period to meet our clients requirements. Again, this can be flexible for the right person.


Emma Maloney

Email Emma

title: Customer Consultant
description:
The Body Shop

When Anita Roddick founded The Body Shop in 1976, she had a vision. Business as a force for good – that’s us. Over 40 years later, we’re proud to be pioneering cruelty-free beauty every step of the way. We’re the original ethical beauty brand. We’ve got a thing for empowering people and enriching our planet. We’re all about keeping it real, in every way possible. Our activist roots remain a huge part of everything we do, from our iconic window posters to our vegetarian products to our infamous campaigns. We’re never afraid to stand up and speak the truth. We like to do things a little differently around here.

The Body Shop is committed to generating positive economic, social and environmental impact. We’re fighting for what we believe in now more than ever. No holding back. Breaking the mould has always come naturally to us, and we need someone who’s not afraid to mix things up.

Your role in a nutshell

To support the store management team in driving sales and profit within the store through the delivery of exceptional customer service on the shop floor at all times. To demonstrate and uphold the values and vision of the company whilst ensuring adherence to company procedures & policies.

More about the role

With over 2,000 exciting products designed to suit every customer's preference, there's a lot to choose from, so our team are on-hand to talk with customers every day. We take the time to learn our customer’s needs and recommend fantastic products that make them feel so good. We offer products that are packed with natural ingredients, many of which have been sourced ethically using Community Trade programmes - so when we advise a customer on their skincare regime, we're not just selling them an ideal, we're actually helping communities build a better life too.


As part of our dedicated team of Consultants you will offer expert advice to our customers and provide an inspirational insight into The Body Shop products and philosophy. You will get to learn the products, their origins and proactively engage with customers to experience a range that suits their preferences and lifestyle.

What we look for

  • Strong interpersonal skills to build rapport with customers - customer service experience is ideal
  • Ability to communicate and listen effectively
  • A genuine passion for beauty and the retail industry
  • Open availability for evening, weekend, and holiday shifts.


Talent Drivers

Collaborative Skills
Personal Conduct
Commerciality
Purpose

title: Energy Consultant
description:
What’s in it for you?

Want to join a fast-growing company that puts people first?

title: Sales Consultant
description:
Pentagon Motor Group have an exciting and rare new career opportunity for a Sales Consultant to join the amazing team at our multi franchise Loughborough dealership!

Is this you . . .

  • Do you have a retail sales background with experience of achieving targets?
  • Do you have a genuine passion for people, making them the main focus in everything you do?
  • Are you prepared to provide an outstanding customer buying experience?

If you can honestly answer ‘Yes’ to the above, then you may be exactly who we are looking for!

Have you heard about our benefits?

When you join Pentagon, from Day 1 you'll have access to a comprehensive benefits package including:

  • 30 days holiday per year (including Bank Holidays) that will increase with length of service.
  • Recommend a Friend Scheme.
  • Discounted days out with family and friends.
  • Retail discounts saving £££'s on shopping and dining out.
  • Fully funded, Nationally Recognised Qualifications.
  • Manufacturer specific training.
  • Salary Finance.
  • 24 hour access to the Employee Assistance Programme and designated site Mental Health First Aiders.
  • Team member Pension Scheme contributions.
  • Friends & family Customer Referral Payments
  • Discounts on products and services that we provide for family and friends.

We pride ourselves on offering exceptional training and development opportunities along with realistic career paths for each member of our Team.

What will you be doing?

Our passionate sales team at our highly successful Loughborough dealership are looking for a new team member with a passion for providing exceptional levels of customer service to join their team. This is a challenging role where customer care always comes first.

You will:

  • Take the time to talk to people & build a genuine rapport in order to identify exactly what your customer needs, turning opportunities into business.
  • Meet sales volume targets and maximise profit opportunities with each sale.
  • Exceed customer satisfaction and promote long term profitability for the Dealership & Group.
  • Telephone prospect new and existing customers.
  • Effectively promote and sell additional items such as GAP, paint protection, service plans and warranties.
  • Keep up to date with current finance options regulations and legislation to be able to provide our customers with all available options.

In return, we’ll take the time to give you all the support and personal development you need to build a successful career with the Pentagon Group.

This position is working 5 days a week 09:00am - 18:00pm as per the sales rota with Sunday's being one of the days off.

Who are we looking for?

You will need to have:

  • Experience working in a target-driven retail sales background.
  • Exceptional Customer Service skills.
  • Strong and effective communication skills.
  • Brilliant rapport building skills.
  • Motivation and drive.
  • The ability to deliver a first class Customer buying experience and maximise every profit opportunity.
  • An enthusiasm and passion for exceeding targets.
  • Knowledge of IT Systems including Microsoft Office
  • A full, UK driving licence.

Previous motor industry sales experience is a distinct advantage but not essential as a full training and development programme will be provided from Day 1.
