title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Progress Teachers are an independent Education Recruitment Agency based in Castle Donnington (DE74).

Founded in 2020, we are a small business looking to hire a versatile and energetic Recruitment Consultant or Trainee responsible for increasing business through effective recruitment activity with Schools across the East Midlands.

You will need to have an entrepreneurial flair with a self-drive matched only by your determination to succeed.

What is the role of a Recruitment Consultant?

  • Building and maintaining relationships with clients & identifying potential new clients and acquiring their business – This entails high volumes of phone, email and in person contact to win business and development relationships.
  • Using sales, business development, marketing techniques and networking to attract business from schools.
  • Recruiting, vetting, and interviewing teachers and school support staff and drawing up shortlists of candidates for clients to interview/ trial.
  • Preparing CVs to present candidates to best advantage and forward to clients regarding suitable job adverts.
  • Negotiating pay and salary rates and finalising arrangements between clients and candidates.

What traits contribute to success in recruitment?

Success in recruitment is influenced by a combination of various traits that play pivotal roles in achieving desired outcomes.

  • Confidence is essential, as it instils trust and credibility in both candidates and clients.
  • Effective communication skills enable recruiters to convey information clearly, build rapport, and understand the needs of both parties involved.
  • Active listening, a trait often overlooked, allows recruiters to grasp crucial details and provide tailored solutions.
  • Resilience is crucial in a dynamic field like recruitment, where challenges and setbacks are common, requiring adaptability and perseverance.
  • A strong knowledge base equips recruiters with industry insights and trends, enhancing their ability to identify suitable candidates.
  • Being target-driven fosters a sense of purpose and motivation, ensuring consistent efforts towards achieving recruitment goals.
  • Sales and marketing skills enable recruiters to promote opportunities effectively, showcase candidate potential, and secure successful placements.

How will we invest in you?

You will be enrolled in the Progress: Recruiter Academy. The aim of this academy is to ensure you have a clear training plan that will allow you to develop best practise in recruitment from day 1. You will work with a high performing sales team to expedite your learning and turbocharge your recruitment career. In doing so, you will have a number of support strands available to you throughout your training.

Some benefits of working with Progress Teachers:

  • Uncapped commission up to 20%
  • Laptop & Phone
  • Access to a bespoke CRM system created solely for our business
  • Hybrid Working schedule
  • Working hours - 08:00am - 17:00pm
  • Reduced hours in school holidays - 09:00-14:00 (13 weeks a year)
  • Complete support & training
  • Weekly prizes & Long-term incentive ladder
  • 30 days annual leave + birthday off + bank holidays

Apply now and ignite your career with us!

title: Sales and Lettings Negotiator
description:
Andrew Granger, part of Sheldon Bosley Knight - Lettings Negotiator, Residential Lettings

Overview

An opportunity for an individual, who is looking to progress their career in Residential Lettings, to join our superb team in Leicester who currently look after over 500 managed properties.

The Company

Andrew Granger are now part of Sheldon Bosley Knight who are a Firm of Land and Property Professionals with its Head Office in Stratford-upon-Avon. Over the last five years, the business has grown and developed to over 100 staff and consultants based in 14 offices from across Warwickshire, Worcestershire, Gloucestershire, Leicestershire and The Cotswolds.

With roots dating back more than 180 years, the business has extensive local knowledge, and the company has strong relationships with many local professional advisors and plays a pivotal role in the communities that it serves.

As well as offering rural advice and professional services, SBK manage commercial and residential property portfolios, residential sales and lettings, valuation, general practice work, planning and architecture, development, strategic land promotion, client accounting, block management and compulsory purchase.

The Role – Negotiating Duties

· To work with the lettings team to achieve move in targets, dealing with legal documentation ensuring that all tenancies are compliant and helping to build the brand in the local marketplace.

· Dealing with telephone and face to face enquiries and providing high levels of customer service at all times.

· Pre-qualifying applicants and arranging viewings

· Carrying out viewings and obtaining feedback

· Supporting the lettings team with administrative duties, issuing terms of business to landlords, carrying out any checks to comply with legislation.

· Negotiating new tenancies with landlords and tenants.

· Processing tenant references and right to rent checks

· Preparing tenancy agreements, issuing legal documents relating to the tenancy and ensuring that all safety certificates are in place prior to move in.

· Working with the property management team ensuring that properties have been
prepared for move in.

· Booking and arranging inventories

· Ensuring a smooth hand over of keys and that tenants have a positive experience during the application process.

· Managing own workload and emails

Skills & Experience

· Previous experience of a similar role is desirable

· Up to date knowledge of current lettings legislation and landlord / tenant laws is desired but not essential

· Excellent time management and organisational skills

· Strong administrative skills with an attention to detail especially when dealing with
contracts

· Confidence in dealing with a variety of people both in face, over the phone and in person

· Able to work as part of a team and alone.

· Strong written and verbal communication skills.

· Articulate, professional and well accustomed to a client facing role

· Working knowledge of Microsoft packages and good keyboard skills

· ARLA qualified or willing to work towards an ARLA qualification.

· Experience of working in a fast paced, busy environment.

· A positive and adaptive attitude to help the team achieve their goals.

· Pro-active and a desire to achieve results

· Full driving license required

Salary: £23,000 - £25,000 DOE, OTE - £2,500 per annum

What we offer:

25 days annual leave, plus bank holidays

Long service holiday, plus birthday off

Employee Pension Scheme

Study support

Charity days

Recruitment referral scheme

SBK Festival

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £23,000.00-£25,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company events

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Supplemental pay types:

  • Commission pay
  • Performance bonus

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Geotechnical Engineer
description:
£45,000 - £50,000 (Permanent)

Nottingham, East Midlands

Senior Geotechnical Engineer

Nottingham

£45,000 - £50,000

An excellent chance to become a part of a prominent engineering consultancy specialising in geotechnical and civil engineering solutions at their Nottingham office. Committed to innovation and sustainable practices, they cater to diverse clients across industries and are currently in search of a Senior Geotechnical Engineer to join their dynamic team.


Requirements:

  • A bachelor’s degree (BSc or BEng) in Geology or Engineering, complemented by a postgraduate qualification in a related field (MEng, MSc, etc.).
  • Already obtained or actively working towards a chartered accreditation.
  • Demonstrated success in design-focused Geotechnical roles.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Take a lead role in geotechnical projects from inception to completion, ensuring adherence to quality, budget, and timeline objectives.
  • Conduct comprehensive geotechnical investigations, including site visits, soil and rock sampling, and laboratory testing.
  • Analyse geotechnical data and prepare detailed reports, offering engineering recommendations and design solutions.
  • Provide expert guidance on foundation design, slope stability, earth retention systems, and other geotechnical aspects of projects.
  • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, including structural engineers, environmental scientists, and construction professionals, to deliver cohesive solutions.
  • Mentor and guide junior geotechnical engineers and technical staff.

If this opportunity aligns with your interests and you would like to explore it further, please reach out to our Geotechnical and Environmental consultant, Dan McIntosh, with your most up-to-date CV.

title: Geotechnical Engineer
description:
(Permanent)

Nottingham, East Midlands

Title: Geotechnical Engineer

Location: Nottingham

Salary: £30,000 - £40,000 (based on years of experience)


Overview

Currently seeking a technically skilled Geotechnical Engineer to come in and assert themselves within the expansion of our client's multi-disciplinary engineering consultancy in Nottingham. My client is looking for an individual with strong industry knowledge to play a pivotal role within a collaborative work environment that fosters innovation and growth and has the opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects that impact communities and industries.


Qualifications

  • Have achieved a Meng/BEng in Civil Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering, Geology, or another related field of study.
  • Between 2-6 years’ experience in a similar role.

Requirements/Responsibilities

  • Perform geotechnical analysis and design for a variety of projects including foundations, retaining walls, slopes, etc.
  • Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to delivering high-quality work across a variety or projects.
  • Prepare comprehensive and technically sound geotechnical reports, feasibility studies, and technical documentation.
  • Be able to collaborate with project teams to provide expert geotechnical recommendations that drive project success.
  • Use geotechnical software and tools to model and analyse soil-structure interaction and stability.

If this opportunity is one of interest and you’d like to discuss it further, please get in touch with our Geotechnical and Environmental consultant, Dan McIntosh, with your most up-to-date CV.

title: Teaching Assistant
description:
We are seeking an empathetic and motivated Teaching Assistant interested in working with SEMH needs. The Teaching Assistant will be expected to provide critical support to students with social, emotional, and mental health challenges. In this full-time role, you will work closely with our team to enable students to develop confidence, resilience, and coping skills.

Within this role as a Teaching Assistant you will be supporting children with mental health challenges, behaviour difficulties and social limitations. As a Teaching Assistant in this school, you will be a trusted role model and it is vital we are ensuring the children are safe and have access to the learning available. On occasion you may be asked to support children on 1-1 or in small groups in their learning or to help them self-regulated.

Salary : £90 - 110 a day

Contract : Daily Cover / Long Term Roles Available

Hours : 8:30 till 4:30 - Monday to Friday

Responsibilities:

Provide 1-on-1 and small group interventions to support students' SEMH development

Help implement personalized strategies and behaviour plans tailored to each student's needs

Build trusting relationships with students through active listening and compassion

Teach and model positive social skills, emotion regulation, conflict resolution, and coping techniques

Collaborate with teachers to integrate SEMH-promoting activities into the classroom

Monitor student progress and adapt support strategies as needed

Maintain detailed records on interventions, student behaviours, progress, and communications

Requirements:

Experience working with in education

Strong communication, creativity, patience, and problem-solving abilities

Dedication to nurturing students' wellbeing and personal growth.

The benefits of working with Simply Education:

  • 24 hour access to the SEN consultant
  • No or minimal timesheets
  • A range of specialist provisions in Northamptonshire, Daventry and Warwickshire
  • FREE CPD Training including (SEND specific)

The successful candidate will be required to:

  • Subject to two years of satisfactory references
  • An Enhanced DBS check

Don't miss out on joining one of Northamptonshire's outstanding SEN team! Get in touch with Simply Education today to explore current vacancies in more details and take the next step. I look forward to helping you progress in your SEN career!

If you are interested in the role please contact Jess our experienced SEND consultant who can help you with more details on 01604 372 495 or email your CV to jessica@simplyeducation.co.uk

Together we can make a difference!

title: Registered Manager
description:
MAIN PURPOSE OF THE JOB:

To manage the day to day running of the children’s home and ensure that it meets the expectations and standards as set out in its Statement of Purpose. To safeguard and promote the welfare of children and ensure that the home remains fully compliant with all legislation in particular that set out in the Children’s Homes Regulations 2015 (CHR) including the Quality Standards. To establish and maintain a competent, motivated and confident staff team and to offer leadership, managerial direction, guidance and support to staff at all levels. To ensure that the companies policies and procedures are adhered to and that resources are managed effectively. To develop systems for the efficient administration of the home and to ensure that the fabric of the home, equipment, appliances and grounds are maintained to the highest order in accordance with Health and Safety requirements. To be the responsible person in managing child protection concerns and complaints.

To liaise with Local Authorities, School, Health and other professionals to achieve best outcomes for young people. To actively promote the home’s equal opportunity and anti-discriminatory practice policies.

OVERALL RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Safeguarding

Our company is committed to the safeguarding and promotion of the welfare of all children and young people in our care. All staff have a key role and responsibility in this area however more specifically as a Registered Manager you will:

 Perform the role of Designated Safeguarding Lead, acting as a source of advice on child protection matters and for co-ordinating action within the home (see Our companies) DSL job description.

 Undertake risk assessments in relation to young people, staff, visitors, premises and equipment to identify any risk factors and take any necessary/appropriate remedial action required in a timely fashion.

 Promote a culture of open and transparency, ensuring anyone feels confident to whistle-blow where necessary on poor practice.

 Report and liaise where appropriate to Children’s Services, Ofsted, LADO’s, MASH and other relevant professionals involved in multi-agency safeguarding arena’s.

 Make decisions with the child at the centre at all times.

2. To meet the needs of children through:

 Ensuring that each young person has a plan which reflects his / her care, education, social, emotional, cultural, therapeutic and health needs and that this plan is regularly reviewed.

 Allocating a Key Worker for each young person with the principal responsibility of implementing the childcare plan.

 Establishing and monitoring high quality standards of care in line with Quality Standards and the home’s Statement of Purpose and implement approved quality assurance measures to ensure these standards are maintained.

 Implement approved systems in which young people are consulted about the quality of care they receive and provide them with a voice.

 Taking responsibility for progressing any complaints or safeguarding concerns

 Working in partnership with parents, carers and other professionals to safeguard and promote the welfare of young people.

 Attending and contributing to child care planning and review meetings as appropriate.

3. To develop a confident and competent staff team through:

 Involvement in the recruitment and retention of staff in line with safer recruitment

principles and promote Equal Opportunities in line with recommendations from the Warner

report.

 Developing a management style which balances the need to exercise control and give

direction with the need to offer staff the opportunity to contribute to decision making.

 Ensuring that all new staff receive a proper induction to the home in line with company

policy.

 Ensuring that each member of staff has a supervision agreement and receives supervision

and probation reviews in line with company policy.

 Ensure timely and qualitive completion or staff PDR reviews in line with cycle set by the

company. Ensuring that each member of staff has a personal development plan from this

process.

 Establishing a programme of fortnightly senior staff and team meetings to facilitate

communication and provide opportunities for consultation and staff development.

 Attending to issues of staff motivation and morale.

 Addressing issues in relation to conduct and competence of staff.

 Promoting personal and professional development through the appropriate delegation of

duties and responsibilities.

 To be responsible for setting up, monitoring and maintaining the process by which staff

undertake Level 3 – 5 Diplomas (formally NVQ’s).

 To prepare and present training for staff on occasions when appropriate within team

meetings.

4. To implement agreed systems which ensure the effective communication & allocation of

resources through:

 To contribute to the development of the Company as a whole through involvement in Care

Operation Meetings (COM).

 To ensure the dissemination of information shared at COM meetings and support and guide

staff through procedural changes made by the company.

 Ensuring adequate staffing levels that meet the needs of the home and manage staff’s

hours to ensure there is a degree of flexibility balanced with combatting the need for

overtime.

 Ensuring that budgets are managed effectively and the use of finances is properly

monitored.

 Ensuring that company vehicles are clean and regularly maintained.

 Monitoring closely the fabric of the building (including fixtures, amenities and grounds) and

agree with senior management remedial action where necessary to keep the home at the

continuously high standard that is expected from Group.

 Work within the scope of policies and procedures to maintain all fire, heating,

lighting and emergency systems and ensure the safety and security of the premises;

ensuring that the required certificates and notices are displayed and in date.

5. To promote the efficient and effective operation of the home through:

 Developing in consultation with young people and staff routines in relation to all aspects of

child care.

 Making decisions calmly when under pressure and be able to prioritise task completion in

order of importance. It is important you adhere to deadlines.

 Clarifying expectations in relation to maintaining the home in a clean and orderly condition.

 Planning rotas which fit best with children’s needs and which adapt to the needs of the

service focussing resources where and when they are required.

 Ensuring that company approved reporting and recording systems are implemented to

ensure compliance with the CHR 2015.

 Attending to all administration issues in relation to the home and the provision of weekly/monthly management information reports for Head Office.

 Maintain confidentiality at all times and ensure compliance with the new guidelines as set out in GDPR.

6. General

 To receive training appropriate to role and maintain an up to date training profile.

 To maintain up to date knowledge of the statutory and procedural frame-work for residential care and communicate this to staff as appropriate.

 To provide high quality written work including reports that can be shared with Local Authorities and other agencies.

 To be prepared to work unsociable hours from time to time to support staff development and lead by example.

 To undertake any other managerial duties as may be necessary. Safeguarding

This post is subject to an Enhanced Disclosure check.

Our company is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. As part of the selection process we will undertake checks to ensure that you do not pose of risk of harm to children and young people.

The post-holder will be expected to contribute to safeguarding children and young people and promoting their welfare of children in accordance with the agreed Child Protection Policy for the setting. Any issues or concerns are reported to their Designated Safeguarding Lead or any Deputy Safeguarding Lead. In the Children’s homes, where the Designated Safeguarding Lead or the deputy Designated Safeguarding Lead is not available, and then it would be reported to the senior on duty.

REVIEW

This job description will be reviewed at least once per year and may be subject to

amendment or modification at any time after consultation with the post holder. It is not a comprehensive statement of procedures and tasks but sets out the main expectations of the establishment in relation to the post holder’s professional responsibilities, duties and grading.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £93,000.00-£100,000.00 per year

  • Company pension
  • Housing allowance
  • On-site parking
  • Relocation assistance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme
  • Loyalty bonus
  • Performance bonus
  • Yearly bonus

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Registered Mental Health Nurse
description:
Sanctuary Personnel – Ref: - Prison Registered Mental Health Nurse

Location: HMP Nottingham

Type of Contract: Locum, 3-Months (full-time)

Hourly Rate: £30-42.50 per hour (assignment rate)

Benefits of working with us:

  • Fully online and paperless registration service
  • Free DBS and compliance service including paid for mandatory e-learning and practical training modules (if applicable)
  • Exclusive access to roles that aren’t available with other agencies; NHSBT, The Home Office and Vaccination Centres (private and public) are just some of the projects we’ve recently recruited to.
  • £250 refer a friend bonus once referral has worked 100 hours (uncapped – T&Cs apply)
  • Registration body costs covered based on length of service (T&Cs apply)
  • Find your own job bonus - Receive £250 for bringing your own position to us
  • Clinical governance and revalidation support from an in-house qualified health professional with over 15 years’ experience
  • Your own dedicated consultant with extensive experience within the healthcare sector
  • Daily payroll and in-house payroll system

Benefits of working in a prison:

  • Adding additional experience and variety to your Nursing CV which will increase your application journey when applying for future roles
  • Gaining prison clearance (if you don't already) which will make you more of an attractive proposition to future prison employers
  • The ability to work shifts around hours that suit your lifestyle as shifts are readily available across sociable and unsociable hours
  • Prison experience can often lead to rapid career progression especially within education, research and management
  • Stringent training and regulations making it a safe place to work for healthcare professionals

Main Duties:

  • To take a lead role in providing the successful and effective delivery of secondary mental health/learning disability services within the offender health directorate. To work as a secondary mental health/ learning disability practitioner within a multi-disciplinary team in a prison setting, leading in provision of care to patients with complex and enduring mental health problems, including those being managed under the Care Programme Approach (CPA).
  • Lead in the coordination of treatment of mental health, and social care needs from the point of entry into the prison system to transfer of care to on-going providers, so the mental health and social functioning of prisoners is improved.
  • To provide leadership to junior staff by maintaining professional standards, ensuring adherence to all relevant policies and procedures to ensure the delivery of high quality care

Requirements of the Prison RMN/Nurse:

  • Relevant nursing qualification and an active NMC Registration (Mental Health)
  • Must have Prison Clearance although clearance is available
  • Minimum 2 years experience

Contact:

This Prison RMN/Nurse job is advertised by Brandon Allen; if you are interested in this position please click above to apply now.We welcome applications from Prison Nurses who meet the above requirements.

Regretfully we are only able to respond to candidates who meet these requirements for this role as we need to meet our clients requirements, but please feel free to browse our open roles that may be more suitable for you.

Reasonable Adjustments:

If you consider yourself to have a disability or require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process or within the workplace, please highlight this at the earliest opportunity. With this information, we will provide appropriate support to you throughout the process and into you work placement.

title: Customer Consultant
description:
The Body Shop

When Anita Roddick founded The Body Shop in 1976, she had a vision. Business as a force for good – that’s us. Over 40 years later, we’re proud to be pioneering cruelty-free beauty every step of the way. We’re the original ethical beauty brand. We’ve got a thing for empowering people and enriching our planet. We’re all about keeping it real, in every way possible. Our activist roots remain a huge part of everything we do, from our iconic window posters to our vegetarian products to our infamous campaigns. We’re never afraid to stand up and speak the truth. We like to do things a little differently around here.


The Body Shop is committed to generating positive economic, social and environmental impact. We’re fighting for what we believe in now more than ever. No holding back. Breaking the mould has always come naturally to us, and we need someone who’s not afraid to mix things up.

Your role in a nutshell

To support the store management team in driving sales and profit within the store through the delivery of exceptional customer service on the shop floor at all times. To demonstrate and uphold the values and vision of the company whilst ensuring adherence to company procedures & policies.

More about the role

With over 2,000 exciting products designed to suit every customer's preference, there's a lot to choose from, so our team are on-hand to talk with customers every day. We take the time to learn our customer’s needs and recommend fantastic products that make them feel so good. We offer products that are packed with natural ingredients, many of which have been sourced ethically using Community Trade programmes - so when we advise a customer on their skincare regime, we're not just selling them an ideal, we're actually helping communities build a better life too.


As part of our dedicated team of Consultants you will offer expert advice to our customers and provide an inspirational insight into The Body Shop products and philosophy. You will get to learn the products, their origins and proactively engage with customers to experience a range that suits their preferences and lifestyle.

What we look for

  • Strong interpersonal skills to build rapport with customers - customer service experience is ideal
  • Ability to communicate and listen effectively
  • A genuine passion for beauty and the retail industry
  • Open availability for evening, weekend, and holiday shifts.


Talent Drivers

Collaborative Skills
Personal Conduct
Commerciality
Purpose

title: Customer Consultant
description:
The Body Shop

When Anita Roddick founded The Body Shop in 1976, she had a vision. Business as a force for good – that’s us. Over 40 years later, we’re proud to be pioneering cruelty-free beauty every step of the way. We’re the original ethical beauty brand. We’ve got a thing for empowering people and enriching our planet. We’re all about keeping it real, in every way possible. Our activist roots remain a huge part of everything we do, from our iconic window posters to our vegetarian products to our infamous campaigns. We’re never afraid to stand up and speak the truth. We like to do things a little differently around here.


The Body Shop is committed to generating positive economic, social and environmental impact. We’re fighting for what we believe in now more than ever. No holding back. Breaking the mould has always come naturally to us, and we need someone who’s not afraid to mix things up.

Your role in a nutshell

To support the store management team in driving sales and profit within the store through the delivery of exceptional customer service on the shop floor at all times. To demonstrate and uphold the values and vision of the company whilst ensuring adherence to company procedures & policies.

More about the role

With over 2,000 exciting products designed to suit every customer's preference, there's a lot to choose from, so our team are on-hand to talk with customers every day. We take the time to learn our customer’s needs and recommend fantastic products that make them feel so good. We offer products that are packed with natural ingredients, many of which have been sourced ethically using Community Trade programmes - so when we advise a customer on their skincare regime, we're not just selling them an ideal, we're actually helping communities build a better life too.


As part of our dedicated team of Consultants you will offer expert advice to our customers and provide an inspirational insight into The Body Shop products and philosophy. You will get to learn the products, their origins and proactively engage with customers to experience a range that suits their preferences and lifestyle.

What we look for

  • Strong interpersonal skills to build rapport with customers - customer service experience is ideal
  • Ability to communicate and listen effectively
  • A genuine passion for beauty and the retail industry
  • Open availability for evening, weekend, and holiday shifts.

title: Teacher
description:
SEMH Teacher Needed at Special Education School

We are looking for a SEMH teacher for a SEND school! Our supportive and close-knit special education school serving students with social, emotional, and mental health challenges is seeking a dedicated SEMH Teacher to join our team. You will be a class teacher to a class size of 6 to 14 students all with EHCP plans, along side you will be a team of dedicated support staff to work with the students.

As an SEMH Teacher you will be expected to teach the class, create appropriate resources, Complete planning and ensure it is differentiated for all children in your class. You will be creating engaging lessons, planning trips when available and ensuring the students can access the environment and curriculum!

The responsibilities include:

Teaching classes across a range of subjects catered to students' individual learning needs

Developing engaging lesson plans that incorporate emotional regulation, relationship-building, and self-management skills

Employing specialized instruction techniques such as visual schedules, movement breaks, sensory tools, and positive behaviour supports

Collaborating with other teachers, counsellors, and parents to implement customized behaviour plans

Encouraging students to express themselves in healthy ways and providing emotional support

Collecting data on behaviour and academic progress to adjust teaching strategies

Maintaining an structured, compassionate classroom environment

The ideal candidate will have:

Special education degree and certification in SEMH

Experience teaching students with learning disabilities, ADHD, mood disorders, trauma, etc.

Knowledge of de-escalation techniques and conflict resolution strategies

Strong classroom management abilities

Empathy, patience, and passion for working with special needs children

The benefits of working with Simply Education:

  • 24 hour access to Jess the SEN consultant with 6 years experience in the education
  • No or minimal timesheets
  • A range of specialist provisions in Northamptonshire and Warwickshire
  • FREE CPD Training including (SEND specific)

The successful candidate will be required to:

  • Subject to two years of satisfactory references
  • An Enhanced DBS check

Don't miss out on joining one of Northamptonshire's outstanding SEN team! Get in touch with Simply Education today to explore current vacancies in more details and take the next step. I look forward to helping you progress in your SEN career!

If you are interested in the role please contact Jess our experienced SEND consultant who can help you with more details on 01604 372 495 or email your CV to jessica@simplyeducation.co.uk

description:

You must have prison clearance to apply for this role!

Pay Rate: £34 - £45 per hour (assignment rate)

  • Weekdays £34ph
  • Nights/ Saturdays £39.50ph
  • Sundays/Bank Holidays £45ph

Contract: Locum & Ongoing Contract

Hours: Full-time

Benefits of working with Sanctuary Personnel:

  • Fully online and paperless registration service
  • Free DBS and compliance service including paid for mandatory e-learning and practical training modules (if applicable)
  • Exclusive access to roles that aren’t available with other agencies; NHSBT, The Home Office and Vaccination Centres (private and public) are just some of the projects we’ve recently recruited to.
  • £250 refer a friend bonus once referral has worked 100 hours (uncapped – T&Cs apply)
  • Registration body costs covered based on length of service (T&Cs apply)
  • Find your own job bonus - Receive £250 for bringing your own position to us
  • Clinical governance and revalidation support from an in-house qualified health professional with over 15 years’ experience
  • Your own dedicated consultant with extensive experience within the healthcare sector
  • Daily payroll and in-house payroll system

Benefits of working in a prison:

  • Adding additional experience and variety to your nursing CV which will increase your application journey when applying for future roles
  • Gaining prison clearance (if you don't already) which will make you more of an attractive proposition to future prison employers
  • The ability to work shifts around hours that suit your lifestyle as shifts are readily available across sociable and unsociable hours
  • Prison experience can often lead to rapid career progression especially within education, research and management
  • Stringent training and regulations making it a safe place to work for healthcare professionals

Main Duties:


  • You will undertake medication rounds, dispense controlled medication, attend emergency response situations, assess patients, undertake reception screening, and offer clinics such as triage, long-term conditions, suturing, wound care, ear irrigation, and sexual health.
  • To run health promotion / harm-minimisation clinics in specific disease-related areas.
  • To ensure that clinics run smoothly and meet national and local priorities and guidelines.
  • Respond to medical emergencies as an emergency responder, co-ordinating care, and providing primary clinical care of a high standard to patients.
  • Deliver a high standard of clinical care in the primary care, emergency care, harm minimisation, health promotion and occupational health remits of prison healthcare; within the extent of your role, experience and level of expertise.
  • Undertake initial and follow-up individual health assessments at reception and health screening, referring to appropriate guidelines.
  • Assist the development of evidence-based nursing procedures / protocols in the prison setting.
  • Identify shortfalls in stock levels / failure of equipment and liaise with the senior supervisor on duty to arrange replenishment.

Requirements of the Prison Nurse:

  • Must be registered on the NMC and must have a relevant qualification in nursing
  • Prison clearance and experience is essential

title: Credit Controller
description:
Exciting Opportunity: Join a diverse and vibrant accounts team based in Ashby-de-la-Zouch as a Credit Controller.

Are you a results-driven Credit Controller with a passion for building healthy financial spaces? Join us as we collaborate with a global leader in their industry, on the lookout for a talented individual to join their dynamic team!

The Role and Benefits:

  • Job Title: Credit Controller
  • Reporting to: Credit and Collections Manager
  • Location: Ashby-de-la-Zouch - 100% office-based
  • Working Hours: Full-Time, Monday to Friday
  • Benefits: 25 Days Holiday + Bank Holidays, Monthly bonus up to £300, Study Support, Standard Pension

Role Profile: As a Credit Controller, you'll play a pivotal role in recovering outstanding debts from existing customers, ensuring a positive customer experience. Here's what you'll be doing:

  • Reconcile complex accounts escalated from credit control administrators.
  • Utilise data analysis skills to prioritise workload effectively.
  • Monitor debtor balances for a significant reduction in DSO.
  • Engage in telephone calls and emails to secure commitments to pay.
  • Provide monthly reports on aged debt movement and customer interaction.
  • Collaborate with various teams to resolve customer queries in a timely manner.
  • Build and maintain relationships with customers, ensuring exceptional service.
  • Support credit control administrators to reduce debt inflow over 90 days overdue.

Knowledge and Experience: Essential:

  • Minimum 2 years of credit control experience (stand-alone role preferred).
  • Full credit control cycle experience, including legal action for debt recovery.
  • IT literate with proficiency in Microsoft packages, especially Excel.
  • Confident telephone manner and proven cash collection track record.

Desirable:

  • Experience with accounting software (e.g., Sage) and CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce).

Skills Required:

  • Accountable and conscientious.
  • Investigative nature.
  • Self-motivated with excellent planning and workload management.
  • Meticulous attention to detail and high accuracy standards.
  • Positive and vibrant attitude, adaptable, and personable.

If you're ready to take your credit control career to the next level and join a global leader in their field, submit your application now!

title: Recruitment Manager
description:
Are you an experienced logistics recruitment consultant looking for an internal role.

Working for a sameday courier business managing a team of recruiters to ensure van drivers are recruited to support the daily plan.

The Carrier Manager will hold a pivotal role in our business. At the core of our operations lies the resource and retention of self-employed drivers. Collaboration with various stakeholders, spanning our operational team, Sales, IT, and everything in between, will be a key aspect of your responsibilities. Your contribution will be instrumental in advancing our goal to become the Courier of choice and enhancing both driver and customer experiences.

Key Job Responsibilities

Your team's responsibilities:

  • Developing a strong driver package.
  • Continuous Improvement to enhance the driver experience.
  • Partner with teams to advise on and manage operational challenges
  • Support the planning and organisation of complex projects
  • Organise and Support full compliance for existing and new drivers.
  • Recommend drivers for allocation to routes/replacements (based on the optimum of cost and performance)
  • Prepare and participate in recurrent Ops calls, business reviews, QBRs, Customer Service workshops (to support the improvement plans)
  • Develop relationships with suppliers to grow our network.

Integral to your role within the team, you will be a key player in a deadline-driven and fast-paced environment, necessitating a detail-oriented approach and effective collaboration with multiple teams both within and outside the organisation. As a Carrier Manager, your responsibilities will entail substantial problem-solving. Collaborating with various teams, you will navigate challenges impacting our operational team, addressing temporary issues while strategically driving the business towards new objectives. This role demands both proactive and reactive approaches, offering you the opportunity to contribute to forecasting and planning for upcoming projects.

Your tasks as a Carrier Manager will span on-the-ground operations and tactical work, ensuring each day brings a new set of challenges and opportunities for learning. To better understand your vision for the role, we request that shortlisted candidates present their insights on "A Day in the Life" and how they envision enhancing the process of attracting and retaining self- employed drivers during the interview. This presentation will provide valuable insights into your approach and potential contributions to the dynamic Carrier Manager role.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Preferred but not essential Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
  • Relevant experience in analysing data and creating reports for leadership
  • Relevant experience of communicating with a wide range of stakeholders, including your colleagues and leadership
  • Relevant experience in managing multiple projects with competing deadlines
  • Advanced proficiency in verbal and written English
  • Relevant experience in supply chain management, operations, engineering, analytics, or a related field
  • Relevant experience in a supply chain, logistics, or transportation planning role
  • Experience using data visualization software.

For more details please forward your CV to:

will.morris@morepersonnel.co.uk

title: Software Engineer
description:
Embedded Software Engineer

A unique opportunity for an Embedded Software Engineer to join an industry-leading security consultancy based in Derbyshire, responsible for developing critical cybersecurity solutions for both Government organisations, and other providers. Offering a brilliant opportunity to use your engineering skills to contribute in a positive way, while working on an interesting array of challenging, bespoke projects.

Salary: £40,000 - £70,000 per annum + excellent benefits

Requirements for Embedded Software Engineer:

  • Ideally, you will have at least 3 years working in a commercial C/C++ Embedded software role
  • Experience of multi-threaded embedded systems (RTOS)
  • Strong design and coding skills
  • Experience of ARM based microcontrollers
  • Keen interest in security (you don’t need prior experience)
  • Given the consultancy element of the role, you will need to be great at understanding requirements and suggesting solutions
  • Any experience on the following technologies would be beneficial: C#, Python, Perl, Bash, PowerShell, SQL, IP standards, network security
  • Due to the nature of the role, this client requires the applicant to be in a position to obtain high level security clearance, therefore, can only accept applicants who can obtain DV security clearance once they have started working (i.e. usually means you have lived in UK for past 10 years, no criminal record etc)

Responsibilities for Embedded Software Engineer

  • Creating high integrity software, based on formally defined specifications and focused on functional correctness
  • Understand requirements and produce solutions
  • Code reviews
  • Produce documentation

What this offers:

  • Excellent salary and benefits
  • An excellent opportunity to witness your contributions playing a pivotal role in ensuring information security.
  • Excellent working culture with a varied and interesting workload

Applications:

If you would like to apply for this brilliant opportunity, we would love to hear from you. Please send an up-to-date CV via the relevant link.

C/C++ / C# / Rust / Scripting Languages / SQL / IP Standards / Network Security / Firmware Engineer / Embedded Systems Developer / Embedded Software Developer / Real-time Systems Engineer / IoT Software Engineer / Embedded Systems Programmer / Firmware Developer / Embedded Software Architect / Low-Level Software Engineer / Device Driver Developer / Embedded Software Designer / Microcontroller Programmer / Real-time Software Developer / Embedded Systems Analyst / Embedded Systems Specialist / Embedded Software Consultant / Embedded Systems Integration Engineer / Embedded Software Test Engineer / Bare-Metal Software Engineer / Embedded Systems Researcher

title: Sales Consultant
description:
Part-Time SALES CONSULTANT

  • You want part-time. You’ve got a life outside of work after all.
  • You’re hungry for progression. ‘Growing our own’ and fast-tracking promotions – that’s in our DNA.
  • You’ve got a winning way with customers. If you can engage and inspire, and get a buzz from selling beautiful product, you’ll go far.
  • You want an industry-leading package with uncapped commission. Basic Part-Time 3-day salary £13,800k.
  • You want best-in-class benefits. 5% pension, 24/7 medical support, health insurance, up to 33 days’ holiday, Perkbox, Refer a Friend bonus, staff discount…
  • You want to work for an award-winning family business, voted an Outstanding Place to Work and the UK’s leading independent furniture retailer.
  • You want to be part of a Great British success story.

The role

You’ll be the face of your store, greeting customers, creating rapport, understanding their needs and creating an awesome end-to-end experience, from ordering to final mile delivery.

You’ll be part of a dynamic team that’s hungry for success. With our industry-leading training, you’ll soon become a Furniture Village expert, well versed in beautiful furniture, world class service and understand how to overdeliver on KPIs.

Your skillset

Our ideal candidate? Looks like this:

  • Instinctively understands and embraces a customer-first mindset
  • Is a natural born communicator, one who leans in to listen and effortlessly persuade
  • Shows initiative and energy, as part of a team or working independently
  • Pays attention to detail (critical when ordering bespoke furniture)
  • Is punctual and professional, with a genuine smile
  • Uses critical thinking to solve problems without being phased

Our business

Our first store opened its doors in Abingdon in 1989. Fast forward and today we have 55 stores across the UK, with more to follow. At Furniture Village, we don’t believe in the hard sell. We believe in understanding customers’ needs, lifestyle and budget, then helping them find the perfect pieces.

Sourcing from across the globe – handmade mattresses from Yorkshire, bespoke marble-top tables from Italy, precision engineered wardrobes from Germany – we offer beautiful furniture and accessories for every room in the home.

Our people

In the words of our founder and CEO Peter Harrison: “We employ nice people to sell nice furniture to nice customers”. We’ve been doing it since 1989 when we opened our first store in Abingdon. Fast forward to today and we have 55 stores on the map with more to come.

The key to our success? Our people. The heartbeat of our business. We offer real progression, real training and real rewards. Not to mention real fun. There’s a reason over 20% of our team has received long service awards, it’s because they want to stay!

Our recruitment

As a family business, it’s really important to us that everyone feels part of our family. We’re an equal opportunities employer and welcome everyone. Ready for the next leap in your career? Apply now and let’s talk. Together we can do wonderful things.

title: Teaching Assistant
description:
Job description

Team Educate are seeking reliable and supportive British Sign Language (BSL) Teaching Assistants to support school pupils in Derby.

Do you have experience using British Sign Language (BSL) in an educational setting? Perhaps you have used BSL in your personal life and would love the opportunity to apply this expertise? Do you have a strong desire to support students with hearing impairments in their education? If so, we'd love to hear from you!

Here at Team Educate, we're currently in search of exceptional Teaching Assistants with the ability to use and understand British Sign Language (BSL). You should be able to use BSL to communicate with young people regarding their education and school life, and possess the ability to learn subject specific terms as you go. Although a background of working in education is advantageous, it is by no means a necessity. A caring and supportive nature, alongside the ability and drive to have an impact on pupils' education is the most desirable trait for this role.

The Role in a Nutshell:

As a BSL Teaching Assistant, you'll play an integral role in providing tailored support to pupils, ensuring they receive the finest education and the tools needed for personal growth. With knowledge of how best to support pupils with hearing impairments, you will use your skills in BSL to encourage collaboration and engagement in lessons. You may find yourself supporting pupils 1-to-1 in mainstream schools, or supporting small groups of pupils in schools for deaf children.

Benefits of being a BSL Teaching Assistant:

  • Immerse yourself in an enriching school environment where you can have a demonstrable impact on pupils.
  • Experience guidance and assistance from supportive professionals with first-hand experience in education.
  • Secure a longer-term position with the potential to extend into the academic year.
  • The opportunity to develop and enhance your own practice and skills through continued professional development.

The successful BSL Teaching Assistant will have:

  • A proactive attitude coupled with a genuine passion for working with children.
  • The ability to communicate effectively using British Sign language (BSL).
  • Previous hands-on experience of working with young learners with varied needs.
  • An enhanced DBS certificate registered with the online update service or a willingness to process a new one.

If you are interested in the above opportunity, or would like some more information about the role or the school, please submit your CV and one of our consultants will be in touch to help. We look forward to hearing from you!

Why Choose Team Educate:

Team Educate is a forward-thinking agency with schools' and candidates' best interests at heart. We pride ourselves on our expertise, with our in-house teaching team on hand to offer guidance and support throughout your registration. We go above and beyond for all of our candidates and can offer the best service in the industry in our amazing schools. Join our amazing team of educators so we can continue to offer an outstanding service to schools and learners. #TeamEducate

Have a friend who may be interested in joining us? We offer £75 for every Teaching Assistant referral and £150 for every Teacher referral (terms and conditions apply)

title: Social Worker
description:
Advanced Social Worker – Children Court Team – Derbyshire

£36 per hour umbrella

About the job:

Are you a seasoned Social Worker passionate about ensuring the welfare of children in the legal context? Are you committed to upholding the rights of children in the judicial system? 3D Recruit is looking for an experienced and dedicated Advanced Social Worker to join a dynamic Children's Court Team. This is a unique opportunity to play a pivotal role in advocating for the best interests of children within the legal framework. It is a locum role where you will be on an initial 3-month contract with the potential to be extended!

As a Social Worker within this team, you will have the following responsibilities:

· Court Representation: Serve as a key representative in court proceedings, presenting comprehensive assessments of children's needs and advocating for their best interests. Collaborate with legal professionals, presenting evidence-based recommendations to support informed decision-making.

· Case Management: Oversee a caseload of children involved in legal proceedings, ensuring the implementation of court orders and collaborating with families, caregivers, and other professionals to create and maintain effective care plans.

· Assessment and Reporting: Conduct in-depth assessments of children's circumstances, utilizing a holistic approach. Prepare detailed reports for court hearings, ensuring accurate and comprehensive documentation of social, emotional, and developmental factors.

· Interagency Collaboration: Work collaboratively with other agencies, including legal professionals, law enforcement, and community organizations, to facilitate a multidisciplinary approach in meeting the needs of children and families.

· Advocacy and Support: Be a strong advocate for the rights and well-being of children, ensuring that their voices are heard in court proceedings. Provide support to children and families throughout legal processes, offering resources and assistance as needed.

· Supervision and Training: Provide guidance and supervision to junior social workers within the team. Contribute to the development and delivery of training programs to enhance the team's skills and knowledge.

Requirements:

· 3 years of qualified Social Work experience

· DBS on the Update Service or happy to apply for one

· 5 years of satisfactory references

· Driving License with access to a vehicle

· SWE Registered

Benefits of working with 3D Recruit:

· Specialist Social Work and Education recruitment business

· Supporting professionals finding opportunities since 2000

· Competitive rates of pay

· Flexible hours to suit your preferences

· Different contract types – locum & permanent

· Part-time and full-time opportunities

· We work with a number of different local authorities

· Dedicated Consultants who listen to your needs

· Support with interview prep

· CPD training events

How to apply

If you are interested in the role or other vacancies, you can easily submit your CV via the advert. If you are not ready to apply now, do contact us through our website.

Refer a Qualified Social Worker to us and you receive £250! (Terms and Conditions apply)

3D Recruit is committed to safer recruitment and adheres to APSCo Compliance+ standards. All candidates who apply for locum or supply contracts will be met face-face and will undertake an interview with an experienced consultant, where documents and references are verified.

3D Recruit is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of adults, children and young people, and expects all staff to share this commitment.

title: Environmental Consultant
description:
Senior Geo-environmental Consultant

Working Pattern: 37 hrs per week – Monday to Friday

Location: West Bridgford, Nottingham

Via is currently looking for an experienced Senior Geo-Environmental Consultant to join our join our established Environmental Management and Design team on a hybrid working basis based at our Trent Bridge House Office in West Bridgford, Nottingham.

You role would be sat within the Environmental Consultancy working on a range of diverse projects including; housing developments, new and existing schools, highways, landfill management, remediation, flood alleviation schemes to name a few, as well as supporting other services delivered by the wider company.

The Job

Key areas of responsibility will include:

  • Providing project management, technical assessment and advisory services to support delivery of projects that may be complex and/or large-scale to internal and external clients
  • Adhere to Health and Safety and Quality management systems, processes and requirements ensuring compliance with health, safety and environmental legislation, policy and best practice
  • Provide specialist contaminated land planning support to the local authority including undertaking role of expert witness at planning/public inquiry, to ensure applications are compliant with legislation and national/local planning policies
  • Development of client relations ships through strong project management, communication and liaison with clients and a wide range of internal and external stakeholders including members of the public and elected Members
  • Mentoring and supporting junior staff to enable them to achieve their potential, peer review of the team’s work, whilst maintaining your own CPD
  • Act as an ambassador for individual schemes and the Company

The Person
Mainly you will self-motivated, practical, and importantly enthusiastic to be a vital part of our Environmental Management & Design Team, but there are just a few other things we’d like from you:

  • Master’s degree in a relevant Geology, Environmental Science or Engineering related discipline, or a bachelor’s degree with proven and demonstrable knowledge gained through practical experience
  • Membership of a relevant professional body and evidence of ongoing CPD maintenance, ideally working towards chartership
  • Proven experience of writing and reviewing technical reports including Phase 1 Desk Studies, Phase 2 Intrusive
  • Investigations, human health risk assessments and remediation strategies. Experience of writing detailed quantitative risk assessments and basic geotechnical assessment and reporting is desirable
  • Up to date knowledge of relevant, technical guidance, legislation and good practice appropriate to the contaminated land sector
  • Strong ICT skills including competence in specialist computer applications used to support contaminated land assessment including site investigation data management software
  • Experience of providing information, communicating and working collaboratively
  • Experience of managing projects to meet financial and programme targets
  • Knowledge of procurement practices, including forms of tender and conditions of contract

About Via

Based in Nottinghamshire, with a multi-skilled local workforce and a range of highly trained staff at a few different locations throughout the county. Via East Midlands provides sustainable highways services for Nottinghamshire and across the wider East Midlands region.

Our roles include highway maintenance, electrical works, mechanics, construction, forestry, road safety, civil engineering and much more. We combine a public-sector service ethos with a strong commercial focus, and we are passionate about innovation and creating and delivering sustainable solutions safely across Nottinghamshire and the wider East Midlands.

Via is a great place to work if you value work-life balance and we are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer a range of family friendly and inclusive employment policies, including generous annual leave allowances, with flexible working available to our office-based staff. With most of our work being based in the East Midlands, our front-line staff also enjoy short journeys to site each working day.

By joining us you will be part of a growing organisation that positively embraces customer and community aspirations.

If this sounds like you, it would be great to hear from you.

title: Day Teacher
description:
Textbook Teachers, a well-established and leading Education Recruitment Agency encourage Qualified Primary teachers who are looking to take a step back from a full-time class teacher role, to apply for our role!

We are a local, honest and trusted agency that has over 22 years of experience. Over the years, we have built and maintained excellent relationships with our client schools, ensuring all Supply teachers have a great experience when fulfilling day-to-day Supply requirements.

Supply teaching is an ideal route for newly qualified teachers; it helps you find your feet by teaching in different local Primary schools allowing you to grow in confidence and use your transferable skills. Equally, for experienced teachers, Supply teaching is perfect if you are seeking a teaching role with less responsibility and offers an improved work/life balance.

Day-to-Day Supply teaching gives you ample opportunity to work with children of different abilities and backgrounds as you will have the chance to go to a new school everyday or every week. You will be in full control of your work schedule and your dedicated consultant will work around your preferences and availability. With no planning to do, your job is to teach pre planned lessons and complete any necessary marking afterwards.

As the demand for Supply teachers continues to grow, we are recruiting Primary teachers that are looking for an immediate start in a new and exciting role. Successful candidates will need to complete company Safeguarding and Keeping Children Safe in Education training. Enhanced DBS and Safeguarding Checks will also be carried out as part of your registration compliance checks.

Does this role sound interesting to you? Apply Now through Indeed by submitting your most recent CV and a member of the team will reach out to you. Alternatively, if you would rather speak with someone first, please call us on 01572 756888.

title: Apprentice Nursery Practitioner
description:
Job Title: Apprentice Nursery Practitioner

Employer: Kids Corner Nursery

Location:315 Gwendolen Rd,

Evington,

Leicester,

LE5 5FS

OR

12 Upperton Rd,

Leicester,

LE3 0BG

Pay: £5.28 per hour (increasing to £6.40 as of 01/04/2024)

Daily Hours: Monday to Friday shifts between 8.30am and 4.30pm

Total Weekly Hours: Average 30 hours per week (minimum 17 hours)

Qualification: Early Years Educator Level 3

Duration: 18 months

Units:

· Continued professional development

· Speech and language

· Equality and diversity

· Partnership working

· Planning and implementing activities for children

· Learning development, observations, and theories

· Safeguarding

· Supporting positive behaviour

· Health, safety, and welfare

· Transitions

How an apprenticeship works:

As an Apprentice, you will be employed, just like anyone else at the company, the only difference is that you spend some of your week studying towards a qualification.

Typically, you will have a teams meeting once a month (2-3 hours) with your assigned Trainer Assessor unlike the usual assumption that you will attend college for one day a week. Throughout the month, you will be expected to complete different assignments and independent study as discussed in this meeting in preparation for the next month. Each week, you will spend a minimum of 6 hours in a number of different Training, Learning & Development Activities that all develop your Knowledge, Skills & Behaviours which will be completed in your place of work during your working hours- so no homework!! These 6 hours will be agreed with your manager and can be set as a whole day or split throughout the week, whatever works best for you!

After approximately 6 months, you will be set mock activities by your Trainer Assessor to help you prepare for your End Point Assessment (EPA). This will include Multiple Choice Questions, Presentations of your work and Q&A’s. You will receive lots of one-to-one support to prepare you for this!

CT Skills is always sure to provide full support from your Initial Application to your final EPA! As we are a training provider, all of our vacancies are for immediate start and available all year round, so please consider this when you are applying!

IN ORDER TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR AN APPRENTICESHIP, YOU MUST HAVE GRADE 4/C OR ABOVE IN GCSE ENGLISH AND MATHS (OR EQUIVALENT) AND HAVE LIVED IN THE UK FOR AT LEAST 3 YEARS.

About the employer & website link:

Kids’ Corner Nursery began in 2012 at the heart of Leicester, Upperton Road. In a small and cosy Victorian building over 3 floors.

Hafsa and Mariam two best friends who had great working careers in childcare struggled to find flexible care for their children. They then took their ambition and expertise into creating a fun, flexible, affordable loving environment for all Children. The very first customers were their own children.

Kids’ Corner Nursery provides excellent childcare throughout the year for babies, toddlers, and pre-school children. We have carefully selected our managers and staff to ensure a high level of commitment and to provide your child with a safe and comfortable environment, ultimately keeping your child happy at all times.

For more information, please visit https://kidscornernursery.net/

About the role:

The main duty within this role is to promote the physical, social, and emotional development of each child within your remit and contribute towards their care and supervision.

If you’re successful with your application, you will be getting involved in the planning and running of playtime, meeting and greeting the parents and making sure the play areas are clean and safe. This means you need some excellent interpersonal skills – if you’re dealing with the parents of the children, they need to be able to trust you!

Daily Duties:

· Supporting supervision of children aged 0-8.

· Supervising and monitoring the safety of children in your care.

· Helping children to keep good hygiene.

· Organising activities or implementing a curriculum that allows children to learn about the world and explore interests.

· Developing schedules and routines to ensure that children have enough physical activity, rest, and playtime.

· Watching for signs of emotional or developmental problems in children and bringing the problems to the attention of parents – vigilant safeguarding activities, Keep records of children’s progress, routines, and interest.

Skills:

Apprenticeships are very demanding as you are working towards a qualification whilst working full time! You will need to be committed and motivated as there is lots of self-guided work involved.

· Exceptional customer service skills.

· Good communication skills.

· Report writing and note taking skills.

· Resilience.

· Awareness of safeguarding.

· A genuine desire to work in the childcare sector.

· The ability to communicate on a variety of levels (between parents, children, and colleagues)

· Have a good sense of humour.

· Ability to work under pressure,

Desired Experience and Qualifications:

· GCSE or equivalent English and Maths (Grade 4/C or above)

· Early Years Level 2 Qualification

Future Opportunities:

As with any apprenticeship opportunity – if you prove yourself to be a valuable member of the team there could be the potential of a permanent post within the business.

Future Careers:

· Nursery Nurse

· Childminders

Please go to https://www.ctskills.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/Early-Years-Educator-Overview-L3.pdf for more information.

INTERESTED? Before you apply….

· Make sure you’ve fully read and understood the advert, the company, and the qualification.

· Are you committed to completing the apprenticeship qualification?

· Do you meet the eligibility criteria?

· Have you explained in your CV/Cover letter why you are applying and what interests you about this qualification?

· Is your CV up to date and relevant to this role? If you need help with this, please use our CV template: https://www.ctskills.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/Candidate-CV-Advice-Template-1.docx

What happens next?

If you’re application is successful, you will receive a phone call from our Recruitment Consultant. So, please ensure that this is apprenticeship programme is of interest to you as it will be a minimum 12-month commitment. If you are interested in an apprenticeship but unsure what you would like to do, please contact us for advice: https://www.ctskills.co.uk/contact-us/

After this phone call, you will be requested to complete a supporting statement that will be added to your CV before being sent to the employer. You will then be sent English and Maths assessments and a Basic Information Form to complete. The assessments must take at least 30 minutes and you need to achieve a Level 1 or above to be put forward for the position. You will also be asked to complete a Knowledge, Skills & Behaviours assessment (KSB) to recognise any prior learning related to the qualification.

Job Types: Full-time, Apprenticeship

Salary: £5.28 per hour

Expected hours: 17 – 30 per week

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

School type:

  • Day nursery

Application question(s):

  • What is it that appeals to you about this role and company?
  • Do you have min Maths & English GCSE Grade C/4 or above (or equivalent)? If NOT, you do NOT meet the minimum application criteria, so please do NOT apply
  • PLEASE NOTE: This is an Apprenticeship Opportunity. If this is NOT of interest, please do NOT apply

Education:

  • GCSE or equivalent (required)

Work authorisation:

  • United Kingdom (required)

Work Location: In person

title: Principal Consultant
description:
Principal Consultant

Location
Leicester

Job Type
Permanent

Salary
£22700 - 35000 per year

Reference
ATA2024PRCWC2

Principal Recruitment Consultant

White Collar Engineering (Design, Project, Controls)

Leicester (LE3)

Up to £35,000 DOE + uncapped commission, paid volunteer leave, employee assistance programme, free on site parking, green commute initiative, incentives and awards + many other benefits

ATA Recruitment are looking for an experienced permanent Recruitment Consultant to join our team in Leicester. Working alongside one of our Associate Directors with over 15 years experience with us and in this sector, this is a rare and exciting opportunity to support with the delivery of one of our key accounts, with a view to take over the management of it after 12 months. Alongside this, there will be the expectation to generate your own client base, through B2B sales and utilising our extensive database. Due to the nature of this role, we are looking for someone who is confident in running a full 360 process, with the ability to successfully manage candidates to the point of offer.

The ideal candidate will aspire to lead and support with the management/development of junior colleagues with a view to move into a formal management position after 12-18 months. They will have a desire to grow a successful team around them, becoming an integral part of ATA Recruitment and future growth plans. There will be training, coaching and support as they make this transition from a Senior Management team who have all progressed through our structure themselves.

Although experience in our sector (or another technical sector) would be viewed favourably, we would also consider someone with a proven track record in white collar permanent recruitment in any sector. 360 recruitment experience is imperative, as is the ability to evidence your previous billings.

The successful candidate can expect to join a supportive and energetic team who are very excited about the growth of our business and welcome new talent with open arms. We ensure all of our Consultants have everything they need to be successful; equipment, access to leading job boards, LinkedIn Recruiter licenses and lead generation tools, as well ongoing internal and external training, weekly one on ones with your Manager and quarterly and annual appraisals. Our commission is completely uncapped, with the ability to earn up to 25% on all placements, as well as team bonus once you have progressed into the management role.

The find out more about this opportunity to please contact our Talent Manager, Rachael Bailey-Frost.

Ganymede is committed to creating a diverse workforce and is an equal opportunities employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of age, disability, gender, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, and sexual orientation

title: Management Accountant
description:
Role Purpose:
To assist the work of the Head of Finance in all areas of management and financial accounting,
providing support with decision making throughout the organisation through implementation of
budgetary controls and corresponding financial performance reporting.

Role responsibilities:
  • Support the monthly management reporting and inventory reporting processes
  • Lease accounting and payment processes, including rent, service charge and landlord
insurance
  • Local authority payments, management of Business Rates and BID payment processes,
with support from External consultant
  • Provide support to the annual budget setting process
  • Perform monthly balance sheet reconciliations
  • Provide support to the quarterly VAT process, reconciliations and VAT return
  • Prepare and post monthly journals relating to income and expenditure (including Payroll)
  • Support the Head of Finance with profit and loss variance analysis
  • Assist with the preparation of the annual statutory financial statements, including
preparation of support schedules for year-end audit requirements and to assist external
auditors as required
  • Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with a broad range of finance and
non-finance colleagues
  • To undertake other/ad hoc duties commensurate with the role, as required
  • Provide support to the Head of Finance on specific projects
Role Parameters
Budget management: None
Working Arrangements: Hybrid (Remote/Corby Head office)

Key Stakeholders: Head of Finance
Management Accountants
Retail Operations
Property
IT
Individual budget holders

Role Essential Skills:
  • Qualified AAT, Part qualified ACA, ACCA or ACMA studying towards a formal accounting
qualification
  • Significant experience within a similar accounting role and strong analytical skills
  • Advanced software skills including Excel, Access and experience of JDA an advantage
  • Proficient with other Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, PowerPoint, Word)
  • Good understanding of accounting principles
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • You must be able to demonstrate good attention to detail, good judgement showing logical
decision making and a hands-on approach.
  • Well organised and disciplined with regard to meeting deadlines
  • Enthusiastic team player with an ability to adapt to change
