title: Civil Engineer
description:
The Civil and Structural Engineering Team at Uniper Technologies are working on varied and exciting new projects and as such want to expand and enhance its capabilities. Projects range from feasibility studies and front end engineering design for green hydrogen facilities and new combined cycle gas fired power plant fitted with carbon capture and storage to decommissioning and demolition works of existing assets. This role will play a significant contribution to assisting Uniper to achieve its Zero Carbon future.


We are Uniper


At Uniper, we are pro-actively transforming the world of energy whilst at the same time ensuring security of energy supply. As an internationally operating company, we work in very diverse teams with the greatest possible working time flexibility for our employees. Our corporate culture is characterized by equal opportunities, mutual appreciation, and respect. With us, you will be able to develop new business models, work on technological solutions for a modern, sustainable, and future-oriented energy supply as well as pro-actively help to shape changes. Interested? Then we will look forward to meeting you!


Your responsibilities


  • We are looking for you to bolster and enhance the teams design, project management and consultancy capability by bringing your Civil / Structural engineering skills onboard.
  • You will join as part of a fast moving team, and will work on varied and interesting projects involving a selection of both office based activities and occasional site based working.
  • You will enjoy the variety that very few roles can offer including, site investigations, project development through the design and tendering phases and providing technical support during the construction of new power stations and low carbon facilities.
  • You may also have the opportunity to apply your knowledge of structures and structural design to existing gas fired power stations, where you would undertake structural appraisalsinspection of structures and assist with either assessing the condition of the asset or be involved with plant modifications or major repairs.
  • You may also have the opportunity to apply your knowledge of structures and structural design to existing gas fired power stations, where you would undertake structural appraisals and assist with either assessing the condition of the asset or be involved with plant modifications or major repairs.
  • Your goals will be to deliver engineering solutions safely, on time and to budget that meet the evolving needs of our customers.


Current Projects
Some current projects to give an idea of the scope involve a number of new power generation plant developments ranging from new biomass boilers to green hydrogen plant front end engineering design studies, feasibility studies for retrofitting carbon capture and storage on an existing plant. In addition, there is the potential to support the operation and maintenance of a wide range of power generating plant including gas and coal fired power stations, wind turbines and energy from waste plants. As such the work tends to be highly diverse, interesting, and therefore requires a broad range of civil and structural engineering skills and experience.


Your profile


  • Chartered Engineer ( MICE or MIStructE).
  • Demonstrable experience within Civil/Structural Engineering and with a broad design background in the design of steel and reinforced concrete structures.
  • Proven experience in developing projects from concept through to detailed design stage.
  • Ability to produce technical specifications and scope of work documents.
  • You will possess excellent analytical skills and be able to identify design improvements at all stages of project development.
  • Ability to clearly communicate to both design engineers and project directors on technical matters in a written form and verbally.
  • Project management experience and ability to manage others both internally and external consultants. Manage time and budgets and be able to critically identify areas which require improvement.
  • Experience of design software such as TEDDS, Trimble Structural, STAAD Pro, or similar design packages and competent with the Microsoft Office suite and AutoCAD.
  • Full Driving License is required, along with willingness to travel to customer sites throughout the UK.
  • Hybrid working with two to three days per week in the Nottingham office


Desirable:
  • Experience in large industrial projects, with experience in either the Petrochemicals or Power Generation.
  • Experience of being involved with project development, undertaking the Owners Engineer role and the design of medium sized industrial buildings would be beneficial.
  • Ability to produce well written technical reports based on site inspections on a range of structural forms and ages.


Your qualities


At Uniper, we not only reward our employees with attractive salaries, an excellent company pension and health related benefits for their hard work and dedication to shaping the future energy transition. You can also expect a supportive working culture that offers a wide range of creative and innovative ideas. We enable various flexible working arrangements, whilst also supporting with home office equipment.
Through regular training and workshops, together we work towards visualising yourself in our company as if it were your own. We support you in highlighting your individual potential, achieving your personal goals, and reaching your ambitions. We invite you to become part of our diverse company with international colleagues from more than 80 countries. As an employer, Uniper has committed itself to providing special support to certain areas:
  • Competitive salary
  • Personal development and Learning opportunities
  • Enhanced company pension – With up to 12% company contributions
  • 26 days annual leave plus Bank Holidays
  • Free electric vehicle charging at our sites
  • In house Occupational Health Services
  • Company funded Private Medical Insurance including free GP service
  • Performance related benefits
  • Access to a range of flexible benefits such as Share Incentive Plan, Dental, Critical Illness and Life Insurance, Cycle2Work, Health Care Cash plan or buy and sell extra holiday
  • Future career opportunities (UK & International) with a strong focus on Diversity Equity and Inclusion


Our employees are the reason for our success. Therefore, you will find many other benefits at the local level to help you reach your potential. Energy evolutionary wanted!


Your contact


Should you have any questions about this opportunity, please contact the UK Talent Acquisition Manager

dominic.lindsey@uniper.energy


Please note, any CV’s sent via email would not be taken into consideration. All CV’s must be submitted via the online application process only.


Job information


Contract type:
Unlimited

Working Hours:
Full time

Start Date:
ASAP

Deadline:

Salary:
£55,000 to £65,000


As an employer, Uniper is committed to diversity and equal opportunities. Therefore, we encourage applications from suitably qualified individuals whose capabilities match the role requirements regardless of gender, origin, disability, age, religion, ideology, sexual identity or marital status. We live inclusion and support flexible working.

title: Client Services Coordinator
description:
Client Service Coordinator
Location: Coventry
Salary: £30,000 - £40,000, depending on experience.

Do you like organising and coordinating tasks, people and things?
Are you good at communicating in a clear and friendly way?
Do you like to find ways to make things more efficient?
Do you enjoy following things up and seeing them through to completion?

A Client Service Coordinator role at Oldfield might be for you….

What does the job involve?

The role of Client Service Coordinator is to provide administrative support to a team of accountants, consultants or tax advisers by managing their schedule of work to be done; liaising with and following up clients to get the information we need; liaising with clients to schedule meetings; and holding your team accountable to get the work completed.

Your role is to enable those in your team to deliver their work efficiently and within budget, and in a way that gives the client a great experience, so the team and the firm hit their fee targets.

Client Service Coordinator - What does success look like in this role?

When youre succeeding in this role, youll be excelling at proactively planning ahead and
coordinating the workflow of your team so the right jobs come in at the right time, and the
team have the right information from clients to complete their work efficiently, accurately and
within budget. Youre following up all outstanding jobs rigorously with clients and with the
team. In short, youll be making sure the cogs in your team are running smoothly, so there are no roadblocks, and client and statutory deadlines are met, and clients receive an excellent experience.

Client Service Coordinator - Attractive benefits & perks

Generous base salary - £30,000 - £40,000, subject to experience.
Company car or car allowance option (after qualifying period in the role).
Free quality lunch provided each day
30 Days Holiday (incl. bank holidays).
Flexible working hours
Team Bonus
Medical insurance (after qualifying period in the role)
Reward Lunches
Team Building days
Young and vibrant team
Excellent career progression

Testimonials from recent starters:

For me personally, the best thing about working at Oldfield Advisory is the sense of satisfaction you can have in being able to help, assist and support a wide variety of clients and businesses in their financial affairs. You can play an active role in growing profitability of your clients by providing meaningful information to improve the effectiveness of management decisions.

Working as an accountant at Oldfield, I have found the work to be very rewarding and meaningful. There is plenty of scope to learn and progress, alongside doing valuable work for clients and building strong professional relationships with other businesses.

There is a lot of variety in the job which keeps it engaging and satisfying.

The managements care for the staff is second to none, recognition is generous and support throughout the career is excellent.

We have an inspiring set of values and an awesome team, creating a quality culture and atmosphere".

title: Land Manager
description:
From the commitment we pour into our homes, to the belief we bring to supporting amazing careers, a role at Persimmon is a springboard for Building Your New Possible. Discover new opportunities to grow, learn new skills and release your potential.

We’re Persimmon Homes, a FTSE 250 listed company and a leading UK house builder serving local communities across the UK and delivering around 10,000 homes a year. We have 29 operating businesses in England, Wales and Scotland, three house-building brands and three off-site manufacturing facilities.

We’re looking for people like you, and this could be your opportunity to start Building Your New Possible.

What is the role?

This is an exciting opportunity for a Senior Land Manager to join the Strategic Land Team at Persimmon Homes.

Reporting to the Group Strategic Land Director, the successful candidate will have experience in identifying and securing new strategic land opportunities. This position would suit someone who is ambitious and looking to take a step towards a Strategic Land Director position. You will have a thorough understanding of the planning system and be suitably experienced in dealing with land contracts. You will be experienced in identifying, resourcing, securing and realising the potential of strategic land under option or promotion contract. A proven negotiator, you are able to build and develop relationships with key players and organisations. You will understand our corporate vision and be instrumental in ensuring our values are upheld.

The role will include:

  • Responsible for the identification and acquisition of quality strategic land opportunities.
  • Develop relationships with land agents and landowners to help promote Persimmon as an effective development partner.
  • Ensure we build and foster relationships with public sector bodies ensuring the company maintains a competitive edge.
  • Develop effective planning and land strategies to ensure our sites are optimally promoted and the value of our strategic sites are maximised.
  • Lead and motivate the strategic land team in ensuring strategic land opportunities are actioned swiftly so to maintain the highest standards of success.
  • Work alongside the operational company Managing Directors, Land Directors and Group Land team in delivering a clear and deliverable pipeline of new strategic opportunities.
  • Take budgetary control for strategic land sites.

What we need from you?

  • Experience is essential working for either a housebuilder or land promoter in a strategic land capacity.
  • Understanding of the financial and legal aspects of strategic land.
  • Excellent knowledge of the Midlands area and good relationships with land agents, landowners, planning consultants, lawyers and local authorities.
  • Full UK Driving Licence

What’s in it for you?

Salary and benefits package

  • Competitive Salary (DOE)
  • Company Car/Car Allowance
  • Pension
  • Life Assurance
  • Bonus
  • Health Care

Persimmon has a Hybrid Working Policy for core roles in the business allowing staff on completion of probation to apply for home working up to 2/3 days per week.

When you join us, the future is yours to explore. You can realise your full potential through industry-leading training and clearly signposted career paths. Persimmon is where hard graft and team spirit means real variety, satisfaction and rewards. A place where you can be at your best, and even go beyond what you thought you were capable of. If this sounds like the place for you, apply today and start Building Your New Possible.

Persimmon are Proud Sponsors of Team GB

No Agencies please – Persimmon will not accept speculative CVs as a means of introduction

Persimmon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to encouraging equality, diversity and inclusion among our workforce and eliminating unlawful discrimination.

Our aim is for our workforce to be truly representative of all sections of society and our customers, and for each employee to feel respected and able to give their best.

If you have any questions about the job or application process please contact us at talentacquisition@persimmonhomes.com

title: Surveyor
description:
Asbestos Surveyor / Consultant

Oracle Solutions is currently looking for a number of highly motivated individuals to join our team of Asbestos Surveyors. We believe in the power of personal and professional growth, and we are committed to supporting our employees on their journey of learning and development. In return for your hard work and dedication, the below is what you can expect as a new team member:

  • Up to 33 days annual leave
  • £2500 joining bonus
  • Up to £40,000 per year
  • Additional leave and benefits scheme
  • Work-from-home opportunity based on business needs
  • Flexible working hours opportunities based on business needs
  • Company car
  • Company events and social
  • Company pension
  • Health & wellbeing programme
  • On-site parking
  • Referral programme
  • Additional training where required

The Role:

  • Conduct comprehensive asbestos surveys in various residential and commercial properties, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements using TEAMS software.
  • Collect samples, perform visual inspections, and accurately record data to assess the presence and condition of asbestos-containing materials.
  • Competent & accurate completion of lab paperwork including Bulk Samples posted in a timely manner.
  • Deliver all asbestos services to the highest standards as set out in current and relevant HSE legislation, in line with UKAS accreditation and company procedural documentation.
  • Personal growth where required in all areas for full competency and certification in all areas of the consultancy job role as outlined within this job description.
  • Contribute to a positive and inclusive work environment by actively participating in team meetings, sharing knowledge with trainees, and supporting colleagues.
  • Pay: Up to £40,000 per year - dependant on experience and qualifications.

As well as the usual asbestos surveying, we also offer the opportunity to grow by giving you the chance to deliver asbestos training, asbestos-contaminated land services, asbestos management, asbestos removal management, and generally working with our clients on all things asbestos.

Requirements:

  • Previous minimum 12 months experience working as an Asbestos Surveyor for a UKAS accredited company.
  • Certifications and qualifications in asbestos surveying - P402 is essential. Any other asbestos modules would be a benefit.
  • A Strong understanding of asbestos-related regulations, guidelines, and best practices.
  • Effective communication skills to be able to interact with clients, contractors, and team members.
  • Flexibility to travel to client’s premises to undertake required Asbestos Services.
  • Clean, UK driving License.

The Company

We have been in the asbestos and associated industries for more than 15 years and are a team of more than 50 asbestos professionals. Oracle is accredited, licensed, and certified to the highest level. Those that run and manage the company are the team members that have helped build it. Every Director and Senior Manager at Oracle Asbestos has been promoted from within. If you are a motivated individual with a passion for learning and growth in the field of asbestos surveying, we invite you to join our team.

If you are a motivated individual with a passion for learning and growth in the field of asbestos surveying, we would like to hear from you!

title: Teacher
description:
SEMH Teacher Needed at Special Education School

We are looking for a SEMH teacher for a SEND school! Our supportive and close-knit special education school serving students with social, emotional, and mental health challenges is seeking a dedicated SEMH Teacher to join our team. You will be a class teacher to a class size of 6 to 14 students all with EHCP plans, along side you will be a team of dedicated support staff to work with the students.

As an SEMH Teacher you will be expected to teach the class, create appropriate resources, Complete planning and ensure it is differentiated for all children in your class. You will be creating engaging lessons, planning trips when available and ensuring the students can access the environment and curriculum!

The responsibilities include:

Teaching classes across a range of subjects catered to students' individual learning needs

Developing engaging lesson plans that incorporate emotional regulation, relationship-building, and self-management skills

Employing specialized instruction techniques such as visual schedules, movement breaks, sensory tools, and positive behavior supports

Collaborating with other teachers, counselors, and parents to implement customized behavior plans

Encouraging students to express themselves in healthy ways and providing emotional support

Collecting data on behavior and academic progress to adjust teaching strategies

Maintaining an structured, compassionate classroom environment

The ideal candidate will have:

Special education degree and certification in SEMH

Experience teaching students with learning disabilities, ADHD, mood disorders, trauma, etc.

Knowledge of de-escalation techniques and conflict resolution strategies

Strong classroom management abilities

Empathy, patience, and passion for working with special needs children

The benefits of working with Simply Education:

  • 24 hour access to Jess the SEN consultant with 6 years experience in the education
  • No or minimal timesheets
  • A range of specialist provisions in Northamptonshire and Warwickshire
  • FREE CPD Training including (SEND specific)

The successful candidate will be required to:

  • Subject to two years of satisfactory references
  • An Enhanced DBS check

Don't miss out on joining one of Northamptonshire's outstanding SEN team! Get in touch with Simply Education today to explore current vacancies in more details and take the next step. I look forward to helping you progress in your SEN career!

If you are interested in the role please contact Jess our experienced SEND consultant who can help you with more details on 01604 372 495 or email your CV to jessica@simplyeducation.co.uk

Together we can make a difference!

title: Surveyor
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION FOR:
DIOCESAN HOUSING SURVEYOR

Location: Coventry Diocesan Offices with travelling across Coventry and

Warwickshire, and occasionally nationally, as required.

Responsible to: Property Manager

Salary: £22,841.40 per annum for 21 hours per week (based on qualifications and experience) for a 0.6 post (£38,069.00 pro rata) plus 8.5% Employer

Pension Contributions, Life Assurance, Rewards & Recognition

Package, pro rata entitlement of 25 days annual leave, 8 days bank holiday, and 3 Diocesan Days at Christmas

Hours: Part-Time – 21 hours per week (3 days). As this is a new role within the Diocese, working hours and days to be agreed to meet the requirements of the role. Some evening and weekend work may be required.

Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Statement

In the Diocesan offices we are committed to work with determination towards a fuller representation of the social, cultural and ethnic diversity which accurately reflects the people we serve in the Diocese of Coventry. We expect all employees to promote and model equality, diversity and inclusion in their working practices and relationships and to uphold principles of equality of opportunity in accordance with our legal and theological obligations as written in

Galatians 3:28 which says, “There is neither Jew nor Gentile, neither slave nor free, nor is there male and female, for you are all one in Christ Jesus”.

If you have a disability or long-term illness that you feel prevents you from meeting any of the essential criteria, please contact us to discuss what reasonable adjustments we can make for you.

As an equal opportunities employer, we particularly welcome applications from United Kingdom

Minority Ethnic / Global Majority Heritage (UKME/GMH) candidates who are currently underrepresented in our organisation. All appointments will be made on merit of skill and experience relative to the role.

All employees undertake mandatory Equality, Diversity and Inclusion training during their employment with us.

Role Profile:

To work alongside the Diocesan Property Manager, and with the support of the Property Officer, to assist in the management of the Clergy Housing stock comprising some 160 houses across

Coventry and Warwickshire.

The Housing Surveyor role is primarily to inspect clergy housing, to specify programmes of work covering their maintenance, repair and refurbishment, appoint and manage contractors, and deliver works projects on time and within budget. Projects can range from £1,000 to £50,000 in value.

Page 1 of 5

To maintain our approved contractors’ database and ensure compliance with health and safety and industry best practice. To provide support to the Property Team when required.

To align with the aims and purposes of the Diocese of Coventry

Main Activities and Responsibilities:

  • Inspect Clergy houses and assess repairs and improvements necessary in compliance with Coventry Diocese Clergy Housing Standards.
  • Responsible for managing, coordinating (this includes promptly responding to queries and keeping all relevant parties updated) repairs and works on the properties, that form part of our portfolio of properties.
  • Implement the recommendations of the Quinquennial Inspections (including net zero improvement works).
  • Arrange Interregnum Inspections and implement the required works (including net zero improvement works) with the agreement of the Property Manager, liaise with the Diocese external surveyor when required.
  • Responsible for managing the implementation of the net zero project works including arranging and coordinating the net zero pilot works projects.
  • Assist with the management of the Glebe portfolio of properties and land.
  • Work with qualified contractors to manage and monitor trees within the demised properties grounds, arrange tree surveys and instruct the recommended works when required.
  • Responsible for reactive repairs and ensure PPM works are undertaken and completed in accordance with the Housing Standards.
  • Prepare schedules of work and cost budgets, agree these with the Property

Manager before tendering to approved contractors.

  • Responsible for managing and inspecting works on site to ensure works are delivered to a high standard, on time and within budget.
  • Responsible for providing prompt responses to queries from clergy, in relation to works and repairs.
  • Deal with adhoc repairs and works undertaken in connection with insurance claims, involving in-house or external consultants as required.
  • Forge good working relationships with Clergy, DBF staff and contractors.
  • To ensure the policy of Best Practice is adhered to at all times.
  • To ensure compliance with legal requirements.
  • To ensure that all work is carried out competently and in accordance with instructions.
  • Work closely with the other members of the Property Team to ensure continued high levels of service to the Clergy and provide cover during holidays etc.
  • When required assist with the property purchase or rental procurement process.
  • To effectively work the Property Management System; maintain databases and manual records relating to the various properties. Furthermore, assist with the implementation of the DBF new housing IT system.

Key Relationships:

Page 2 of 5

The post holder is line-managed by the Property Manager.

T he role involves relationships with a range of people:

  • Diocesan Secretary
  • Director of Operations
  • Archdeacons
  • Chair of the Board of Finance
  • Director of Finance
  • Property Team and Diocesan Surveyors
  • Clergy and Churchwardens
  • External Agents and Contractors

The post holder will be employed by the Coventry Diocesan Board of Finance Limited.

Training, Monitoring and Evaluation:

The post holder will participate in reviews of progress every 6 months and an annual review as a member of Diocesan Staff.

All employees are expected to undertake mandatory training including Equality & Diversity,

Unconscious Bias, GDPR, Internet Security, plus other training that is identified during the course of employment.

Page 3 of 5

Person Specification

This section details the attributes which are required in order to undertake the full remit of this post.

AF=Application Form; Int = Interview; Test=Written and Verbal Test

Attributes Essential Desirable Means of

Assessment

Qualifications

Degree Level or relevant experience commensurate to the role √ AF

Relevant Professional Qualification (MCIOB, MRICS) √ AF

Evidence for continuing professional development √ AF

Driving License with access to own car √ AF

Experience

Previous experience of managing small works contracts √ AF

Working knowledge of residential building defects and their resolution √ AF/I

Proven awareness of health and safety with regard to building management and works contracts √ AF/I

Being responsible for the day-to-day maintenance of properties whilst remaining within budgetary and time constraints √ AF/I

Experience of developing and delivering property planned maintenance and improvement programmes √ AF/I

Experience of commissioning and managing external agents and contractors. √ AF/I

Experience of using a modern Property Management software package √ AF/I

Skills/Abilities

Excellent organisational and administrative skills with the ability to work accurately and with attention to detail √ AF, I, T

Strong knowledge and understanding of health and safety legislation and procurement processes. √ AF, I

Proven record of IT skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook or Property

Management Systems √ AF, I, T

Have a proactive approach, being able to plan ahead anticipate any problems, and prepare for best- and worst-case scenarios √ AF, I

Able to secure, build and maintain good working relationships with all stakeholders, contacts, and colleagues √ AF, I

Ability to deal sensitively and appropriately with confidential information √ AF, I

A good working knowledge of the Church of England, it’s approaches and structures √ AF

Page 4 of 5

Personal Qualities

Professional, friendly, and approachable, including when under pressure √ AF, I

A positive and constructive attitude with a collaborative working style. Conscientious, diligent, hard-working, and flexible √ AF,I

Confident working in a team but also independently with minimal supervision √ AF, I

Results focused with the commitment to achieving goals within set time frames and within budget √ AF, I

Supportive of the mission and ministry of the Church of England and the Diocese of Coventry mission purpose statement √ AF

Be Supportive of and live out our values at work:

Community: To have a sense of togetherness and common purpose, with room for differences

Christ-like: To show humility and love for one another, to be √ AF/I welcoming and to have grace and patience

Integrity: To be genuine, authentic and honest, and value each other

Service: To recognise people’s needs, give without expectation and use our gifts for each other

“There is no Occupational requirement for the successful applicant to be a Christian. We welcome applications from all candidates regardless of faith or belief system”

If you have a disability or long-term illness that otherwise prevents you from meeting any of these criteria, please contact us to discuss what reasonable adjustments we can make for you.

It is a condition of any offer of employment we make to you that you have, or gain, permission to work in the

UK. By law, you will not be able to start working for us until you are able to provide evidence that this permission has been granted

Page 5 of 5

title: Marketing Executive
description:
Performance Marketing Executive | Salary: £25-£30,000 per year

Company Profile;

Dedicated to bridging the gap between brands and their customers by harnessing first-party data and helping to deliver stand-out brand experiences with the creation of beautifully functional websites, customer journeys, and marketing strategies to captivate and engage the audiences of some extremely interesting and leading brands in their specific industries.

From Strategy & insight, UX & Design, Development, E-commerce, and Digital Marketing you’d have a hand in managing the entire process of a brands digital asset creation from inception to completion.

The Role;

As Performance Marketing Executive you’ll be using data-driven strategies to reach the right audiences, at the right time, on the right channel. Working with the Head of Marketing Services to ensure clients find their new customers in the most effective way whilst meeting their business KPIs and responding to marketing insights.

Seamless relationship management with agency partners is a big part of the role, making sure that you reach the best outcomes possible, with the support of your colleagues. Reporting and insight are also essential to this position, therefore you’d need to be confident presenting your data-led solutions and then back the insights obtained from your campaigns, testing, and optimisation.

Key Channels we’d need you to be well versed on;

· Meta Suite of platforms

· Google Suite of platforms

· TikTok

· Pinterest

Skills Required;

· Hands-on experience creating digital marketing campaigns, with use of Facebook Ads Manager and Google ads.

· Budget management

· Open-minded to new developments and platforms

· Experience of analytic tools such as Google Analytics and Looker studio

· Proven experience working in line with KPIs, such as traffic, CPC, CPA, ROAS, and conversion rate.

· An analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and performance metrics and present results, liaising with other leads to consider solutions.

· A collaborative attitude and willingness to learn.

· Excellent planning and organisational skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritise across multiple projects.

· Able to meet tight deadlines, coordinate workload, and remain calm under pressure.

· Excellent communication skills both in writing and verbal. You should have the ability to take the complex and distil it to our clients in layman’s terms that they can follow.

Nice to Have’s:

· A solid understanding of SEO

· Experienced in optimising business panels

· Experience in the property industry

· Experience of working with Rightmove and Zoopla

· Experience of advertising on Reddit

· CRM / Email marketing

· Experience in using generative AI

Benefits, allowances, and additional Information;

· 25 Days Holiday per year plus bank holidays

· Annual Performance related bonus

· Planting trees and funding the world’s best climate crisis solutions to offset carbon emissions of team members.

· A Macbook.

· Option to work flexible hours – core hours are 10am-5pm.

· Herman Miller chairs (say goodbye to back pain).

· Whatever tools you need to do an amazing job for your clients.

· Huge opportunities to learn and develop through professional qualifications, as well as exposure to incredible projects, and informal lunch and learns hosted by your colleagues.

· Regular team events and Socials.

· Annual away day – A chance to celebrate the years successes with your colleagues.

· If you’re a cyclist, a safe place to store your bike.

**The office is also a short walk from a train station so is commutable via public transport.**

When applying for this role please state where you’re currently based, which locations you are happy to commute to, and upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV excluding imagery.

For more information search Initiate Resourcing on LinkedIn and Twitter or www.initiateresourcing.co.uk to see more of our latest jobs, industry news, tips, and more, alternatively please call one of our consultants on 07398 612341.

title: Scientist
description:
The Biomedical Science team at Maxxima are currently recruiting a Band 6-7 Biomedical Scientist in Haematology/Trranfusion to work in Nottingham. We are looking for a biomedical scientist who can make a real difference in supporting the laboratory's service.

Position: Biomedical Scientist
Banding: 6/7
Location: Nottingham
Hours: Full-time (9:00 to 17:30)
Duration: 3 months/ Ongoing

What will you be doing in this Biomedical Scientist role?
As a Biomedical Scientist in haematology and blood transfusion you will be expected to have an excellent experience in using analysers for full blood counts (FBC) and for coagulation. You will be experienced in maintaining and troubleshooting the analysers alongside your usual duty in loading and operation. The role will also require you to ensure that the correct blood type is received by the recipient.

The benefits of this position are:
  • Practical assistance with relocation, accommodation and DBS/CRB checks
  • Dedicated and experienced consultants who fully understand your specialist field
  • Dedicated payroll consultant to ensure prompt payment
  • Guidance and advice on CV and interview techniques
  • Practical assistance with professional body registration
  • A choice of PAYE, umbrella or LTD company payments
Essential Requirements for this Biomedical Scientist position:
  • HCPC registered
  • Microtomy experience
  • UK NHS or private sector Haematology laboratory experience
  • Experience in coagulation, Blood film morphology, blood grouping and antibody testing.
  • Previous experience using Sysmex, Beckman Coulter Dxh and/or BioRad IH-1000
We are unable to support or accept applications from candidates who are residents within the Red or Amber list of the Code of practice for the international recruitment of health and social care personnel in England, based on the World Health Organisation (WHO) Workforce Support and Safeguard List.


Why work with Maxxima?

Knowledgeable, dedicated and vastly experienced Biomedical Science Team with longstanding professional relationships with multiple client
Access to exclusive vacancies through our numerous Master Vendor trusts across the country
Vacancies outside of NHS Rate caps with our private sector agreements
Access to International roles outside of England and the United Kingdom
Collaboration on exclusive Laboratory projects with the wider Acacium Group as a whole

What are the next steps?

Should you wish to apply for this position please click on the “apply now” button to start the process.

We know you'll love working with us, and so would your friends. So why not introduce us and earn some extra money in the process?
The way it works is simple: if you introduce candidates who are not previously known to Maxxima and we are successful in placing them, we will pay you up to £1,500. More information regarding referrals can be found on our website.

About Maxxima
The minute you register with us we make it about one thing: you. The first time we talk you'll realise we know your speciality inside out.
Our expert recruitment consultants are here to find you the very best opportunities and help you every step of the way in securing the greatest placement. We hold preferred or sole supplier status with many clients which means you'll have access to a range of opportunities that can't be found anywhere else.

Maxxima is proud to be an equitable, diverse, and inclusive employer, if you require any reasonable adjustment or support during the recruitment process or within the workplace, please highlight this at the earliest opportunity by contacting our team. With this information, we will provide appropriate support to you throughout the process and into your work placement.

Please note that our job adverts are correct at the time of publication, but some details and job responsibilities are subject to change. This job advert may not be copied, imitated, or used, in whole or in part, by third-party websites, without prior written consent.

title: Residential Sales
description:
Overview:


Join the U.K’s largest independent property services group as a Sales Negotiator, where no two days are the same, and where you can deliver exceptional service to your clients.


Benefits of being a Sales Negotiator
  • £25000+ complete on-target earnings
  • £16,000 Basic Salary
  • Five months of supplementary payments to support you whilst you build your pipeline

  • A Company Car
  • Enrolment onto fully-funded training course that will earn a Level 2 Estate Agent Qualification

A day in the life of a Sales Negotiator
  • Liaising with prospective venders and buyers and arranging property viewings in line with their needs
  • Negotiating offers and agreeing sales
  • Developing and maintaining strong relationships with venders and buyers
  • Marketing properties to buyers utilizing various marketing skills
  • A focus on generating new and repeat business

  • Full UK Driving Licence for a manual vehicle
  • Works well with others to create a team spirit and an enjoyable working environment.
  • A reputation for delivering outstanding customer service
  • Ability to work under own initiative
  • Good telephone manner
  • Strong IT skills (Basic Microsoft Packages)

The Finer Details

We are currently conducting some interviews using video software. To be eligible to proceed in our recruitment process, you will need:

  • Full UK Driving Licence
  • Legal entitlement to live and work in the UK (in accordance with the Immigration Asylum and Nationality Act 2006)
  • We’ll need evidence of your right to work in the UK, in the form of:
    Passport/Birth Certificate

We will also need

  • Proof of Address
  • National Insurance
  • Drivers Licence Check

Armed Forces Covenant:
Spicerhaart is a forces-friendly company offering many Estate Agency roles to those considering leaving the forces.
If you are looking for an exciting career, where you feel part of something bigger, and where your excellent communication skills come into play every single day, then the world of property sales and lettings could be for you.

title: Residential Sales
description:
:


Join the U.K’s largest independent property services group as a Sales Negotiator, where no two days are the same, and where you can deliver exceptional service to your clients.


Benefits of being a Sales Negotiator
  • £25000+ complete on-target earnings
  • £16,000 Basic Salary
  • Five months of supplementary payments to support you whilst you build your pipeline

A day in the life of a Sales Negotiator

title: Scientist
description:
The Biomedical Science team at Maxxima are currently recruiting a Band 6-7 Biomedical Scientist in Haematology/Trranfusion to work in Coventry. We are looking for a biomedical scientist who can make a real difference in supporting the laboratory's service.

Position: Biomedical Scientist
Banding: 6/7
Location: Coventry
Hours: Full-time (9:00 to 17:30)
Duration: 3 months/ Ongoing

What will you be doing in this Biomedical Scientist role?
As a Biomedical Scientist in haematology and blood transfusion you will be expected to have an excellent experience in using analysers for full blood counts (FBC) and for coagulation. You will be experienced in maintaining and troubleshooting the analysers alongside your usual duty in loading and operation. The role will also require you to ensure that the correct blood type is received by the recipient.

The benefits of this position are:
  • Practical assistance with relocation, accommodation and DBS/CRB checks
  • Dedicated and experienced consultants who fully understand your specialist field
  • Dedicated payroll consultant to ensure prompt payment
  • Guidance and advice on CV and interview techniques
  • Practical assistance with professional body registration
  • A choice of PAYE, umbrella or LTD company payments
Essential Requirements for this Biomedical Scientist position:
  • HCPC registered
  • Microtomy experience
  • UK NHS or private sector Haematology laboratory experience
  • Experience in coagulation, Blood film morphology, blood grouping and antibody testing.
  • Previous experience using Sysmex, Beckman Coulter Dxh and/or BioRad IH-1000
We are unable to support or accept applications from candidates who are residents within the Red or Amber list of the Code of practice for the international recruitment of health and social care personnel in England, based on the World Health Organisation (WHO) Workforce Support and Safeguard List.


Why work with Maxxima?

Knowledgeable, dedicated and vastly experienced Biomedical Science Team with longstanding professional relationships with multiple client
Access to exclusive vacancies through our numerous Master Vendor trusts across the country
Vacancies outside of NHS Rate caps with our private sector agreements
Access to International roles outside of England and the United Kingdom
Collaboration on exclusive Laboratory projects with the wider Acacium Group as a whole

What are the next steps?

Should you wish to apply for this position please click on the “apply now” button to start the process.

We know you'll love working with us, and so would your friends. So why not introduce us and earn some extra money in the process?
The way it works is simple: if you introduce candidates who are not previously known to Maxxima and we are successful in placing them, we will pay you up to £1,500. More information regarding referrals can be found on our website.

About Maxxima
The minute you register with us we make it about one thing: you. The first time we talk you'll realise we know your speciality inside out.
Our expert recruitment consultants are here to find you the very best opportunities and help you every step of the way in securing the greatest placement. We hold preferred or sole supplier status with many clients which means you'll have access to a range of opportunities that can't be found anywhere else.

Maxxima is proud to be an equitable, diverse, and inclusive employer, if you require any reasonable adjustment or support during the recruitment process or within the workplace, please highlight this at the earliest opportunity by contacting our team. With this information, we will provide appropriate support to you throughout the process and into your work placement.

Please note that our job adverts are correct at the time of publication, but some details and job responsibilities are subject to change. This job advert may not be copied, imitated, or used, in whole or in part, by third-party websites, without prior written consent.

title: Teaching Assistant
description:
Teaching Assistant – ASD

Location: Desborough

Pay: £80 - £100 (Regular pay reviews)

TA Recruitment are looking for a Teaching Assistant to join a forward thinking school working in their special educational needs department with a children who have ASD (Autism). You will be working with a range of different ages. You will be supporting the children not only with their work, but also helping them develop both socially and emotionally. This role is full-time (8:30am-4pm) and it is the chance to help children who need extra support flourish in and out of school. The pay rate for this role is between £80 – £100 but with regular performance reviews to reward you for the good work you do.

What you will need to succeed:

You will be willing to get stuck in and have a desire to really make a difference to children’s lives. You don’t need experience (although it is preferable) just a great personality and a passion for working with children. If you have a background in; Youth Work, Care, Social Work, Army, Police and Creative Activities please apply!

About TA Recruitment:

TA Recruitment is an agency who truly goes above and beyond to make a difference. We make sure all our staff are rewarded for the good work they do because we truly want to help the next generation succeed. Work on behalf of TA Recruitment and you will be rewarded and be par of inspiring the next generation.

– Transparent pay rates and payslips

title: Administrator
description:
Excel Administrator
£24,000 / £12.73ph
Nottingham (hybrid)
Hours: 36.25 M-F 8-4 or 9-5

Harper Recruitment Group is working in partnership with a leading apparel company who are looking for an Excel Administrator to maximise on time delivery performance. This is a temporary contract for 3-6 months with the potential of a permanent contract for the right person.

What will the role involve?

  • Assessing order book allocation to ship orders on time and in full
  • Collaborating with the customer service team to overcome any challenges
  • Working closely with the planning & logistics team to track inbound freight
  • Manipulating data to allocate orders
  • Constantly analysing and reviewing order book movements
  • Highlighting any delays and opportunites
  • Checking all daily and allocation jobs are running on time
  • Monitor weekly and monthly on time delivery performance and order fulfilment rates

Who are we looking for?

  • Analytical experience
  • Pro-active team player
  • Experienced user of Excel – This role requires somebody who can manipulate large amounts of data quickly and accurately using formulas, V-lookups, Pivot tables etc. You will be required to complete an Excel test for this role and show workings out.

What’s in it for you?

  • Supportive and diverse company culture
  • Hybrid working – 2 days in the Nottingham office
  • Casual dress code
  • Development opportunity in a global company

Apply NOW to avoid disappointment! Due to the large volume of applications we receive, we are unfortunately unable to contact all candidates. If you have not heard from a Consultant within the next three days, please assume that you have not been successful on this occasion. Please do not hesitate to apply for other suitable roles in the future.

About Harper Recruitment Group:

Harper Recruitment Group has been offering high-quality recruitment services across Nottingham, Derby and the wider East Midlands since 1987, specialising in recruiting business support professionals of all levels on a permanent, contract or temporary basis.Looking for something different? Visit our website today for a list of live vacancies or to send an up-to-date CV.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary contract, Temp to perm
Contract length: 6 months

Salary: £12.73 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

Reference ID: 2322

title: Senior Recruitment Consultant
description:
A very well-established and successful multi-site Education Recruitment Agency is seeking a Senior Consultant to start as soon as possible.

Senior Consultants from any recruitment sector of interest. Must have experience in recruitment that is 360, doing Business Development and working with candidates and existing clients. Must have experience recruiting in the Education Sector.

The Role

  • The role will be based in Nottingham city center, near to good transport links.
  • Everyone is responsible for new BD, but they are very well established with a very strong client network; there will be lots of live roles and established relationships.
  • You can start billing on day 1. There is no candidate ownership, so there are tonnes of good candidates, live roles, etc, to work on so you can start earning commission straight away.
  • When you are ready to manage, there is leadership training direct from the CEO and regular Senior leadership meetings and training sessions to develop leadership and management skills.

The Ideal Candidate

  • You will have a contract or temp agency recruitment background. You could have come from a range of recruitment agency backgrounds, such as teaching, Industrial, office support, general staffing or more specialist markets.
  • You don’t need an Education Recruitment background necessarily.
  • You need to be high achieving with good billings, progression, and tenure and have been promoted previously.
  • Have gravitas, and be engaging and motivational, high energy and approachable.

Package

  • £25K to £33K
  • 7:30 am to 4:30 pm with potential for reduced hours in school holidays
  • Commission on own billings with no threshold and no cap
  • Benefits/ Perks
  • Flexible work-from-home policy (days you can take at any time in a year)
  • Extra annual leave (1x Birthday day off, charity days off, 1x activity day a year, 1x duvet day)
  • Health Insurance
  • Gym Discount
  • Employee assistance programme
  • Great commission and no threshold
  • internal and external training and mentoring for career progression.
  • Plus many more

The company is very strong on inclusivity and diversity; they have seminars on it every three weeks. They celebrate black history month and Pride Month; they have seminars on hidden disabilities, men's mental health, etc. This is really important to them as a business. They also have a very strong focus on charity events, fundraising, and community.

Please apply now for more details.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £26,000.00-£33,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's (preferred)

Experience:

  • Recruiting: 2 years (required)

Ability to Commute:

  • Nottingham City Centre, Nottinghamshire (required)

Work Location: In person

title: Human Resources Advisor
description:
JOB TITLE: HR Advisor
LOCATION: Nuneaton
SALARY: £32,000 - £35,000

The COMPANY
Our client is a very well-established nationwide provider of business-critical services to thousands of SME organisations all over the UK for over 75 years. Our client is one of the UK's leading businesses in their field with 130,000 clients worldwide and have one of the best trained and rewarded staff in the industry. They are currently looking for an HR Advisor to join their team.

The ROLE
The successful HR Advisor will be required to do the following:

  • You will be advising across a multi-sector client base on a multitude of different cases from disciplinary and grievances, to the right the way to complex redundancies.
  • Support clients with legally compliant advice and a personal touch.
  • Take ownership and responsibility of cases to resolution.
  • Building rapport and relationships with clients on each interaction.
  • Record your advice accurately against the appropriate cases on the relevant databases.
  • Support clients in drafting 'ad-hoc' letters where appropriate.
  • Advise in line with the client's documentation taking into consideration their terms and conditions.
  • Attend legal briefings and internal company training to ensure that the advice provided is compliant with our services.
  • You are given a thorough 6 week training course.

CANDIDATE
Our client is looking for a strong HR Advisor with the following experience and attributes:
  • Previous HR experience.
  • Or previous people management experience (you may be from a management background with experience of some HR issues).
  • Proactive and creative problem solver, always thinking outside of the box.
  • A willingness to learn and the ability to communicate effectively within the team.
  • Ability to remain professional in a fast-paced environment.
  • Always maintain a professional and responsible attitude.
  • Broad knowledge of employment law, HRM and ACAS best practice.
  • Excellent communication and writing skills. MS Office knowledge and experience.

This role is commutable from:

Hinckley
Atherstone
Nuneaton
Coventry
Bedworth
Tamworth

ALTERNATIVE JOB TITLES: HR Advisor, HR Partner, HR Administrator, HR Consultant, Human Resources Advisor, Manager, Retail Manager, Operations Manager, Sales Manager, HR Delivery Manager, HR Support
INCAL1

Mana Resourcing is a specialist recruitment company working within the Engineering, Sales, IT and Commercial sectors. We are established to service and support the recruitment requirements of modern businesses and candidates alike. This particular role includes people with experience in HR Advisor, HR Partner, HR Administrator, HR Consultant, Human Resources Advisor, Manager, Retail Manager, Operations Manager, Sales Manager, HR Delivery Manager, HR Support.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
JOB TITLE: Customer Service Advisor
LOCATION: Bedworth
SALARY: £23,000

The COMPANY
Our client is a very well-established nationwide provider of business-critical services to thousands of SME organisations all over the UK for over 75 years. Our client is one of the UK's leading businesses in their field with 130,000 clients worldwide and have one of the best trained and rewarded staff in the industry. They are currently looking for a Client Engagement Specialist to join their team.

The ROLE
The successful Customer Service Specialist will be required to do the following:

  • Contact clients who have queries, service issuses or have requested to cancel the service.
  • You will be the first point of contact for any issues or concerns raised.
  • To be the key person for receiving member complaints and retention opportunities
  • To be the key person for responding to all online reviews for the business
  • To ensure that all member service issues are resolved in a timely manner and at all times focused on member resolution and retention
  • To liaise with the Business Development Manager regarding clarification of the members contracted service provision
  • To contact members to activate their account and book the initial appointments with consultations in line with service levels and diary booking guidelines.
  • Salary rise every 6 months as long as KPIs are hit.

CANDIDATE
Our client is looking for a strong customer service canddiate with the following experience and attributes:
  • Previous customer service experience.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • Strong time management skills
  • A dynamic and flexible approach, as well as the ability to work under pressure.
  • To have the ability to work independently.
  • To be a very good listener.
  • Excellent communication and writing skills. MS Office knowledge and experience.

This role is commutable from:

Hinckley
Atherstone
Nuneaton
Coventry
Bedworth
Tamworth

ALTERNATIVE JOB TITLES: Customer Service, Client Engagement Specialist, customer service consultant, Customer Complaints Officer, Complaints Advisor, Customer Support, Customer Service Representative, Customer Service Advisor.
INCAL1

Mana Resourcing is a specialist recruitment company working within the Engineering, Sales, IT and Commercial sectors. We are established to service and support the recruitment requirements of modern businesses and candidates alike. This particular role includes people with experience in Customer Service, Client Engagement Specialist, customer service consultant, Customer Complaints Officer, Complaints Advisor, Customer Support, Customer Service Representative, Customer Service Advisor.

title: Teaching Assistant
description:
SEND – Teaching Assistant

Location: Kettering

Pay: £85-£95 a day (Regular pay reviews)

TA Recruitment are looking for a SEND Teaching Assistant to work in a school with children who require additional support with their: School Work, Behaviour, Social and Emotional Health and Independence/Life Skills. We are working with a school who require someone to come in and support children to allow them to flourish and inspire them. This role will require working with SEND such as Autism, ADHD and SEMH. This role is full-time (8:30am-4pm) and you will be part of inspiring the next generation. The pay rate for this role is between £85 - £95 but with regular performance reviews to reward you for the good work you do. This role is starting as soon as possible.

What you will need to succeed:

You will be willing to get stuck in and have a desire to really make a difference to children’s lives. You don’t need experience in a school (although it is preferable), just a great personality, experience with additional needs and a passion for working with children. We are looking for people who want to inspire and support children every day. If you have a background in; Youth Work, Care, Social Work, Army, Police and Creative Activities please apply!

About TA Recruitment:

TA Recruitment is an agency who truly goes above and beyond to make a difference. We make sure all our staff are rewarded for the good work they do because we truly want to help the next generation succeed. Work on behalf of TA Recruitment and you will be rewarded and become part of inspiring the next generation.

Benefits:

- Easy Registration Process

- FREE CPD training courses

- We listen to you and what you want from your next role

- Dedicated consultant who is there to support you

- Transparent pay rates and payslips

- On call GP available 24/7

Once you apply for this job your journey to your next rewarding role will begin. The process is quick and efficient, and you will be out working in a school in no time. Part of the process will require you to go through several compliance checks and you will require an Enhanced DBS. If you do not have one you can apply through TA Recruitment.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £85.00-£95.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Employee discount
  • Free parking
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

  • Kettering (required)

Work Location: In person

The COMPANY
Our client is a forward thinking national company who have an enviable position in the marketplace. They are looking for graduates to train and contribute a vital function in their business arm.

The ROLE

title: Assistant Manager
description:
Assistant Manager

Hours: 40 hours over 5 days, working any 5 out of 7 days including bank holidays and weekends.

Salary: Basic salary up to £26,000 per annum with the opportunity to earn commission and rewards.

The Company:

Established in 2018, here at Austen & Blake, we create made-to-order diamond jewellery with the support of talented craftspeople, bringing more than 200 years of experience to the realisation of our customers’ dreams. Be it a stunning ring, an elegant necklace or beautiful earrings, Austen & Blake craftspeople help people translate feelings into jewellery every day.

About this role:

We are seeking an experienced and dedicated Assistant Manager to join our successful team in Nottingham. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in maintaining our brand's reputation for excellence and luxury while assisting the Store Manager in overseeing daily operations and driving sales.

Join us and be a part of our pursuit striving for excellence and work together with an exceptional team dedicated to delivering unparalleled beauty, craftsmanship, and joy to our loyal customers.

How you’ll contribute:

Leadership and Team Support:

  • Assist the Store Manager in leading and mentoring the sales team to achieve and exceed sales targets.
  • Collaborate with team members to create a positive and motivating work environment.

Client Engagement and Consultation:

  • Greet clients with warmth and professionalism, building genuine relationships by actively listening to their needs and preferences.
  • Provide guidance to the sales team on effective client engagement and consultative sales techniques whilst following, implementing and coaching each stage of the Sales Journey.

Product Knowledge:

  • Develop a comprehensive understanding of our jewellery, including materials, design details, and craftsmanship.
  • Train and educate sales consultants to enhance their product knowledge.

Sales Performance:

  • Collaborate with the Store Manager to set and execute sales strategies, ensuring individual and team sales targets are met.
  • Encourage a consultative and customer-centric approach to sales.

Customer Experience:

  • Maintain exceptional customer service standards, resolving inquiries, concerns, and ensuring clients feel valued.
  • Assist in handling client escalations when necessary.

Brand Ambassadorship:

  • Uphold and promote our brand's essence by maintaining a polished appearance and a genuine passion for luxury jewellery.

Qualifications, Skills & Experience:

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in luxury retail, preferably in the jewellery sector, with a proven track record of achieving and surpassing sales targets.
  • Experience liaising with high-end clientele is advantageous.
  • Confident communication skills and a proactive team player.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and adaptability to changing role requirements.
  • Proficiency in new software and ability to quickly learn new systems.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, including exceptional listening, communication, and relationship-building abilities.
  • A passion for luxury products and a keen sense of style.
  • Strong attention to detail and an eye for aesthetics.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while maintaining a high level of professionalism.
  • A proactive and results-driven attitude, combined with a genuine desire to exceed customer expectations.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Commission
  • 20 days holiday plus 8 days bank holiday pro rata
  • Private Healthcare
  • Access to 24hr Employee Assistance Programme
  • Company discount

Neve Jewels Group is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing a work environment that supports, inspires, and respects all individuals. We do not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, colour, religion, age, disability, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements which cannot be shown.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £23,000.00-£26,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Employee discount
  • Private medical insurance
  • Referral programme

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Weekend availability

Supplemental pay types:

  • Commission pay

Experience:

  • Jewellery: 2 years (required)
  • Management: 2 years (required)

Work Location: In person

title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Recruitment Consultants

Coventry

£28,000 to £35,000 DOE & Commission

Due to rapid growth the Recruitment Bunker have exciting new opportunities for highly driven, successful individuals that want to further build and develop a professional recruitment services hub, helping build the Recruitment Bunker brand.

This role comes with exciting opportunities to not only exclusively support the McDermott, DRVN and BNKR Groups of businesses but to also support the expansion of the external RB division and grow your own recruitment desk should you desire.

Overview of the Role:

  • Recruitment Consultants
  • Salary – £28,000 to £35,000 DOE & Commission
  • Holidays: 25 days plus 8 Bank Holidays (including statutory holidays)
  • Pension Scheme
  • Coventry - Free on-site parking

Company Overview

The Recruitment Bunker is a recruitment agency powered by building excellent relationships with clients and candidates. With a specialism in the luxury automotive industry, we also cover many other sectors and disciplines within Manufacturing, Construction, Social Housing and Retail across the permanent arenas, and focus on delivering best-in-sector services in the employment market.

The Recruitment Bunker sources highly skilled individuals who can be placed in the perfect role, to fulfil your business recruitment needs. Blending our relationship-first approach with years of placing the perfect applicants in outstanding roles, each member of our team also specialises in industry-specific knowledge that gets people into jobs.

Responsibilities

  • Technical recruitment, across Engineering, Manufacturing, Construction, Public Sector and Retail sectors, with the ability to recruit for various other roles in different industries where required
  • Recruitment lifecycle: ensuring all activity is carried out professionally and in line with legislation, carrying out relevant employment checks i.e. right to work checks, Driving Licence Checks, Valid Disclosures etc
  • Ensure all candidates have the right qualifications for the role
  • Understanding the different business capabilities
  • Identify market trends, carry out benchmarking activities and summarise for management reporting
  • The development of both existing business and generating new business wins
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and candidates to ensure they receive the best possible service
  • Responsible for internal/external permanent recruitment services across several businesses, clearly establishing the requirements e.g. job description, hours of work, rates of pay etc
  • Write and advertise professional and effective job advertisements to attract candidates
  • Source, and identify suitable candidates for current and prospective business, building a strong database of candidates to place into businesses
  • Headhunting ‘A grade’ candidates through various platforms
  • Represent the business at networking and recruitment events
  • Use marketing tools to generate business and source candidates via LinkedIn, Job Boards, social media
  • Confidence in learning an in-house CRM system (Vincere) to manage the recruitment process
  • Working closely with the Commercial director and HR function, planning, and implementing strong recruitment initiatives
  • To liaise with customers to arrange interviews, debrief candidates, and once candidate is successfully placed, hand over the offer process to the HR function for internal recruitment and correct contact contact for external recruitment
  • Working alongside the company’s marketing partner to develop the Professional Services brand

Essential Skills

  • Experienced technical recruiter, with proven ability of working within a fast-paced environment,
  • Understanding of Technical, Engineering, Manufacturing roles, with the ability and confidence to recruit for various other roles where required
  • Account management knowledge
  • Confidence in using CRM systems (Vincere)
  • Knowledge and understanding of recruitment databases, use of job boards, LinkedIn Recruiter, and others
  • Previous experience of working within a recruitment agency setting or internal recruitment capacity, successfully placing candidates
  • Proficient in Microsoft word, PowerPoint, and Excel
  • Proven ability to win work
  • Analytical skills and ability to produce reports
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal and negotiation skills to maximise profit
  • Ability to prioritise heavy workloads
  • Adaptable and resilient
  • Able to work using own initiative, but passionate and keen to grow and potentially manage a team
  • Driven and willing to go the extra mile to provide an excellent quality service to stakeholders
  • Flexible, hardworking and target driven
  • Honesty, trustworthy and professional
  • Hold a clean UK driving licence and willing to travel for business purposes where required
  • Must have IDLR/Full Rights to Work in UK - Sponsorship or Work Permits will not be accepted/ provided.

Please note we do not provide sponsorships to those who require it and will only accept applications from those who have full rights to work in the UK with no restrictions and IDLR/Full Settlement status. Please provide status on applications.

Our inclusive workplace welcomes and values all candidates from all backgrounds, we believe that diversity enhances our ability to innovate and serve our customers effectively. We are an equal opportunity employer and strive to create an environment where everyone feels respected, supported, and able to bring their authentic selves to work. If you require any reasonable adjustments to participate in the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will do our best to accommodate your needs.

title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Recruitment Consultant

Temp desk

Why This Role? – Recruitment Consultant:

· Market leading highly reputed recruitment brand.

· First class automation / IT systems / great back-office support.

· A very consultative environment- quite simply grown-up recruitment.

· Salary to £35k + open ended bonus scheme huge OTE potential.

· Progression / career development clearly mapped out.

· A great team environment – a business with clear values and goals.

· The tools to do the job, great brand, first class Infrastructure and support.

· A genuine market leader in what they do.

Role and responsibilities – Recruitment Consultant:

· Temp / Contract Billing role will consider candidates from all recruitment sectors.

· Client management, development, candidate attraction, Account management.

· The automation allows a real focus on the whole recruitment process.

· Team support / liaison.

· Delivery against targets / self-managed.

· Encouragement to undertake training and further personal development.

The Benefits – Recruitment Consultant:

· Genuine base salary to £35k – may pay more DOE.

· Open ended bonus scheme.

· Generous holiday package.

· Great reward schemes.

· Quality support around you, team, and management.

· A great place to work.

The Essentials – Recruitment Consultant:

· Recruitment experience a must – Temp, Contract, Interim desk.

· Ability to prioritise and manage multiple accounts, candidate campaigns.

· Credibility at senior level.

· Driven by quality and results.

· Consultative and analytical in approach.

· An experienced recruiter looking for a next step on the career ladder.

What to expect from The Job Office Ltd?

· A clear recruitment process, not elongated by procedure.

· Interviews with decision makers.

· A prompt turnaround from application to interviews.

· Immediate feedback and progress for suitable candidates.

· Honesty and transparency at all times.

· Confidentiality.

The Job Office Ltd is recruiting on behalf of the client, please view our privacy policy on our website to understand how we will use and manage your data if you apply for this role.

Required skills:

  • Recruitment experience in an agency setting a must.
  • B2B sales experience in a recruitment setting a must.
  • Recruitment Process / sales
  • Contract or perm desk Staffing experience
  • Resilience
  • A proven Relationship builder
  • Articulate
  • Tenacious
  • Professional Work Ethic
  • Recruitment consultant

Unfortunately, we are unable to contact all applicant’s due to the vast number of applications that we receive, therefore if you have not heard from us within 1 week of your application then please assume you have not been shortlisted for interview.

The Job Office Ltd is acting as an employment business / employment agency regarding this position. The Job Office Ltd is an employment agency practicing within Recruitment to Recruitment. We offer a confidential service to both client and candidate. We positively welcome applications from suitably qualified candidates, no matter what their age, race, gender, or lifestyle and those who have the right to live and work in the UK.

We are always interested in hearing from experienced recruiters such as : Recruitment Consultant / Resourcer / Executive Search and Selection/ Business Development Manager / Recruiter /Account Manager / Managing Consultant / Senior Consultant / New Business Manager / Service Delivery Consultant / Recruiter / Recruitment Manager / Business Development Executive /Senior Recruitment Consultant/Senior Recruiter / Recruitment manager/ Branch Manager/ Team Leader/ Recruitment Branch Manager/ regional manager recruitment / Area Manager Recruitment / Divisional Manager/ Perm consultant/Recruitment professional

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £30,000.00-£35,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme

Experience:

  • Recruitment in an agency setting: 1 year (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Administrator
description:
Express Recruitment are proud to advertise for a local charitable organisation who put their clients at the heart of what they do. We are proud to be supporting our client with the recruitment of their newest Hub Support Administrator, to act as an office-based emotional support person for survivors of sexual abuse. The successful candidate will be a passionate individual with a range of telephone and administration skills, combined with knowledge of supporting vulnerable survivors of abuse.

Due to the nature of the role, candidates will need to be willing for us to process an Enhanced DBS on your behalf.

This is a part-time role with the following working patterns, and hybrid working options are available:

  • Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday, 9:00am-5:00pm
  • Wednesday, 11.30am – 7.30pm
  • Saturday Mornings, 1 in every 5

Although this role starts off on a Temporary basis, our client does offer a generous benefits package for those who become permanent employees of their organisation, which is inclusive of; extra leave for occasions such as birthdays, weekly emotional support meetings/EAP, ongoing training and development, and more.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Update multiple bespoke databases with sensitive client information
  • Signpost service users from a waiting list to external third-party organizations
  • Liaise with police, health and social services via telephone and email
  • Co-ordinate a high volume of appointments between clients and counsellors
  • Complete risk assessments and process referrals

Skills & Experience

  • Previous experience working directly with victims of abuse
  • Strong administrative skills, demonstrated through previous experiences
  • Ability to use IT systems
  • Strong data management skills
  • Empathetic and patient attitude essential
  • Great organisational skills, to manage a varied workload

About Express Recruitment

Express Recruitment has been offering exceptional recruitment solutions across the East Midlands since 1987, “exceeding expectations every time” of over 267,000 candidates.

We supply a diverse range of sectors including Engineering, Technology, Professional Services, Languages, Sales & Marketing, Call Centres, Commercial, Manufacturing, Local Authority, NHS, Education and Voluntary organisations.
