title: Project Engineer
description:
Career Opportunity: MEICA Project Engineer

Here at Jackson, we are dynamic, innovative and focused, supported by an inclusive and fun company culture. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity, and the quality we deliver. As a result, our people get to enjoy working on some of the most exciting and varied projects. We want our people to succeed both in work and life and to support this we promote a healthy, productive, and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.

We are recruiting a MEICA Project Engineer to strengthen the existing team given a predicted increase in MEICA work related projects. This role would be to support the current MEICA Co-ordinator increasing the resilience of the MEICA Team. This role will predominantly be office based in Tamworth or Huntingdon, but expected to visit sites, client and consultant’s offices, requiring some overnight stays, to help develop robust scopes and solutions for MEICA projects.

Main Duties:

· Development of works scope and sequencing considerations, supporting the development of scheme costs to establish project deliverables for client’s approval and subsequent delivery by Jackson’s operational delivery teams.

· Involved in scoping and delivering Asset investigation / survey works and reporting, to establish the scope of works that maybe required, working closely with our supply chain the client and consultants as well as the procurement and management of those services on the ground.

· Produce regular reports on the status of the projects and attend key project, design, and construction team meetings across the projects.

· Collaborate with other Jackson’s key functions, client, designers, community, stakeholders, and public relations managers to ensure the portfolio projects are achieved.

· Assist JCE quantity surveyors in tender bids for the MEICA element of tender bids.

Must haves:

· Someone who holds professional membership with minimum status of Incorporated Engineer qualified as either a Mechanical Engineer or Electrical Engineer with a comprehensive understanding of the other discipline, with preferable experience of pumping stations, river & tidal control structures (with electrical or hydraulic actuation), level monitoring instrumentation (Ultrasonic, radar or pressure transducers) and control systems using PLC and HMI control.

· Experience of attending FAT’s and SAT’s for MEICA projects

· Hold a Full UK Driving Licence.

· Good understanding of the latest CDM regulations to be able to carry out the role of Design Coordinator on MEICA projects.

· Understand BIM to be able to help in the closing of MEICA related projects.

· Experience in dealing with Statutory Bodies, Clients, specialists, subcontractors, supply chain etc.

· Good knowledge of MEICA Assets and the associated construction / project management considerations, through experience, training, and education. Willing to undertake further training.

· Experience of promoting good practices relating to sustainability, carbon reduction’ sharing best practice and learning.

· Good interpersonal skills to develop and maintain good relationships and networks.

Excellent benefits package and personal development opportunities:

We don’t just offer a great place to work with a supportive, family atmosphere. We also offer:

· Life assurance cover (4x annual salary)

· Company car or car allowance

· Company pension scheme (we match up to 6%)

· 25 days holiday plus bank holidays (with an option of buying more holiday)

· Extensive training programmes

· Cycle-to-work scheme

· Employee Assistance Programme

· Employee benefits platform

· Free on-site parking

· Company social calendar

· Regular fun days and a broad range of charity events

· A supportive business that genuinely wants to help you progress in your career.

· “The Great Escape” – this is an early finish on a Friday

Candidates must be eligible to live and work in the UK

We are committed to equality of opportunity for all staff and applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.We also place high importance on our inclusive recruitment policy and will do our very best to support those applicants who may need adjustments in order to take part in the recruitment process. Please do let us know if you require any additional assistance or adjustments. Due to the high volume of applications, we receive it is not always possible to respond to unsuccessful applicants. Therefore, if we have not responded to your application within two weeks, please note that on this occasion your application has not been successful.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company car
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Referral programme
  • Sick pay
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Do you hold a professional membership with minimum status of Incorporated Engineer qualified as either a Mechanical Engineer or Electrical Engineer with a comprehensive understanding of the other discipline

Licence/Certification:

  • full UK Driving Licence (required)

Work Location: In person

Reference ID: JCECDTMPE

title: Residential Sales
description:
Overview:


Join the U.K’s largest independent property services group as a Sales Negotiator, where no two days are the same, and where you can deliver exceptional service to your clients.


Benefits of being a Sales Negotiator
  • £25000+ complete on-target earnings
  • £16,000 Basic Salary
  • Five months of supplementary payments to support you whilst you build your pipeline
  • Uncapped commission scheme
  • A Company Car
  • Enrolment onto fully-funded training course that will earn a Level 2 Estate Agent Qualification
  • Career progression opportunities
  • Employee Assistance Programme, for all colleagues
    • Our new company-wide Elevate incentive program


A day in the life of a Sales Negotiator
  • Liaising with prospective venders and buyers and arranging property viewings in line with their needs
  • Negotiating offers and agreeing sales
  • Developing and maintaining strong relationships with venders and buyers
  • Marketing properties to buyers utilizing various marketing skills
  • A focus on generating new and repeat business
  • Canvassing the local area
  • Door knocking and leaflet dropping
  • Ensuring properties adhere to health and safety standards

Essential Skills of a Sales Negotiator
  • Full UK Driving Licence for a manual vehicle
  • Works well with others to create a team spirit and an enjoyable working environment.
  • A reputation for delivering outstanding customer service
  • Ability to work under own initiative
  • Good telephone manner
  • Strong IT skills (Basic Microsoft Packages)
    • Attention to detail


The Finer Details

We are currently conducting some interviews using video software. To be eligible to proceed in our recruitment process, you will need:

  • Full UK Driving Licence
  • Legal entitlement to live and work in the UK (in accordance with the Immigration Asylum and Nationality Act 2006)
  • We’ll need evidence of your right to work in the UK, in the form of:
    Passport/Birth Certificate

We will also need

  • Proof of Address
  • National Insurance
  • Drivers Licence Check

Armed Forces Covenant:
Spicerhaart is a forces-friendly company offering many Estate Agency roles to those considering leaving the forces.
If you are looking for an exciting career, where you feel part of something bigger, and where your excellent communication skills come into play every single day, then the world of property sales and lettings could be for you.
https://www.haart.co.uk/about-us/armed-forces-covenant/

Equal Opportunities: At Spicerhaart, variety makes our Company DNA come to life. We love people, and what's more, we love the differences that make each person who they are, we support you and encourage those differences, to make you the best person you can be. Spicerhaart are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and we welcome all talented individuals to apply for a career with us. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let our Talent Team know and we will be happy to assist to the best of our ability – regardless of how small or large your requirement may be.

To All Recruitment Agencies: Spicerhaart does not accept speculative agency CVs. Please do not forward CVs to the Talent Team, Spicerhaart employees or any other company location. Spicerhaart is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs received from external recruitment sources through our Preferred Suppliers List or otherwise.

Privacy Policy: We process any information you provide in accordance with our Privacy Policy which is available on the Spicerhaart website: https://www.spicerhaart.co.uk/about-us/our-people/staff-privacy-policy/

title: Residential Sales
description:
Overview:


Join the U.K’s largest independent property services group as a Sales Negotiator, where no two days are the same, and where you can deliver exceptional service to your clients.


Benefits of being a Sales Negotiator
  • £25000+ complete on-target earnings
  • £16,000 Basic Salary
  • Five months of supplementary payments to support you whilst you build your pipeline
  • Uncapped commission scheme
  • A Company Car
  • Enrolment onto fully-funded training course that will earn a Level 2 Estate Agent Qualification
  • Career progression opportunities
  • Employee Assistance Programme, for all colleagues
    • Our new company-wide Elevate incentive program


A day in the life of a Sales Negotiator
  • Liaising with prospective venders and buyers and arranging property viewings in line with their needs
  • Negotiating offers and agreeing sales
  • Developing and maintaining strong relationships with venders and buyers
  • Marketing properties to buyers utilizing various marketing skills
  • A focus on generating new and repeat business
  • Canvassing the local area
  • Door knocking and leaflet dropping
  • Ensuring properties adhere to health and safety standards

Essential Skills of a Sales Negotiator
  • Full UK Driving Licence for a manual vehicle
  • Works well with others to create a team spirit and an enjoyable working environment.
  • A reputation for delivering outstanding customer service
  • Ability to work under own initiative
  • Good telephone manner
  • Strong IT skills (Basic Microsoft Packages)
    • Attention to detail


The Finer Details

We are currently conducting some interviews using video software. To be eligible to proceed in our recruitment process, you will need:

  • Full UK Driving Licence
  • Legal entitlement to live and work in the UK (in accordance with the Immigration Asylum and Nationality Act 2006)
  • We’ll need evidence of your right to work in the UK, in the form of:
    Passport/Birth Certificate

We will also need

  • Proof of Address
  • National Insurance
  • Drivers Licence Check

Armed Forces Covenant:
Spicerhaart is a forces-friendly company offering many Estate Agency roles to those considering leaving the forces.
If you are looking for an exciting career, where you feel part of something bigger, and where your excellent communication skills come into play every single day, then the world of property sales and lettings could be for you.
https://www.haart.co.uk/about-us/armed-forces-covenant/

Equal Opportunities: At Spicerhaart, variety makes our Company DNA come to life. We love people, and what's more, we love the differences that make each person who they are, we support you and encourage those differences, to make you the best person you can be. Spicerhaart are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and we welcome all talented individuals to apply for a career with us. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let our Talent Team know and we will be happy to assist to the best of our ability – regardless of how small or large your requirement may be.

To All Recruitment Agencies: Spicerhaart does not accept speculative agency CVs. Please do not forward CVs to the Talent Team, Spicerhaart employees or any other company location. Spicerhaart is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs received from external recruitment sources through our Preferred Suppliers List or otherwise.

Privacy Policy: We process any information you provide in accordance with our Privacy Policy which is available on the Spicerhaart website: https://www.spicerhaart.co.uk/about-us/our-people/staff-privacy-policy/

title: Geotechnical Engineer
description:
RSK Geosciences an RSK Group company are recruiting for a Geotechnical Engineer to join the team based in Derby, UK. This is a full-time, permanent position.

The Geosciences team delivers consultancy and design services to a wide range of external clients including engineers, house-builders, oil companies and local authorities. RSK is committed to ED&I and prides itself on offering staff a rewarding and challenging career, encouraging Continuous Professional Development and allowing them to reach their full potential.

Responsibilities:

  • Completing and managing geotechnical projects from cradle to grave including desk studies and ground investigation phases, through to the production of interpretive reports, planning & design advice, detailed design and specification, works supervision and verification.
  • Design, supervision and management of ground investigation and construction works.
  • Earthworks materials assessment, design, specification, supervision and verification.
  • Technical review of desk study, ground investigation reports and associated documents and/or geotechnical design reports (PSSR,GIR/GDR/GFR), basement impact assessments, earthworks specifications etc.

Qualifications and Experience:

  • BSc / Beng degree level qualified in Geology, Engineering Geology, Geotechnics or Civil Engineering
  • MSc in Engineering Geology/Geotechnical Engineering or related subjects preferable but not essential
  • Experience of supervising intrusive site investigations desirable however training can be given
  • Knowledge of SHEQ issues affecting site works
  • Candidates must be willing to spend a significant amount of their working day out on site and away from home
  • Full UK driving licence

Salary and Benefits:

  • Commensurate with experience
  • Contributory Pension Scheme
  • Free life assurance cover
  • A flexible benefits programme including the option to buy additional holidays, private health care, ride to work, electric car leasing, flexitime, hybrid working, favourable gym membership discounts and other benefits.
  • We encourage Continuing Professional Development and, as a Registered Practice with the Geological Society or Institute of Civil Engineers, we are committed to supporting candidates along the pathway to Chartership.

#Engineering #recruitment #RSKfamily

Full Job Description attached

RSK will not accept unsolicited CVs from agencies other than RSK PSL or Secondary agencies.


We are a market-leading site investigation, contaminated land and geotechnical consultancy with geophysics and survey teams and waste management consultants, operating from 20 UK locations. Our company also includes Leap Environmental, an award-winning site investigation, geotechnical design and geoenvironmental consultancy and Carbon Zero Consulting, which undertakes appraisals for ground source heat projects.

Throughout our 30 years of operations, we have enabled our clients to realise opportunities and manage the potential liabilities associated with acquiring, owning, operating and developing land. Our clients come from the public and private sectors, including many of the UK’s leading property developers, major and local house builders, utility providers and main contractors, local authorities and other government organisations.

RSK Geosciences is part of the RSK Group, a leading integrated environmental, engineering and technical services business providing dynamic, multidisciplinary services to broad-ranging sectors. Founded in 1989, RSK has evolved into a market-leading organisation. It is headquartered in the UK and has an established presence across Europe, the Middle East, Asia, Africa and Australasia. The group is growing fast thanks to its diverse operations, entrepreneurial spirit and open management style. When you join RSK, you are connecting to a growing community of experts and specialists who regularly collaborate to deliver projects and support each other across business units.

title: Physiotherapist
description:
CLINICAL & MEDICAL

Senior Physiotherapist (Bank Role)

Physiotherapist (Hospital)
Leicester Nuffield Health Hospital
Up to £20 depending on experience

Bank Role
Weekend cover as part of our 7 day service

We offer flexible working, freedom to focus on patients, and everything you need to take your career further. With senior mentoring, academy training – and our partnership with the Manchester Metropolitan University partnership – you could progress to a clinical role or managerial position.

As a Bank Physiotherapist at our Leicester Nuffield Health hospital, you’ll have a BSc in Physiotherapy or equivalent and registration with the Health and Care Professions Council. You will work on the weekend rota provide physiotherapy to elective Orthopaedic patients. You’re a confident communicator, skilled at engaging with all kinds of people.

As a Physiotherapist, you will:

  • Work across Inpatients and a range of post-operative cases
  • Be part of our multidisciplinary team of nurses, AHPs and consultants, supported by a regional Clinical Lead
  • Help our patients achieve, maintain and recover to their aspired level of health and wellbeing
  • Deliver excellent clinical care that’s safe, effective, caring, well-led and responsive to patients’ needs
  • Be compliant with all governance standards and participate in clinical audit and quality assurance processes
  • Enjoy protected CPD time and access to programmes and events by the Nuffield Health Academy

Supporting your growth.

We’re committed to the professional development of all our clinical colleagues. Inside our Learning and Development Academy, you’ll discover a range of internal CPD courses and online content to support your clinical and professional development. As a Nuffield Health Physiotherapist, you’ll also enjoy opportunities tofor funding support towards your relevant CPD activity and postgraduate study. Plus, you can access further professional development opportunities via the large number of apprenticeship programmes we offer.

Helping you feel good.

We want you to love coming to work, feeling healthy, happy and valued. That’s why we’ve developed a benefits package with you in mind. With a cycle to work scheme, online GP, emotional wellbeing support and private healthcare – at Nuffield Health, we take care of what’s important to you.

Join Nuffield Health and create the future you want, today.

If you like what you see, why not start your application now? We consider applications as we receive them and reserve the right to close adverts early (for example, where we have received an unprecedented high volume of applications). So, it’s a good idea toright away to ensure you’re considered for this role.

It starts with you.

Location

Leicester - Leicestershire

Contract type

Bank

Reference

JR0073047

REWARDS & BENEFITS

Helping you be and feel your best.

Annual Leave

25 days + Bank Holidays, increasing to 27 days after 5 years and to 30 days after 10 years of service.

Nuffield Health Healthcare Plan

Membership is free for employees and you can add partner and dependants at your own cost.

Financial Wellbeing

A range of employee benefits through a Financial Wellbeing provider – including affordable loans repaid through salary, access to your pay when you need it, simple savings, a government Help to Save scheme and money insights.

Cycle to Work Scheme

Save money, get fit and reduce your carbon footprint by taking advantage of this tax-efficient scheme to get a new bike.

Gym Membership

Free membership to any Nuffield Health gym, plus discounted memberships for family members.

Online GP

Discounted access to secure video and telephone GP consultations and a suite of healthcare management tools, provided by digital healthcare company Doctor Care Anywhere.

Emotional Wellbeing Support

Access to our Emotional Wellbeing services and discounted virtual, telephone, and face-to-face treatment.

Season Ticket Loan

Spread the cost of your annual travel ticket and save money with our interest-free Season Ticket Loan benefit.

title: Senior Safety Consultant
description:
Our Opportunity

Inspiring Careers for Exceptional People!

Pick Everard are on the search for a tenacious, experienced Senior Health and Safety Consultant, to lead and shape a diverse range of projects throughout the Midlands.

Are you an experienced Health and Safety professional looking to make a positive impact within a growing, innovative consultancy?

Are you passionate about driving health and safety practices forward?

Do you want to engage with prestigious clients and designers on exciting projects across a range of sectors?


If you answered yes to the above questions, we want to hear from you!

Due to our continued growth, we are looking for an ambitious Senior Principal Designer/Senior H&S Construction Consultant to join our team at Nottingham or Leicester. Working within a collaborative team, you will undertake work throughout the region.

Our excellent teams work on a wide variety of schemes as part of a multi-disciplinary practice, delivering principal designer and CDM services for a growing list of clients.

You’ll become part of a business with an excellent reputation in the industry for client care and quality with a diverse range of industry experts for you to collaborate with and learn from. All of us working here share immense pride in Pick Everard’s 150-year heritage and the progress we have driven as a leading consultant.

The core role will be delivering CDM and Health and Safety advisory services across both internally delivered projects and external, with significant opportunities for completing training and personal growth.

The core of our service is supporting the business as principal designer and working with the design team to reduce and manage risks in design.

Key Responsibilities
  • Ensuring projects comply with CDM 2015, making use of our policies and standard processes
  • Assisting the client in discharging their duties and enacting positive H&S management
  • Attending design team meetings, reviewing designs
  • Engaging with and support the design team
  • Attending construction sites to complete H&S inspections and reporting to the client
  • Engaging with the principal contractor to drive positive safety management


About You

We are looking to expand our team with a dynamic, enthusiastic, responsible and practical person who can help us drive our Health and Safety offering forward within the industry.

Key Requirements
  • Practical experience in managing or providing dedicated CDM / H&S advisor / Principal Designer services/role
  • Experience within healthcare sector is desirable
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Construction, Design and Management (CDM) Regulations 2015
  • Experience in either construction site safety or design (Architecture, Engineering, Surveying etc.)
  • NEBOSH National Certificate in Construction Health and Safety preferred (or equivalent)
  • Professional qualification in a construction, engineering, building surveying or building services discipline - desirable
  • Recognised membership of a proven Health & Safety organisation – desirable
  • Security Clearance is necessary for the role

About Us

    At Pick Everard, we work together to make the extraordinary a reality. We are looking for exceptional new talent to be a part of our journey as we move forward through our ambitious five-year Business Plan.

    We are an independent award-winning property and construction consultancy firm, operating within the industry, providing complete integrated service delivery to help our clients deliver better solutions across real estate, infrastructure and the natural environment.

    We are at the forefront of the industry and enjoy a culture that is centered around being creative, professional, compassionate, client-oriented and fun.

    Our recent successes include:

    • Listed as an NCE100 Consultancy and AJ100 Practice
    • Named a Top 150 Consultancy by Building Magazine
    • Recognised as a leading Financial Times Consultancy
    • Winners of the Association of Consulting Engineers (ACE) Awards, Best Business Performance of the Year – Large Consultancy
    • Winners at the RICS Awards – Infrastructure category
    • An Investors in People and Investors in Excellence accredited business
    • Winners at the Enterprising Women Awards

    Through our remarkable history we have already established the sound principles of success and we have the vision and ambition to be even better, as we move forward into a very bright future. We’re growing and we need more experts onboard. Join us and we will provide you with an inspiring environment in which you’ll be able to drive real progress and impact in your career.

    To learn more about why it is good to work here please visit our website and follow us on social media. Be part of it.

    Remuneration and Benefits

    We value and promote a positive work-life balance and encourage every member of our team to get involved with charity, sports, community, and company events. Providing a balanced, enjoyable career is important to us, and we work hard to make sure everyone feels a valued part of our organisation. We are also a responsible employer and Investors in People accredited business.

    You will receive an attractive salary that will match your skills and experience, as well as the following benefits:

    • Hybrid working
    • Stakeholder pension
    • Life assurance
    • Private healthcare
    • 26 days’ annual leave + Bank Holidays + option to buy up to 5 days’ additional leave
    • Healthcare cashplan
    • Enhanced Maternity, Paternity and Childcare benefits
    • Enhanced Adoption & Shared Parental Leave benefits
    • Long service awards – including enhanced annual leave and vouchers
    • Annual Being PickEverard awards
    • Staff Discount Scheme
    • Spot Rewards
    • Professional subscriptions
    • Season ticket loan or car loan at senior level
    • Cycle to work scheme
    • Wellbeing support and Employee Assistance Programme

    Please note we do not accept speculative CVs or approaches from recruitment agencies.

    As an equal opportunities’ employer, Pick Everard is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership.

    We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join us on our journey.

    #LI-hybrid, #LI-BS1

Apply

Share

    Share Vacancy on Facebook
    Share Vacancy on X
    Share Vacancy on LinkedIn
    Send Vacancy to a friend

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Our Opportunity

Are you a Building Services Mechanical Engineer looking to work on a variety of projects?
Do you want to join a supportive and collaborative practice?
Are you looking for your next opportunity within an award-winning multi-disciplinary construction and property consultancy?
Do you have a passion for sustainable design, looking to make a real impact within the built environment?
We are looking to appoint a Mechanical Engineer to join the growing team in Nottingham, supporting nationwide for both private and public sector clients on a wide variety of projects.
Key responsibilities will be:
  • Manage smaller contracts
  • Prepare designs and reports
  • Deputise for senior staff as appropriate
  • Liaise directly with Clients and Contractors
  • Supervise junior staff on a day-to-day basis
  • Help ensure projects are delivered to the right scope of time, quality and budget.
  • Responsible for ensuring that they (and where appropriate their team) understand and comply with all Health & Safety requirements, practices, and procedures
Interested to find out more? Contact us today!

About You

We are looking for an experienced and design-focused Mechanical Engineer who has the desire and capabilities to develop their career within a people and client orientated construction and property consultancy.
Key knowledge and experience we’d like you to have:
  • HND/Degree or equivalent professional qualification
  • Knowledge of construction industry design processes and procurement arrangements
  • Design experience with consultant or contractor
  • Knowledge of engineering principles
  • Knowledge of current legislation e.g., Building Regulations
  • Awareness of electrical services principles – desirable
  • Knowledge of H&S / CDM requirements
  • Mechanical design software experience
  • Heating-, cooling- and ventilation system design experience
  • Domestic water services design experience
  • Knowledge of specification writing / NBS Engineering
  • Verbal communication – able to liaise with clients, contractors, fellow professionals
  • Written communication – report letter, specification writing

We’re growing and we need more experts onboard. Join us and we will provide you with an inspiring environment in which you’ll be able to drive real progress and impact in your career.

    To learn more about why it is good to work here please visit our website and follow us on social media. Be part of it.

    Remuneration and Benefits

    We value and promote a positive work-life balance and encourage every member of our team to get involved with charity, sports, community, and company events. Providing a balanced, enjoyable career is important to us, and we work hard to make sure everyone feels a valued part of our organisation. We are also a responsible employer and Investors in People accredited business.

    You will receive an attractive salary that will match your skills and experience, as well as the following benefits:

    • Hybrid working
    • Stakeholder pension
    • Life assurance

    • Healthcare cashplan
    • Enhanced Maternity, Paternity and Childcare benefits
    • Enhanced Adoption & Shared Parental Leave benefits
    • Long service awards – including enhanced annual leave and vouchers
    • Annual Being PickEverard awards

title: Private Client Solicitor
description:
Wills & Probate Solicitor / Legal Executive 2+ Years' PQE

Loughborough

Salary competitive / negotiable depending on experience

We are working with a well-established, multi-office, Lexcel accredited law firm, who are seeking a Private Client Solicitor or Chartered Legal Executive to join their friendly and supportive team at their office in Loughborough.

The role will involve dealing with the following:

  • Managing a caseload of Private Client matters
  • Preparation of Wills, Lasting Power of Attorneys
  • Dealing with Administration of Estates
  • Attending to clients by telephone, email and face to face
  • Maintaining files and ensuring efficient case management of Private Client matters, keeping clients updated
  • Drafting legal documentation including correspondence, briefs, court documentation, full attendance notes and statements of evidence

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Qualified Solicitor or Chartered Legal Executive status
  • 2+ Years' PQE
  • Experience in dealing with probate and estate administration, preparing Wills and Lasting Powers of Attorney
  • Expertise in trusts and/or court of protection would be an advantage
  • Access to their own transport (this is essential)

This is a full time, permanent position working 9:00am until 5:00pm Monday-Friday, offered with:

  • Company pension scheme
  • Parking on site
  • Additional paid leave over the Christmas shutdown period
  • Friendly and supportive culture
  • Paralegal support
  • Flexible working opportunities
  • Training and development opportunities to progress your career

Note: Salary is given as a guideline in line with market rate and will be dependent on level of experience. The information given above is correct to the best of our knowledge.

For more information, please contact Katie at Talentwise Solutions

About Talentwise

Talentwise Solutions is a family-run, boutique recruitment agency specialising in legal professional and business support jobs throughout Coventry and Warwickshire, Birmingham and the Midlands.

title: Private Client Solicitor
description:
Wills & Probate Solicitor / Legal Executive 2+ Years' PQE

Derby

Salary competitive / negotiable depending on experience

We are working with a well-established, multi-office, Lexcel accredited law firm, who are seeking a Private Client Solicitor or Chartered Legal Executive to join their friendly and supportive team at their office in Derby.

The role will involve dealing with the following:

  • Managing a caseload of Private Client matters
  • Preparation of Wills, Lasting Power of Attorneys
  • Dealing with Administration of Estates
  • Attending to clients by telephone, email and face to face
  • Maintaining files and ensuring efficient case management of Private Client matters, keeping clients updated
  • Drafting legal documentation including correspondence, briefs, court documentation, full attendance notes and statements of evidence

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Qualified Solicitor or Chartered Legal Executive status
  • 2+ Years' PQE
  • Experience in dealing with probate and estate administration, preparing Wills and Lasting Powers of Attorney
  • Expertise in trusts and/or court of protection would be an advantage
  • Access to their own transport (this is essential)

This is a full time, permanent position working 9:00am until 5:00pm Monday-Friday, offered with:

  • Company pension scheme
  • Parking on site
  • Additional paid leave over the Christmas shutdown period
  • Friendly and supportive culture
  • Paralegal support
  • Flexible working opportunities
  • Training and development opportunities to progress your career

Note: Salary is given as a guideline in line with market rate and will be dependent on level of experience. The information given above is correct to the best of our knowledge.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
About Us:
Indulge your passion for problem-solving and embrace the thrill of addressing risk head-on at Gallagher's global brokerage team. Join a family of diverse minds, united by a relentless pursuit of excellence. As part of our team, you'll be the architect of protection, safeguarding businesses and empowering their ambitions. Together, we'll build a legacy of trust and triumph in the dynamic world of risk management.

We believe that every candidate brings something special to the table, including you! So, even if you feel that you’re close but not an exact match, we encourage you to apply.
Overview:
Gallagher are looking for new Customer Service Consultants in Nottingham to join our team. Do you enjoy helping others and providing brilliant service to every customer you speak to? Are you looking for a job which provides full training, support to gain industry qualifications and potential career progression opportunities all over the world? If so, we’d love you to apply for one of our exciting new opportunities!
Responsibilities:

What you’ll be doing:


Our Customer Service Consultants help small to medium size businesses find insurance policies that meet their needs. You will use your communication skills to build a rapport, gather the right information to understand their needs, while providing excellent customer service.

You might need to balance multiple tasks at the same time, utilise a range of systems and will work in a dynamic, friendly, agile team.

Summary of the role:

  • Our working hours are Monday to Friday 9am-5pm.
  • Annual salary is from £22,000- £25,000
  • We are based in Nottingham City Centre with easy access from local bus routes and Park & Ride buses. We are located a 1-minute walk from Maid Marian Way tram station & a 10-minute walk from Nottingham train station.
  • Structured 4-week training programme and a dedicated team to ensure you reach your potential.
Qualifications:

Skills and experience we’re looking for:

  • Experience call handling (ideally customer service expertise) is required
  • Experience in Insurance is preferred but not essential, many of our Customer Sales Executives come from a wide vareity of customer focused careers
  • You will enjoy speaking to customers, be able to build strong rapport and take a genuine interest in their needs
  • We are looking for new colleagues that will fit in with our fun, but results driven culture
  • The ability to perform basic maths tasks and simple IT systems


About Us:

Gallagher is a global leader in insurance, risk management and consulting services. We help businesses grow, communities thrive, and people prosper. We live a culture motivated by The Gallagher Way, our set of shared values. A culture driven by our people, over 30,000 strong, serving our clients with customised solutions that will protect them and fuel their futures.

Our employing entity, Arthur J. Gallagher Services (UK) Limited, is proud to be accredited as a Living Wage employer with the Living Wage Foundation. Gallagher is committed to diversity of opportunity for all and is opposed to any form of less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender or gender identity, marital status, civil partnership status, parental status, race, ethnicity, colour, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, religion/ belief, age, and those with caring responsibilities.

We want Gallagher to be the organisation that all our people are proud to be a part of and where everyone can call themselves one of the team. Where our culture is embracing of difference, where you can be the best and, perhaps most importantly, be yourself.

Additional Information:
Gallagher is Disability Confident Committed. We have pledged to make sure our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible, in addition to supporting our existing employees with any long-term health conditions or disabilities.
We understand that applicants may have disabilities, if you do, you may find some parts of the recruitment process more challenging than others. Don’t worry, we’re here to help, however, we can only do this if you let us know.
Should you require any reasonable adjustments with your application, please get in touch with TAGlobalSupport@ajg.com. If you’d prefer to speak on the phone, please request a call back, leaving details, so we get in touch.
Our employing entity, Arthur J. Gallagher Services (UK) Limited, is proud to be accredited as a Living Wage employer with the Living Wage Foundation. We are committed to diversity and opportunity for all and is opposed to any form of less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender or gender identity, marital status, civil partnership status, parental status, race, ethnicity, colour, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, religion/ belief, age and those with caring responsibilities.
If this sounds like somewhere you’d like to join, we'd love to hear from you!

title: Science Teacher
description:
SECONDARY SCHOOL SCIENCE TEACHER

SMART EDUCATION is a specialist consultancy focusing exclusively on the Education sector. We work extensively with Nurseries, Schools (Mainstream & SEN), Academies, FE Settings, and alternative education establishments across Birmingham recruiting for PERMANENT and TEMPORARY staff. We offer a bespoke service to both the clients and candidates and are proud of our honest reputation and our professional attitude towards Safeguarding and customer Service.

Job Description:

SMART Education would like to recruit Secondary Science School teacher in Ludlow.

This science teacher position will be offering additional support within a secondary school in Wolverhampton. This prestigious school is looking for an experienced teacher to support the learning of their pupils for the autumn term.

These positions commences as soon as possible and offers full-time work..

The schools want to hold interviews and lesson observations as soon as possible.

The schools recognise that creativity enhances children’s academic, social, and mental well-being and should not be compromised. They truly believe in having the child at the heart of learning. They like to collaborate with local communities, schools, and beyond.

It would be best if you were committed to high-quality teaching and were able to demonstrate a record of success in raising children’s attainment to join their wonderful department and team.

Qualifications Required: QTS and at least 6+ Months’ experience within a secondary school setting environment, teaching science and following the National Curriculum.

Salary: £145 - £215

Hours: Full-time Monday to Friday, temporary contract

Location: Tamworth

Interview Dates: ASAP

Start Date: ASAP, minimum of a 5 week contract

Contact: Graham Kelly

If you are a teacher, TA, Lecturer, SEN specialist, cover supervisor, or Nursery Nurse and are looking for work opportunities on both a permanent or temporary basis, then call SMART EDUCATION today. You are guaranteed a professional and efficient service from our very experienced and approachable consultants. At SMART EDUCATION exceeding your expectations is our priority. Our Key Values to you: Service Motivation Approachability Reliability Trust, we look forward to hearing from you.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £145.00-£215.00 per day

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Master's (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • QTS (required)

Work Location: In person

title: Technical Consultant
description:
Job Title: Technical Consultant

Reporting to: Technical Associate Director

Salary: £40,000+ Dependent on Experience

CBTax are an award-winning, leading tax consultancy practice supporting clients with research and development (“R&D”) claims and other tax saving service offerings. Having won the Accounting Excellence Fast-Track Firm of the Year 2022, and Business of the Year 2021 at the Northamptonshire Business Excellence Awards, CBTax has been recognised as the fastest growing tax consultancy firm in the UK and Ireland with an ambition to become the largest R&D practice.

CBTax are seeking an Technical Consultant to join our team to support the firms continued growth across the UK. Candidates will have a desire to further their career into a consultative role, and to prepare financial and technical reports for submission to HMRC.

It is essential that the right candidate wants to build a career in supporting clients in the engineering field on a consulting basis. The role will offer potential to a driven and dynamic person to develop within professional services industry and all CBTax Engineering Graduates will also be fully supported in future training and continuous professional development.

Experience

Required

  • Science/Engineering (or similar) degree or post graduate qualification.
  • 2 year's experience working in Engineering/Industrial field.
  • Desire to learn about preparing and submitting R&D tax relief claims in the sector.
  • Adept at translating technical conversation into concise and compelling written documents.
  • Strong numerical ability, attention to detail and first-time accuracy.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of wider business and economic issues.
  • Interact readily with technical professionals, and have outstanding interpersonal skills.
  • Comfortable working autonomously and in a close team.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint and Word packages.

Preffered

  • Prior R&D Tax Credit experience and understanding of the tax claim process.

Key responsibilities

  • Identifying qualifying R&D projects through participation in technical discussions with clients.
  • Technical assessment of projects in-line with HMRC R&D tax relief guidelines and preparation of supporting technical documentation.
  • Interaction with clients' technical and financial staff to develop a comprehensive understanding of claim benefit value in-line with HMRC's R&D Tax Relief Guidelines.
  • Preperation of claim reports and documentation for client review and approval.
  • Managing R&D claims and maintaining client information via CRM system.
  • Providing support to R&D tax relief claims in the event of HMRC enquiries.

Company Benefits

  • Performance Bonus
  • Referral scheme
  • 5% Employer Pension Contribution
  • BUPA healthcare
  • Full study support
  • Client facing exposure

We strongly encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. For applicants with disabilities, please contact us to let us know of any adjustments we can make to support you during the recruitment process.

title: Gallery Technician
description:
We have an opportunity available for a Gallery Technician to join our friendly team based in Nottingham. Joining us on a full time, permanent basis working 37.5 hours per week, you will receive a salary of £20,400 per annum plus bonus and benefits.

As our Gallery Technician, you will join Washington Green and Castle Fine Art. This position has responsibility for providing technical and logistical support across the Gallery.


Key responsibilities as our Gallery Technician:

  • Providing support for artwork installations for bespoke Gallery/Company events as required
  • Ensuring safe movement and installation of all artwork (including sculptures)
  • Accompanying sales consultants to client appointments and home approvals, including pre-installation assessment of clients’ homes if required
  • Delivering artwork to clients homes
  • Transporting artwork between Galleries and Head Office
  • Hanging/installing artwork as required
  • Handling the setting up of events and exhibitions
  • Responsibility for maintenance and upkeep of vehicle checks
  • Handling risk assessments and awareness in the workplace
  • Basic maintenance services and health and safety checks within Galleries

Skills and experience required to become our Gallery Technician:

  • The ability to represent the Company professionally to clients and deliver excellent customer service
  • Experience Microsoft Office (Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook)
  • Excellent organisational skills with the ability to plan effectively, manage time to meet deadlines
  • Reliable, flexible and is able to use their own initiative when carrying out their role
  • Ability to think on your feet
  • A full clean driving license is required – this position will be responsible for a company van which must be kept in pristine condition
  • Treating all artwork with the utmost respect at all times and ensuring it is always handled, wrapped and stored properly

About us:

Washington Green and Castle Fine Art is the UK’s leading art publisher and retailer of fine art. Offering a welcoming, relaxing environment to enjoy art in accessible, high street locations, Castle Fine Art’s ethos is encapsulated in its motto “Your World, Our Art”.

We offer original paintings, limited edition prints and sculptures representing some of the biggest names currently in the art world, such as; Ronnie Wood, Bob Dylan, Raphael Mazzucco and Stan Lee - Marvel - just to name a few!

If you are self-motivated and passionate, please apply now to become our Gallery Technician. We’d love to hear from you!

title: Information Technology Manager
description:
Ref: 17112023VSNFI4_1700227737

Project Manager - Technology

England

  • £45,000 to £55,000 GBP
  • Project Manager Role
  • Level: Mid-level

Job description

Project Manager - Technology

17112023VSNFI4_1700227737

A small and growing Microsoft Consultancy who help their clients to become more data-driven, are looking an experienced Project Manager to join their team - this is a hybrid role, and will require to you travel to their office in Shenstone (near Lichfield) one day per week.

In this role you will work as part of a small and agile PMO, supporting a Principal Consultant to manage the end-to-end delivery of complex technical data & analytics projects - often working on multiple projects at any one time.

This will include having early involvement of initial scoping during pre-sales engagements, through to programme design, and then control delivery to ensure it is on time, to budget, and working through change requests. Throughout, as well as managing day-to-day activities, you will pro-actively work to remove road-blocks and liaise closely with the Principal Consultant, CTO and Analytics Director as required to ensure successful delivery.

This role would be well-suited to a candidate with experience in a similar technical delivery capacity, and ideally some experience or knowledge of data-focused projects. This is an incredible opportunity to join a growing organisation who are doing some extremely interesting work to enable their clients maximise the value in their data and make better evidence-based decisions.

Requirements:

  • Experience in a technical project manager / delivery role
  • Experience working on data projects would be highly beneficial but not essential
  • Experience creating project plans in Microsoft Project (or something similar)
  • Exceptional stakeholder engagement and management skills

Benefits:

  • Salary of £45-55,000 depending on experience
  • 25 days holiday plus bank holidays
  • 5 personal development days - to develop skills to support your professional development
  • 2 volunteering days - to give back to the community



Please Note: This is a permanent role for UK residents only. This role does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in the UK with no restrictions. Some of our roles may be subject to successful background checks including a DBS and Credit Check.

Nigel Frank are the go-to recruiter for Power BI and Azure Data Platform roles in the UK, offering more opportunities across the country than any other. We're the proud sponsor and supporter of SQLBits, Power Platform World Tour, the London Power BI User Group, Newcastle Power BI User Group and Newcastle Data Platform and Cloud User Group. To find out more and speak confidentially about your job search or hiring needs, please contact me directly at v.simpson@nigelfrank.com

title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Are you an experienced 360 Recruitment Consultant with a strong track record of success?

Are you looking for a growing company with a great opportunity to develop and progress?

If so, then we are working for the perfect company for you!

Who is our client?

Our client is a specialist recruitment firm that is leading the way across the recruitment market, working with everyone from Independent agencies to more globally recognised brands, along everyone in between. With a demonstrable track record of adapting to the needs of an ever changing market and having the ability to utilise the best in up and coming technology and talent, they are a company that reaches all levels of industry, and do it well!

With over 30 decades of experience in the industry, our client understands that their best resource is the employees and with this they place as much focus on providing success for their employees as they do for their clients, so you can expect an environment with all the tools needed for you to flourish.

Tasks

Manage the recruitment process from client onboarding to the offer/fulfilment stage.

Sourcing and interviewing candidates

Negotiating salary packages and presenting suitable candidates to clients.

Identify, build and develop mutually beneficial relationships with clients and candidates

Attract and onboard new clients and candidates through marketing, business development, and networking

Advising the most appropriate solution for attracting candidates and maintaining a candidate database

Meeting or beating targets for bringing new business leads or conversations

Requirements

Experience within the recruitment sector as we know that experience and personality provide people with all the skills they need to succeed and build a professional and billing career, full of unlimited progression opportunities. So, if you have talent, enthusiasm and a good level of experience in the industry, this is for you!

Benefits

Our client is offering a starting salary of £26,000-£40,000 excluding bonuses and commission with a range of great incentives, excellent training and tech-stack, inclusive team working culture, and full support to ensure you can be a success.

Uncapped commission, new skills, a supportive team, the rewards in this position are endless,

The role can be challenging, but also exciting as the profession is fast-paced, target driven, and demanding. However, if you feel you have what it takes please contact us directly or apply with your CV

description:
Are you an experienced 360 Recruitment Consultant with a strong track record of success?

Are you looking for a growing company with a great opportunity to develop and progress?

If so, then we are working for the perfect company for you!

Who is our client?

Our client is a specialist recruitment firm that is leading the way across the recruitment market, working with everyone from Independent agencies to more globally recognised brands, along everyone in between. With a demonstrable track record of adapting to the needs of an ever changing market and having the ability to utilise the best in up and coming technology and talent, they are a company that reaches all levels of industry, and do it well!

With over 30 decades of experience in the industry, our client understands that their best resource is the employees and with this they place as much focus on providing success for their employees as they do for their clients, so you can expect an environment with all the tools needed for you to flourish.

Tasks

Manage the recruitment process from client onboarding to the offer/fulfilment stage.

Sourcing and interviewing candidates

Negotiating salary packages and presenting suitable candidates to clients.

Identify, build and develop mutually beneficial relationships with clients and candidates

Attract and onboard new clients and candidates through marketing, business development, and networking

Advising the most appropriate solution for attracting candidates and maintaining a candidate database

Meeting or beating targets for bringing new business leads or conversations

Requirements

Experience within the recruitment sector as we know that experience and personality provide people with all the skills they need to succeed and build a professional and billing career, full of unlimited progression opportunities. So, if you have talent, enthusiasm and a good level of experience in the industry, this is for you!

Benefits

Our client is offering a starting salary of £26,000-£40,000 excluding bonuses and commission with a range of great incentives, excellent training and tech-stack, inclusive team working culture, and full support to ensure you can be a success.

Uncapped commission, new skills, a supportive team, the rewards in this position are endless,

The role can be challenging, but also exciting as the profession is fast-paced, target driven, and demanding. However, if you feel you have what it takes please contact us directly or apply with your CV

Effective Staffing Solutions are operating as a Recruitment business when hiring for permanent roles

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £26,000.00-£40,000.00 per year

  • Company events

  • Day shift

  • No weekends

Supplemental pay types:

title: Project Manager
description:
Our Opportunity

Are you a Project Manager looking to take the next important step in your career?
Do you want to build on your experience and expand your project range?
Are you looking to work as part of a collaborative team, where you can produce a real impact?
If you answered yes to the above questions, this may be the role for you.
Pick Everard are looking to appoint an ambitious Project Manager for our growing Leicester office.
In this role, you will become an essential part of our Project Management team, helping to deliver a range of projects in the region.
As a leading construction consultancy, we are looking to recruit the very best talent to help us continue to deliver excellence on our 160+ year journey within the UK market.

You can expect to become involved in a range of exciting and challenging schemes across both the private and public sectors, including commercial, retail, residential, education, healthcare, regeneration and infrastructure.

This role provides an exciting opportunity to develop within growing dynamic team, supported by expertise across our multi-disciplinary consultancy.

If you are looking to make your mark and achieve fast-track career development, then we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Agree and develop the client’s brief from inception in conjunction with any other consultants appointed
  • Co-ordinate, manage and communicate with the client, project stakeholders and other consultants appointed to meet requirements of the project, preparation of programmes and undertaking programme management
  • Undertake change management, co-ordinate the design process, oversee and manage the control of the project both pre- and post-contract including financial expenditure throughout all RIBA stages.
  • Co-ordinate and manage the development of the procurement strategy and procurement activities
  • Undertake and participate in risk-, value- and opportunities management, including facilitating workshops in order to ensure that these activities are controlled within the project team including contractors, sub-contractors, and the supply chain
  • Communicate and chair meetings with the client, their stakeholders, and contractors as necessary
  • Prepare and issue reports, including but not limited to preparation of Project Execution Plans (PEP), Strategy Reports, Risk Registers, Progress Reports etc.
  • Develop new business opportunities including leading and participating in the preparation and presentation of bids

About You

Key Requirements:
  • NEC accredited is ideal but as a minimum, well versed and experienced in administering NEC contracts
  • Experience in a similar role in the construction environment
  • HNC, HND or a construction related degree is desirable
  • Member of a construction related professional body, such as RICS, CIOB, CIBSE, etc. is desirable
  • A comprehensive knowledge of building technology and construction principles
  • Have a good understanding of forms of building contract and experience of contract administration
  • Ability to control day to day programming and planning
  • Ability to monitor progress and expenditure of projects
  • Have a clear understanding of risk management including identification, management, mitigation and risk transfer
  • A good understanding of IT including Microsoft Word, Excel and Project
  • Bid writing and presentation skills

About Us

    At Pick Everard, we work together to make the extraordinary a reality. We are looking for exceptional new talent to be a part of our journey as we move forward through our ambitious five-year Business Plan.

    We are an independent award-winning property and construction consultancy firm, operating within the industry, providing complete integrated service delivery to help our clients deliver better solutions across real estate, infrastructure and the natural environment.

    We are at the forefront of the industry and enjoy a culture that is centered around being creative, professional, compassionate, client-oriented and fun.

    Our recent successes include:

    • Listed as an NCE100 Consultancy and AJ100 Practice
    • Named a Top 150 Consultancy by Building Magazine
    • Recognised as a leading Financial Times Consultancy
    • Winners of the Association of Consulting Engineers (ACE) Awards, Best Business Performance of the Year – Large Consultancy
    • Winners at the RICS Awards – Infrastructure category
    • An Investors in People and Investors in Excellence accredited business
    • Winners at the Enterprising Women Awards

    Through our remarkable history we have already established the sound principles of success and we have the vision and ambition to be even better, as we move forward into a very bright future. We’re growing and we need more experts onboard. Join us and we will provide you with an inspiring environment in which you’ll be able to drive real progress and impact in your career.

    To learn more about why it is good to work here please visit our website and follow us on social media. Be part of it.

    Remuneration and Benefits

    We value and promote a positive work-life balance and encourage every member of our team to get involved with charity, sports, community, and company events. Providing a balanced, enjoyable career is important to us, and we work hard to make sure everyone feels a valued part of our organisation. We are also a responsible employer and Investors in People accredited business.

    You will receive an attractive salary that will match your skills and experience, as well as the following benefits:

    • Hybrid working
    • Stakeholder pension
    • Life assurance
    • Private healthcare
    • 26 days’ annual leave + Bank Holidays + option to buy up to 5 days’ additional leave
    • Healthcare cashplan
    • Enhanced Maternity, Paternity and Childcare benefits
    • Enhanced Adoption & Shared Parental Leave benefits
    • Long service awards – including enhanced annual leave and vouchers
    • Annual Being PickEverard awards
    • Staff Discount Scheme
    • Spot Rewards
    • Professional subscriptions
    • Season ticket loan or car loan at senior level
    • Cycle to work scheme
    • Wellbeing support and Employee Assistance Programme

    Please note we do not accept speculative CVs or approaches from recruitment agencies.

    As an equal opportunities’ employer, Pick Everard is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership.

    We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join us on our journey.

    #LI-hybrid #LI-BS1

Apply

Share

    Share Vacancy on Facebook
    Share Vacancy on X
    Share Vacancy on LinkedIn
    Send Vacancy to a friend

title: National Sustainability Assistant
description:
Working closely with the National Sustainability Manager, you'll play a vital role in making sure everything runs smoothly.

National Sustainability is part of our core values, so you'll be on the front line, celebrating best practice with industry bodies, NGO's, retailers and suppliers. You will be considered a specialist in your given field and will be immersed in a wide variety of different tasks involving putting proposals together, training new staff members and liaising with stakeholders.

We do things our own way at Aldi. But whatever we're doing, we must be getting it right. With a wave of impressive sales figures behind us, we're opening new stores at lightning speed. And that means managing our National Sustainability is more crucial than ever before.


This is a 12 month Maternity Cover contract for a Sustainability Assistant leading on Agriculture. It is a mid-level role in an area that receives a lot of attention, not only from external stakeholders but also across the rest of the business. The role will be crucial in developing the strategy and initiatives to deliver against Aldi’s targets for farming, animal welfare and environmental impact in our supply chains. It is an exciting time to join the team, with a lot of activity planned for 2024.

If you’re a hardworking individual that’s ready to kick-start your career with an award-winning employer, apply to join #TeamAldi today!

Responsibilities:

  • Work with the Agriculture Manager to:
  • Support with overarching sustainability initiatives in agriculture, including projects, across the following areas:
  • Produce
  • Water
  • Peat
  • Pesticide usage
  • Biodiversity
  • Carbon footprinting
  • Regenerative agriculture principles
  • Specifically:
  • Develop and implement agriculture strategy for the Produce category.
  • Work within the WRAP Water Roadmap and UK water projects relating to agriculture
  • Understand and recommend improvements to our pesticides policy and reporting
  • Supplier review of existing activity in carbon footprinting, biodiversity, regenerative agriculture, waste projects etc
  • Carry out research of the market for competitor comparison, media trends, and NGO campaigns to inform strategy and policy development.
  • Understand on farm carbon footprinting and how this can support wider business carbon reduction work to meet our 2040 Net Zero Carbon commitment.
  • Work with Buying Teams and Suppliers to identify key activities to support the above and to answer any queries on policy and/or provide recommendations.
  • Maintain regular contact with key external stakeholders for each topic (including consultants, industry groups, NGOs and Government bodies) to understand any emerging issues and how best to support farmers.
  • Regular contact with the International Sustainability department and input into International Sustainability Working Groups on topics of responsibility.
  • Co-ordinate feedback for specification systems and advise technical service providers (TSPs) on collection of relevant data.
  • Co-ordinate policy updates.
  • Work with the Communications and Marketing Teams to explore opportunities to promote the work that Aldi is doing in this area and update the website with latest agriculture/sustainability activity.
  • Review of weekly Specialbuy leaflet for opportunities to promote what we are doing.
  • Draft presentations and communication materials for each topic.
  • Respond to external stakeholder queries, customer/NGO/government letters.
  • Provide general support to the Agriculture Manager.

Essential:

  • A keen interest and passion in agriculture and sustainability.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • The ability to build effective relationships with colleagues at all levels of the business.
  • Good organisational skills with the ability to manage a varied workload, conflicting deadlines and multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Desire to improve and simplify processes wherever possible.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Ability to be pro-active and work on own initiative, as part of a team and independently.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office, specifically Excel.
  • Ability to investigate and analyse a challenge and offer a solution.

What You’ll get in Return

  • Salary details £36,080 rising to £42,135
  • Monday to Friday, 8am to 4:30pm, with the opportunity of 2 days a week remote working
  • 5 weeks’ annual leave plus Bank Holidays
  • In office flexi-time
  • Full training provided
  • Pension scheme
  • Private employee medical insurance after 4 years
  • Company sick pay scheme
  • Company maternity and adoption pay after 1 year and paternity leave pay after 2 years
  • Long service rewards
  • Access to MyBenefits, where you can find a wide range of benefits, including our bike to work scheme, shopping and cinema discounts, health cash plan, a FREE will, travel and discounted gym memberships, as well as a host of benefits to support your financial and wellbeing needs.
  • Access to a free,24/7, confidential virtual GP service for all Aldi Colleagues and their children (under the age of 16)


Aldi is an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and are dedicated to promoting a culture of inclusion, providing an environment in which collaboration, respect and fairness are essential. We value diversity and are dedicated to treating all of our colleagues and prospective colleagues fairly and with respect.

If you’re looking for a career that gives you more, apply today!

title: Chemist
description:
• Salary: £22,000-£25,000pa
  • REF Number: 00056434
  • Consultant: Sajra Hameed
  • Contact: 01246457712
  • Date Published: 02.01.2024
  • Sector: Chemicals
  • Location: Derby, UK Anywhere
  • Discipline: Technical Support

CK Group are recruiting for a Graduate Chemist to work in a technical support function with a chemicals manufacturing company at their site based in Derby on a full time, permanent basis.

The Company:

Our client is an expanding manufacturerof cleaning and decontamination products. They now have a vacancy for a Chemist to join their team and will consider a chemistry graduate or someone with industry experience. Reporting to the Technical Director, the successful candidate will undertake technical work in product development and related areas comprising both QC and R&D. The company offers £22,000-£25,000pa depending on experience as well as 25 days holiday plus bank holidays, private healthcare, pension and perk box.

Location:The Chemist will be based at the company's site in Derby, easily commutable from surrounding areas including Nottingham, Loughborough, Belper, Ashbourne, Burton and Ashby.

Your main duties will be to:

  • Carry out all work in accordance with the QMS, to agreed timelines and specifications
  • Perform Technical Service work as requested and communicate results effectively with colleagues and customers
  • Process samples in connection with technical service activities, record and reportresults as appropriate
  • Undertake training in the manufacturing QC function and understand the role. Deputise for QC chemists if required
  • Carry out R&D work in accordance with project plans. Maintain documentation and records according to procedures. This work includes new product developments, product improvements, evaluation of new and alternative raw materials and work on technical improvements in production processes and QC procedures
  • Represent the department at meetings as required. Produce and present data on projects and test results

Your Background:

The ideal candidate for this role will have the following skills and experience:

  • Degree or equivalent in chemistry or a related discipline
  • Ideally, relevant industrial experience
  • Knowledge and experience in chemical formulation preferred
  • Perseverance, patience and attention to detail

Apply:

It is essential that applicants hold entitlement to work in the UK. Please quote job reference 56434 in all correspondence.

Sajra Hameed

Senior Recruitment Consultant

T: 01246 457720

title: Commercial Manager
description:
County: Warwickshire

Town/City: Rugby

Sector: Management, Parts Factor

Salary: £45000 - £55000 per annum

Job ref: 129385


Commercial Operations Manager required in Warwickshire
  • Salary circa £45,000, plus bonus
  • Not less than 40 hours per week Monday to Friday, office based
  • Leading Automotive Garage Equipment Provider
Our client is a well-established, Midlands family run business, who are a leading specialists in their field. They are seeking a General Manager who will take responsibility for the overall running of the business, reporting into the Directors. This Commercial Operations Manager role within the organisation will require critical thinking and problem-solving skills, along with written and verbal communication expertise.

Commercial Operations Manager duties:
  • Directly reporting to the Directors
  • Support & overall responsibility for a team of 10-15 people modelling a ‘can-do’ attitude
  • Strategic approach for all operations of the business, including sales, growth, quality and profitability
  • Overall Project success inc profitability & customer satisfaction
  • Create and deliver production strategies in line with business aspirations
Requirements in this Commercial Operations Manager role:
  • Desirable Minimum 5 years' management experience within the Automotive / engineering sector
  • Experienced in leading a team
  • Financial acumen
  • Pro-active & commercial awareness to be able to make the most of sales & business opportunities
  • Be a good communicator
  • Confident IT skills
  • Man-management and team building skills/experience
What’s in it for you?
  • Good salary, plus good bonus / profit share (negotiable for the right candidate)
  • Rare senior management opportunity with a successful business
  • Possibilities for growth
  • Company Benefits: Pension, Holiday Allowance: 22 days + bank holidays, Onsite Parking

title: Estimator
description:
We're seeking an Estimator or trainee, to join a dynamic estimating team and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of infrastructure projects. If you're a numbers-driven professional with a passion for precision and a knack for building strong supplier relationships, this is the opportunity you've been waiting for.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Winning Work: Drive our success by producing winning tenders and nurturing key customer relationships.
  • Cost Estimation: Create precise cost estimates for materials, labour, and equipment, based on customer drawings and specifications.
  • Market Insight: Stay ahead of the curve by understanding current market prices and benchmarking our solutions for increased success rates.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with the Business Manager to ensure compliance with company procedures, business strategy, and clearance levels.
  • Customer Engagement: Assist in presenting tender proposals to customers and actively participate in customer meetings throughout the tender process.
  • Risk Management: Assess and adhere to all risk assessments and health and safety requirements, ensuring the safety of all stakeholders.
  • Supplier Selection: Source suitable sub-contractors and specialists for each project to guarantee the highest quality standards.
  • Teamwork: Collaborate effectively with Construction Managers, Planners, and the Design Team to ensure seamless project execution.
  • Documentation: Prepare comprehensive documents for senior management to showcase cost calculations and project feasibility.
  • Knowledge Transfer: Ensure a smooth handover of bid documentation to the commercial and project operations teams.

Qualifications and Requirements:

  • Experience in pricing highway lighting, signage, smart motorway comms would be advantageous.
  • Educated to degree level.
  • An understanding of highways electrical infrastructure and the construction industry.
  • Confidence in independently pricing projects with minimal reliance on others.
  • Exceptional numeracy skills.
  • Excellent IT skills, including proficiency in all Microsoft packages.
  • Strong analytical capabilities for financial analysis.
  • Previous experience of using costing software such as conquest would be advantageous.
  • The ability to thrive in high-pressure situations and meet tight deadlines.
  • Outstanding organisational skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, for effective collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.

If this role is of interest then please apply immediately

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Free parking
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

Work Location: In person
