title: Property Manager
description:
Summary

Job Reference:
220692BR

Nottingham Support Office

Permanent

37.5 hours per week

Our application process

Contract: Permanent

Recruitment Partner: Lizzy Parfitt

About the role

The Estates Team operates as a valued consultant to the business, working closely with the wider Property, Finance, Legal, Procurement, and Retail & Pharmacy Operation teams. We advise across a large, mature portfolio with significant opportunities to add and return value year-on-year.

We are looking for a talented Estates Manager to join the team. You will have good all-round property experience, commercial acumen, a strong customer focus and a high level of drive and self-motivation to succeed in a fast paced, challenging environment.

You will report to the Senior Estates Manager and deliver great results by:

  • Being a great team player, building relationships with key internal customers and the external market to deliver business objectives
  • Assisting teams on business projects to deliver measurable results
  • Having a mindset of continual improvement in both tactical strategy and processes
  • Managing the performance of external advisors to deliver on time and under budget
  • A diverse workload including managing lease renewals and rent reviews, dealing with, day to day property management issues, lease obligations and dilapidations to undertaking project work or dealing with our sublet portfolio

You will have responsibility for:

  • Supplier management and managing a portfolio comprising retail stores.
  • Negotiating the best commercial terms in the market on all aspects of property management and rental transactions
  • Financially appraising and evaluating property transactions, preparing and presenting approval papers.
  • Assisting in the preparation of the annual property budget and monitoring progress on delivery to it.

Hybrid working:

We currently operate a fixed hybrid working approach for Support Office team members with a mix of remote and office-based working. Our set office days are Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday with team members able to work remotely on Mondays and Fridays.

What you’ll need to have

You’ll have a degree in Real Estate Management and will be a Member of the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors. The best candidate will be:

  • Able to work collaboratively as part of a team of professionals to deliver business objectives.
  • Commercially aware, being analytical and use financial knowledge to bring an innovative approach to property solutions

  • A good communicator, able to build effective relationships within the business and the external market
  • Self-motivated and results focussed to meet budget requirements with a high level of integrity and trust

Our benefits

  • Boots Retirement Savings Plan
  • Enhanced maternity/paternity/adoption leave pay
  • Discretionary annual bonus
  • Generous employee discounts
  • Flexible benefits scheme including discounted gym membership, life assurance, activity passes, holiday buying and much more.

We have a great range of benefits in addition to the above that go beyond salary and offer flexibility to suit you;(all rewards and benefits are subject to change and eligibility). Please note, any salary estimates given on third-party sites are not provided or endorsed by Boots and may not be accurate.

Why Boots

We're always looking for people who care; people who go the extra mile to change things for the better. You'll be joining a company that is evolving and always looking to improve. We foster a working environment where consideration and inclusivity help everyone to be themselves and reach their full potential. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, passionate about embracing the diversity of our colleagues and providing a positive and inclusive working environment for all. As the heart of everything we do at Boots, it's with you, we can change for the better.

What's next

If your application is successful, our in-house recruitment team will be in touch to arrange an interview and to answer any initial questions you have. If you have not been successful on this occasion you will be notified by email.

We are always open to discussing possible flexible working options and what this may look like for you, including job share and reduced hours. If you require additional support as part of the application and interview process, we are happy to provide reasonable adjustments to help you to be at your best.

title: Project Manager
description:
Our Opportunity

Are you a Project Manager looking to take the next important step in your career?
Do you want to build on your experience and expand your project range?
Are you looking to work as part of a collaborative team, where you can produce a real impact?
If you answered yes to the above questions, this may be the role for you.

In this role, you will become an essential part of our Project Management team, helping to deliver a range of projects in the region.

As a leading construction consultancy, we are looking to recruit the very best talent to help us continue to deliver excellence on our 160+ year journey within the UK market.

You can expect to become involved in a range of exciting and challenging schemes across both the private and public sectors, including commercial, retail, residential, education, healthcare, regeneration and infrastructure.

Ideally you will have proven track record in delivering infrastructure projects specifically, ideally highways as these make up a great deal of upcoming projects.

This role provides an exciting opportunity to develop within growing dynamic team, supported by expertise across our multi-disciplinary consultancy.

Providing a balanced, enjoyable career is important to us, and we work hard to make sure everyone feels a valued part of our organisation. title: Project Manager
description:
Our Opportunity

Are you a Project Manager looking to take the next important step in your career?
Do you want to build on your experience and expand your project range?
Are you looking to work as part of a collaborative team, where you can produce a real impact?
If you answered yes to the above questions, this may be the role for you.
Pick Everard are looking to appoint an ambitious Project Manager for our growing Nottingham office.
In this role, you will become an essential part of our Project Management team, helping to deliver a range of projects in the region.

As a leading construction consultancy, we are looking to recruit the very best talent to help us continue to deliver excellence on our 160+ year journey within the UK market.

You can expect to become involved in a range of exciting and challenging schemes across both the private and public sectors, including commercial, retail, residential, education, healthcare, regeneration and infrastructure.

Ideally you will have proven track record in delivering infrastructure projects specifically, ideally highways as these make up a great deal of upcoming projects.

This role provides an exciting opportunity to develop within growing dynamic team, supported by expertise across our multi-disciplinary consultancy.

If you are looking to make your mark and achieve fast-track career development, then we want to hear from you.
We are proud to offer hybrid working, with a mixture of home, office and site, to promote a flexible work-life balance.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Agree and develop the client’s brief from inception in conjunction with any other consultants appointed
  • Co-ordinate, manage and communicate with the client, project stakeholders and other consultants appointed to meet requirements of the project, preparation of programmes and undertaking programme management
  • Undertake change management, co-ordinate the design process, oversee and manage the control of the project both pre- and post-contract including financial expenditure throughout all RIBA stages.
  • Co-ordinate and manage the development of the procurement strategy and procurement activities
  • Undertake and participate in risk-, value- and opportunities management, including facilitating workshops in order to ensure that these activities are controlled within the project team including contractors, sub-contractors, and the supply chain
  • Communicate and chair meetings with the client, their stakeholders, and contractors as necessary
  • Prepare and issue reports, including but not limited to preparation of Project Execution Plans (PEP), Strategy Reports, Risk Registers, Progress Reports etc.
  • Develop new business opportunities including leading and participating in the preparation and presentation of bids

About You

Key Requirements:
  • NEC accredited is ideal but as a minimum, well versed and experienced in administering NEC contracts
  • Experience in a similar role in the construction environment - Ideally within infrastructure, specifically highways
  • HNC, HND or a construction related degree is desirable
  • Member of a construction related professional body, such as RICS, CIOB, CIBSE, etc. is desirable
  • A comprehensive knowledge of building technology and construction principles
  • Have a good understanding of forms of building contract and experience of contract administration
  • Ability to control day to day programming and planning
  • Ability to monitor progress and expenditure of projects
  • Have a clear understanding of risk management including identification, management, mitigation and risk transfer
  • A good understanding of IT including Microsoft Word, Excel and Project
  • Bid writing and presentation skills

About Us

    At Pick Everard, we work together to make the extraordinary a reality. We are looking for exceptional new talent to be a part of our journey as we move forward through our ambitious five-year Business Plan.

    We are an independent award-winning property and construction consultancy firm, operating within the industry, providing complete integrated service delivery to help our clients deliver better solutions across real estate, infrastructure and the natural environment.

    We are at the forefront of the industry and enjoy a culture that is centered around being creative, professional, compassionate, client-oriented and fun.

    Our recent successes include:

    • Listed as an NCE100 Consultancy and AJ100 Practice
    • Named a Top 150 Consultancy by Building Magazine
    • Recognised as a leading Financial Times Consultancy
    • Winners of the Association of Consulting Engineers (ACE) Awards, Best Business Performance of the Year – Large Consultancy
    • Winners at the RICS Awards – Infrastructure category
    • An Investors in People and Investors in Excellence accredited business
    • Winners at the Enterprising Women Awards

    Through our remarkable history we have already established the sound principles of success and we have the vision and ambition to be even better, as we move forward into a very bright future. We’re growing and we need more experts onboard. Join us and we will provide you with an inspiring environment in which you’ll be able to drive real progress and impact in your career.

    To learn more about why it is good to work here please visit our website and follow us on social media. Be part of it.

    Remuneration and Benefits

    We value and promote a positive work-life balance and encourage every member of our team to get involved with charity, sports, community, and company events. Providing a balanced, enjoyable career is important to us, and we work hard to make sure everyone feels a valued part of our organisation. We are also a responsible employer and Investors in People accredited business.

    You will receive an attractive salary that will match your skills and experience, as well as the following benefits:

    • Hybrid working
    • Stakeholder pension
    • Life assurance
    • Private healthcare
    • 26 days’ annual leave + Bank Holidays + option to buy up to 5 days’ additional leave
    • Healthcare cashplan
    • Enhanced Maternity, Paternity and Childcare benefits
    • Enhanced Adoption & Shared Parental Leave benefits
    • Long service awards – including enhanced annual leave and vouchers
    • Annual Being PickEverard awards
    • Staff Discount Scheme
    • Spot Rewards
    • Professional subscriptions
    • Season ticket loan or car loan at senior level
    • Cycle to work scheme
    • Wellbeing support and Employee Assistance Programme

    Please note we do not accept speculative CVs or approaches from recruitment agencies.

    As an equal opportunities’ employer, Pick Everard is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership.

    We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join us on our journey.

    #LI-hybrid, #LI-BS1

title: Housing Officer
description:
What's involved with this role:
Temporary Homelessness Prevention Officer – Housing

Job Ref: Leicester TCL 0008 26AA / 1


Pay Rate: £17.42 per hour PAYE

Hours per week: 37 Monday – Friday, normal working hours

Role Length: This opening assignment is for 2-3 months, likely to be extended

City: Leicester

Hybrid working - days in the office, 3 days at home once trained. Will be more whilst training.

Standard DBS disclosure required for this role

The purpose of the role is to prevent and relieve homelessness in the city by assisting customers to either retain their present accommodation or by the provision of an alternative housing resolution and ensuring access to suitable housing for those in need in line with the Homelessness Strategy and relevant statutory legislation.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Provides an effective, professional and customer-friendly service on behalf of the council including offering a full range of advice on housing options and a comprehensive homelessness prevention service.

  • Manages a large, varied and complex caseload. Including handling the service’s more complex cases for example handling illegal eviction cases in the private sector, handling higher-profile / sensitive cases and managing referrals from other local authorities.

  • Undertakes assessment and investigation of homelessness approaches and applications in line with the council’s statutory duties under relevant statutory legislation, guidelines and case law.

  • Develops, updates and reviews personalised housing plans with customers, identifying actions that lead to customers retaining their current accommodation or securing new suitable accommodation.

  • Develops effective working relationships with colleagues, other council and statutory services, external bodies, service users, landlords as well as voluntary and other housing organisations and ensures effective sign-posting / referrals. Participates in partnership working including attendance at meetings as deputy portfolio lead.

  • Produces written correspondence including legal notification letters for statutory homeless applications and responses to councillor, MP enquiries and others.

  • Maintains accurate written and computer records, reports and other monitoring information as required and keep other records necessary to provide an adequate management information database.

  • Maintains a comprehensive awareness of relevant law and good practice and its application to the work of the service.

  • Mentors and supports lower-level officers and is a source of advice for the service in their identified area/s of expertise and / or where they are deputy portfolio lead. Includes occasionally providing training to groups of people.


NB: Please feel free to apply to us direct via jobs@tclrec.com by quoting the job reference and job title exactly.

To help speed up the process of uploading your CV to the client we would suggest that you send us your CV in Word format (or equivalent) if possible, rather than as a PDF.

If you are successful in securing this role, please note that for the entire duration of this contract, regardless of extension you will be working this role at the PAYE rate that has been advertised. For absolute clarity, we only work on a PAYE basis, rather than entertaining umbrella pay terms, we do not offer Ltd/umbrella or outside IR35 rates. If you wish to understand PAYE vs Umbrella more, please let us know and we can send you some additional information for clarity.
Please quote the Job Title & Vacancy Reference No. in your application, or we will be unable to match your CV to the role being applied for.




Other “Essential Requirements” – Please check to ensure that your CV addresses the following items:

Unless the DBS requirement stated above is for a Basic Disclosure, your DBS must be either through us or be accompanied by a subscription to the DBS updating service.


*** Qualification details and any other experience/skills relevant to the job role to help support your application (and help us to help you!) – please give full details within your CV document.

Experience:

  • Minimum of 12 months recent experience in a similar role, or context and ideally within a public sector organisation.

  • Experience of working with homeless clients.

  • Experience of carrying out interviews, investigations, negotiations.

  • Experience of managing a caseload.

  • Ability to assess a customer’s needs and abilities and write an appropriate personalised action plan that addresses the housing issues presented

  • Experience of interviewing and advising members of the public.


Knowledge:

  • Knowledge of all homelessness legislation, housing legislation, welfare benefit expertise and social care knowledge.

  • Knowledge of the 1996 Housing Act, the Homelessness Reduction Act 2017, the Children’s Act and the Care Act.

  • Knowledge in relation to 1-2 homelessness / homelessness prevention areas e.g. domestic violence, mental health, care leavers, 16- and 17-year-olds, offenders, private-rented sector, IT and data systems.

  • Strong awareness of current issues in the field of housing / homelessness.


Skills & Abilities:

  • High level of interpersonal, skills to deal with a range of customers and stakeholders including in conflict and sensitive situations.

  • Ability to interpret legislation and apply it to own caseload.

  • Ability to work independently to deadlines under pressure, be self-motivated and prioritise a demanding and complex workload.

  • Ability to gather information and interpret complex issues e.g. legislation and case law and think creatively about problems and identify solutions with time restraints.

  • Ability to represent the service effectively at partnership meetings.

  • Strong IT skills including Microsoft packages or equivalent (e.g. G Suite).



S Please note that clients invariably ask us to strip out contact details from CVs before we submit them for consideration. This is always quicker and easier to do if you send your CV to us in Word format, rather than as a PDF please

title: Water Quality Consultant
description:
Water Quality Consultant, SOCOTEC, Leicester

To support our ambitious growth plans, we have a great opportunity to join our Environment and Safety Division. SOCOTEC provides a comprehensive range of environmental monitoring and consultancy services to help companies fulfil their legal obligations and to comply with environmental regulations. Our expert field teams provide national coverage and tailored services including site investigation, sampling and analysis, monitoring, interpretation and consultancy. Our qualified and highly talented field consultants provide environmental analysis, environmental monitoring and consultancy services to assist clients in complying with legislation.


We’re looking for a skilled Water Quality Consultant to join our growing team and to manage a portfolio of sites across the Midlands.


Here at SOCOTEC, we deliver excellence to our customers by recruiting and retaining the very best industry talent. To be successful in this role, you will be able to demonstrate:


  • Carry out PPM’s on sites to ensure compliance with HSG 274 & AcoP L8
  • Closed System analysis and sampling
  • TMV Servicing
  • Cooling Tower analysis and reporting for weekly and monthly visits
  • Develop and maintain good relationships with clients
  • Up-keep of on-site logbooks and client liaisons


SOCOTEC is the UK's leading provider of testing, inspection and certification services. We offer an unrivalled range of technical expertise and services throughout the UK and worldwide. By joining us, you’ll be part of an 1,800+ strong team, where we will provide you with both the flexibility and a host of opportunities. We are committed to personal and professional development, and you will be supported and mentored at every step of your journey with us. You will join a large team of industry-leading, expert professionals and receive exposure to some of the best opportunities and challenges available.

As well as a competitive salary, we can offer you a wide range of benefits including, 25 days holiday with the opportunity to buy more. Where applicable we also offer an electric car scheme, employee recognition schemes, family friendly support, employee benefits and discounts app, employee assistance programmes and enhanced company pension.

Think you’ve got what it takes to add value to our success? We would love to hear from you and look forward to receiving your application.

Building a safer and more sustainable world is the core mission we set out to achieve at SOCOTEC, it is at the heart of everything that we do. We are committed to acting as a key player in society, investing in innovative solutions to ensure social and environmental concerns are at the forefront of all of our business operations.

title: Safety Manager
description:
Join Our Team as a Construction Health and Safety Manager and Make a Difference!


About Us: At Adler and Allan Group, we're not just a company - we're environmental champions committed to protecting our planet while helping businesses thrive. We're a diverse, dynamic team dedicated to providing top-tier environmental and energy infrastructure services across the UK. Our mission is clear: safeguarding the environment, minimizing operational disruptions, and supporting sustainability goals for our valued clients.


What makes us a great employer?


  • Purpose-Driven Impact:     As a construction Health and Safety Manager, you'll play a pivotal role in providing a visible and robust senior health and safety presence. You will positively challenge, advise, support, coach, and mentor key stakeholders to aspire health and safety excellence.
  • Growth and Development: Join an ambitious team that values your growth. We offer extensive training, career advancement opportunities, and a chance to expand your skill set.
  • Wellness and Support: We care about your well-being. Enjoy life assurance, unlimited access to our mental health support and Medicash, our health care cash plan for you and up to four dependants.
  • Dynamic Culture: Our workplace is more than just a job - it's a community. Experience a fun, can-do culture where your contributions matter.
  • Benefits Package- Competitive salary, enhanced maternity & paternity leave and pay, private pension, internal referral scheme & learning and development funded courses. This position also comes along with a company car/ car allowance.


Your Responsibilities:


  • Provide expert technical knowledge to Managers to enable compliance of all aspects of Health and Safety primarily relating to civils, construction and maintenance projects.
  • Facilitate the implementation of policies and procedures which help reduce risk and support a positive H&S culture.
  • Monitor, report and support project managers and managers to ensure full compliance is met with relating to key duties under the CDM2015 regulations.
  • Support project managers and managers to ensure construction sites are established and welfare provisions are compliant with all current regulations and standards.
  • Undertake visits to civils and construction sites to monitor performance and feedback results along with advice and solutions for any non-conformances identified.
  • Develop and promote positive working relations with all key customers i.e. project management teams, General Managers, work crews as well as external stakeholders.
  • Ensure that civils and construction projects undertake regular planning and engagement workshops with site management teams and the work crews themselves.
  • Assist project managers & supervisors in preparing RAMS and briefing workers and ensure that they are reviewed and updated at regular intervals.
  • Where appropriate, for example planned high risk work projects, support project management teams with client and project pre-start workshops so as to ensure that the works are planned and will be executed safely prior to commencing on site.
  • Where working practices pose a significant risk to health, safety or the environment ensure that the unsafe operation is stopped and inform project and senior operational management immediately.
  • Ensure appropriate support, advice and assistance is offered at all times and work with the project managers, site supervisors and work crews to ensure that any necessary remedial actions are implemented effectively and timely.
  • Promptly investigate all health, safety and environmental incidents as required by company policies, in accordance with company guidance and timescales. Make known to all relevant parties any significant findings/recommendations and ensure lessons learnt/alerts are captured, developed and communicated effectively throughout the business.
  • Assist project managers, supervisors and senior management in closing out all incident investigations promptly and completely and work closely with such people to ensure all investigation recommendations are implemented.
  • Monitor the civils and construction crews and work with them where appropriate to ensure that all staff, including office-based personnel, receive appropriate H&S training and information.
  • Maintain a working knowledge of all relevant H&S standards, policies, procedures and guidance to a level which will allow you to guide and support depots and work crews in their effective implementation.
  • To be individually responsible for professional and personal development. This will include but not be limited to; appropriate internal and external research and learning, continuous professional development and taking on the role of 'Champion' for at least 1 H&S topic.
  • Develop and deliver suitable training courses for staff to ensure we remain compliant with current legislation and industry best practice.


Qualifications and Skills:

  • Evidence of experience and success in leading and implementing Health and Safety strategies in delivery of construction and civils projects, which involve cultural and organisational redesign to raise standards and achieve corporate goals.
  • You will demonstrate effective communication and be able to engage positively and proactively at all levels of the business.
  • It is essential the Constructions Health & Safety Manager has a strong behavioural H&S background and experience of cultural change management, not afraid of a challenge and continually demonstrates a 'hands on' approach.
  • Due to the regional nature of the role and group structure, the you will be required to travel and work and stay away from home overnight; due to the travel required, you must possess a clean UK driving licence.


Why Choose Adler and Allan: By becoming a part of the Adler and Allan Group, you'll embark on a rewarding journey where we truly value your ideas and contributions. Whether you're just starting your career or in search of a new challenge, we offer a platform for personal growth and professional advancement, enabling you to shape a successful and fulfilling career path. Our group includes Jet Aire, Detectronic, Aqua Consultants, Oneline, Flotech, KwikFlow, AMGS, and OHES.

title: Geotechnical Engineer
description:
RSK Geosciences an RSK Group company are recruiting for a Geotechnical Engineer to join the team based in Coventry, UK. This is a full-time, permanent position.

The Geosciences team delivers consultancy and design services to a wide range of external clients including engineers, house-builders, oil companies and local authorities. RSK is committed to ED&I and prides itself on offering staff a rewarding and challenging career, encouraging Continuous Professional Development and allowing them to reach their full potential.

Responsibilities:

  • Completing and managing geotechnical projects from cradle to grave including desk studies and ground investigation phases, through to the production of interpretive reports, planning & design advice, detailed design and specification, works supervision and verification.
  • Design, supervision and management of ground investigation and construction works.
  • Earthworks materials assessment, design, specification, supervision and verification.
  • Technical review of desk study, ground investigation reports and associated documents and/or geotechnical design reports (PSSR,GIR/GDR/GFR), basement impact assessments, earthworks specifications etc.

Qualifications and Experience:

  • BSc / Beng degree level qualified in Geology, Engineering Geology, Geotechnics or Civil Engineering
  • MSc in Engineering Geology/Geotechnical Engineering or related subjects preferable but not essential
  • Experience of supervising intrusive site investigations desirable however training can be given
  • Knowledge of SHEQ issues affecting site works
  • Candidates must be willing to spend a significant amount of their working day out on site and away from home
  • Full UK driving licence

Salary and Benefits:

  • Commensurate with experience
  • Contributory Pension Scheme
  • Free life assurance cover
  • A flexible benefits programme including the option to buy additional holidays, private health care, ride to work, electric car leasing, flexitime, hybrid working, favourable gym membership discounts and other benefits.
  • We encourage Continuing Professional Development and, as a Registered Practice with the Geological Society or Institute of Civil Engineers, we are committed to supporting candidates along the pathway to Chartership.

#Engineering #recruitment #RSKfamily

Full Job Description attached

RSK will not accept unsolicited CVs from agencies other than RSK PSL or Secondary agencies.


We are a market-leading site investigation, contaminated land and geotechnical consultancy with geophysics and survey teams and waste management consultants, operating from 20 UK locations. Our company also includes Leap Environmental, an award-winning site investigation, geotechnical design and geoenvironmental consultancy and Carbon Zero Consulting, which undertakes appraisals for ground source heat projects.

Throughout our 30 years of operations, we have enabled our clients to realise opportunities and manage the potential liabilities associated with acquiring, owning, operating and developing land. Our clients come from the public and private sectors, including many of the UK’s leading property developers, major and local house builders, utility providers and main contractors, local authorities and other government organisations.

RSK Geosciences is part of the RSK Group, a leading integrated environmental, engineering and technical services business providing dynamic, multidisciplinary services to broad-ranging sectors. Founded in 1989, RSK has evolved into a market-leading organisation. It is headquartered in the UK and has an established presence across Europe, the Middle East, Asia, Africa and Australasia. The group is growing fast thanks to its diverse operations, entrepreneurial spirit and open management style. When you join RSK, you are connecting to a growing community of experts and specialists who regularly collaborate to deliver projects and support each other across business units.

title: Nursery Nurse
description:
Location:
Coventry

Industry:
Early Years

Salary:
£9.50 - £13.50 per hour

Reference:
0000189673_1705507904

Contact name:
Aspire People Limited

Contact email:
lisan@aspirepeople.co.uk

Job description

Are you a Level 3 qualified Early Years Practitioner looking for a part time and full time work in Coventry?

Aspire People are work with a large nursery group based in Coventry. We are looking for a bank of Level 3 or above nursery practitioners to work on weekly a shift pattern, working part time and full time hours, Monday to Friday across all sites.

Your experience working with children aged 0 - 5 years will allow you to provide the necessary support to help them reach their full potential in this important foundation stage.

The successful applicant will have.
  • Level 3 or above qualification in Early Years or Childcare (or equivalent)
  • Paediatric First aid certificate - training course can be provided if you haven't got
  • Experience working in an Early Years setting.
  • Clean DBS on the update (or be able to pay for one)
  • References from past employers
  • A kind and caring nature
  • Strong Knowledge of the EYFS framework and ability to plan for and track progress of key children.

While working closely with these nurseries, every single one of my candidates commented on what a lovely place it was to work and how welcoming the team are.

Why Aspire People?
  • As one of the largest Midlands-based education recruitment agencies, specialising in placing teaching and associated staff into the Nursery, SEND, Primary & Secondary sectors, you will be supported by dedicated consultant.
  • Competitive rates of pay.
  • Holiday pay
  • Safeguarding training and Paediatric first aid training
  • £100 after working with Aspire People for 10 days.
  • Recommend a friend scheme.

Aspire People Limited provides services as an Education Agency and an Education Employment Business. Aspire People is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of pupils and expects every candidate to share this commitment. Placements are subject, to appropriate Child Protection screening, including checks with former employers and the Disclosure and Barring Checks.

Lisa Newman

Birmingham & Black Country Early Years Consultant

title: Community Nurse
description:
Posted 17 January 2024 by Reece

Hallam Medical has an opportunity for experienced Community Nurses to support an integrated community team in Melton Mowbray.

This opportunity offers excellent rates of pay.

This is a great opportunity for NMC registered Community Nurses looking for locum work to join the Community Team in Charnwood Mill.

As a member of the team, you will oversee a caseload of patients and provide high quality nursing care within the community across Leicestershire to prevent hospital admission. We are looking for Community Nurses (RGN) who can confidently carry out all standard community nursing duties; this includes Palliative Care, Syringe drivers, Wound Care, Compression Bandages, Medication administration, Insulins, and Catheterisation.

This is a community-based service, so it is essential that you are a car driver and have access to your own vehicle.

To apply for this role:

  • NMC Registered
  • Full UK driving licence
  • Confident in carry out all standard community nursing duties
  • A minimum of 6 months UK Community Nursing experience

This opportunity offers:

  • Immediate start
  • Ongoing support with additional skills, training and development
  • Monday to Friday shifts from 08:00am to 16:00
  • Dedicated Consultant 24/7
  • Fantastic Refer a Friend scheme
  • Access to the latest news to emerge from Community Nursing through our partnership with the QNI
  • Excellent rates of pay!

What Hallam Medical can offer you:

  • Flexible shift patterns
  • DBS application support
  • FREE revalidation E-Portfolio
  • FREE Smartcard
  • FREE mandatory training
  • Access to educational support
  • A dedicated consultant available 24/7
  • Fantastic ‘Refer a Friend’ scheme
  • Clinical support
  • Access to a National Network

description:
Posted 17 January 2024 by Reece

Hallam Medical has an opportunity for experienced Community Nurses to support an integrated community team in Hinckley.

This opportunity offers excellent rates of pay.

This is a great opportunity for NMC registered Community Nurses looking for locum work to join the Community Team in Charnwood Mill.

As a member of the team, you will oversee a caseload of patients and provide high quality nursing care within the community across Leicestershire to prevent hospital admission. We are looking for Community Nurses (RGN) who can confidently carry out all standard community nursing duties; this includes Palliative Care, Syringe drivers, Wound Care, Compression Bandages, Medication administration, Insulins, and Catheterisation.

This is a community-based service, so it is essential that you are a car driver and have access to your own vehicle.

To apply for this role:

title: Administrator
description:
Join this well-regarded specialist Pensions Administration firm who are looking for a pensions administrator to manage a mixed portfolio of SIPP / SSAS schemes.

The company has vast experience of providing Small Self-Administered Schemes (SSAS) and Self Invested Personal Pensions (SIPP), and proud to be an independent trustee who offer their own SSAS and SIPP plans.

About You

You will have some experience of Pension administration and demonstrate the following core competencies:

  • Desire to improve skills and knowledge of the industry
  • Good personal organisational skills with the ability to prioritise their own workload
  • Proactive, enthusiastic and driven approach
  • Analytical with good attention to detail
  • Works well under pressure
  • Ability to work to prescribed deadlines
  • Clear concise communication skills at all levels
  • A positive attitude to client care

The Package

  • Competitive salary, depending on experience.
  • Group Pension scheme.
  • Employee Assistance Programme.
  • 25 days holiday plus Bank Holiday.
  • 4 x Death in Service.

The Role and Responsibilities

Responsible for the day-to-day administration of a portfolio of SSAS schemes under the guidance of a Team Manager, Head of Pension Administration and other Senior Managers. Responsibilities include:

  • Electronic filing; telephone call recording; keeping the database up to date; transaction / asset entry; effective use of Worklog to manage workflow / work priorities
  • Processing all investment types in full, from cash investments to complex property purchases (including VAT; borrowing) / loan backs and everything in between
  • Establishing New Schemes – File set up (electronic & paper); inputting of scheme onto the database; registering scheme with HMRC; establishing bank account; registering with ICO/Pensions Regulator
  • Pension Regulator Registrations, Renewals & Returns
  • Drafting scheme specific Deeds (from Templates)
  • Legal Entity Identifier – registrations and renewals
  • Attendance at client meetings where necessary
  • Benefit Calculations / Payment of PCLS & Death Benefits. Transfers In / Out
  • Scheme Wind Up / Loss to Another Provider
  • SSAS Takeovers – dealing with all aspects
  • Submitting HMRC Pension Scheme Returns
  • Customer Service – effective communication with clients / IFA’s / solicitors / accountants / HMRC / investment providers and other professional connections and colleagues
  • Sound knowledge of existing pensions legislation as it applies to SSAS’s
  • Awareness of and compliance with GDPR and AML requirements
  • Assisting Team Manager and other Team Colleagues as required with annual leave cover

Administration of SIPPs

  • Work closely with the SIPP Team Leader, Management and Financial Consultants to deliver the highest possible standard of service to clients and their advisers
  • Ensure that all relevant work received is recorded in the SIPP Pro Worklog using the appropriate task types. Update the system using appropriate notes to reflect the work undertaken and when the task is complete update accordingly
  • Process contributions and transfers into existing SIPPs
  • Monitor SIPP bank accounts to ensure that funds are invested when necessary and that sufficient cash is retained to pay fees, adviser remuneration and income payments
  • Process new investments ensuring that they are approved and permitted investments
  • Arrange surrenders of investments where appropriate
  • Assist team members to undertake property and land purchases
  • Ensuring that rent reviews, lease expiries and insurance renewals are dealt
  • Prepare drawdown calculations in accordance with internal procedures and guidelines
  • Prepare SIPP asset valuations
  • Administer a small scheme allocation with guidance to aid progression
  • Attend regular team meetings and contribute feedback and ideas
  • Ensure that tasks personally allocated on the SIPP Pro Worklog are monitored and updated

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £24,000.00-£27,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • pension administration: 1 year (preferred)

Work Location: In person

Reference ID: JR-1842

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
JOB TITLE: Area Sales Manager
LOCATION: Leicester
SALARY: Guarantee earnings of £60K for First Year
Realistic Year Two earnings of £100K (uncapped)

The COMPANY
Our client is a very well-established nationwide provider of business-critical services to thousands of SME organisations all over the UK for over 75 years. Our client is one of the UK's leading businesses in their field with 130,000 clients worldwide, and have one of the best trained and rewarded staff in the industry. They are currently looking for an experienced Field Sales Executive.
The ROLE
The successful Field Sales Executive will be required to do the following:

  • Take a consultative approach to sales, providing each Client with a solution that matches their specific requirements.
  • Attend sales appointments made for y by your telemarketing partner.
  • Self-generate new leads from a combination of networking, referrals and cold calling.
  • Thrive on working in a fast paced, target focused high energy and high reward culture.
  • You will receive world class training with a four-week induction programme.

CANDIDATE
Our client is looking for a strong Area Sales Manager with the following experience and attributes:

  • B2B field sales experience.
  • Understand a consultative sales process.
  • Ambitious and entrepreneurial.
  • Experience of self-generating your own leads.
  • Used to selling to SME's.
  • A good closer.
  • Excellent communication skills and highly organised.
  • A full driving licence.

This role is commutable from:
Northampton
Kettering
Corby
Wellingborough

ALTERNATIVE JOB TITLES: Business Development Manager, Sales Executive, Field Sales Account Manager, Field Sales Consultant, Field Sales Executive, Sales, Field Sales Manager, Field Sales Rep, Field Sales Executive, Technical Sales, Area Sales, Area Manager, Senior Sales Executive, Senior Sales Consultant, B2B Sales, Business to Business Sales.
INCAL1

Mana Resourcing is a specialist recruitment company working within the Engineering, Sales, IT and Commercial sectors. We are established to service and support the recruitment requirements of modern businesses and candidates alike. This particular role includes people with experience in Business Development Manager, Sales Executive, Field Sales Account Manager, Field Sales Consultant, Field Sales Executive, Sales, Field Sales Manager, Field Sales Rep, Field Sales Executive, Technical Sales, Area Sales, Area Manager, Senior Sales Executive, Senior Sales Consultant, B2B Sales, Business to Business Sales.

title: Client Services Coordinator
description:
Client Service Coordinator
Location: Coventry
Salary: £30,000 - £40,000, depending on experience.

  • Do you like organising and coordinating tasks, people and things?
  • Are you good at communicating in a clear and friendly way?
  • Do you like to find ways to make things more efficient?
  • Do you enjoy following things up and seeing them through to completion?

A Client Service Coordinator role at Oldfield might be for you….

What does the job involve?

The role of Client Service Coordinator is to provide administrative support to a team of accountants, consultants or tax advisers by managing their schedule of work to be done; liaising with and following up clients to get the information we need; liaising with clients to schedule meetings; and holding your team accountable to get the work completed.

Your role is to enable those in your team to deliver their work efficiently and within budget, and in a way that gives the client a great experience, so the team and the firm hit their fee targets.

Client Service Coordinator - What does success look like in this role?

When you’re succeeding in this role, you’ll be excelling at proactively planning ahead and
coordinating the workflow of your team so the right jobs come in at the right time, and the
team have the right information from clients to complete their work efficiently, accurately and
within budget. You’re following up all outstanding jobs rigorously with clients and with the
team. In short, you’ll be making sure the cogs in your team are running smoothly, so there are no roadblocks, and client and statutory deadlines are met, and clients receive an excellent experience.

Client Service Coordinator - Attractive benefits & perks

  • Generous base salary - £30,000 - £40,000, subject to experience.
  • Company car or car allowance option (after qualifying period in the role).
  • Free quality lunch provided each day
  • 30 Days Holiday (incl. bank holidays).
  • Flexible working hours
  • Team Bonus
  • Medical insurance (after qualifying period in the role)
  • Reward Lunches
  • Team Building days
  • Young and vibrant team
  • Excellent career progression

Testimonials from recent starters:

“For me personally, the best thing about working at Oldfield Advisory is the sense of satisfaction you can have in being able to help, assist and support a wide variety of clients and businesses in their financial affairs. You can play an active role in growing profitability of your clients by providing meaningful information to improve the effectiveness of management decisions.”

“Working as an accountant at Oldfield, I have found the work to be very rewarding and meaningful. There is plenty of scope to learn and progress, alongside doing valuable work for clients and building strong professional relationships with other businesses.”

“There is a lot of variety in the job which keeps it engaging and satisfying.

The management’s care for the staff is second to none, recognition is generous and support throughout the career is excellent.

We have an inspiring set of values and an awesome team, creating a quality culture and atmosphere".

Job Type: Permanent

Salary: £30,000.00-£40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Free parking
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

  • Bonus scheme

Work Location: In person

Job description

Are you a Qualified Teacher looking for work?

We are currently recruiting Teachers for temporary supply cover & long term roles in Nuneaton. This could be full time or part time on a flexible day to day basis or one of our long-term vacancies. We have built up great relationships with our schools and hope to continue building this by supplying dedicated individuals who will support their ongoing development. Our schools are looking for patient and caring individuals who have a passion for teaching. Aspire People is dedicated to helping improve the education of children. It is a priority of ours to not only support our schools by providing them with hardworking high-quality teachers, but I will make it a priority to get to know you & your teaching carer so far to help find exactly what you want to do.

As a supply teacher you will help us to support many of the local schools we work with, for many years we have supplied to Primary schools in Coventry & Warwickshire. Our schools are looking for positive and enthusiastic staff who want the best for their classroom.

To become a Supply Teacher with Aspire you will need:
  • UK QTS/ECT
  • Relevant Teaching experience with a thorough knowledge of the EYFS to Y6 curriculum
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Flexible & positive attitude to working
  • Commitment & determination to raise standards
  • Clear DBS
  • Provide References

Benefits of working with Aspire:
  • Dedicated consultant service 24/7
  • Joining Bonus of £100 once you have worked 10 shifts
  • Referral Fee if you refer a friend (Teacher/Teaching Assistant)
  • Holiday Scheme
  • Get paid to scale
  • Access to short-term/long-term, teaching, and non-teaching roles within local schools.

I continue to see the positive change flexible working can provide to many people. Not only does it allow you to do a job you love on the days that suits you. It also supports the continued growth and development of the local schools.
I am very keen to talk to candidates who are interested in working with Aspire People in schools in Nuneaton starting immediately or in September 2023.

If you are interested and would like further information please apply or call 02476998525 and ask for Paige.

Aspire People Limited provides services as an Education Agency and an Education Employment Business. Aspire People is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of pupils and expects every candidate to share this commitment. Placements are subject, to appropriate Child Protection screening, including checks with former employers and the Disclosure and Barring Checks.

title: Surveyor
description:
Asbestos Surveyor / Consultant

Oracle Solutions is currently looking for a number of highly motivated individuals to join our team of Asbestos Surveyors. We believe in the power of personal and professional growth, and we are committed to supporting our employees on their journey of learning and development. In return for your hard work and dedication, the below is what you can expect as a new team member:

  • Up to 33 days annual leave
  • £2500 joining bonus
  • Up to £40,000 per year
  • Additional leave and benefits scheme
  • Work-from-home opportunity based on business needs
  • Flexible working hours opportunities based on business needs
  • Company car
  • Company events and social
  • Company pension
  • Health & wellbeing programme
  • On-site parking
  • Referral programme
  • Additional training where required

The Role:

  • Conduct comprehensive asbestos surveys in various residential and commercial properties, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements using TEAMS software.
  • Collect samples, perform visual inspections, and accurately record data to assess the presence and condition of asbestos-containing materials.
  • Competent & accurate completion of lab paperwork including Bulk Samples posted in a timely manner.
  • Deliver all asbestos services to the highest standards as set out in current and relevant HSE legislation, in line with UKAS accreditation and company procedural documentation.
  • Personal growth where required in all areas for full competency and certification in all areas of the consultancy job role as outlined within this job description.
  • Contribute to a positive and inclusive work environment by actively participating in team meetings, sharing knowledge with trainees, and supporting colleagues.
  • Pay: Up to £40,000 per year - dependant on experience and qualifications.

As well as the usual asbestos surveying, we also offer the opportunity to grow by giving you the chance to deliver asbestos training, asbestos-contaminated land services, asbestos management, asbestos removal management, and generally working with our clients on all things asbestos.

Requirements:

  • Previous minimum 12 months experience working as an Asbestos Surveyor for a UKAS accredited company.
  • Certifications and qualifications in asbestos surveying - P402 is essential. Any other asbestos modules would be a benefit.
  • A Strong understanding of asbestos-related regulations, guidelines, and best practices.
  • Effective communication skills to be able to interact with clients, contractors, and team members.
  • Flexibility to travel to client’s premises to undertake required Asbestos Services.
  • Clean, UK driving License.

The Company

We have been in the asbestos and associated industries for more than 15 years and are a team of more than 50 asbestos professionals. Oracle is accredited, licensed, and certified to the highest level. Those that run and manage the company are the team members that have helped build it. Every Director and Senior Manager at Oracle Asbestos has been promoted from within. If you are a motivated individual with a passion for learning and growth in the field of asbestos surveying, we invite you to join our team.

If you are a motivated individual with a passion for learning and growth in the field of asbestos surveying, we would like to hear from you!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Up to £40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Additional leave
  • Company car
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Free parking
  • Health & wellbeing programme
  • On-site parking
  • Referral programme
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Flexitime
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)
  • P402 Qualification (required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Civil Engineer
description:
The Civil and Structural Engineering Team at Uniper Technologies are working on varied and exciting new projects and as such want to expand and enhance its capabilities. Projects range from feasibility studies and front end engineering design for green hydrogen facilities and new combined cycle gas fired power plant fitted with carbon capture and storage to decommissioning and demolition works of existing assets. This role will play a significant contribution to assisting Uniper to achieve its Zero Carbon future.


We are Uniper


At Uniper, we are pro-actively transforming the world of energy whilst at the same time ensuring security of energy supply. As an internationally operating company, we work in very diverse teams with the greatest possible working time flexibility for our employees. Our corporate culture is characterized by equal opportunities, mutual appreciation, and respect. With us, you will be able to develop new business models, work on technological solutions for a modern, sustainable, and future-oriented energy supply as well as pro-actively help to shape changes. Interested? Then we will look forward to meeting you!


Your responsibilities


  • We are looking for you to bolster and enhance the teams design, project management and consultancy capability by bringing your Civil / Structural engineering skills onboard.
  • You will join as part of a fast moving team, and will work on varied and interesting projects involving a selection of both office based activities and occasional site based working.
  • You will enjoy the variety that very few roles can offer including, site investigations, project development through the design and tendering phases and providing technical support during the construction of new power stations and low carbon facilities.
  • You may also have the opportunity to apply your knowledge of structures and structural design to existing gas fired power stations, where you would undertake structural appraisalsinspection of structures and assist with either assessing the condition of the asset or be involved with plant modifications or major repairs.
  • You may also have the opportunity to apply your knowledge of structures and structural design to existing gas fired power stations, where you would undertake structural appraisals and assist with either assessing the condition of the asset or be involved with plant modifications or major repairs.
  • Your goals will be to deliver engineering solutions safely, on time and to budget that meet the evolving needs of our customers.


Current Projects
Some current projects to give an idea of the scope involve a number of new power generation plant developments ranging from new biomass boilers to green hydrogen plant front end engineering design studies, feasibility studies for retrofitting carbon capture and storage on an existing plant. In addition, there is the potential to support the operation and maintenance of a wide range of power generating plant including gas and coal fired power stations, wind turbines and energy from waste plants. As such the work tends to be highly diverse, interesting, and therefore requires a broad range of civil and structural engineering skills and experience.


Your profile


  • Chartered Engineer ( MICE or MIStructE).
  • Demonstrable experience within Civil/Structural Engineering and with a broad design background in the design of steel and reinforced concrete structures.
  • Proven experience in developing projects from concept through to detailed design stage.
  • Ability to produce technical specifications and scope of work documents.
  • You will possess excellent analytical skills and be able to identify design improvements at all stages of project development.
  • Ability to clearly communicate to both design engineers and project directors on technical matters in a written form and verbally.
  • Project management experience and ability to manage others both internally and external consultants. Manage time and budgets and be able to critically identify areas which require improvement.
  • Experience of design software such as TEDDS, Trimble Structural, STAAD Pro, or similar design packages and competent with the Microsoft Office suite and AutoCAD.
  • Full Driving License is required, along with willingness to travel to customer sites throughout the UK.
  • Hybrid working with two to three days per week in the Nottingham office


Desirable:
  • Experience in large industrial projects, with experience in either the Petrochemicals or Power Generation.
  • Experience of being involved with project development, undertaking the Owners Engineer role and the design of medium sized industrial buildings would be beneficial.
  • Ability to produce well written technical reports based on site inspections on a range of structural forms and ages.


Your qualities


At Uniper, we not only reward our employees with attractive salaries, an excellent company pension and health related benefits for their hard work and dedication to shaping the future energy transition. You can also expect a supportive working culture that offers a wide range of creative and innovative ideas. We enable various flexible working arrangements, whilst also supporting with home office equipment.
Through regular training and workshops, together we work towards visualising yourself in our company as if it were your own. We support you in highlighting your individual potential, achieving your personal goals, and reaching your ambitions. We invite you to become part of our diverse company with international colleagues from more than 80 countries. As an employer, Uniper has committed itself to providing special support to certain areas:
  • Competitive salary
  • Personal development and Learning opportunities
  • Enhanced company pension – With up to 12% company contributions
  • 26 days annual leave plus Bank Holidays
  • Free electric vehicle charging at our sites
  • In house Occupational Health Services
  • Company funded Private Medical Insurance including free GP service
  • Performance related benefits
  • Access to a range of flexible benefits such as Share Incentive Plan, Dental, Critical Illness and Life Insurance, Cycle2Work, Health Care Cash plan or buy and sell extra holiday
  • Future career opportunities (UK & International) with a strong focus on Diversity Equity and Inclusion


Our employees are the reason for our success. Therefore, you will find many other benefits at the local level to help you reach your potential. Energy evolutionary wanted!


Your contact


Should you have any questions about this opportunity, please contact the UK Talent Acquisition Manager

dominic.lindsey@uniper.energy


Please note, any CV’s sent via email would not be taken into consideration. All CV’s must be submitted via the online application process only.


Job information


Contract type:
Unlimited

Working Hours:
Full time

Start Date:
ASAP

Deadline:

Salary:
£55,000 to £65,000


As an employer, Uniper is committed to diversity and equal opportunities. Therefore, we encourage applications from suitably qualified individuals whose capabilities match the role requirements regardless of gender, origin, disability, age, religion, ideology, sexual identity or marital status. We live inclusion and support flexible working.

title: Land Manager
description:
From the commitment we pour into our homes, to the belief we bring to supporting amazing careers, a role at Persimmon is a springboard for Building Your New Possible. Discover new opportunities to grow, learn new skills and release your potential.

We’re Persimmon Homes, a FTSE 250 listed company and a leading UK house builder serving local communities across the UK and delivering around 10,000 homes a year. We have 29 operating businesses in England, Wales and Scotland, three house-building brands and three off-site manufacturing facilities.

We’re looking for people like you, and this could be your opportunity to start Building Your New Possible.

What is the role?

This is an exciting opportunity for a Senior Land Manager to join the Strategic Land Team at Persimmon Homes.

Reporting to the Group Strategic Land Director, the successful candidate will have experience in identifying and securing new strategic land opportunities. This position would suit someone who is ambitious and looking to take a step towards a Strategic Land Director position. You will have a thorough understanding of the planning system and be suitably experienced in dealing with land contracts. You will be experienced in identifying, resourcing, securing and realising the potential of strategic land under option or promotion contract. A proven negotiator, you are able to build and develop relationships with key players and organisations. You will understand our corporate vision and be instrumental in ensuring our values are upheld.

The role will include:

  • Responsible for the identification and acquisition of quality strategic land opportunities.
  • Develop relationships with land agents and landowners to help promote Persimmon as an effective development partner.
  • Ensure we build and foster relationships with public sector bodies ensuring the company maintains a competitive edge.
  • Develop effective planning and land strategies to ensure our sites are optimally promoted and the value of our strategic sites are maximised.
  • Lead and motivate the strategic land team in ensuring strategic land opportunities are actioned swiftly so to maintain the highest standards of success.
  • Work alongside the operational company Managing Directors, Land Directors and Group Land team in delivering a clear and deliverable pipeline of new strategic opportunities.
  • Take budgetary control for strategic land sites.

What we need from you?

  • Experience is essential working for either a housebuilder or land promoter in a strategic land capacity.
  • Understanding of the financial and legal aspects of strategic land.
  • Excellent knowledge of the Midlands area and good relationships with land agents, landowners, planning consultants, lawyers and local authorities.
  • Full UK Driving Licence

What’s in it for you?

Salary and benefits package

  • Competitive Salary (DOE)
  • Company Car/Car Allowance
  • Pension
  • Life Assurance
  • Bonus
  • Health Care

Persimmon has a Hybrid Working Policy for core roles in the business allowing staff on completion of probation to apply for home working up to 2/3 days per week.

When you join us, the future is yours to explore. You can realise your full potential through industry-leading training and clearly signposted career paths. Persimmon is where hard graft and team spirit means real variety, satisfaction and rewards. A place where you can be at your best, and even go beyond what you thought you were capable of. If this sounds like the place for you, apply today and start Building Your New Possible.

Persimmon are Proud Sponsors of Team GB

No Agencies please – Persimmon will not accept speculative CVs as a means of introduction

Persimmon is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to encouraging equality, diversity and inclusion among our workforce and eliminating unlawful discrimination.

Our aim is for our workforce to be truly representative of all sections of society and our customers, and for each employee to feel respected and able to give their best.

If you have any questions about the job or application process please contact us at talentacquisition@persimmonhomes.com

title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Recruitment Consultant

Temp desk

Why This Role? – Recruitment Consultant:

· Market leading highly reputed recruitment brand.

· First class automation / IT systems / great back-office support.

· A very consultative environment- quite simply grown-up recruitment.

· Salary to £35k + open ended bonus scheme huge OTE potential.

· Progression / career development clearly mapped out.

· A great team environment – a business with clear values and goals.

· The tools to do the job, great brand, first class Infrastructure and support.

· A genuine market leader in what they do.

· Client management, development, candidate attraction, Account management.

title: Education Consultant
description:
Senior Recruitment Consultant - Education

Nottingham

Competitive salary based on experience

Operam Education Group is an award winning Education agency, with 7 brands already under the umbrella, our growth plans for further acquisitions are really exciting. It’s now that we are growing our teams to continue on our journey as we welcome Provision Education into the portfolio. Specialists in Further Education, we are excited to expand our service offering in the Sector.

We are a Best Companies award winning business genuinely focused on our employee’s wellbeing, development and skills, which in turn has a positive impact on the schools and candidates we support. We believe in supporting people to go beyond their expectations, with hard work not going unnoticed.

We offer amazing benefits such as reduced hours in school holidays, your birthday off and CPD support to only name a few!

We’re looking for an enthusiastic Recruitment Consultant who is looking for a rewarding career in Education recruitment. You will support the expected culture aligned with legislation, company values and achieving success in line with target requirements… this all sounds exciting, but most importantly we want you to have fun whilst doing it.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES – Recruitment Consultant

· Resource relevant candidates for your clients and forward plan ensuring that you have enough candidates of various disciplines to support your desk pipeline

· Proactive Business Development and Account Management with candidates, potential talent and clients/Schools

· Ensure the full process of compliance and onboarding is actioned including management of clients/candidate timesheets, ‘Right to Work’, safeguarding, screening etc

· Achieve results with your productivity and sales targets for an exceptional fulfilment rate of candidate and client service levels

· Keep up to date on relevant legislation, competitors, and local knowledge

· Adhere to standards and processes related to compliance and Safer Recruitment Practices

· Report to Managers on improvements, findings, and terminated contracts monthly

· Manage complaints according to company policy and deliver any feedback to both schools and candidates in a professional and effective way

· Adhere to company policies, procedures, and work protocols at all times

· Attend events and site visits when required

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE – Recruitment Consultant

· Previous experience in a Recruitment role would be desired

· Have knowledge of the education sector, understanding regulated requirements including safeguarding & DBS policy and procedures

· Experience in Sales or Customer Service environment is essential

· Effective time management, multitasking and workload management skills, with the ability to work towards set goals, targets and meet deadlines.

· Excellent rapport building

· Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the confidence to communicate through various platforms; email, phone, technology, online

· Strong presentation skills

BENEFITS

  • Competitive salary
  • Reward & recognition scheme, inc. Uncapped commission
  • Eye care scheme
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • 25 days holidays + bank holidays
  • Extra day off on your birthday
  • Pledge days
  • Flexible/reduced hours during summer holidays
  • Training and development opportunities via our Career pathways

We look forward to your application.

If you would like any further information, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us, we would love to have a chat with you. Please email careers@operam-education.co.uk .

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £20,000.00-£25,000.00 per year
