title: Tax Director
description:
• Join a leading, fast growing independent with a clear director pathway
  • Head up the tax function across Nottingham

About Our Client

Joining a leading firm with offices across the wider Midlands region and London as an Associate Tax Director with a clear pathway to Director.

You will be part of a successful team who are renowned for providing client excellence, with their size doubling in the last 5 years and further exciting growth planned. It therefore offers fantastic career progression and development for the right individual.

Job Description

The following responsibilites are not exhaustive, but you can expect to be responsible for;

  • Offering expert tax consultancy services for all aspects of clients' tax operations, covering compliance, reporting, and planning.
  • Devise and execute efficient tax planning strategies, with the aim of optimising tax positions and minimising tax risks for clients.
  • Supervise the preparation of tax filings for corporation tax etc, ensuring adherence to UK tax laws and regulations.
  • Provide professional advice on the tax implications of various business strategies, conduct tax risk assessments, and implement appropriate risk mitigation measures for clients.
  • Stay abreast of changes in UK tax legislation and offer well-informed guidance on their impact to clients.
  • Foster a culture of continuous learning and client-focused service by developing, mentoring, and managing junior tax consultants.
  • Coordinate and support clients during tax audits conducted by HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC).
  • Act as a representative for clients in their interactions with HMRC, effectively managing relationships with tax authorities on their behalf.
  • Assist clients in establishing and maintaining internal controls to facilitate tax accounting and compliance.
  • Collaborate with other team leaders to align tax strategies with clients' business objectives.

The Successful Applicant

  • Holding ACCA, ACA, or CTA qualification.
  • The ideal candidate should have at least 10 years of experience in a tax consultancy role, with a specific focus on corporation tax, and/or income tax, and capital gains tax.
  • Extensive knowledge of the UK tax code, compliance, and procedures is essential.
  • Strong ability to handle multiple client projects simultaneously and deliver results within given deadlines.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills are a must, as the candidate will be required to effectively convey complex tax strategies to both clients and internal teams.
  • Integrity, attention to detail, and exceptional analytical skills are highly valued attributes for this position.
  • Familiarity with tax software and accounting systems is expected.

What's on Offer

If you're ready to make a significant impact and thrive in a challenging and rewarding environment, this opportunity is tailor-made for you!

  • Opportunity for a strong Senior Manager to move into a role with a clear and quick route to Director.
  • Head up the tax function across Nottingham.
  • Market rate salary (£65,000 - £85,000. Strong technical candidates will command the higher end)
  • Host of other benefits to be discussed at interview stage.

title: Principal Consultant
description:
Organisation Summary

The OM Group, established as a beacon of Health and Safety services within the Construction sector, has grown over the last 15 years into a multi-disciplinary consultancy and training provider revered for its innovative and client-centric ethos. We are advocates for change within the construction industry, fostering innovation, diversity, and inclusion. Our fast-growth trajectory is fuelled by a commitment to continual growth, professional development, and adherence to the evolving legislative landscape, such as the Building Safety Act.

Job Summary

We are in a phase of rapid expansion and as a Principal Designer / CDM Consultant at OM Group, you are more than just a pivotal asset to our consultancy wing; you are a reflection of our commitment to excellence and the driving force behind our reputable standing in the industry. This role transcends traditional expectations, offering you a space to exercise autonomy, foster robust client relationships, and make a mark within our senior management echelon.

Your engagement will go beyond mere adherence to current standards; it's about steering the OM Group alongside the dynamic landscape of the construction industry, nurturing a culture steeped in perpetual learning, growth, and innovation. Your role will span across a diverse spectrum of projects in the commercial, leisure, residential, public-sector, and infrastructure domains. Each project will be a testament to The OM Group's blend of safety, compliance and commercial acumen, solidifying our position as a trailblazer in delivering client-centric solutions. Your role is not just a job; it's a journey of growth, a challenge to innovate, and an opportunity to leave a lasting imprint on the industry.

Duties Include

· Engaging in a spectrum of new-build and refurbishment projects across diverse sectors, steering them from design to completion while ensuring adherence to CDM 2015 Regulations and the Building Safety Act.

· Acting as the linchpin between clients, design consultants, principal contractors, and suppliers, fostering a synergy that underpins project success.

· Orchestrating design risk workshops, reviewing designers' risk assessments, and ensuring that pre-construction information is meticulously curated and communicated.

· Championing the preparation and review of CDM documentation, liaising closely with the Principal Contractor to prepare their Construction Phase Plan.

· Cultivating relationships with a broad spectrum of stakeholders within and beyond the project ambit, ensuring seamless communication and collaboration.

· Driving the evolution of Health and Safety protocols within the company, staying abreast of legislative changes such as the new Building Safety Act, and ensuring compliance across the board.

Skills & Experience

· A solid foundation of 3-5+ years in a similar role within the construction industry.

· Robust knowledge of CDM 2015 Regulations, current health and safety legislation, and a keen understanding of the Building Safety Act.

· Health and Safety related qualification (e.g., NEBOSH National General or Construction Certificate or equivalent) is essential.

· Membership of CIOB, IOSH and/or APS is desirable.

· Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, coupled with a client-facing demeanor.

· A proactive, organised, and disciplined approach, underpinned by a drive for continual learning and development.

· Strong understanding and willingness to understand the company ethos, its goals, and standards.

Growth and Development Opportunities:

· Engage in an ongoing programme of professional development, with the backing of a company committed to your growth.

· Embark on a variety of high-profile projects, each presenting a unique set of challenges and learning landscapes.

· Explore promotional opportunities and engage in training support aimed at honing your expertise and advancing your career as a Principal Designer.

Benefits

  • Access to state-of-the-art technology to facilitate the effective execution of your responsibilities.
  • Ongoing opportunities for professional development, aiding in the enhancement of your expertise.
  • Thrive in a dynamic and rapidly expanding business milieu, collaborating with a diverse clientele within the Construction Sector.
  • Enrolment in a competitive pension scheme to secure your financial future.
  • Generous leave entitlement of 25 days per annum, in addition to recognised bank holidays.
  • Experience a relaxed office ambiance, complemented by two annual team outings fostering camaraderie and a collaborative culture.

Your Growth Journey with OM Group

We are ardent about people development and offer excellent and progressive career opportunities along with sponsored learning. As a member of the OM Group, your career trajectory is not just a path but a journey filled with learning, growth, and ample opportunities to excel. We invite you to be part of our story, to grow with us, and to contribute towards shaping a sustainable, innovative future within the construction sector.

Job Types: Permanent, Full-time

Salary: £50,000.00-£60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Coventry: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

  • How many years experience do you have working in a similar role?
  • Do you hold a Health and Safety qualification at Level 3 or above?

Work Location: In person

title: Principal Consultant
description:
Organisation Summary

The OM Group, initially established as a beacon of Health and Safety services within the Construction sector, has over the past 15 years evolved into a multi-disciplinary consultancy and training provider. Our growth narrative is a testament to our unwavering commitment to creating a conducive environment where every team member, regardless of their background, can thrive and contribute towards shaping a safer and more efficient construction landscape.

Our ethos is rooted in fostering innovation, embracing diversity, and driving sustainable change within the industry. As we adapt to evolving legislative landscapes such as the Building Safety Act, our innovative and client-centric approach propels us to the forefront of advocating positive change within the construction industry, ensuring a harmonious blend of continual growth, professional development, and steadfast adherence to industry advancements and standards.

Our journey, marked by a commitment to excellence and an inclusive culture, positions OM Group as a trusted partner in delivering unparalleled value to our clients while nurturing a culture of learning and impactful contributions from every member of our team.

Job Summary

We are in a phase of rapid expansion and as the Associate Principal Designer / Senior CDM Consultant at OM Group, your role will be pivotal within our consultancy division, encapsulating the forward momentum that has been a hallmark of our organisation. This senior position goes beyond conventional adherence to current standards. It's about advancing in tandem with the industry, instilling a culture of continual learning and growth within the team and broader organisation.

You will oversee a diverse range of projects across commercial, leisure, residential, public-sector, and infrastructure domains, ensuring a seamless integration of creativity, safety, and compliance. Your leadership will be instrumental in not only guiding the PD/CDM team but also in nurturing robust client relationships, thereby enhancing our operational footprint in Coventry and across our extensive UK clientele.

This role is not merely a position but a pathway. The right candidate will have the ambition and capability to evolve into a more encompassing leadership role, potentially advancing to become the Head of Multi-Disciplinary Services. As a senior member, your input will not only be valued but will be critical in shaping the strategy and direction of the consultancy division. You'll have the opportunity to be a part of the Leadership Team, contributing to the overarching vision of OM Group, and playing a significant role in steering the company towards its long-term objectives.

Your expertise, leadership acumen, and ability to forge enduring client relationships will be the cornerstone upon which your success, and the continued success of the OM Group, is built. This position is crafted for a visionary leader, ready to step into a role filled with potential, leading not just a team but contributing to the broader strategic narrative of the OM Group.

Duties Include

  • Leading in developing our services, business development endeavours, and growth trajectories.
  • Steering the CDM/PD team adeptly, managing work and resource allocation whilst overseeing financial performance.
  • Engaging actively with designers on Design Risk Management, and address any information gaps proficiently.
  • Championing the preparation and review of CDM documentation, providing indispensable CDM advice to designers and project managers.
  • Engaging with other business units, cross-selling services and contributing towards other relevant building consultancy work.
  • Engaging in a spectrum of new-build and refurbishment projects across diverse sectors, ensuring adherence to CDM 2015 Regulations and the Building Safety Act.
  • Acting as the linchpin between clients, design consultants, principal contractors, and suppliers, fostering project success.
  • Orchestrating design risk workshops, reviewing designers' risk assessments, and ensuring meticulous communication of pre-construction information.
  • Cultivating relationships with a broad spectrum of stakeholders, ensuring seamless communication and collaboration.
  • Drive the evolution of Health and Safety protocols within the company, staying abreast of legislative changes such as the new Building Safety Act.
  • For the right candidate, demonstrating the right acumen, the opportunity to lead the charge in developing our services, business development endeavours, and growth trajectory as a multi-disciplinary solutions provider in the sector. In addition, the opportunity to steer the CDM/PD team adeptly, managing work and resource allocation whilst overseeing financial performance and being an integral part of the Leadership Team.

Skills & Experience

· Hold a Degree or Level 6 qualification in a Construction Professional Discipline or Occupational H&S or equivalent (ideally CMIOSH) with at least 5-7 years of experience in a similar role within the construction industry.

· Full (Certified) APS membership (CMaPS) or CIOB Membership (MCIOB) with a robust knowledge of CDM 2015 Regulations, current health and safety legislation, and a keen understanding of the Building Safety Act.

· Proven team leadership acumen, commercial experience, and excellent client communication skills.

· Ability to meet fee targets, engage with the team to achieve overall targets, and showcase commercial astuteness.

· Exhibits excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, coupled with a client-facing demeanour.

· A proactive, organised, and disciplined approach, driven by a passion for continual learning, development, and alignment with the company ethos, goals, and standards.

Growth and Development Opportunities:

· Participate in a structured programme of professional development, supported by a company dedicated to fostering your growth and career advancement.

· Take the helm of diverse high-profile projects, each offering a distinctive set of challenges and avenues for learning and application of your expertise.

· Delve into promotional opportunities within the firm, coupled with training support aimed at refining your skills and propelling your career forward as an Associate Principal Designer / Senior CDM Consultant.

Benefits

  • Access to state-of-the-art technology to facilitate the effective execution of your responsibilities.
  • Ongoing opportunities for professional development, aiding in the enhancement of your expertise.
  • Thrive in a dynamic and rapidly expanding business milieu, collaborating with a diverse clientele within the Construction Sector.
  • Enrolment in a competitive pension scheme to secure your financial future.
  • Generous leave entitlement of 25 days per annum, in addition to recognised bank holidays.
  • Experience a relaxed office ambiance, complemented by two annual team outings fostering camaraderie and a collaborative culture.

Your Growth Journey with OM Group

We are ardent about people development and offer excellent and progressive career opportunities along with sponsored learning. As a member of the OM Group, your career trajectory is not just a path but a journey filled with learning, growth, and ample opportunities to excel. We invite you to be part of our story, to grow with us, and to contribute towards shaping a sustainable, innovative future within the construction sector.

Job Types: Permanent, Full-time

Salary: £55,000.00-£65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Coventry: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

  • How many years experience do you have working in a similar role?
  • Do you hold a Health and Safety or Construction related qualification at Level 6 or equivalent?

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Civil Engineer
description:
The Role:

  • Undertake civil design on a wide variety of civil and structural engineering projects within the commercial, residential, industrial, healthcare and education sectors on projects up to £40 million in value.

What you need to succeed:

  • Suitable civil engineering qualification with a minimum of 6 years’ experience.
  • Experience in the design of below ground foul and surface water drainage systems.
  • Capable of managing deadlines and organising your own work.
  • Capable of overseeing the technical work undertaken by graduate and project civil engineers and assist in their training.
  • Initiative, and ability to work well as part of a team.
  • Competent in producing drawings in AutoCad.
  • Capable of liaising confidently with local authority planning departments and lead local flood authorities.
  • Confident in representing PRP UK Ltd at meetings with clients, consultants and contractors.
  • Ablility to write full detailed drainage strategies and verification reports.
  • In-depth knowledge of SuDS and flood risk assessments.
  • Familiarity with the MicroDrainage and/or the InfoDrainage software packages.
  • Knowledge of 3D civil design software.
  • Familiarity with highways design and how it interacts with drainage design.
  • Hold a full UK driving licence and have your own transport.

Benefits

  • Hybrid working policy.
  • Loyalty to employees – 25 days annual leave increasing by one day per year up to a maximum of 30 days plus 8 statutory holidays.
  • Wellbeing Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)
  • Income protection scheme.
  • Company contributory pension scheme. Training and development programme – company support and investment in your personal development.
  • In-house software training.
  • IStructE and ICE chartership mentoring.
  • Membership to professional institutions funded by the company.
  • Long service awards – 10, 15 and 20 years.
  • Company funded team building events.
  • Working for a company with 38 years’ experience in the industry with solid financial stability.

title: Civil Technician
description:
Our client is a global engineering consultancy firm who are well-known within the industry for their extensive Civil, Structural, Geotechnical, Construction & Digital engineering expertise, and they currently have an opening for a Senior Civils Technician to join the Civils team.

As a Senior Technician it is expected that the successful candidate will take a leadership role with responsibility for training, mentoring ad delegating work to more junior technicians.

The Role:

  • Continued development of AutoCAD and Civils 3d or equivalent protocols,
  • Take overall control and responsibility of project leaders duties in their absence,
  • Civils 3d / AutoCAD Drafting.
  • Maintaining a professional attitude when communicating with internal and external staff,
  • Liaise with Architect and service consultants with respect to questions/queries relating to their documentation and inform the Project Engineer and other members of the project team of any changes.
  • Keeping Technicians under your direction, informed and up to date with specific project related issues and changes.
  • Attend and be involved with drafting meetings and monthly resource meetings if required.
  • Assist with the development and implementation of drawing office standards.
  • Checking all drafting staff’s work (where required) to comply with the Standard Drafting Procedures.

What you need to succeed:

  • ONC/HNC in Civil Engineering,
  • Minimum of 7 years’ civil drafting experience,
  • Proficient in the use of Civils 3D or Similar,
  • Good communication skills, both written and oral.

There is excellent opportunity for progression for the successful candidate.

There is the potential for the successful candidate to work for 1-3 days in the office with the remainder from home.

As a Senior Diagnostic Technician, you will be instrumental in ensuring peak performance for customers' vehicles. Your role involves diagnosing intricate mechanical and electronic issues using state-of-the-art tools. We need your expertise, problem-solving skills, and passion for delivering exceptional service.

Key Responsibilities as a Diagnostic Technician:
  • Conduct in-depth diagnostic assessments, pinpointing and repairing mechanical, electrical, and electronic issues.

  • Collaborate seamlessly with the service team, providing timely and efficient solutions to customer concerns.
  • Stay updated with the latest automotive technologies, attending relevant training sessions.
  • Mentor and guide junior technicians, sharing your knowledge to enhance the team's skills.
  • Maintain meticulous records of repairs, parts used, and labour time to ensure streamlined work-flow and outstanding customer satisfaction.
  • Uphold high standards of quality, professionalism, and customer service.
Senior/Diagnostic Technician Requirements:
  • Level 3 qualification in Light Vehicle Maintenance.
  • Proven experience as a Technician in an automotive dealership.
  • Advanced knowledge of vehicle diagnostic systems, including electronic and mechanical components.
  • Proficiency in utilising diagnostic tools and software to resolve complex issues.
  • Strong communication skills, capable of explaining technical concepts to non-technical staff members/customers.
  • Exceptional problem-solving abilities with keen attention to detail.
  • Team player with a positive attitude, committed to delivering exceptional customer service.
  • Valid driving license and a clean driving record.
Benefits as a Senior Diagnostic Technician
  • 30 Days Holiday including Bank Holidays
  • Excellent bonus structure
  • Retailer discounts
  • Manufacturer training and experience
  • Strong pension
  • Fully funded, nationally recognised qualifications
  • Refer a friend scheme

title: Account Executive
description:
Who We Are

NFP is a six-time Best Places to Work award winner in Business Insurance who has also earned the 5-Star Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) award from Insurance Business magazine and the WORK180 employer endorsement. We’re a recognized Elite Agency award winner and a leading property and casualty broker, benefits consultant, wealth manager, and retirement plan advisor. NFP provides solutions enabling client success through the expertise of over 7,500 global employees, investments in innovative technologies, and enduring relationships with highly rated insurers, vendors and financial institutions. To learn more, please visit: https://www.NFP.com.

Summary of Role

As an Account Executive in Mid-Market segments, you will support consultants in managing client accounts by researching, analyzing, and evaluating medical, dental, life and disability benefits plans and programs for employers. The expectation at this level is that the Account Executive will exercise more independent thinking and be able to complete projects with little guidance from consultants. Often, tasks are time sensitive, and the employee may be working under intense deadlines and pressure.


Responsibilities

  • Data entry and analysis – assist the consulting team in gathering, organizing, entering and analyzing data using Excel spreadsheets to be used for various client
    projects. This role also involves an increased focus on analysis of the results and managing portions of projects, including reviewing the work of lower-level analysts.

Examples of the types of projects and responsibilities include:

  • Marketing efforts – gather benchmarking, utilization or rate data from the vendors via a Request for Proposal (RFP); interpret the meaning of the data
    and summarize the responses from the RFP in Excel or PowerPoint format for presentation to the client
  • Plan design consolidation – gather data from the client and current vendors needed for analyzing the impact of a client’s consolidation of its healthcare
    plans; typically involves organizing and summarizing plan design details and costs in Excel for further analysis by the team; responsibilities also include
    checking data for reasonableness and follow-up with vendors regarding missing or inaccurate data.
  • For experience rated clients – Cost projections and vendor renewal workups –gather data from the client and vendors to populate Excel spreadsheets used
    for developing cost projections and evaluation of vendor renewal workups; results are used as part of client renewal and budget meetings
  • For experience rated clients – Tracking claims experience – gather data from client and vendors and check for reasonableness using independent judgment; analyze actual versus expected healthcare costs using an Excel template; results are typically sent to clients on a monthly or quarterly basis
  • Understand Health and Benefits products, services and tools – Understand vendor/carrier markets, more advanced underwriting and financial skills, Health &
    Benefit products, services and technical tools, and intranet resources offered by NFP by participating in training courses, online learning, or through learning from more experienced colleagues.
  • Project management & consulting skills – understand and demonstrate project management and consulting skills
  • Managing the quality and timeliness of client deliverables
  • Helping to develop budgets and billing reports
  • Participating in client calls and meetings as appropriate
  • Delegating to and reviewing project work of more junior colleagues
  • Assisting with the preparation and delivery of clear and concise client-friendly communications.
  • Develop and present benchmarking reports – gather and analyze health benefits data from a national survey administered and published by various sources, input it into a standardized template and compare a client’s medical and dental plan information (such as the benefits they offer, rates, contributions) to other companies by industry or geography and present the final report to the client. The analyst will have a discussion with a consultant up front to determine what cuts of the data to make.

Requirements

  • Three to five years of industry experience required
  • Intermediate to Advanced knowledge of MS Office Tools (Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Excellent interpersonal skills; strong oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a demanding work environment
  • Ability to work independently and on a team
  • Required to obtain and maintain appropriate licenses as required by state
  • regulations and NFP policies

What We Offer

We’re proud to offer a competitive salary, PTO & paid holidays, 401(k) with match, exclusive discount programs, health & wellness programs, and more. Our PeopleFirst culture focuses on building and nurturing lifelong relationships with our employees because, at the end of the day, we exist to be there for others.

NFP and You… Better Together!

NFP is an inclusive employer who values diversity.

title: R&D Engineer
description:
Job Advert

Due to unprecedented growth and future expansion, following the Group's acquisition by the Sun PE firm, Sun Capital Partners, we are now seeking to expanding our Technical R&D Consulting business in the Midlands. Operating from our HQ in Derby, we are seeking experienced R&D Tax Experts, who are looking to manage the entire Client journey from start to finish, with the full support of an in-house Technical Writing Team.


You will be organising in person meetings with Clients, typically meeting the main decision makers within the business (Owner, Managing Director, Financial Director, Technical/Operations Director), to talk through the entire R&D tax credit scheme, how it operates and then proceed to extract the technical information regarding the innovations and research and development work performed by the Company during the recent periods, to identify whether their quality for R&D Tax Credits.


It will be your role to review (and support the writing of) the Technical Reports to submit to HMRC in order to justify the R&D tax credit claim on behalf of the Client. On going project management of the process, in conjunction with the Client - liaison with the Client to help them collate financial information to prepare their claim, as well as extracting descriptions regarding material and sub-contractor costs, working with our internal Accounts Team to prepare the information provided by the Client in order to create financial schedules.


Requirements:

  • You will ideally have prior R&D Tax Credit experience and understanding of the tax claim process.
  • A friendly and personable approach, good communicator, who is able to understand and reflect on technical information in order to ask probing questions.
  • A degree of scientific, technical and/or engineering knowledge to help perform technical elicitations.
  • A full UK driving licence.
  • A basic knowledge of accountancy (profit and loss accounts, balance sheets) is useful, but not essential.


Positive Aspects of Role:

  • Ability to organise one’s own schedule to suit individual needs.
  • Output orientated approach – not tied down to working hours – flexible working to suit your lifestyle, with opportunity to work from home as well as in our Derby office.
  • The chance to work with a range of interesting Clients, performing clever and innovative work from a wide range of sectors from all over the UK, but predominantly in the Midlands.
  • Sociable company to work for - lots of internal development and part of a wider International Group.
  • Competitive salary.

title: Support Consultant
description:
Company Description

Come join us and make a difference in the world!


We’re NEC Software Solutions (part of global tech giant NEC Corporation). While you read this ad, our software is helping to dispatch ambulances, support families, keep trains on the move, locate missing people and even test the hearing of newborn babies.


Working with us, you’ll be helping our 3,000+ employees push the boundaries of what’s possible and support amazing public services.


We work with governments, hospitals, police forces, housing providers, local authorities and more. We help them pay financial support faster, speed up treatments for patients and respond to emergencies in the right way. The more we do, the more our customers can do for others. And together, we make a world of difference.


We’d love your help. And we’ll support you all the way.


Discover more at www.necsws.com


Job Description

The role will be working within a mature 2nd line support team, with responsibility for resolving incidents raised by customers, via the NEC Service Desk, for the CONNECT Police software.

You will be joining a team with strong technical background who formerly had roles in development, end user support and software implementation disciplines.

About the role:

  • Provide software application support;
  • Own and undertake the investigation of complex application incidents;
  • Recreate scenarios on internal test environments to provide evidence of defects;
  • Identify and document workarounds;
  • Work within contractual SLAs;
  • Work to ITIL aligned support process procedures;
  • Work closely with other NEC Teams and 3rd parties;
  • Participate in an Out of Hours on call rota.


Qualifications


KNOWLEDGE, QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

  • Experience of working with complex bespoke software applications either in a Support, Development or QA role;
  • Experience of working within a structured process driven environment;
  • Experience of using an IT Service Management tool or similar;
  • ITIL Foundation certificate;
  • Experience of investigating data related issues within a relational database;
  • Capability to generate and manipulate SQL scripts used to query and manage database content;
  • Ability to check log files and restart services on a number of operating systems including Microsoft Windows and UNIX Solaris;
  • Understand principles of software development within an ISO 9001/ISO 20000 accredited environment

    Exposure to the following:
  • Microsoft Windows Servers environments;
  • UNIX Solaris servers environments;
  • Java;
  • Uniface;
  • Ensemble;
  • Microsoft .net;
  • SQL;
  • Oracle;
  • jetnexus;
  • Javascript;
  • HTML;
  • Active MQ

PERSONAL SKILLS AND COMPETENCES

  • Self-motivated and persistent with a desire to learn and enjoys helping people;
  • Demonstrate solid analytical and lateral thinking skills;
  • Capable of communicating to technical and non technical staff unambiguously at all levels with respect to support calls;
  • Willing to challenge and improve existing processes and practices;
  • Proactive and forward thinking to stop incidents occurring;
  • Capability to multi-task and balance complex customer and internal priorities;
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills;
  • Willing to travel (when required) to customer sites;
  • Ability to contribute and participate in identification of permanent fixes;
  • Exhibit empathy and patience during interactions with customers


Additional Information

We pride ourselves in offering an excellent benefits package, including an above average pension scheme. When you join the team at NEC Software Solutions, you are provided with the following:


  • Private Medical Cover funded by NEC for Employees (with the option to add family members at an additional cost)
  • 25 days paid holiday with the option to buy/sell
  • 4 x basic salary life assurance cover funded by NEC (with the option to increase cover at an additional cost)
  • A Group Pension Plan with fantastic employer contributions up to a maximum of 8.5%
  • A selection of flexible benefits to suit your individual needs


Candidates must be able to demonstrate a pre-existing right to work and travel within the UK. Documentary evidence will be required.


All offers are subject to satisfactory vetting and reference checks. Depending on the nature of the role a Disclosure Barring Service (DBS) check may also be required.


NEC Software Solutions is an equal opportunities employer, welcoming applications from all communities.

title: Intake Coordinator
description:
St. James's Place (SJP) works in partnership to plan, grow and protect our clients’ financial futures. We deliver personalised, face-to-face financial advice to our clients, who trust us to manage their money to reach their goals. We provide this service via the Partnership, a network of qualified, expert advisors. We put financial wellbeing and responsible business choices at the heart of everything we do. We believe in the value of difference and know that diverse teams can help us problem and innovate for clients.

We look for people to join SJP to make an impact and to contribute to our culture which is based around long term relationships, doing the right thing, and being the best version of ourselves.

Coordinator Intake Management

Location: Nottingham Office / Cirencester Office

Workplace Type: On-Site

Employment Type: 14 month Fixed-Term Contract

Seniority: Entry Level

The main purpose of the role is to be responsible for the organisation and delivery of programme events across Terms 1-4 of the Early Years programme, whilst building and developing strong relationships with recruits and being the main point of contact of multiple intakes over the period of a year.

You will ensure recruit experience is not compromised by proactively planning ahead, keeping key stakeholders informed of changes and effective problem solving.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Having full ownership and accountability for the organization, consistency & timely delivery of programme events, both virtual and face to face across Terms 1 – 4 of Early Years.
  • Supporting the Academy Training Consultants and Managers with the scheduling of events, ensuring timely and accurate communication with recruits about the events and being responsible for resolving unexpected issues utilising problem-solving skills to come up with pragmatic solutions.
  • Building and developing internal and external stakeholder relationships, including Partners and Advisers within Early Years.
  • Loading Learning & Development content onto the system for recruits in a timely manner and working with the Team Manager - Intake Management to monitor budget and expenses for event.
  • Using initiative to flag suggestions for process improvement and supporting other team members with cover as and when required.

Who we’re looking for:

An experienced administrator with strong organisational skills and the following:

  • Strong IT capability including Microsoft Office skills: Word, Excel & PowerPoint.
  • Ability to build strong relationships with others, internally and externally and with excellent written and verbal communication skills, appropriate to all levels.
  • High attention to detail, working with accuracy and precision and able to work independently, prioritising own workload.
  • A varied and comprehensive knowledge of how all the different roles operate within Early Years and the wider Operating Model.
  • A high degree of problem-solving skills, being able to work effectively with key stakeholders to resolve issues without compromising the recruit experience.

Special Requirements

  • Travel or overnight stays will be required to attend intake events.
  • Subject to the SJP Share Dealing policy and Share Dealing codes due to the access to confidential company information.

What's in it for you?

  • Non-Contributory Pension – 10% (increasing with length of service up to 15%) with further pension matching.
  • Parental leave – 6 months full pay
  • 28 days holiday entitlement plus bank holidays (based on full-time equivalent) with the option to buy up to an additional 5 days holiday

Flexible Working
We know that everyone works best in different ways, at different times and in different environments. We have introduced a hybrid working policy to provide greater flexibility for part-time work, job-sharing, remote working, and flexibility on hours. Our people are encouraged to work in a flexible way that suits their lifestyle, so please ask the question and start a conversation!

Research tells us that applicants (especially those from underrepresented groups) can be put off from applying for a role if they do not meet all the criteria or have been on an extended career-break. If you think you would be a good match for this role and can demonstrate some transferable experience please apply, regardless of whether you tick every box.

What's next?

Our team will be in touch. As a business regulated by the FCA we would advise you to familiarise yourself with the conduct regulations and in particular consumer duty obligations prior to an interview with SJP.

#LI-ONSITE

title: Senior Structural Designer
description:
About the role


Balfour Beatty is currently recruiting a Senior Structural Design Engineer to join the Power T&D team in Derby.
The main function of the role is to deliver such design calculations, engineering drawings and documents that enable a safe and constructable engineered solution.

The position reports to the Design Delivery Manager – Structures.


What you'll be doing

General responsibilities.
- Assume the role of lead structural engineer for complex projects as directed by the Design Delivery Manager - Structures.
  • Analyse and understand contract documents to determine scope of works, design parameters/methodologies, engineering programme and budget.
  • Ensure projects are delivered to he engineering manager in accordance with the agreed scope of works, design parameters/methodologies, engineering programme and budget
  • Review designs and design calculations produced by other engineers or apprentices to ensure the designs are appropriate and can be manufactured and constructed safely in accordance with contract documents and/ or current
best practice.
  • Produce appropriate designs and calculations for review that can be manufactured and constructed safely in accordance with contract documents and/ or current best practice.
  • Practice Safety and Sustainability by Design in all design work ensuring compliance with CDM regulations.
  • Assist in the analysis and resolution of complex design issues.
  • Communicate with other business functions, consultants, clients, and operational teams to ensure projects are delivered to the agreed scope of works, design parameters/methodologies, and engineering programme.
  • Visit operational sites and offices to discuss design issues and to develop solutions.
  • Analyse and understand tender documents to produce engineering tenders for review by engineering managers, that, state the scope of work to be undertaken, identify the engineering tasks and associated cost allocations, develop
engineering programmes, and identify any significant risk.
  • Liaise with engineering managers, principal structural design engineers, senior structural design engineers and other engineers or apprentices as required.
  • Support the Chief Engineer – Structures, to deliver complex technical improvement and innovation.
  • Deliver and undertake training as required.

Interacts with:

Internal design team, suppliers/manufacturers, construction teams, internal/external clients, CDM Principal Designer.

Operating Environment:

  • Proactively observe Balfour Beatty’s cultural framework all times.
  • Observe Balfour Beatty values, lean, expert, trusted, safe and sustainable, at all times.
  • Observe Balfour Beatty behaviours, talk positively, collaborate relentlessly, encourage constantly, make a difference,
and value everyone, at all times.
  • Take personal responsibility and accountability for own and actions of others

Who we're looking for
Qualifications\Skills Required:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Civil/Structural or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
  • Excellent structural analysis skills, ability to solve problems from first principles.
  • Good communication skills, able to communicate effectively at all levels.
  • Knowledge of lattice type structures.
- Experience with BS EN 1993-1-1 2005; BS EN 1993-3-1 2006; BS EN 50341-2-9-UK NNA (2017).
  • Experience with Autodesk Robot Structural Analysis, Bentley Staad Pro and PLS CADD/TOWER, etc.
  • Working towards IEng/CEng.

Why work for us


Day in, day out, our teams deliver some of the UK’s most ambitious, exciting and meaningful projects; developing, building and maintaining the vital infrastructure that supports national economies and strengthens communities.

Why join us?

As if contributing to and supporting work that makes life better for millions wasn’t rewarding enough, we offer a full range of benefits too. You’ll have the freedom to shape the package that’s right for you and your life. Here are some of our key benefits:

  • Smart working, giving you more flexibility such as staggered start and finish times, with up to 40% remote working, where roles allow.
  • 25 days paid annual leave (pro rata)
  • Family friendly policies which include 28 weeks full pay for maternity/adoption leave and four weeks full pay for paternity/partners leave
  • Pension, share incentive plan, volunteering leave, recognition schemes and much more…

About us


Balfour Beatty’s Power Transmission & Distribution teams work with regional, national and international electricity network owners and operators to provide technical engineering solutions across the full spectrum of the electricity grid, including overhead lines, cabling, substations and distribution networks.

From scoping and feasibility, to design, construction and on-going maintenance, our in-house experts, flexible resources and industry-leading innovations support customers in the development of some of the UK’s most ambitious power transmission and distribution projects.

Diversity and inclusion

At Balfour Beatty we believe that diversity and inclusion are essential components of any successful, happy workplace. Through our Value Everyone Diversity and Inclusion Strategy and Action Plan, we are growing our diverse workforce and developing our inclusive culture where everyone is able to thrive and reach their full potential, regardless of their identity or background. To find out how we are making this a reality, visit www.balfourbeatty.com/diversityandinclusion

We are a Gold Award holder in the Ministry of Defence 'Employer Recognition Scheme' and actively encourage applications from Armed Forces personnel, veterans and reservists.

As a Disability Confident Employer, we are committed to working with people who have disabilities and long-term health conditions to remove barriers for them in obtaining employment. We are also committed to offering applicants with a disability an interview if they meet the minimum requirements for the role. For more info, visit: https://disabilityconfident.campaign.gov.uk/

We are looking to continually improve our resourcing process and ensure that it is fair and inclusive for all. If you have any feedback on the process, please share this with us at: candidaterecruitmentqueries@balfourbeatty.com


Job Reference: BBUK03510

title: Environmental Consultant
description:
Job Introduction

We are looking for a versatile and highly motivated individual to join our energetic and successful Geoenvironmental Division as a Graduate Geoenvironmental Consultant to join our team in Nottingham. We are offering a competitive basic salary of between £23,000 - £26,000 depending on skills, location and experience.

Main Responsibilities

  • We provide advice on risk in the ground, whether contamination, ground gas, coal mining or geotechnical. We have experts in all relevant disciplines who are on hand to support our Graduates to develop their own careers.

    The Geoenvironmental team aims to deliver great client care, being approachable and responsive, delivering clear and concise ground risk advice. We foster a safe, rewarding and supportive work environment where our people can reach their full potential, such that we are the first choice for both Employees and Clients.

    As a Graduate Geoenvironmental Consultant, you will support the planning, delivery and management of geoenvironmental site investigations and associated reporting for major industry clients.

    Key Responsibilities

  • Plan simple projects or assignments, identifying key milestones and time frames for delivery.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of project objectives and rationale.
  • Organise and coordinate project resources, including suppliers, to enable efficient timescales.
  • Produce desk study reports including obtaining data, undertaking research and Site inspections.
  • Facilitate and deliver intrusive site investigations and monitoring.
  • Schedule and assess third party chemical and geotechnical testing data.
  • Use software and technical guidance documents for the assessment of data to determine the required outcome for the project or assignment.
  • Produce structured factual geoenvironmental reports to provide solutions to the client’s business needs.
  • Adhere to and model high Health and Safety standards, in line with Company procedures.
  • Commitment to develop personal CPD.
  • Develop your working knowledge of relevant geo-environmental legislation, standards, and guidance.
  • Develop your working knowledge of the design of conceptual models and thought.
  • Professional communication with colleagues and all stakeholders.
The Ideal Candidate
  • Bachelor’s degree in relevant subject
  • Demonstration of equivalent qualification or experience.
  • Strong work ethic, and the ability to work effectively and intuitively either alone or in a small team.
  • Sound communication and personal effectiveness skills.
  • An ability to build and maintain effective working relationships at all levels.
  • A full UK Driving Licence (manual)
  • Flexible as the role requires out of hours work and travel across the UK from time to time.
About The Company

Delta-Simons is a multi-disciplinary environmental and health and safety consultancy providing trusted advice and solutions to 'Protect People and Planet' through facilitating sustainable development, both throughout the UK and internationally. If you are looking to start or grow your career in environmental consultancy, Delta-Simons is a place where ongoing learning, training, innovation and collaborative thinking is encouraged and helps to form our identity.

Now part of the Lucion Group, there has never been a more exciting time to join our growing and diverse team.

Get in touch

Feel free to email our Recruitment Team at recruitment@luciongroup.com if you have any questions.

All candidates are advised to read our privacy policy.

Delta-Simons is an equal opportunities employer.

Package Description

What's in it for you?

At Delta-Simons, recruiting and retaining the best individuals is key to our success and continued growth. We celebrate our staff by offering:

  • £23,000 - £26,000 basic salary, depending on skills, location and experience.
  • Company matched pension scheme.
  • 24 days annual leave in addition to bank holidays, increasing with service.
  • Opportunity to buy additional leave.
  • Extensive training opportunities and supported CPD.
  • Employee Assistance Programme, which includes counselling services and legal assistance.
  • Cashback and discounts on purchases and events, from a range of brands and services including gym membership and restaurant deals.
  • Supported opportunities for volunteering and community action.

title: Quantity Surveyor
description:
Quantity Surveyor

Willmott Dixon Construction are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Quantity Surveyor to join our Midlands team. As a Quantity Surveyor at Willmott Dixon, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful delivery of our construction projects. You will be responsible for managing the cost and all financial aspects of our projects.


Your initial project will be an 8-million-pound education scheme in Market Harborough, this role has the potential to be a Senior Quantity Surveyor or grow into a Senior position and manage multiple schemes from March 2024.

The Key Responsibilities:



  • Ensure projects are delivered within budget and to the highest quality, exceeding customer expectations.

  • Work closely with the project team and senior commercial staff to ensure budgeted targets are met.

  • Establish strong working relationships with supply chain, consultants, and customers.

  • Assist in accurately valuing, certifying and issuing payment notices for supply chain partners in accordance with contract arrangement.

  • Ensure external valuations are submitted in accordance with conditions of the main contract and that payments are received by the due date.

  • Complete cost value comparison reports that accurately reflect the current position on site and the final projection.

  • Identify any potential disputes in a timely manner and enable introduction of effective solutions.

The ideal candidate:



  • Previous experience of managing all commercial aspects of schemes of a similar value

  • Professional quantity surveying qualification but not essential

In return:

In return for your hard work, we offer a competitive package that includes flexible benefits to fit your lifestyle and priorities. This includes an enhanced pension scheme, discounted or full private medical, life assurance, incentive bonus, and a car scheme that will make us a market leader in sustainable company travel. You'll also benefit from a motoring expenditure allowance (MEA) and everyone can access a new generation of low carbon and electric cars via the Willmott Dixon run car leasing scheme.


Join us and be a part of our innovative team pioneering new ways to build and establish ourselves as leaders in the industry. We understand everyone has unique potential and abilities to make a difference and succeed, and we're committed to developing your skills and recognising your talent.

Additional Information

At Willmott Dixon we provide an inclusive and flexible working environment for people to thrive in and we are happy to support agile working wherever possible.


We are a proud member of the Disability Confident Scheme.

About Us

Over 170 years of rich history, Willmott Dixon’s purpose is beyond profit; delivering brilliant buildings, transforming lives, strengthening communities and enhancing the environment so our world is fit for future generations. Ensuring that we add lasting value to the neighbourhoods we work in; our values, people, innovation, partnerships and focus on sustainability has allowed us to build a successful and solid privately owned business where our people can thrive.


Construction is changing and we are at the forefront of that change. Pioneering new ways to build, innovating the way construction is viewed and establishing ourselves as one of the top employers in any industry. It truly is an amazing company in one of the most exciting industries with a vast array of professional career paths. Adding to that our numerous people awards, we understand everyone has a unique potential and ability to make a difference and succeed; if you want your skills developed and talent recognised, why not join our business!


Willmott Dixon has recently been awarded No 1 in the Best "Big" Companies (2022) to work for and already holds the Times Top 50 Employers for Women 2022 and is the first major contractor and developer to win a Queen’s Award for Enterprise in the category of sustainable development.

title: Sales Consultant
description:
Pentagon Motor Group have an amazing new opportunity for a Light Commercial Vehicle Sales Consultant to join their highly successful Derby Fiat Professional team.

Is this you . . .

  • Do you have a retail sales background with experience of achieving targets?
  • Do you have a genuine passion for people, making them the main focus in everything you do?
  • Are you prepared to provide an outstanding customer buying experience?

If you can honestly answer ‘Yes’ to the above, then you may be exactly who we are looking for!

What’s in it for you?

When you join Pentagon, from Day 1 you'll have access to a comprehensive benefits package including:

  • 30 days holiday per year (including Bank Holidays) that will increase with length of service.
  • Recommend a Friend Scheme.
  • Discounted days out with family and friends.
  • Retail discounts saving £££'s on shopping and dining out.
  • Fully funded, Nationally Recognised Qualifications.
  • Manufacturer specific training.
  • Salary Finance.
  • 24 hour access to the Employee Assistance Programme and designated site Mental Health First Aiders.
  • Team member Pension Scheme contributions.
  • Friends & family Customer Referral Payments
  • Discounts on products and services that we provide for family and friends.

We pride ourselves on offering exceptional training and development opportunities along with realistic career paths for each member of our Team.

What will you be doing?

Our sales team at our fantastic Derby Fiat Professional Business Centre are looking for a new team member with a passion for providing exceptional levels of customer service to join their team. This is a challenging role where customer care always comes first.

You will:

  • Take the time to talk to people & build a genuine rapport in order to identify exactly what your customer needs, turning opportunities into business.
  • Meet sales volume targets and maximise profit opportunities with each sale.
  • Exceed customer satisfaction and promote long term profitability for the Dealership & Group.
  • Telephone prospect new and existing customers.
  • Conduct customer meetings to secure orders and have full involvement in all processes up to and following delivery.
  • Effectively promote and sell additional items such as GAP, paint protection, service plans and warranties.
  • Keep up to date with current finance options regulations and legislation to be able to provide our customers with all available options.

In return, we’ll take the time to give you all the support and personal development you need to build a successful career with the Pentagon Group.

The working rota for this role is Monday - Friday, 09:00am - 18:00pm plus alternate Saturday mornings.

Who are we looking for?

You will need to have:

  • Experience working in a target-driven retail sales background, ideally within an Automotive setting.
  • Exceptional Customer Service skills.
  • Strong and effective communication and persuasion skills alongside telephone prospecting experience
  • Experience of selling F&I products.
  • Motivation and drive.
  • The ability to deliver a first class Customer buying experience and maximise every profit opportunity.
  • An enthusiasm and passion for exceeding targets.
  • An ability to perform well under pressure
  • An organised and methodical approach to work
  • Knowledge of IT Systems including Microsoft Office
  • A full, UK driving licence.

The successful applicant must agree to a Basic Disclosure under the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) procedures. Employment will be offered to the successful applicant subject to a satisfactory Disclosure report.

Why choose us?

For more information on why becoming a member of the Pentagon Motor Group team is an amazing career choice head over to our website!

https://www.pentagon-group.co.uk/recruitment

title: Industrial Consultant
description:
We're hiring an Industry Process Consultant – Services, you will join a team responsible for bridging the gap between the customer’s needs and the mechanism of Dassault Systèmes' products.

Dassault Systèmes, “The 3DEXPERIENCE Company”, provides businesses and individuals with the virtual universes needed to design sustainable innovations. Its market-leading solutions transform the design, manufacturing and maintenance of their products for its customers. Dassault Systèmes' collaborative solutions help promote social innovation and offer new possibilities to improve the real world through virtual universes. With sales in more than 140 countries, the Group brings value to more than 200,000 companies of all sizes in all industries. For more information: www.3ds.com. Roles & Responsibilities

  • Leading the alignment between Dassault Systèmes and our customers through your expert communication between our programmers, algorithm experts, infrastructure consultants, and the customer’s teams.
  • Identifying & mapping customer’s requirements, their impact on the business processes and KPIs.
  • Maximizing solution value for the customer by mapping out the AS-IS and defining the TO-BE process.
  • Validating and testing whether configured functionality is in line with customer requirements, processes, and expectations.
  • Demonstrating configured solutions to the customer, while focusing on value for the customer.
  • Providing functional support to the customer on our solutions during development and in daily operation.

Qualifications/Experience

  • Proven years of consulting experience that combines working with 3DEXPERIENCE
  • Extensive and demonstrable experience guiding and educating customers in relation to Design Process, Project Management, Change Management, BOM Management and the wider automotive OEM business in general
  • Knowledge and experience of the 3DEXPERIENCE platform

As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonised Workforce of the Future.

title: Software Architect
description:
We invite you to join our outstanding team of technical experts, taking your place as an experienced Solution Architect in the UK West Midlands region delivering Supply Chain solutions to our customers.
Dassault Systèmes, the 3DEXPERIENCE Company, provides businesses with virtual universes to imagine sustainable innovations. Our world-leading solutions transform the way products are designed, produced and supported. Our Industry Services division is responsible for the delivery of our product implementations in enterprise and household name brands, providing exciting and challenging exposure to leading-edge innovation across a wide range of industries.

Role & Responsibilities:

  • Design Supply Chain solutions (e.g. Commodity planning, Supplier Capacity Assessment, Supply Chain Visibility, Supply Chain Optimisation) integrated with the overall product design and development processes.
  • Work closely with Dassault business consultants to promote 3DS Industry Process Experiences (IPEs) and their related Dassault-defined business processes.
  • Support application consultants in development of functional specifications to be implemented.
  • Adapt and develop solutions, in a manner consistent with an "Out of the Box" approach.
  • Take an active part in our community of Architects, both within DS and from SI partners.
  • Provide feedback to Dassault worldwide teams in charge of defining/maintaining the product roadmap and architecture.
  • Work in both services and sales contexts to ensure technical continuity between delivered solutions and value propositions scoped in the sales cycle.

Qualifications/Experience:

  • Strong Dassault Product knowledge of supply chain capabilities across Dassault Brands (e.g. ENOVIA, DELMIA, NETVIBES) and the 3DEXPERIENCE platform is a requirement for this application.
  • 8+ years’ services and consulting experience including enterprise-scale PLM solutions is a requirement for this application.
  • Experience of leading technical teams with a track record of success is a requirement for this application.
  • Industry Experience of Automotive or discrete manufacturing OEMs would be an advantage
  • Familiarity and experience with Scaled Agile Framework SAFe is an advantage.
  • Demonstrable experience guiding and educating customers in relation to Supply Chain capabilities is an advantage.

Diversity statement

As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

title: Psychiatrist
description: The main focus of the role will include the assessment of new patients referred to the service related to patients resident in the catchment area, GP liaison work, management of patients within the recovery model, Mental Health Act work (Section 12) when required, day on-call duty rota (this will be based on a pro rata and on average 3 to 4 times a month for emergency work only, it is factored into the sessions and does not impact on work as it is a last resort cover), cover for colleagues when on leave and working within the multidisciplinary team supporting other members of the team. There will be an emphasis on providing leadership and consultancy to the team. This will include support of multidisciplinary team meetings and RAMM meetings (meeting to discuss patients who are not very well and plan interventions).

title: Psychiatrist
description:
An RRP of 20% of the minimum point of the National Consultant (2003) contract will be paid for this post.

This is a full time (10 sessions) replacement post working within the Rushcliffe Local Mental Health Team. The mental health service provision in the community has undergone a recent transformation to move to a model of locality teams. This was to improve care provided to patients, have a smoother transition within the NSF teams as they will be all based within the team. This was to ensure patients got the right care with the required intensity of support relevant to their needs

The number of new medical assessment does vary. The locality team will receive up to 12 referrals per week, most taken on by service and most seen by service unless there was a specific medical need as the first assessment. For community posts, numbers of referrals, team meetings, supervision of team members.

Management of complex cases

Clinical leadership of team, engagement with MDT and RAMM

Role in assessment of referrals/admissions

Care plan and treatment formulation, guidance on evidence-based treatment and effectiveness

Liaison and collaborative working with other services/agencies/colleagues

Mental Health Act implementation

Multi-disciplinary, multi-agency and partnership working

Day duty on-call rota

Nottinghamshire Healthcare employs over 10,000 colleagues who help #MakeADifference every day. We provide intellectual disability, mental health, community health, forensic and offender healthcare services across Nottinghamshire, Leicestershire, Lincolnshire and South Yorkshire. Care is delivered from over 120 sites within the community from acute settings and across low, medium and high secure environments including prisons.

As one of the largest mental health and community trusts in the East Midlands and one of the biggest employers in Nottinghamshire. We are also home to national and regional services such as the National High Secure Deaf Service and the Nottingham Centre for Transgender Health.

We are committed to flexible and agile working, including the opportunity to join our bank.

Your health and wellbeing is our priority and as such we invest significantly in this via our in-house Occupational Health Service, Staff Counselling Service and Health and Wellbeing Team.

We offer a number of employee-led staff networks, including Equality, Diversity and Inclusion (EDI) groups, our Green Champions Network, Freedom to Speak Up Network. Health and Wellbeing Champions Network and Menopause Champions. We provide care to a diverse range of communities and are passionate about supporting diversity and inclusion in the Trust.

If you believe in our values of Trust, Honesty, Respect, Compassion and Teamwork, then we would love to hear from you!

#TeamNottsHC

The main focus of the role will include the assessment of new patients referred to the service related to patients resident in the catchment area, GP liaison work, management of patients within the recovery model, Mental Health Act work (Section 12) when required, day on-call duty rota (this will be based on a pro rata and on average 3 to 4 times a month for emergency work only, it is factored into the sessions and does not impact on work as it is a last resort cover), cover for colleagues when on leave and working within the multidisciplinary team supporting other members of the team. There will be an emphasis on providing leadership and consultancy to the team. This will include support of multidisciplinary team meetings and RAMM meetings (meeting to discuss patients who are not very well and plan interventions).

title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Reference ID

17057

Type

Full time

Category

Hearingcare

Salary

£ 21000-£ 30000

Job Status

Live vacancy

Posted Date

09/05/2023

Job description

We recruit for specialist Healthcare people in the UK. It's a great market, and a lot different to recruiting for warehouse operatives. We are a small but growing team. We have some of the best people, both professionally and personally, in the game today. We're hungry, we want to be the best of the best, and we're not that far off that, we just need to add the right kind of people to our ranks and expand.


You'll join as a Recruitment Consultant. It will be tough. But you'll be working alongside a very supportive and successful team, to quickly grow and develop your own relationships. You'll get a career development plan and a promotion target, you'll be up and running, and then it's up to you as far as you want to take this! We'll help you make it happen!

This job can be a career, and a VERY lucrative one. You will learn to love your market, your clients, and your candidates. You will meet and make lifelong friends and build very long-term relationships.
You will have the genuine capacity to make financial decisions that many people can only dream of.
Your job makes a difference to people... and it really does. Your desire to be the best can easily be turned into a reality. You decide where you want to go. You're the ceiling.


Job Role:
  • Resourcing candidates using telephone, social media and headhunting
  • Identifying and calling candidates/clients
  • Business development and Building relationships with existing and prospective clients/candidates
  • Matching candidates to bookings
  • Achieving and exceeding realistic individual sales targets
  • Availability/Telephone Interviewing candidates
  • Meeting KPIs and targets
  • Using a recruitment-based system to log all communications
The successful candidate must be self-motivated and capable of building strong client and candidate relationships. You will also need the determination to identify suitable candidates from a variety of sources in a shortage profession and consequently competitive market. We are a small, friendly, close knit bunch so you will need to be a team player working hard to provide recruitment solutions whilst developing lasting relationships with both our clients and candidates. You will also need a working knowledge of how to use various social media platforms such as Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter. Due to the nature of the work you will need to have excellent communication skills, ambition and dedication to succeed in a fast-paced and competitive environment.
Benefits:
  • Monday to Friday working only (No Weekends)
  • Core hours are 9am -5.30pm
  • Friendly team who are more like family than colleagues
  • High commission of 30% once you hit your monthly target
  • Monthly incentives E.G paid meals, hotel stays, concert tickets
  • 25 days holiday plus bank holidays
  • Office closes over Christmas
  • Secure car park, free parking
We need people who are not easily disheartened. We want people who can provide innovative solutions to complex problems and explain the logic behind it. Intelligence AND communication. You don't need to be a degree holder, but we do value people who are brilliant face to face, over email, and a great team player with a proven track record on a billing desk either temp or perm (with a minimum of 12 months experience)


We're an unconventional option. We're not arrogant. We work together. We succeed and fail together. And we're building something special.


Will it be tough? YES!!

We do all the nice stuff too of course... Team building, staff holidays, dogs in the office, dress down day every day, monthly 'Star' awards, we have free parking etc etc etc, but you can learn all the good bits over a coffee with us.


Will it be worth it? ABSOLUTELY...

description:

Rate: £45 - £60
STart Date: ASAP
Duration: 3 months

  • Relevant Clinical Physiology qualification

We are unable to support or accept applications from candidates who are residents within the Red or Amber list of the Code of practice for the international recruitment of health and social care personnel in England, based on the World Health Organisation (WHO) Workforce Support and Safeguard List.

Why work with Maxxima?

The minute you register with us we make it about one thing: you. The first time we talk you'll realise we know your speciality inside out.

Our expert recruitment consultants are here to find you the very best opportunities and help you every step of the way in securing the greatest placement. We hold preferred or sole supplier status with many clients which means you'll have access to a range of opportunities that can't be found anywhere else.

We always act in your best interests, talking with you and listening to you. You're an individual. A professional; not a resource.

Refer a friend

We know you'll love working with us, and so would your friends. So why not introduce us and earn some extra cash in the process?

The way it works is simple: if you introduce candidates who are not previously known to Maxxima and we are successful in placing them, we will pay you up to £1,500. More information regarding referrals can be found on our website.

Reasonable adjustments

If you consider yourself to have a disability or require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process or within the workplace, please highlight this at the earliest opportunity by contacting our team. With this information, we will provide appropriate support to you throughout the process and into your work placement.

title: CNC Programmer
description:
Job role: CNC Miller, Setter & Programmer
Salary: £30,000-£45,000 DoE
Location: Coventry, Warwickshire
Hours: 8:30 to 17:00 Monday to Friday
Job Type: Full Time, Permanent

Holiday: 25 days + Bank Holidays

Overtime: Time 1/3

Benefits: Pension and on-site parking available

The Company:

Interaction have partnered with a leading precision engineering firm specialising in the aerospace, automotive and motorsport industries based in Coventry on their search for an experienced 5 Axis CNC Miller, Setter & Programmer.

The Benefits:

  • £30,000-£45,000 salary dependent on experience
  • Overtime readily available at time 1/3
  • 33 days including bank holidays
  • Pension
  • Ongoing commitment to training and progression
  • On-site parking
  • Clean working environment

The Role:

  • You will program, set and operate multi axis Milling machines
  • You will produce small, complex batches of components to quality standards and tight tolerances.
  • You will be using Haas, Bridgeport, DMG mori 5 axis, Siemens Heindenhain and some Fanuc controlled machinery.
  • You will join the busy Milling section and be extremely important to the running of the team

The Requirements:

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as CNC Miller, Setter and Programmer using Fanuc controls (essential)
  • Apprentice Trained (advantageous)
  • HyperMill / EdgeCam experience (advantageous)
  • High attention to detail and able to work to tight tolerances
  • Self-motivated

Interaction Recruitment have specialist consultants across the majority of industries within the UK, including but not limited to, Finance & IT, Technical & Engineering, Industrial, Commercial and Hospitality. We offer both temporary and permanent support. For more information regarding the position or to discuss any other opportunities, you can reach us on 01604 620032, 077973877010
Thank you for taking the time, we hope to speak in the near future.

title: Delivery Specialist
description:
inspHire is a market leader in the development and provision of rental software environments for a variety of sectors addressing single or multi-branch operations, as well as catering for organisations with 'point-of-sale' hire desks and warehouses.

As Project Delivery/Implementation Consultant, you will work autonomously implementing the inspHire product suite via on site or remote sessions. You will evidence experience of supporting the roll out of technology systems. This is a hybrid position that requires an individual who has hands on consultancy experience along with some technical expertise (SQL etc). What's more important to us is that you evidence a passion for IT and delivery. The environment is extremely fast moving, and you will need to evidence the ability to be agile in your approach to delivering assigned projects. Sometimes you will need to deliver difficult messages and manage conflict resolution so strong client management skills are required.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Ensure all projects are implemented within given timelines, escalating if slippage.
  • Manage multiple projects or varying scope and size simultaneously.
  • Full implementation life cycle of inspHire product suite.
  • Training customers both on-site and remote as determined by the project scope.
  • Prepare and conduct project kick-off meetings.
  • Monitor, track and report delivery activity and project status.
  • Manage/document/escalate delivery risks and issues to Head of PSG.
  • Utilise correct tools and processes to ensure project success.

Key Requirements:

Essential

  • Strong organisational and communication skills.
  • Demonstrable experience in Project Management/Implementation.
  • Attention to detail and thoroughness in all aspects of the project life cycle.
  • Great problem-solving ability.
  • Full driving licence required.

Desirable

  • Understanding of ERP systems and their delivery (any software implementation is great).
  • If you have experience in a PM role you will need to evidence good 'standalone' implementation experience (This is a single contributor role, no direct reports limited budget responsibility).
  • Exposure to SQL Server databases and Crystal Reports or similar.
  • Commercially Aware.
  • Forward thinking/proactive nature.

Company Info

inspHire is a business within the Kerridge Commercial Systems Group (KCS) and boasts global recognition as a specialist software provider; delivering fully integrated trading and business management solutions to companies in the rental industry – wherever they are in the world.

Equal Opportunities

KCS is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires us to adjust the recruiting process please do advise us when contacted.

If this role is of interest to you please apply online.

To all recruitment agencies: KCS does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers site or direct to KCS employee. KCS is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
