title: Accountant
description:
County: Staffordshire

Town/City: Burton-on-Trent

Sector: Administration and Accounts, Car Dealership

Salary: £35000 per annum

Job ref: 120647


Prestige/Luxury Dealership Accountant needed for Automotive Business in Burton-on-Trent
  • Basic Salary up to £35,000, plus bonus
  • Hours: Monday to Friday, 9-5, with Saturday mornings on a rota
  • An award winning and nationally recognised Dealership.
Your responsibilities as a Dealership Accountant will include, but are not limited to;
  • Managing and overseeing the day-to-day functions of the vehicle accounts department.
  • Processing VAT returns.
  • Payroll.
  • Invoicing.
In order to qualify for the Dealership Accountant position, you will have a successful track record within an Accounts department, ideally with SAGE50 experience.

Candidates for this Dealership Accountant role with strong accounts experience in similar professions will be considered for the position so long as they are the right fit for the business.

Whatever your professional background is, for this Dealership Accountant position, you must have experience processing VAT Returns and payroll.

You will be paid up to £35,000 depending on skill level, whilst there is a clear path to increasing earnings as you train through with the company. So if you want to join a unique and exciting automotive business, please get in touch.

title: Mot Tester
description:
County: Northamptonshire

Town/City: Corby

Sector: Sevice and MOT, Fast Fit Centre

Salary: £31000 - £35000 per annum

Job ref: 125518


Vehicle Technician / MOT Tester Vacancy - Corby
  • Basic Salary: £31,000
  • Plus Bonus, OTE circa £35,000
  • Monday - Friday: 8:30am - 5:30pm
  • 1 in 2 Saturday Mornings
  • Excellent bonuses, benefits and progression/training
Our Client, one of the fasted growing suppliers of Automotive Servicing, MOT's & Tyre fitting services are nowseeking a MOT Tester and Vehicle Mechanic for their expanding site in Corby, Northamptonshire.

With over 150 Garages and 50 years of trading experience, our client provides a busy working environment with a strong reputation of providing customers with a friendly service, with great choice & quality.

They are seeking a fully qualified MOT Tester to help with holiday cover but general technician duties most of the time. They are also happy to consider applicants who require a MOT Refresher.

Our Client wants to offer an opportunity of a job that works for their employees and for the business. Our client often rewards overachievement with career progression within group!

Get in touch today, to discuss this role and other automotive jobs!

What’s in it for you?
  • A Competitive Basic Salary circa £31,000 DOE
  • A supportive Management Structure
  • Full Systems & Process Training
  • Enhanced Maternity/Paternity Pay
  • Life Cover
  • Employee Discount
  • Long Service Holiday Entitlement
  • Employee wellbeing programme
  • Buy & Sell Holiday
  • Charity Match – Raising Money for a good cause? They will match it!
  • Free Eye Test & Flu Jab
  • Company Pension
  • Future Development Opportunities with a Large Group.
Duties of MOT Tester / Technician with our Client
  • Ensure the work completed on each vehicle is carried out safely and to a high standard.
  • Carry out MOT testing in accordance with VOSA testing requirements.
  • Fast fit tyre fitting whilst being able to use an alignment machine and understand the reading and relevant adjustments.
  • Fitting brakes, exhausts and other mechanical products.
  • Work in a safe manner and comply with health & safety regulations at all times.
  • Ensure you do not work on any product or service that you have not been assessed as competent in or trained to carry out.
  • Adhere to company procedures on the use of vehicle inspection sheets.
  • Make customers and/or management aware of any additional faults found on the customer’s vehicle.
  • To carry out other duties as you may reasonably be called upon to perform.
What our Client expects of their MOT Tester / Technician
  • Experience in a Mechanical Technician position
  • Valid MOT Testing Licence
  • Good understanding/experience of repairs and mechanical servicing and braking
  • Logical problem-solving skills
  • Full UK driving licence with no more than 9 points (you will be subject to licence checks)
  • The ability to interact with our customers effectively; especially when explaining faults
  • Act on your own initiative and take responsibility for the quality of your own work
  • The willingness to constantly learn and improve your own performance and that of the business
  • Experience in a professional workshop environment
  • Good approach to customer service

title: Podiatrist
description:
The Podiatry team at Maxxima are currently recruiting for a Band 7 Podiatrist in Leicester, East Midlands. The successful candidate will be working full-time hours across Monday to Friday. We are looking for a Podiatrist to have specialist clinical knowledge and experience of MSK assessment and rehabilitation acquired through in depth post registration practical experience. Previous experience of working within the NHS is desirable for this role.

Position: Podiatrist
Banding: 7
Location: Leicester
Hours: 37.5 hours per week
Duration: 3/6 months

Essential skills:
  • HCPC registered
  • Experience of working within the NHS
  • Relevant qualification in Podiatry

Why work with Maxxima?

The minute you register with us we make it about one thing: you. The first time we talk you'll realise we know your speciality inside out.

Our expert recruitment consultants are here to find you the very best opportunities and help you every step of the way in securing the greatest placement. We hold preferred or sole supplier status with many clients which means you'll have access to a range of opportunities that can't be found anywhere else.

We always act in your best interests, talking with you and listening to you. You're an individual. A professional; not a resource.

Reasonable adjustments

If you consider yourself to have a disability or require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process or within the workplace, please highlight this at the earliest opportunity by contacting our team. With this information, we will provide appropriate support to you throughout the process and into your work placement.

Refer a friend

We know you'll love working with us, and so would your friends. So why not introduce us and earn some extra cash in the process?

The way it works is simple: if you introduce candidates who are not previously known to Maxxima and we are successful in placing them, we will pay you up to £1,500. More information regarding referrals can be found on our website.

title: Chef
description:
Job Description
Chef
Location: Woodlands Hospital, Kettering
Hours: 30 hours per week
Salary: Depending on experience + Benefits

The role:
We currently have a new opportunity in our Catering department for an experienced Chef to join our team at Woodland Hospital.
In this role you will be an integral part of a team who are committed to delivering the highest quality outcomes in a supported environment, where you will be valued for your skills and expertise.
This role will involve food preparation, cooking and service to our patients, staff, consultants and visitors. You will need to have a good understanding of current health and hygiene regulations, and ensure that these are adhered to in the preparation and service of all food items.

What you’ll bring with you:
  • Experience working as a Chef
  • Minimum of level 2 Basic Food hygiene
  • A warm, considerate and empathetic character
  • The ability to make decisions and use your initiative
  • Strong communication skill
  • A flexible and positive attitude

Benefits:
  • Contributory pension scheme
  • Access to the Ramsay Academy – genuine opportunities to grow, develop and specialise in your career
  • 25 days + 8 bank holidays annual leave (Pro-rated)
  • Flexible shift options
  • Private Healthcare and Life Assurance
  • Free onsite parking and a subsidised staff restaurant
  • Free uniform
  • Access to our employee Discount Programme
  • Wellbeing centre and access to 24/7 employee assistance line for free advice

About us:
Ramsay Health Care UK is a well-established global hospital group with over 50 years’ experience. It is well respected within the healthcare industry and is one of the leading providers of independent hospital services in England.

We love people with a positive, “can do” attitude who want to make a difference in their work. "Our employees are Ramsay." The skills and commitment of our employees forms the basis for our success.

“The Ramsay Way” culture recognises that people – staff and doctors – are Ramsay Health Care’s most important asset and this has been key to our ongoing success. Click here to find out more.

We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. This position is subject to an Enhanced DBS check.
We value your application and welcome any questions you may have prior to applying. Please be advised that we reserve the right to close our advertisements prior to the announced closing date to ensure a quality recruitment process.
We care.

It’s more than what we do, it’s who we are. Everything we do is about striving to deliver the best care. And it's a belief that's as true today as it was when we welcomed our first patients in 1964.

“The Ramsay Way” culture recognises that our people are our most important asset and this has been key to our ongoing success.
We are proud to support the UK’s Armed Forces and Reservists and have already achieved the Silver Award as part of the MOD’s Armed Forces Covenant Employer Recognition Scheme. The scheme recognises employers who actively support Defence while encouraging other organisations to adopt the same behaviours in their workplace. As a company we are committed to supporting the wider Armed Forces community and this includes our staff as well as our patients.
We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. This position is subject to background and DBS checks.

title: Automation Engineer
description:
About us

Solirius Consulting delivers technical consultancy and application delivery to our clients in order to solve real world problems and allow our clients to respond to an ever-changing technical landscape. We partner closely with our clients, embedding our consultants into their businesses in order to provide a bespoke service, allowing us to truly understand our clients’ needs.

It is this close collaboration with our clients that has enabled us to grow rapidly in recent years and will drive our ambitious future growth plans. We currently have over 250 consultants working with a variety of key clients from both the public and private sectors such as the Ministry of Justice, Department for Education, FCDOS, UEFA, International Olympic Committee and Mercedes Benz; with plans to increase our client base further in the near future.

We operate as a flat organisation and believe in trusting and supporting our team to operate independently. We pride ourselves on being specialists at what we do, making the most of our consultants’ expertise in their fields in order to provide a best-in-class service to our clients. All our consultants have the opportunity to work on a range of different projects, providing a broad range of knowledge on which to develop their careers and progress in the direction they choose.

The Role


We are looking for experienced QA Automation Testers/SDET on a perm basis to work with our major public sector clients. You will have a testing background and be confident using your skills to run projects directly with clients with minimal supervision.

This role will require 2 days per week working from Coventry. This would therefore suit someone located in the Midlands.

You will be a fundamental member of the team, responsible for designing, developing and delivering test solutions whilst supporting and developing other members of the team and fostering best practice, keeping up to date with industry standards and advances.

Requirements

Key Requirements
  • Designing and building maintainable test automation frameworks and suites
  • Embedding test execution jobs into CI/CD pipelines
  • Configuring and managing test environments and test data
  • Performing exploratory and scripted manual and automated tests
  • Reporting, prioritising and owning issues

Key Skills and Experience

  • Expertise in .NET C# test development essential
  • Experience with SpecFlow and ideally Serenity BDD
  • Experience with Playwright
  • Experience with RestSharp
  • Knowledge of testing methodologies, tools and processes
  • Commercial experience with Cloud services. (Azure desirable) beneficial
  • Experience in working to Agile methodologies

Benefits

Package and Benefits:

  • Competitive salary, dependent on experience
  • Flexible working / Work from home
  • Private Healthcare
  • Generous annual discretionary bonus
  • 25 days annual leave + bank holidays
  • 10 days allocated development training per year
  • Contributory pension
  • Gym membership
  • Annual away days and social events


Equality & Diversity:

Solirius Consulting is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to creating a work environment that supports, celebrates, encourages, and respects all individuals and in which all processes are based on merit, competence and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexuality, age, disability, ethnicity, marital status or any other protected characteristics.

Should you require further assistance or require any reasonable adjustments be put in place to better support your application process, please do not hesitate to raise this with us.

title: Sage Intacct Consultant
description:
Reporting to our implementation manager, we require a Sage Intacct consultant to join our busy delivery team.

This is NOT a trainee position so the successful candidate should be fully qualified in the product and have a track record of successful Sage Intacct implementations. A working knowledge of the Sage Intacct marketplace would be an advantage but not essential.

Crucial to all applicants will be enthusiasm, ability to work as part of a team and a good work ethic. Customer service is very important to our company, so a customer-first attitude and a strong desire to produce quality projects are essential. It is equally important that you value the service and the way you interact with your internal customers / colleagues here at Smith Cooper.

Why Smith Cooper?

In return, we can offer, a great company with a clear growth plan and the appetite to execute it, a great working environment/team ethos plus lots of great projects to get stuck into immediately.

Again, this is NOT a trainee role. However, the opportunity to develop your career with our company will be significant for anyone who can contribute to our positive, forward-thinking environment. We also have a proven track record of internal promotion.

We operate a flexible working policy and, due to the current climate, the majority of our consultancy team are now largely home-based. As such, all geographies are welcome.

Why should you apply?

Our Intacct practice is growing at pace and we are securing multiple new projects every month. Perhaps you have worked to get qualified for Intacct, have enjoyed the few projects you have done but you don't know when the next project is landing? Perhaps your current employer is struggling to focus fully on Intacct alongside more traditional Sage products? Perhaps you don't have a Intacct 'team' to bounce off? If any of the above is true, please get in touch asap - it would be great to have a chat.

title: Contract Manager
description:
Role Overview:
In a Nutshell…
We have a new opportunity for a Contracts Manager to join our team within Vistry South East Midlands. The project is located at Great Haddon near Yaxley, Cambridgeshire and consists of a total of 507 traditionally built units, some of which are open market sale and some for a HA Client, all on a design and build basis. The project is part of a much larger consortium development with our Bovis and Linden brands, all to be delivered by Vistry Group
We are looking for a driven Project Manager that will advise and support the Design and Procurement teams for buildable and commercial solutions before delivering on site with a dedicated build team whilst interfacing with the client and their agents. You will be a strong forward planner and manage the flow of information from all stakeholders to be received in a timely manner.

Let’s cut to the chase, what’s in it for you…
  • Competitive basic salary and annual bonus
  • Company car or car allowance
  • Agile working possible (dependent on role)
  • Up to 33 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Private Healthcare and Dental Insurance
  • Competitive contributory pension scheme
  • Life assurance – 4 x your annual salary
  • Share incentive schemes
  • Employee rewards portal with many more benefits…
In return, what we would like from you…
  • Behave in line with our company values – Integrity, Caring and Quality
  • Is self-sufficient, works independently and can deliver projects with some support from visiting Operations Manager.
  • Proven experience as a Project Manager / Contracts Manager within high volume residential construction
  • A solid `builder` that can identify problems, communicate solutions, and ultimately drive the project to completion to an agreed programme
  • Be hands on, boots on site and interacting with the trades and their supervision
  • Able to work on any project secured by the business within a reasonable locality. Job is site based and Reporting to Contracts Manager
  • SMSTS, CSCS, First Aid, Scaffold inspection qualification
  • Basic use of Asta PowerProjects would be beneficial but not essential
More about the Contracts Manager role…
  • Responsible for the safety and welfare of the general public, staff and supply chain within their control under the strict observance of the safety policy
  • Working safely, stopping work if unsafe and speaking up to address any safety concerns
  • Participate in safety initiatives
  • Maintain site cleanliness and presentation on site at all times
  • Responsibility for the successful completion of the overall project and to lead by example in all that they do, managing the day-to-day delivery of construction project, quality, time, procurement, contractors
  • Manage sub-contractors, including monitoring of contractor attendance and progress; provide direct instruction and support as necessary such that contractual arrangements are achieved.
  • Follow Vistry site procedures and maintain all daily, weekly, and monthly site paperwork as is required to be audit compliant
  • Involved with the management of internal/external design team/consultants to meet project deadlines under supervision from an Operations Manager
  • Produces and regularly reviews both long and short term programmes in line with the overall project programme (including procurement & Design & Build) to ensure completion on time under the supervision of Operations Manager. Produce and feed in to progress and programme reports for both internal and client monthly reports.
  • Ensure that detailed plans are available commensurate with the overall project plan such that material/resources/supply chain can be delivered to meet scheduled deadlines
  • Appreciate the commercial implications and drivers within the construction process and incorporate these into decision making working closely with the project Surveyor
  • Liaise with Operations Manager to ensure that they are fully aware of project progress and is notified of all financial, specification and time risks ensuring that all additional work is identified
  • Embrace learning and development opportunities that are available within a progressive company
  • Understand and carry out the role specific requirements of procedures and help to identify opportunities for improvement
  • Understand those sustainable practices relevant to your role, helping to identify opportunities for improvement
Finally, let’s tell you a bit more about us…
At Vistry Group, we build more than homes. We develop sustainable communities across all sectors of the UK housing market through our leading housing brands Bovis Homes, Linden Homes and Countryside Homes. Delivered through Vistry Housebuilding, Countryside Partnerships and Vistry Works with the support of Vistry Services, our values of integrity, caring, and quality continue to shape all we do.
We’re proud that our UK Green Building Council membership, 2021 Large Housebuilder of the Year award and status as a UK top-five housebuilder with a five-star House Builders Federation (HBF) customer satisfaction rating allows us to transform land into thriving spaces. We’re also proud that our culture sees everyone treated fairly and respectfully, with diversity and inclusion a top priority and reasonable adjustments provided during the application process. From memories and communities to worthwhile careers, we’re making Vistry.

title: Quantity Surveyor
description:
Quantity Surveyor

Ref
MAX9794
Consultant
Daria Tkach
Region
Midlands and East Anglia
Location
Leicester
Salary
£40-55k (DOE)
Job Posted
13/06/2023
Type
Permanent
Status
Live: Interviewing now

A great opportunity for a Quantity Surveyor to join a retail team of a leading property and construction consultancy based in Leicester. This is a hybrid role – split between office, site and working from home.

The employer rewards high-achieving Quantity Surveyors with great career progression opportunities.

Project Details

This is a client-facing Quantity Surveyor role, in which you will get exposure to pre and post-contract duties. You would be reporting to Technical Director and work as a part of the existing retail team.

The successful candidate for this Quantity Surveyor role will have a good level of retail, such as shop fit-out experience. There will be an opportunity for hybrid working. Successful Quantity Surveyor will be managing their time between the office, site and home.

Responsibilities and Duties

The Quantity Surveyor job role will involve pre and post-contract quantity surveying duties and there will be a principal focus towards providing excellent pre-contract services to repeat client customers in the retail sector.

  • Leading and managing project work independently, such as retail fit outs
  • Preparation of tender enquiry documents
  • Feasibility reports
  • Valuations
  • Cost Reporting
  • Final Accounts
  • Deploy excellent time management strategies to ensure efficient working practices
  • Maintaining a good client relationship throughout

Desired Skills and Experience

  • 4-10 years of experience as a Quantity Surveyor
  • Some previous retail experience is desired
  • Pre – post contract and cost management experience
  • Excellent negotiation skills
  • Procurement and tendering experience.
  • Excellent communication skills to be able to support prestige clients in the Retail sector
  • Strategically minded with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong commercial acumen
  • IT skills, with a high level of proficiency in MS Word and Outlook
  • Ability to work independently, and as part of a team.
  • Full driving license

Qualifications/Educational Requirements

  • A BSc in Quantity Surveying or a degree in Cost Management or similar is preferred.
  • MRICS is preferred, although help towards achieving MRICS is available, as this employer offers a very strong and well-established APC programme.

Employing Company Overview and Profile

This premium client is an international property and construction consultancy. They provide these services across numerous sectors, and pride themselves on being responsive and reliable which enables them to develop strong, ongoing relationships with their clients, and as part of the growth, there is an opportunity for a Quantity Surveyor to be based out of the Leicester office.

They fully support hybrid and flexible working arrangements. Help with becoming MRICS is offered and can be seen as an attractive feature of this employer.

Additional Benefits Package and Incentives

  • Generous basic salary range of £40,000 to £55,000 dependant on experience
  • Package – to be confirmed with suitable candidates
  • Hybrid Working

title: Senior Structural Designer
description:
About the role


Balfour Beatty is currently recruiting a Senior Structural Design Engineer to join the Power T&D team in Derby.
The main function of the role is to deliver such design calculations, engineering drawings and documents that enable a safe and constructable engineered solution.

The position reports to the Design Delivery Manager – Structures.


What you'll be doing

General responsibilities.
- Assume the role of lead structural engineer for complex projects as directed by the Design Delivery Manager - Structures.
  • Analyse and understand contract documents to determine scope of works, design parameters/methodologies, engineering programme and budget.
  • Ensure projects are delivered to he engineering manager in accordance with the agreed scope of works, design parameters/methodologies, engineering programme and budget
  • Review designs and design calculations produced by other engineers or apprentices to ensure the designs are appropriate and can be manufactured and constructed safely in accordance with contract documents and/ or current
best practice.
  • Produce appropriate designs and calculations for review that can be manufactured and constructed safely in accordance with contract documents and/ or current best practice.
  • Practice Safety and Sustainability by Design in all design work ensuring compliance with CDM regulations.
  • Assist in the analysis and resolution of complex design issues.
  • Communicate with other business functions, consultants, clients, and operational teams to ensure projects are delivered to the agreed scope of works, design parameters/methodologies, and engineering programme.
  • Visit operational sites and offices to discuss design issues and to develop solutions.
  • Analyse and understand tender documents to produce engineering tenders for review by engineering managers, that, state the scope of work to be undertaken, identify the engineering tasks and associated cost allocations, develop
engineering programmes, and identify any significant risk.
  • Liaise with engineering managers, principal structural design engineers, senior structural design engineers and other engineers or apprentices as required.
  • Support the Chief Engineer – Structures, to deliver complex technical improvement and innovation.
  • Deliver and undertake training as required.

Interacts with:

Internal design team, suppliers/manufacturers, construction teams, internal/external clients, CDM Principal Designer.

Operating Environment:

  • Proactively observe Balfour Beatty’s cultural framework all times.
  • Observe Balfour Beatty values, lean, expert, trusted, safe and sustainable, at all times.
  • Observe Balfour Beatty behaviours, talk positively, collaborate relentlessly, encourage constantly, make a difference,
and value everyone, at all times.
  • Take personal responsibility and accountability for own and actions of others

Who we're looking for
Qualifications\Skills Required:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Civil/Structural or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
  • Excellent structural analysis skills, ability to solve problems from first principles.
  • Good communication skills, able to communicate effectively at all levels.
  • Knowledge of lattice type structures.
- Experience with BS EN 1993-1-1 2005; BS EN 1993-3-1 2006; BS EN 50341-2-9-UK NNA (2017).
  • Experience with Autodesk Robot Structural Analysis, Bentley Staad Pro and PLS CADD/TOWER, etc.
  • Working towards IEng/CEng.

Why work for us


Day in, day out, our teams deliver amazing projects in challenging conditions; developing, managing and maintaining the vital infrastructure and public spaces that modern economies, societies and communities rely on.


About us


Our skilled and dedicated teams deliver a range of proactive and reactive services which support a reliable and safe supply of power flowing to millions of homes and businesses around the world. Our contracts range from 50,000 schemes to 100 million plus major projects.

Balfour Beatty’s Power Transmission & Distribution teams work with regional, national and international electricity network owners and operators to provide technical engineering solutions. With experience and expertise across the full spectrum of the electricity grid our teams have capability across overhead lines, cable tunnels, distribution networks and substations. From scoping and feasibility, to design, construction and on-going maintenance, our in-house experts, flexible resources and industry-leading innovations support clients in the development of some of the world’s most ambitious power transmission and distribution projects.

At Balfour Beatty we are committed to creating a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture where everyone can be themselves and reach their full potential, not only because this is the right thing to do, but because it makes us a better business. To ensure we deliver on this commitment, we have a UK Diversity and Inclusion Action Plan which sets out the wide range of targeted, proactive, measurable steps we are taking to make this a reality. You can read our UK Diversity and Inclusion Action Plan in full at www.balfourbeatty.com/value_everyone

To help and support us with ourdesired commitment to create an inclusive culture we are members of WISE, enei, Business Disability Forum and Women into Construction. In 2020, we signed the Audeliss and Involve Open Letter to demonstrate our commitment to taking key long term and sustainable actions on Black Inclusion. Balfour Beatty is also a Gold Award holder in the Ministry of Defence 'Employer Recognition Scheme' and actively encourage applications from Armed Forces personnel, veterans and reservists.

As a Disability Confident Employer, we are committed to working with people who have disabilities and long-term health conditions to remove barriers for them in obtaining employment. We are also committed to offering applicants with a disability an interview if they meet the minimum requirements for the role.

Further information on Disability Confident can be found at: https://disabilityconfident.campaign.gov.uk/


Job Reference: BBUK03510

title: Respiratory Physiologist - Band 6
description:
The Clinical Physiology team at Maxxima are currently recruiting for a Band 6 Respiratory Physiologist in Leicester. The successful candidate will be able to work full-time throughout the week. This role is available to start ASAP; the starting pay rate for this job is £28-34 per hour.

Position: Respiratory Physiologist
Banding: 6
Location: Leicester
Hours: Full time
Rate: £30 - £35/h
Start Date: ASAP
Duration: Ongoing
Essential requirements:
  • Clinical PFT/LFT experience. CPAP & Sleep scoring desirable
  • Essential the candidate have passed the ARTP practitioners Exam
  • Relevant Clinical Physiology qualification


We are unable to support or accept applications from candidates who are residents within the Red or Amber list of the Code of practice for the international recruitment of health and social care personnel in England, based on the World Health Organisation (WHO) Workforce Support and Safeguard List.

Why work with Maxxima?

The minute you register with us we make it about one thing: you. The first time we talk you'll realise we know your speciality inside out.

Our expert recruitment consultants are here to find you the very best opportunities and help you every step of the way in securing the greatest placement. We hold preferred or sole supplier status with many clients which means you'll have access to a range of opportunities that can't be found anywhere else.

We always act in your best interests, talking with you and listening to you. You're an individual. A professional; not a resource.

Refer a friend

We know you'll love working with us, and so would your friends. So why not introduce us and earn some extra cash in the process?

The way it works is simple: if you introduce candidates who are not previously known to Maxxima and we are successful in placing them, we will pay you up to £1,500. More information regarding referrals can be found on our website.

Reasonable adjustments

If you consider yourself to have a disability or require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process or within the workplace, please highlight this at the earliest opportunity by contacting our team. With this information, we will provide appropriate support to you throughout the process and into your work placement.

title: Sales Assistant
description:
CLIENT: Independent retail jeweller
LOCATION: Leicester City Centre, Leicestershire
SALARY: Competitive £salary + in-store performance reward (s) + training + career development opportunity
POSITION: Permanent
POSTED: 23/01/2024

The landscape of retailing has very definitely changed. Our client is a proud Independently owned Retail Jeweller with a long tradition of serving their locality with a carefully selected portfolio of watch and jewellery precious items. Opportunities for this client have never been as bright.

The company has recently invested further in their infrastructure, widened their product specialism, and fast-forwarded their jewellery and watch aftersales services now available in-store. Ambitious and keen to grow their customer service reactivity in-store, now is felt to be the perfect time to welcome a further talented sales professional to their much-revered sales floor team.


Job Role:
Increasingly today there is becoming more opportunity to be a specialist consultant – therefore your default career setting is to be keen to learn evermore and take on greater and greater store responsibilities.

Brands be they timepieces or fine jewellery are ever keener to be presented in a specific manner reflective of their own distinctive manufacturing kudos – for you this is respected, and you are keen to oblige.

Communicationally you are proactive by nature – effervescent in person, efficient with persona if online or virtual, and above all take considerable pride in the traditional meaning of genuinely delivering best store service.

Team play in-store is so important. All are encouraged to support each other’s transaction successes – ensuring that each purchasing experience is at the optimum level of customer satisfaction possible.

Full comprehensive trade training is available, and this may be via coaching from existing senior company personnel alongside individuals taking the initiative to follow online tutoring provided by select supplier partners.

Career wise there are opportunities to in the future push towards taking responsibility of a certain product area / brand or even if opportune use a new area of talent since developed to lead a future store sales and marketing initiative. That’s the attraction of being part of an established Family Jeweller ever ready to adventurously explore new market trends with an agility that within their own locality is difficult to market match.


Requirements:

    If prospective candidates have already enjoyed selling and serving clientele within the Watch and Jewellery market place this previous experience is of course helpful. Though there are many trade examples of candidates transferring their best attributes very successfully to the Jewellery trade from other spheres of retailing be it from premium / luxury consumer goods.

    A further area of late that has pleasingly hit the selection mark has been individuals perhaps moving from a five-star hospitality environment with a strong appreciation of what delivering the ultimate customer experience really means.

    Importantly your own skills are very much communication/selling led – and you are able retain pertinent and relevant product information able to recall always in the right way to each differing client need.

    Well organised, you are orderly and compliant when it comes to observing best sales protocols.

    Ever mindful of stock safety and equally conscious that all merchandise handled must remain in pristine ready- to- market condition.

To apply please forward your CV to the recruiting team at Jolyon Marshall Limited who look forward to reviewing your own matched brilliance and will where possible happily push your talent to the next deserved placement level.

title: Manufacturing Technician
description:
Our Client is one of the UK’s leading pioneers in the race to develop and manufacture the latest Battery technology for industry, with an initial primary focus on supporting our ever growing Automotive manufacturing sector (but not exclusively!), ensuring that there will be a brighter and greener future for us all.

Working from state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in the West Midlands, it is our pleasure to now be partnering our Client to help develop, build and nurture their team with only the very best talent!

As part of this growth, we are now actively seeking an experienced Manufacturing Technician to support the industry and develop the next generation of battery systems from Electrode Manufacturing to Cell Assembly through to Module and Pack Assembly to enable the industry to move to full scale, high volume battery manufacturing.


Key responsibilities

  • Support for R&D cell assembly activities team
  • Perform electrode preparation activities following standard operation procedures
  • Adhere to company policies such as Health & Safety and Quality
  • Maintenance of production equipment
  • Assist with the Internal movement of materials
  • Maintain quality standards by inspecting and testing finished products
  • Observe good housekeeping and safety procedures in line with 5S methodologies
  • Exhibit a positive team-based attitude

Knowledge skills and experience

  • Ideally served an Indentured Apprenticeship in Electrical/Mechanical or Engineering
  • Ideally qualified to ONC/HNC/HND Level 3
  • Experience of Maintenance in High Speed/Precision Environment
  • Strong eye for detail
  • Experience in processes such as reel to reel manufacturing, slitting, chemical handling and die tooling experience would be advantageous
  • Ability to read Engineering Drawings
  • Robot/Automation Experience
  • Experience of Working in and leading Teams

This position is available immediately.


To APPLY, please contact Iwona Peplinska, Senior Recruitment Consultant at Forbes HR Ltd on:

Telephone: 01327 304858

Mobile: 07545500552

Email: iwona.peplinska@forbeshr.com


Forbes HR (part of the Millbank Holdings Group Ltd) is an equal opportunities employer and respects diversity, we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons who are eligible to live and work in the UK. Millbank is proud to be a member of the ‘Disability Confident Scheme’. Millbank operates as an Employment Agency and Business.

title: Process Engineer
description:
Our Client is one of the UK’s leading pioneers in the race to develop and manufacture the latest Battery technology for industry, with an initial primary focus on supporting our ever growing Automotive manufacturing sector (but not exclusively!), ensuring that there will be a brighter and greener future for us all.

Working from state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in the West Midlands, it is our pleasure to now be partnering our Client to help develop, build and nurture their team with only the very best talent!

As part of this growth, we are now actively seeking an experienced Process Engineer (Electrode Manufacturing).

The role

In this role the successful candidate will work alongside a small and growing team of Professional Engineers in new product development and industrialisation of automotive batteries. Reporting to the Head of Manufacturing Engineering, this position will support UKBIC baseline products and evaluation of customer proposals. As process engineer the successful candidate will support battery production activities of pilot and R&D cell manufacturing lines by supervising, and improving manufacturing equipment and methods. Focus will be on the calendaring process for compaction of lithium-ion electrodes. Also responsible for transferring technical knowledge on pilot scale operations as well as the conceptualization and development of new calendaring techniques to reduce cost, improve sustainability and develop best practices for cell assembly

Key accountabilities and responsibilities

  • Research, design, and testing of manufacturing methods and equipment.
  • Research, commission, and validate new equipment or modify existing equipment to prototype new electrode manufacturing methods and formats.
  • Analyse production to increase manufacturing uptime, availability and reliability metrics-yield, OEE, cycle time, quality and investigate bottlenecks to identify root cause and countermeasure to maximize throughput
  • Drive root cause analysis through process and equipment expertise, correlate with upstream/downstream processes.
  • Troubleshoot and recover processes by PLC, HMI, or tool management software, and implement changes/improvements.
  • Work independently and with vendors to understand root cause of failures, propose design or component changes, and implement and validate equipment modifications.
  • Generate and maintain documentation including machine and process specifications, drawings, BOM, spare parts, PFMEA, control plan, process flow chart.
  • Support daily industrialisation activities, providing guidance and instruction to electrode manufacturing process
  • Prepare technical reports and documentation by collecting, analysing, and summarizing information and trends.

Knowledge skills and experience

  • BSc in Mechanical, Chemical, Manufacturing or Industrial Engineering
  • Either a BS with 5+ years’ relevant experience or an MS in mechanical engineering, manufacturing engineering, Process Engineering or equivalent.
  • Position will offer unique and complex engineering challenges that require persistence, innovative thinking and a positive attitude
  • Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent understanding of Manufacturing / Process Engineering fundamentals and methods.
  • Experience in high volume manufacturing environment from similar industry.
  • Exceptional appreciation for Health, Safety and Quality control procedures.
  • Exposure to data acquisition equipment and software.
  • Exposure to PLC Controls or other automated systems is preferred.
  • Strong communication and reporting skills.

Does this sound like you?

On offer to the successful candidate is a negotiable (albeit dependent on relevant experience) basic salary, together with a full flexible benefits package and car schemes.

This position is available with immediate effect.

To APPLY, please contact Iwona Peplinska, Senior Recruitment Consultant at Forbes HR Ltd on:

Telephone: 01327 304858

Mobile: 07545500552

Email: iwona.peplinska@forbeshr.com


Forbes HR (part of the Millbank Holdings Group Ltd) is an equal opportunities employer and respects diversity, we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons who are eligible to live and work in the UK. Millbank is proud to be a member of the ‘Disability Confident Scheme’. Millbank operates as an Employment Agency and Business.

title: Senior Principal
description:
Job Introduction

We are looking for an experienced & highly motivated Senior/Principal Ecologist to join our successful Ecology team. We work predominantly in the private sector on a range of interesting projects including renewable energy, residential, logistics, education and leisure (and no HS2 work!). we offer a range of training support to advance our staff careers and skills set.

We can be flexible on location in the UK but your nearest local office may be our Nottingham facility.

Main Responsibilities
  • Undertaking extended phase 1 habitat surveys/ UK Habs surveys to accurately describe and map habitats and assess their potential to support notable/protected species.
  • Undertaking phase 2 surveys for legally protected species.
  • Producing a range of ecological reports and reviewing junior team work
  • Designing and managing ecological surveys and associated mitigation.
  • Project Management
  • Liaising with clients, professional advisors, contractors and the general public.
  • Building and maintaining effective working relationships at all levels within the business, with clients, subcontractors and other third parties (regulators, statutory consultees, etc.).
  • There will also be opportunities for managing and mentoring junior team members if candidate desire.
The Ideal Candidate
  • Bachelor’s degree in relevant subject
  • At least four years’ experience as a professional ecological consultant.
  • Good ecological field skills covering a range of protected species and habitats.
  • A sound understanding of the legislative and planning policy framework as it relates to ecology and nature conservation.
  • The ability to write concise, high quality, technical reports in line with CIEEM guidelines.
  • Ideally, experience of reviewing technical ecology reports written by others.
  • Experience of using the latest Defra Biodiversity Metric desirable (training can be given).
  • Experience of writing fee proposals, project management and client liaison desirable (training can be given).
  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills.
  • Membership of CIEEM
  • Protected species licence(s) or working towards licences (support and training could be provided for interested candidates wishing to pursue their licences)
  • Full UK driving licence
About The Company

Delta-Simons is a multi-disciplinary environmental and health and safety consultancy providing trusted advice and solutions to 'Protect People and Planet' through facilitating sustainable development, both throughout the UK and internationally. If you are looking to start or grow your career in environmental consultancy, Delta-Simons is a place where ongoing learning, training, innovation and collaborative thinking is encouraged and helps to form our identity.

Now part of the Lucion Group, there has never been a more exciting time to join our growing and diverse team.

Get in touch

Feel free to email our Recruitment Team at recruitment@luciongroup.com if you have any questions.

All candidates are advised to read our privacy policy.

Delta-Simons is an equal opportunities employer.

Package Description

What's in it for you?

At Delta-Simons, recruiting and retaining the best individuals is key to our success and continued growth. We celebrate our staff by offering:

  • £30,000 - £55,000 basic salary, depending on skills and experience. Higher salaries may apply in the South East.
  • Working away allowance for overnight fieldwork
  • Company matched pension scheme.
  • 24 days annual leave in addition to bank holidays, with holiday increasing with service with options to buy additional holiday
  • Extensive training opportunities and supported CPD.
  • Hybrid working
  • Employee Assistance Programme, which includes counselling services and legal assistance.
  • Cashback and discounts on purchases and events, from a range of brands and services including gym membership and restaurant deals.
  • Supported opportunities for volunteering and community action.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Our Client is one of the UK’s leading pioneers in the race to develop and manufacture the latest Battery technology for industry, with an initial primary focus on supporting our ever growing Automotive manufacturing sector (but not exclusively!), ensuring that there will be a brighter and greener future for us all.

Working from state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in the West Midlands, it is our pleasure to now be partnering our Client to help develop, build and nurture their team with only the very best talent!

As part of this growth, we are now actively seeking an experienced Business Development Manager with a manufacturing background that ideally has experience in growing and closing significant sales, as they also do in working as a development partner with skills in putting together project proposals and planning on a permanent basis.

Purpose of the Role:

To generate & convert business opportunities to quality contract wins. The Role reports directly into Commercial Director and requires both strategic and tactical thinking and abilities. It is primarily a Collaborative selling role in a highly technical field where a reasonable level of technical competence in the field is necessary, alongside a proven ability to develop and win business. The role operates across the full management hierarchy within clients and sponsor organisations. It will be important to develop strategic relationships with new clients and to win business at strategic and tactical operating levels. The role will require UK and some level of international travel. It will be based onsite, but some level of home-based working may be viable.


Key Responsibilities:

General

  • Work with the Commercial Director and Business Development (BD) team to identify and target new market areas.
  • Work with Marketing and Communications function to define lead generation marketing activity.
  • Directly follow up new Enquiries and develop into business opportunities
  • Actively prospect for potential new clients and new client opportunities
  • Engage directly with potential clients via phone, video, e-mail, visits etc to understand their organisations, their commercial positions and their needs and devise and agree appropriate roadmaps to achieve them.
  • Dig into client corporate strategies to gain an in-depth understanding of their future plans and devise potential approaches for UKBIC that best match them
  • Produce client requirement / solution roadmap briefing documents for UKBIC Commercial Director / CTO and for bid teams
  • Work with bid team covering both commercial & technical aspects as appropriate, to assist in the generation of bids for clients, including the proposition of appropriate and bid strengthening USPs and benefits
  • Generate and maintain prospect forecasting database
  • Provide updates, reports, appropriate documentation and new agenda items for regular Sales meetings

Day to Day

  • New enquiry follows ups, New Opportunity prospecting, Track and report on new enquiries and progress
  • Ensure that briefing, bidding and supporting documentation is generated and available within agreed timelines.
  • Escalate issues to Commercial Director where resolutions cannot be found within normal protocols
  • Maintain client relationships. Keep in touch with client deliverables and take responsibility for keeping clients informed about progress on won programmes.
  • Keep up to date with client organisational changes and strategies and report back in sales meetings with any significant information
  • Liaise closely with bid manager through bid stages
  • Present Bids in all forms (quotes, discussion documents, proposals etc) to clients
  • Define the need for and agree the direct support of other team members in opportunity sales meetings
  • Ensure appropriate, auditable control documentation is produced and maintained
  • Undertake special projects as required

People Management

There are no direct reports


Relationship Management

  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to ensure optimal performance
  • Work collaboratively, negotiate and engage with key stakeholders to facilitate delivery and compliance with the organisational strategy
  • Provide guidance to departments and many groups of the organisation
  • Liaise and communicate with other departments, customers, suppliers and other service providers
  • Propose and contribute to new business initiatives and programmes

Self-Management

  • Comply with the Health, Safety and Environmental Policies
  • Highly motivated, flexible and organised
  • Anticipates and overcomes obstacles
  • Makes useful links to arrive at insightful plans and solutions
  • Embraces personal challenge
  • Confident, rounded thinking
  • Thinks both strategically and tactically and operates well in both
  • Takes ownership for team cohesion and proactively contributes to creating a good team atmosphere
  • Is resilient, optimistic and open to change
  • Has a collaborative approach to others, inside and outside of the organisation

Skills and Attributes:

  • Very strong customer interfacing and management skills
  • Customer orientated approach to all tasks
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Contractual negotiation understanding and skills
  • Ability to lead and influence in negotiations of complex arrangements
  • Methodical, disciplined approach and an ability to communicate requirements clearly at all levels
  • Ability to lead staff of various skills and personalities who are not direct subordinates
  • Ability to develop strong working relationships
  • Ability to manage and prioritise multiple demands
  • Ability to work as part of a team or independently
  • Data-driven approach to analysis

Qualifications and Experience Levels:

  • Relevant scientific, engineering or manufacturing degree or HND
  • Experience in Engineering, preferably within automotive and/or battery industries
  • Experience and proven track record in customer facing roles, preferably in Business Development manager or senior Technical Sales engineer roles
  • Membership of an industry related Professional Body would be advantageous
  • Good IT skills including MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Programme
  • Experience in delivering engineering programmes on time and within budget

Does this sound like you?

On offer to the successful candidate is a negotiable (albeit dependent on relevant experience) basic salary, together with a full flexible benefits package and car schemes.

This position is available with immediate effect.

To APPLY, please contact Iwona Peplinska, Senior Recruitment Consultant at Forbes HR Ltd on:

Telephone: 01327 304858

Mobile: 07545500552

Email: iwona.peplinska@forbeshr.com

Forbes HR (part of the Millbank Holdings Group Ltd) is an equal opportunities employer and respects diversity, we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons who are eligible to live and work in the UK. Millbank is proud to be a member of the ‘Disability Confident Scheme’. Millbank operates as an Employment Agency and Business.

title: Associate Dentist
description:
NRS UK has a market leading role available for Associate Dentists at an established dental practice in Bedworth, UK

My client is a Modern Dental practice, that is looking to recruit Dentists from the UK, EU and overseas to their team in Bedworth. They are very supportive and keen on helping dentist in their organisation grow and advance their careers.

The Dental practice is open to UK and overseas Dentists, able to provide sponsorship, help with relocation and can provide assistance with attaining an NHS Performer number, if needed.

As can be seen above, the practice is highly supportive when it comes to the growth of their Dentists and is happy to consider dentists from a wide range of backgrounds, regardless the stage of your career.

The practice is looking for a highly motivated individual to join the team on a full, or part time time basis, with flexible shift patterns. The well established practice offers both NHS, private and cosmetic work, with excellent private earning potential and great rates of Pay for UDA's

Current my clients Dentists are earning great money from both their private and NHS work.

Key benefits:
  • Recruiting dentists from UK, EU and Overseas
  • Experienced practice group with vast experience of working with dentists from all backgrounds
  • Seeking experienced dentists or new graduates
  • Sponsor licence available paid for by the practice.
  • Relocation assistance if required, including practical items such as bank accounts etc
  • Experienced mentor support in practice
  • Full support to gain NHS performer number whether this be conditional or PLVE route for overseas
  • Modern equipment and facilities in each practice
  • Digital x-ray CBCT scan facilities
  • Intra oral cameras in each surgery
  • Rotary endo machine in practice
  • Specialities in practice including implantology, restorative, sedation and orthodontics
  • Monthly earnings from £3,000 to £10,000 per month dependant on dentist work pattern (self employed basis)
  • 6 weeks annual leave per year including study leave
  • Flexible hours full time and part time
  • Access to study days and educational information
  • Opportunity to develop whatever stage you are at in your dental career with a supportive dynamic team

If you fit the brief we would love to hear from you, click apply, and one of our consultants will be in touch within 24 hours.

Alternatively, feel free to contact Michael on 07503224505 to discuss in more depth.

Thanks to all that apply.

title: Client Advisor
description:
Express Recruitment are currently recruiting for an established, thriving Leicestershire-based fashion company who are looking to add a fluent German Speaking Customer Care Advisor to their rapidly-expanding team.

Our client is offering a basic salary of c£26,000 D.O.E plus great career progression opportunities and training.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Resolve customer enquiries via telephone and email
  • Work closely with colleagues to resolve every query quickly and efficiently
  • Support with general administration tasks as required
  • Contribute to the overall effectiveness of the overseas customer support area

Skills & Experience

  • Bilingual written and verbal communication skills in German essential
  • Professional telephone manner and communication skills essential
  • Experience in a specific telephone-based customer service role highly advantageous
  • Good IT skills and comfortable using MS office functions
  • Able to work in a busy environment

About Express Recruitment

Express Recruitment has been offering exceptional recruitment solutions across the East Midlands since 1987, “exceeding expectations every time” of over 267,000 candidates.

We supply a diverse range of sectors including Engineering, Technology, Professional Services, Languages, Sales & Marketing, Call Centres, Commercial, Manufacturing, Local Authority, NHS, Education and Voluntary organisations.

Not quite found the right role for you yet? Let us do the scrolling for you! Your search for a new role has never been so easy, just fill in our contact form on https://bit.ly/3NHa9NR or give us a call on 0115 924 0010 and we will do the rest for you.

Vacancy Summary

Hours: Monday – Friday, (8:30am – 4:30pm)

Salary: c£26,000 per annum D.O.E

Location: Loughborough, Leicestershire

Job Type: Permanent

Unfortunately, we are unable to contact all candidates due to the large volume of applications we receive. If you have not heard from a consultant within the next three days, please assume that you have not been successful on this occasion. Please do not hesitate to apply for other suitable roles in the future.

This vacancy is being advertised on behalf of Express Recruitment Ltd. The services advertised by Express Recruitment Ltd. are those of an Employment Agency.

title: Experienced Sage 200 Consultant
description:
Reporting to our implementation manager, we require an experienced Sage 200 consultant to join our busy delivery team.

This is NOT a trainee position so the successful candidate should have a proven track record of Sage 200 implementations, along with a working knowledge of the add-on market. Knowledge of the Sicon product range and/or Manufacturing (Sage 200 or Sicon) is particularly desirable.

Crucial to all applicants will be enthusiasm, ability to work as part of a team and a good work ethic. Customer service is very important to our company, so a customer-first attitude and a strong desire to produce quality projects are also essential.


Why Smith Cooper?

In return, we can offer, a great company with a clear growth plan and the appetite to execute it, a great working environment/team ethos plus lots of great projects to get stuck into immediately.

Again, this is NOT a trainee role. However, the opportunity to develop your career with our company will be significant for anyone who can contribute to our positive, forward-thinking environment. We also have a proven track record of internal promotion.

We operate a flexible working policy and, due to the current climate, the majority of our consultancy team are now largely home-based. As such, all geographies are welcome. However, candidates based in the Midlands or the South of England would be at a distinct advantage.

If you are an experienced Sage 200 consultant who is bored or undervalued in your current role, is in between jobs due to the current economic climate or just simply fancy a new challenge, then please get in touch.

title: HGV Technician
description:
County: Nottinghamshire

Town/City: Nottingham

Sector: Service Department, Commercial Dealership

Salary: £37500 - £40000 per annum

Job ref: 116907


HGV Technician Required in Nottingham
  • Salary up to £37,500 (OTE £40,000)
  • Hours on a rotating shift pattern: Week 1 = 6-2 and Week 2 = 2-10
  • 1 in 2 Saturday Morning (time and a half)
Are you eager for a challenge? Ready to take on a new opportunity with a massive Nottingham-based National Company?

We are looking for HGV Technicians in the area who are looking for real opportunities for career progression.

Responsibilities of a HGV Technician:
  • Performing major and minor repairs to heavy goods vehicles, trailers and other vehicles in the company fleet
  • Performing regular inspection and general preventive maintenance services such as tyre rotation and oil changes
  • Maintaining inventory in the workshop and cleanliness from oil spills and dust
  • Working with repair teams to help diagnose and plan repairs for the vehicles
  • Keeping records of vehicles that have been repaired or handled
  • Providing repair services to clients on the road in case of emergencies
  • Completing relevant documentation and paperwork as required and providing warranty claims or escalating them to higher management
The successful HGV Technician will have:
  • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and in customer-demanding situations
  • Ability to perform well independently and as part of a team
  • Ability to work under tight instructions and concentrate over long periods
  • Excellent understanding of vehicle technology
  • A solid commitment to the industry and keen knowledge of the latest technology relating to HGVs
  • Keen awareness of health and safety standards of vehicles
  • Excellent problem-solving and practical skills
The successful HGV Technician will get:
  • Large organisation with clear opportunities for career progression
  • Always avoid rush hour traffic working at these times
  • Join existing placements of ours in the workforce as they further progress their careers
  • Have full utility of their high-end equipment
  • A place in a business that has recently increased it's number of sites

title: Mot Tester
description:
County: Northamptonshire

Town/City: Corby

Sector: Sevice and MOT, Fast Fit Centre

Salary: £31000 - £35000 per annum

Job ref: 125518


Vehicle Technician / MOT Tester Vacancy - Corby
  • Basic Salary: £31,000
  • Plus Bonus, OTE circa £35,000
  • Monday - Friday: 8:30am - 5:30pm
  • 1 in 2 Saturday Mornings
  • Excellent bonuses, benefits and progression/training
Our Client, one of the fasted growing suppliers of Automotive Servicing, MOT's & Tyre fitting services are nowseeking a MOT Tester and Vehicle Mechanic for their expanding site in Corby, Northamptonshire.

With over 150 Garages and 50 years of trading experience, our client provides a busy working environment with a strong reputation of providing customers with a friendly service, with great choice & quality.

They are seeking a fully qualified MOT Tester to help with holiday cover but general technician duties most of the time. They are also happy to consider applicants who require a MOT Refresher.

Our Client wants to offer an opportunity of a job that works for their employees and for the business. Our client often rewards overachievement with career progression within group!

Get in touch today, to discuss this role and other automotive jobs!

What’s in it for you?
  • A Competitive Basic Salary circa £31,000 DOE
  • A supportive Management Structure
  • Full Systems & Process Training
  • Enhanced Maternity/Paternity Pay
  • Life Cover
  • Employee Discount
  • Long Service Holiday Entitlement
  • Employee wellbeing programme
  • Buy & Sell Holiday
  • Charity Match – Raising Money for a good cause? They will match it!
  • Free Eye Test & Flu Jab
  • Company Pension
  • Future Development Opportunities with a Large Group.
Duties of MOT Tester / Technician with our Client
  • Ensure the work completed on each vehicle is carried out safely and to a high standard.
  • Carry out MOT testing in accordance with VOSA testing requirements.
  • Fast fit tyre fitting whilst being able to use an alignment machine and understand the reading and relevant adjustments.
  • Fitting brakes, exhausts and other mechanical products.
  • Work in a safe manner and comply with health & safety regulations at all times.
  • Ensure you do not work on any product or service that you have not been assessed as competent in or trained to carry out.
  • Adhere to company procedures on the use of vehicle inspection sheets.
  • Make customers and/or management aware of any additional faults found on the customer’s vehicle.
  • To carry out other duties as you may reasonably be called upon to perform.
What our Client expects of their MOT Tester / Technician
  • Experience in a Mechanical Technician position
  • Valid MOT Testing Licence
  • Good understanding/experience of repairs and mechanical servicing and braking
  • Logical problem-solving skills
  • Full UK driving licence with no more than 9 points (you will be subject to licence checks)
  • The ability to interact with our customers effectively; especially when explaining faults
  • Act on your own initiative and take responsibility for the quality of your own work
  • The willingness to constantly learn and improve your own performance and that of the business
  • Experience in a professional workshop environment
  • Good approach to customer service
